title: A World Vision Donor Sponsored a Boy. The Outcome Was a Mystery to Both.
description: HUSAN, West Bank  The Sabateen clan recognized the dewy-eyed boy in the World Vision sponsorship card from his birth date and the striped collar of his cardigan. His mother used to make him wear that sweater on special occasions.

title: Daily Report: What Tech Happens in China Stays in China
description: To get a good sense of tech in China, its useful to think about the last 5,000 years, particularly as they relate to a big event this week.

title: William Bratton, New Yorks Influential Police Commissioner, Is Stepping Down
description: William J. Bratton, the commissioner of the New York Police Department and the most widely recognized face in American policing, will step down next month to take a job with a private advisory firm, ending a 45-year career in public life that spanned the country, from Boston to Los Angeles, and that reshaped the image of what a police commander could be.

title: Agern
description: A New Nordic restaurant in Grand Central Terminal arrives from one of the founders of Noma.

title: All Aboard the Nordic Express, at Agern
description: Almost everyone who has lived in Manhattan has had the dream. Wandering through your apartment, you see a door nobody has noticed before. On the other side, you find that you have been living all along with extra rooms: enough space for an office, a guest bedroom, a painting studio, a walk-in closet, a tiki bar, a library.

title: Sony Is Allowed to Close Deal With Michael Jacksons Estate
description: Sony has received approval from the European Commission to complete its $750 million purchase of the half of the Sony/ATV Music Publishing catalog owned by the Michael Jackson estate, the commission announced on Tuesday.

title: Getting Chatty in Gmail
description: Q. When using Gmail in a browser, what is the difference between Google Chat and Google Hangouts?

title: UnREAL Season 2, Episode 9: This Is All We Need
description: Some shows are best experienced in a single breathless plunge. The first season of UnREAL benefited from a binge: its biggest sticking point (Marys tragic turn) became just another wave in a rising tide as the show kept its focus on Rachel and Quinns codependent brilliance and the delicious behind-the-scenes machinations of a reality dating show.

title: Theres Something Going On in Turkey, U.S. Colonel Was Told During Coup Attempt
description: INCIRLIK AIR BASE, Turkey  Late on a Friday night last month, Col. David Trucksa sat in his living quarters on the base here, watching a baseball game as he tried to unwind after a long week overseeing American airstrikes on Islamic State militants.

title: The Town Center Regains Significance
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  When suburban malls began to stagnate in the early 1990s, the parent company of the retail stalwarts Bath & Body Works and Victorias Secret took a chance on a different kind of shopping experience.

title: 4 More Years: Rush Limbaugh Signs a New Radio Contract
description: Rush Limbaugh, the king of conservative talk radio, has renewed his contract with the distributor iHeartMedia, the company announced on Tuesday.

title: Seeking Climate Change Clues in Old Pollen and Mammoth Dung
description: Jacquelyn Gillis a talented young paleoecologist at the University of Maine  achieving lead-author status as a graduate student back in 2009 on a much-cited paper in Science that shed light on what did, and didnt, contribute to the great die-off of mammoths and other megafauna in North America as the last ice age ended.

title: Hell Chicken
description: On Sundays, the staff of Achilles Heel in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, cooks chicken over an open flame.

title: Its Called Hell Chicken for a Reason
description: The Hell Chicken at Achilles Heel, a bar in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, seems straightforward enough.

title: Obama Says Republicans Should Withdraw Support for Trump
description: WASHINGTON  In an extraordinary denunciation of Donald J. Trumps temperament and competence, President Obama urged leaders of the Republican Party on Tuesday to withdraw their endorsements of Mr. Trumps candidacy, flatly calling him unfit to serve as the nations 45th president.

title: For a Star of UnREAL, Style Starts With the Socks
description: B. J. Britt, 34, stars in the second season of UnREAL, a Peabody Award-winning critics favorite on Lifetime, in which he plays a National Football League quarterback who signs on to be the star of a reality-TV courtship show. The native of Wilson, N.C., took a moment to discuss how his style has evolved since relocating to Los Angeles, and the one accessory he is very particular about.

title: Playing Pokmon Go on the Road? A Website Can Help With Rooms
description: For travelers seeking to score some out-of-town Pokmon with the popular Pokmon Go game, the search engine Alltherooms.com has added a PokView filter. Though the Pokmon critters tend to move around, using the filter during a room search shows the number of Pokmon within a radius of about 500 feet at the time of the search, specifying the type and number of Pokmon in that range. The website, which aims to function like the Google of accommodations searches, compiling all rooms available in a location from Couchsurfing and Airbnb accommodations to hotels and houseboats, also notes the proximity of stationary Poke gyms and Pok stops, places where players may spend more time.

title: Czech Man Is Charged With Attempted Terrorism
description: A 25-year-old mechanic and loner from a small Czech town, who tried to travel to Syria in January, was charged on Tuesday with attempted terrorism, in what the authorities said was the first known case of a Czech citizen trying to join the Islamic State.

title: Illegal in Massachusetts: Asking Your Salary in a Job Interview
description: In a groundbreaking effort to close the wage gap between men and women, Massachusetts has become the first state to bar employers from asking about applicants salaries before offering them a job.

title: Fly-Fishing in Montana, Where a River Still Runs Through It
description: In our family, there was no clear line between religion and fly fishing. Thats how Norman Maclean began A River Runs Through It, his revered 1976 autobiographical novella about his life in Missoula, Mont., as the son of a Presbyterian minister and devout angler in the years before World War II.

title: Ill Boy, 7, Dies a Day After Being Made Honorary Marine
description: Wyatt Gillette was only 4 when doctors told his family that he had Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome, a disease that affects the brain, immune system and skin.

title: James ONeill, Officer Since 1983, Will Step Into Police Dept.s Top Job
description: For months, Chief James P. ONeill was the man in the blue uniform with four gold stars standing, shoulders square, just behind Police Commissioner William J. Bratton in his pressed suits and Herms ties.

title: China, Not Silicon Valley, Is Cutting Edge in Mobile Tech
description: HONG KONG  Snapchat and Kik, the messaging services, use bar codes that look like drunken checkerboards to connect people and share information with a snap of their smartphone cameras. Facebook is working on adding the ability to hail rides and make payments within its Messenger app. Facebook and Twitter have begun live-streaming video.

title: In Case You Missed It: July's Top Real Estate Stories
description: Catch up on the most popular stories of the month.

title: When the Shop Looks a Lot Like Home
description: In the market for a bath fixture? Why just browse when you can take an actual shower at the Pirch showroom in SoHo and bring immersive shopping to a whole new level? Better yet, book a night at the New Road Residence in London: Try the linens, towels, appliances and whip up a dinner in the model kitchen before committing to your home improvement purchases. Over at the Apartment by the Line you can rifle through closets and dresser drawers stocked with clothing from burgeoning labels such as Protagonist and Khaite, then take the dresser itself, charge and carry. Or perhaps youd prefer to retire to an elegant Upper East Side townhouse  courtesy of the Row  and check out the brands latest offerings nestled among a fantasy collection of Keith Harings and Basquiats.

title: The McCall Pattern Company
description: The home-sewing brand founded in 1863 finds itself newly fashionable.

title: McCall Pattern Companys Archive
description: A look back at some of the classic looks and now-famous models featured in McCall patterns over the years.

title: Pessimism Might Not Be a Winning Bet for Republicans
description: A political lifetime ago, Ronald Reagans pollster seized on this question to frame the campaigns argument during his 1980 presidential campaign: Is the country headed in the right direction, or is it on the wrong track?

title: Muslims in the Military: The Few, the Proud, the Welcome
description: When Donald J. Trump said last fall that he would consider making Muslims in the United States carry special identification cards, Tayyib Rashid reached into his wallet and pulled out his military ID, then posted a picture of it online, adding:

title: Feeling Guilty About Not Flossing? Maybe Theres No Need
description: For decades, the federal government  not to mention your dentist  has insisted that daily flossing is necessary to prevent cavities and gums so diseased that your teeth fall out.

title: Do-It-Yourself Fashion Thrives at the McCall Pattern Company
description: The internet did little to disrupt it. Globalization could not shut it down. But while the McCall Pattern Company, the home-sewing brand founded in 1863, may seem like a business that time forgot, it finds itself newly fashionable.

title: Growth and Government
description: Despite arguments that Big Government hinders economic activity, many countries where government has grown the most have also experienced stronger economic growth. Governments have grown across most industrialized nations  raising more taxes over time to offer more public services. In the United States, by contrast, the government remains virtually as small as it was 50 years ago.

title: Why Hillary Clintons Polling Bounce Has a Better Chance to Persist
description: What a month. At the end of a series of tumultuous events and two political conventions, the presidential race is more or less where it was before it all began: Hillary Clinton has a clear lead.

title: Faun Fabless Summer Tour Diary, from the Alps to Oklahoma
description: The alt-folk band, consisting of Dawn McCarthy and Nils Frykdahl and their three young daughters, has traveled all over Europe and the U.S. this summer during the girls summer break.

title: On the Road with a Ragtag Family Band
description: I felt a calling, the gypsy family, the Von Trapp family singers, says Dawn McCarthy, who fronts the alt-folk band Faun Fables along with her partner, Nils Frykdahl. (Their website describes them as art-witch songtellers, which should give you some idea of what they sound like.) The band is now truly a family affair: It includes the couples three young daughters, Edda, 8, Ura, 6, and Gudrin, 3. Edda and Ura are in school during the year at the familys home in Sonoma County, Calif.; but during their summer break, Faun Fables pack up their gear to drive cross-country for tours  and travel to European music festivals.

title: Opting for Jimmy Fallon as Host, Globes Choose Playful Over Biting
description: LOS ANGELES  A kinder, gentler Golden Globes? NBC said on Tuesday that one of its biggest homegrown stars, Jimmy Fallon, the host of The Tonight Show, would serve as the next Golden Globe Awards M.C., taking the baton from Ricky Gervais.

title: Dylann Roof Legal Filing
description: Lawyers for Dylann Roof, who is accused of a mass killing at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in 2015, submitted a motion challenging the constitutionality of the death penalty.

title: Years of Litigation Loom as Redstone Cases Open a Pandoras Box
description: The fight over Viacom is digging in for years of litigation as each side holds on to its own self-righteous claim to the poorly performing media company.

title: The New Mother Sauces
description: Expand your weeknight dinner options with these five simple sauces and their variations.

title: Five Sauces for the Modern Cook

description: To the Editor:

title: Stephen Sondheim Hopes His Next Musical Will Be Produced in 2017
description: Its looking like a Buuel bonanza in New York: The American musical-theater composer Stephen Sondheim and the British opera composer Thomas Ads have both written adaptations of the Surrealist Spanish filmmaker Luis Buuels 1962 dark comedy The Exterminating Angel, and both are hoping for productions in New York in late 2017.

title: Body Count Rises as Philippine President Wages War on Drugs
description: MANILA  Since Rodrigo Duterte became president of the Philippines just over a month ago, promising to get tough on crime by having the police and the military kill drug suspects, 420 people have been killed in the campaign, according to tallies of police reports by the local news media.

title: Donald Trump Proposes to Double Hillary Clintons Spending on Infrastructure
description: Donald J. Trump took a step to Hillary Clintons left on Tuesday, saying that he would like to spend at least twice as much as his Democratic opponent has proposed to invest in new infrastructure as part of his plan to stimulate the United States economy.

title: An Addition to de Blasios Morning Coffee and Workout: Protesting Police Officers
description: Mayor Bill de Blasios dedication to his morning ritual around a gym in his former neighborhood of Park Slope, Brooklyn, has been well documented.

title: 3 Walmart Employees in Florida Face Charges in Death of Shoplifter
description: It was, by the official account, a brazen shoplifting attempt. A 64-year-old man loaded a shopping cart with $380 worth of DVDs at a Walmart in Florida and made for the door, holding up his sagging pants as he ran.

title: Donald Trump Jousts With a Crying Baby at His Rally
description: ASHBURN, Va.  Silent protesters. A group in AARP shirts. A crying baby. They all ended up having to leave Donald J. Trumps rally in Virginia on Tuesday, for various reasons.

title: This Land Is Whose Land?
description: About 640 million acres of land in the United States  permanent wilderness, national parks, national wildlife refuges and other protected areas  belong not to the states or to individuals, but to Americans as a whole through ownership by the federal government. The land is ours to conserve, protect, enjoy and, in some instances, to lease for oil drilling, mining, ranching and other commercial uses.

title: Turks Can Agree on One Thing: U.S. Was Behind Failed Coup
description: ISTANBUL  A Turkish newspaper reported that an American academic and former State Department official had helped orchestrate a violent conspiracy to topple the Turkish government from a fancy hotel on an island in the Sea of Marmara, near Istanbul. The same newspaper, in a front-page headline, flat-out said the United States had tried to assassinate President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on the night of the failed coup.

title: Trump Remarks on Baby at Event
description: During a rally in Virginia on Tuesday, Donald J. Trump, the Republican presidential nominee, told a crowd he loved babies when a child started crying. Then he quickly pivoted, saying, Get the baby out of here.

title: The Scale of Turkeys Purge Is Nearly Unprecedented
description: How the Turkish presidents sweeping purge of political opponents would look if Americans were targeted at a similar scale.

title: Time for a Permanent Site for the Olympics
description: To the Editor:

title: Faun Takes a Playful Spin in Prospect Heights
description: FAUN A neighborhood charmer, to be sure, but this airy, polished storefront with a long bar and seating in a lushly planted garden may well attract a wider audience. Its about the chef, Brian Leth, who was at Vinegar Hill House for four years. David Stockwell, who owns the restaurant with Carla Swickerath, said the name was meant to reflect a certain mythic playfulness. Though many dishes on the Italian-accented menu seem familiar, they often veer into quirky new directions and showcase uncommon ingredients. A soft shell crab is parked on a Caesar-style salad, bone marrow lurks in the ravioli, and there are offerings like tongue, Spanish mackerel, tripe, cockscombs, veal short ribs and lamb neck. The restaurant takes reservations but not tips: 606 Vanderbilt Avenue (St. Marks Avenue), Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, 718-576-6120, faun.nyc.

title: Obama Defends Trans-Pacific Deal Against Strong Anti-Trade Tide
description: WASHINGTON  Battling a powerful anti-trade tide, President Obama vowed on Tuesday to continue pressing for his historic trans-Pacific trade deal over opposition from both Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump, saying the agreement is essential for America to thrive in a global economy.

title: With Donald Trump as Nominee, Whats a Troubled Republican to Do?
description: To the Editor:

title: When in London, Skip Town for the Sea
description: In the 19th century, Londoners headed 80 miles east to Margate, Kent, for healing waters and holiday vibes; by the 1970s, the town had sunk into a sea of neglect. Now, five years after the opening of the David Chipperfield-designed Turner Contemporary gallery, Margate is seeing a second wave with a growing community of artists and epicures  plus hipsters down from London joining the bucket-and-spade brigade. Some even call it Shoreditch-on-Sea.

title: Anthrax Outbreak in Russia Kills Boy, 12, and Hospitalizes Others
description: MOSCOW  An outbreak of anthrax, a deadly bacterial disease that is rare in developed countries, has hit a remote region of northern Russia, killing a 12-year-old boy and sending 90 other people to hospitals.

title: Online Upstarts Pose a Threat to Procter & Gamble
description: Shave Club syndrome could hamper Procter & Gambles makeover.

title: Major Change Possible in South Africa
description: Local elections could usher in change in South Africa, opinion polls suggest. The ruling African National Congress could lose major cities it has held since the end of apartheid 22 years ago.

title: A Face-Lift for Tattoos
description: Jo Galvis was 15 years old when she got a tattoo on the center of her lower back. She had been fighting with her family and living at a friends house. What better way to infuriate her parents?

title: Big Banks Make a Pitch for Hearts and Minds
description: At both the Democratic and Republican conventions, the nations biggest banks were again cast as the bad guys, criticized as being too big and too risky.

title: 3 Top D.N.C. Officials Leave as Upheaval After Email Breach Continues
description: The shake-up at the Democratic National Committee after an embarrassing breach of its email system continued on Tuesday with the departure of three senior officials.

description: Does this sound familiar?

description: $2.5 MILLION

title: Calvin Klein Names Its First Chief Creative Officer
description: Calvin Klein named its first chief creative officer on Tuesday as the fashion industrys extraordinary game of musical chairs at the top of major houses continues this season.

title: Stop Indulging Trump
description: This column has been updated to reflect news developments.

title: Wrongfully Convicted of Rape, a New Jersey Man Finds More Punishment After Prison
description: Exonerations of wrongfully convicted people have become so routine in recent years that their stories are almost commonplace. We think we know the narrative: A defendant languishes in prison for a crime he did not commit; through tenacious legal work  or the magic of DNA tests  he is freed.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: A Salzburg Festival Rich With Dreams and Power
description: SALZBURG, Austria  Thousands of refugees are fleeing conflicts in the Middle East that once felt far away. Politicians making strident nationalist arguments are surging in polls. The problems coursing through Europe right now could hardly be more real. So it at first seems curious, even irresponsibly escapist, that the theme of this summers Salzburg Festival is the nature and power of dreams.

title: Franciszek Macharski, 89, Dies; Archbishop Succeeded John Paul II in Krakow
description: WARSAW  Cardinal Franciszek Macharski, who succeeded John Paul II as archbishop of Krakow and was known for his work with the poor over his 27 years in the post, died on Monday in Krakow. He was 89.

title: Bangladesh Offers Bounties for Two Terrorism Suspects
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  The authorities in Bangladesh have offered cash bounties for two men believed to have planned recent Islamist attacks there, reflecting a sense of urgency as terror alert levels remain high.

title: The Unbundled City
description: I want to indulge myself a bit, talking about todays interesting article in the Times about corporate headquarters moving back to cities and how it relates to an old discussion in one of my home fields, economic geography.

title: The Messages of Koko, Zika and the Colorado
description: Three television documentaries are vying for your attention over the next two days, serendipitously stacked in order of accessibility. Start off by revisiting a famous talking gorilla, then get serious with everybodys favorite modern nightmare, devastating viruses. If you make it through those two (which are on Wednesday night on PBS) on Thursday, Discovery has a graduate-level offering about the never sexy but crucial issue of water rights.

title: After Withdrawing From Bayreuth, This Conductors Silence Grows Louder
description: LENOX, Mass.  Late on Thursday afternoon, the strains of a trumpeter rehearsing the opening bars of Mahlers Fifth Symphony drifted across the Tanglewood lawns here. It didnt sound quite confident enough to be the Boston Symphony Orchestras principal, Thomas Rolfs. And it wasnt  it was the orchestras music director Andris Nelsons.

title: Forbes Carlile, Innovative Coach Who Studied Science of Swimming, Dies at 95
description: Forbes Carlile, the Australian whose innovative ideas about sports physiology made him one of the worlds best-known swimming coaches and authorities on the sport, died on Tuesday in Sydney. He was 95.

title: Summer Movies Preview: 10 Trailers for August
description: A suicide squad, a samurai, hot dogs and a young Barack Obama come to the big screen this month.

title: I, Destini
description: A racist system. A brother in jail. One teenage girl turned to animation to make sense of it all.

title: Olympic Cover-Up: Why You Wont See Some Shoe Logos
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The track and field events at the Rio Olympics this month will showcase elite athletic talent and, if you look closely, creative subterfuge.

title: Destinis Brother
description: When we conceived this film two years ago, we were simply trying to break through the static narratives of police violence that we saw on our televisions. We were in Durham, N.C., which in terms of racial tension felt similar to many American cities before Ferguson became a household name, and Black Lives Matter became a national movement. The city was full of organizers, families and working people who spent their evenings huddled in the backs of restaurants, barber shops and community centers, trying to shed light on issues of inequality that we felt the media consistently missed.

title: Ronald Lauder, Advocate of Art Restitution, Says His Museum Holds a Clouded Work
description: When it comes to art plundered in Europe during World War II, Ronald S. Lauder, chairman of the Commission for Art Recovery, has been very much the face, and soul, of the restitution movement.

title: Cover Lets Household Drills Be Used in Surgery
description: A sterile cover for hardware-store drills, which allows them to be used in operating rooms, is one of several innovations that the Grand Challenges of Canada program has chosen to support financially.

title: Pope Francis Appoints Panel to Study Women Deacons: Q&A With a Member
description: Pope Francis has created a commission to study the possibility of ordaining women as deacons in the Roman Catholic Church. On Tuesday, he named 12 experts  six men and six women  to serve on the panel.

title: U.S. Presidential Race, Rio, William Bratton: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: South Africans Head to Polls Amid Fierce Challenge to Party of Mandela
description: MAMELODI, South Africa  For an opposition candidate like Solly Msimanga, this township outside South Africas capital, Pretoria, was a gold mine of unhappiness. Residents of the areas shacks complained about the lack of electricity, water and jobs  and they placed the blame squarely with the long-governing African National Congress.

title: Colson Whitehead on Slavery, Success and Writing the Novel That Really Scared Him
description: Colson Whitehead has long had a thing for the metaphoric possibilities of mechanized modes of transport, the more old-fashioned the better.

title: The Essentials of Brazilian Music for Olympic Listening
description: Casual and seductive on the surface, ingenious and multilayered within  thats the music of Brazil, which is about to get a new burst of global exposure as the Olympics begin in Rio de Janeiro. Its a great moment to discover how much wider and deeper Brazilian music goes, beyond the stereotypes of gaudy carnival parades and suave bossa novas by the beach.

title: Not Forgotten: James Baldwin, Who Wrote for Equality at All Costs
description: The great African-American writer and activist, remembered through his own words.

title: Ivanka Trump Stays Mostly Mum on Being Dragged Into Debate on Sexual Harassment
description: Ivanka Trump, 34, is many things: a mother, an executive and an entrepreneur who has a prominent role in the Republican presidential campaign of her father, Donald J. Trump.

title: Donald Trump Refuses to Endorse Paul Ryan and John McCain
description: Donald J. Trump on Tuesday refused to endorse two leading Republicans  the House speaker, Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin, and Senator John McCain of Arizona  in their primary election campaigns.

title: In Libya, a New Front in the War on ISIS
description: The American military this week began bombing Islamic State targets in Libya, opening another front in its war against the terrorist group. The campaign was launched to help Libyan fighters allied with the countrys fledgling, internationally recognized government rout the Islamic State from Surt, a coastal city that, since 2014, has served as a base for ISIS efforts to establish a franchise in Libya.

title: U.S. Strikes Help Libyan Forces Against ISIS in Surt
description: WASHINGTON  The United States on Tuesday stepped up a new bombing campaign against the Islamic State in Libya, conducting its first armed drone flights from Jordan to strike militant targets in the coastal city of Surt.

title: U.N. Drafts Agreement on Refugees and Migrants
description: More people are forcibly displaced from their homes today than at any time since the end of the Second World War.

title: Sailors on Guanabara Bay Are Adept at Dodging Debris and Skirting Sewage
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Ian Andrewes, a coach for the Canadian sailing team, thought he had seen every type of flotsam and jetsam in his years on the water.

title: Memories of Depression-Era Brooklyn
description: Dear Diary:

title: Redstones Granddaughter Joins a Suit Against Him
description: Claiming that she has been disinherited out of $6 million and potentially $1 billion more, the granddaughter of the mogul Sumner M. Redstone has joined the lawsuit challenging his mental competence, asserting that he has been unduly influenced by his daughter.

title: The Police Force Mr. Bratton Leaves Behind
description: Police Commissioner William Bratton abruptly announced on Tuesday that he is stepping down next month, more than a year earlier than expected. He is leaving his boss, Mayor Bill de Blasio, in a tough spot.

title: Delaware Supreme Court Rules States Death Penalty Unconstitutional
description: Delawares rules for imposing the death penalty are unconstitutional, the states Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday, a decision that could mean an effective end to capital punishment in Delaware.

title: U.S. Womens Soccer Team Has Changed, but Hunt for Gold Has Not
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Scroll back to 2011 for a minute. In the quarterfinals of the Womens World Cup, with the United States down a goal and a player in the final seconds of overtime, Megan Rapinoe curled a 45-yard crossing pass onto the forehead of Abby Wambach, who smashed it into the net for a 2-2 tie in a game that the Americans won on penalty kicks.

title: Underwater in the Las Vegas Desert, Years After the Housing Crash
description: LAS VEGAS  Michael Hutchings bet it all when he built his 3,300-square-foot dream home on a strip of rock-strewn desert gazing west toward the Las Vegas Strip. He had made a fortune building custom homes as Vegas boomed higher and higher, and for his own, he chose red Spanish tiles, wrought iron and silky white plaster. A guesthouse? Sure. Swimming pool? Of course.

title: In Las Vegas, Thousands Have Not Recovered From the Housing Crisis
description: More than eight years after the housing crash, one in four homeowners in the Las Vegas area owes more than his or her home is worth.

title: As Brattons Successor, ONeill Is Rising to Critical Job at Key Time
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio just shrank the chances of one especially piercing political headache in an election year: Almost surely, he wont have the departing police commissioner, William J. Bratton, shooting at him from the weeds.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The whole systems kind of broke. Were trying to reinvent ourselves, trying to run businesses, trying to pretend like its 2003 again. And its not.

title: Saudi Inclusion in List of Childrens Rights Violators Resurfaces at U.N.
description: Saudi Arabias inclusion in a United Nations report on armies that kill and maim children  which incited that countrys fury  resurfaced on Tuesday in a Security Council meeting, two months after the Saudis pressed Secretary General Ban Ki-moon into temporarily removing the designation.

title: Man Shot by Officer in Queens Apartment Is Charged With Burglary
description: A 37-year-old man who was shot by a New York City police officer in Queens was arrested and charged on Tuesday with breaking into the home where he encountered the officer, the authorities said.

title: Decorated College Quarterback Hopes to Catch, Not Throw, Passes for the Jets
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  For as long as Jason Vander Laan can remember, math has fascinated him.

title: Ignoring Advice, Donald Trump Presses Attack on Khan Family and G.O.P. Leaders
description: Donald J. Trumps unabashed and continuing hostility toward the parents of a slain Muslim American soldier, and his attacks on Republican leaders who have rebuked him for it, threaten to shatter his uneasy alliance with the Republican Party at the outset of the general election campaign.

title: A Queens Dairy Plant Closes, but the Cows Had Long Since Gone Home
description: Henry Schwartz remembers going to the 1939 Worlds Fair, where crowds that had oohed and aahed at the Trylon and Perisphere watched his grandmother demonstrate how to milk a cow. She also gave talks on how to run a dairy.

title: Mets Mix-and-Match Outfield Has Jay Bruce in Right to Start
description: Two giant red Cincinnati Reds duffel bags sat in Jay Bruces locker in the far corner of the Mets clubhouse. Bruce, a slugging outfielder, had landed in New York on Tuesday morning and headed straight to Citi Field to begin his new life without checking in to his hotel.

title: Alex Rodriguez Finds His Final Role: The Yankees Elder Statesman
description: It took him more than 20 years in professional baseball, but Alex Rodriguez may have found a persona that will save his career. There may be nothing left in his bat, but as an elder statesman on a team in transition, he still has value.

title: No Rain in Sight, but a Closed Roof at Arthur Ashe Stadium Is Welcomed
description: Three years after plans for a retractable roof on Arthur Ashe Stadium were announced, and 13 years after it was a twinkle in the eye of United States Open officials, the roof closed Tuesday for its public unveiling. Then it would not reopen.

title: At Soccers Coaching Summit, Job Security Is a Relative Term
description: HOBOKEN, N.J.  Javier Martnez is about to begin his fifth season with Bayern Munich, the German juggernaut that has won 26 Bundesliga titles, 18 German Cup titles and five European titles. In every one of his first four seasons, Martnez helped the club raise the German league trophy.

title: Where Venice Is
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  When we last saw Neville Fogarty, he was looking at what happens when you break apart a common word; today he is doing something similar without being repetitive, so kudos to him. The theme was so much fun, it brought a song to my lips. Perhaps it did for you, too.

title: Federal Judge Allows Suit Against Trump University to Proceed
description: A federal lawsuit by former Trump University students against the schools founder, Donald J. Trump, will proceed toward trial, the judge in the case ruled on Tuesday.

title: Mahasweta Devi, Bengali Writer and Activist Who Fought Injustice, Dies at 90
description: NEW DELHI  Mahasweta Devi, a prominent Bengali writer and social activist who immersed herself in the lives of Indias poor and marginalized as she chronicled the injustices against them in fiction, died on July 28 in Kolkata. She was 90.

title: Meg Whitman, Calling Donald Trump a Demagogue, Will Support Hillary Clinton for President
description: Meg Whitman, a Hewlett Packard executive and Republican fund-raiser, said Tuesday that she would support Hillary Clinton for president and give a substantial contribution to her campaign in order to stop Donald J. Trump, whom she berated as a threat to American democracy.

title: I.O.C. Members Berate WADA Over Russia Scandal
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The United States top Olympic official had his first formal forum on Tuesday to weigh in on the issue that is consuming global sports officials ahead of the Rio Games: how to penalize Russia for doping violations and elaborate cheating schemes.

title: De Aza, dArnaud and deGrom Help Mets Cruise Past Yankees
description: For two Mets players, the season has been a slog. Alejandro De Azas miserable start had fans calling for his release by the summer. Travis dArnaud missed 50 games with a shoulder injury, was slow to return to form and was dangled as trade bait.

title: City Report Suggests Progress in Effort to Curb Violence at Rikers Island
description: After years of struggling to curb brutality by guards at the Rikers Island jail complex, the New York City Correction Department on Tuesday heralded a substantial drop in the use of physical force on inmates resulting in serious injuries in the first half of the year.

title: North Korea Fires Ballistic Missile Into Waters Off Japan
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea fired a ballistic missile into waters near Japan on Wednesday, a day after President Park Geun-hye of South Korea said her government remained firm in its plan to deploy an advanced American missile defense system despite protests at home and from China.

title: A Memoir by the Daughter of Art Spiegelman and Franoise Mouly
description: IM SUPPOSED TO PROTECT YOU FROM ALL THISA MemoirBy Nadja Spiegelman372 pp. Riverhead Books. $27.

description: HERE COMES THE SUNBy Nicole Dennis-Benn336 pp. Liveright Publishing. $26.95.

description: FRONT PAGE

title: Motion Picture Academy, After Diversifying, Keeps Leadership Intact
description: LOS ANGELES  Having taken aggressive steps to change its membership roster, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has opted to keep its leadership the same: Cheryl Boone Isaacs was elected on Tuesday night to a fourth consecutive one-year term as the groups president.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Koko  The Gorilla Who Talks and Beat Bugs
description: Koko  The Gorilla Who Talks catches up with that language-savvy, kitten-cuddling primate as she turns 45. Beat Bugs sets childhood lessons to Beatles hits. And Hulu adds Youre the Worst and Homeland to its lineup.

title: Tim Huelskamp, Anti-Establishment House Republican, Loses Primary in Kansas
description: Representative Tim Huelskamp, a member of the hard-line conservative Freedom Caucus, lost to a political newcomer on Tuesday in the Republican primary for his Kansas district.

title: HSBC Profit Down 40% in Difficult Environment
description: LONDON  HSBC said on Wednesday that its profit fell 40 percent in the second quarter as the bank navigated the tumult surrounding Britains vote to leave the European Union in June.

title: Make the Government a Model Employer
description: When the Labor Department ruled last week that 674 workers in the cafeteria of the United States Senate had been denied their full pay in recent years, the contractor that runs the cafeteria said it was an accident. The workers said it was deliberate.

title: The Case for (Finally) Bombing Assad
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration wants to reduce the violence and suffering in Syria and, at the same time, quash jihadist groups there. This is why the White House is now pushing a plan for the United States to cooperate with the Russian military in Syria, sharing intelligence and coordinating airstrikes against the Islamic State and the Qaeda-affiliated Nusra Front. In return, Russia would force the government of Syrias president, Bashar al-Assad, to stop using barrel bombs and air attacks in areas in which neither extremist group is present.

title: What Protest Looks Like
description: This is the seventh in a series of dialogues with philosophers and critical theorists on the question of violence. This conversation is with Nicholas Mirzoeff, a professor of media, culture, and communication at New York University. He is the author of How to See the World and other books.

title: Why Trump Is Not Like Other Draft Dodgers
description: Boston  On the evening of Dec. 1, 1969, I was sitting on the floor of a crowded Brandeis University dorm room while on the TV the birth dates of men across the nation, contained in small blue capsules, were drawn out of a container. This lottery would largely determine who among some 850,000 of the draft-eligible would go to Vietnam and who would be left to carry on with their careers, free from the threat of enemy fire.

title: How Clinton Could Knock Trump Out
description: Maybe I just missed it. But in all the testimonials at the Democratic convention about what Hillary Clinton has done for other people, I dont recall anyone saying, I started a business because of Hillary Clinton. Or, I hired someone because of Hillary Clinton.

title: How to Crack Down on Social Media Threats
Paul Ryans Long, Hot Summer
description: Late in March, in the waning days of the Republican primary campaign, certain conservatives (myself among them) argued that Paul Ryan had an obligation to do more to stop the ascent of Donald Trump. At which point The Wall Street Journal editorial page rose to the speaker of the Houses defense.

title: An Olympian Feat: Seeing Pictures Before They Happen
description: Drawing upon experience, instinct and visual virtuosity, Chang Lee elevates the art of sport photography to an Olympic event.

title: Bitcoin Plunges After Hacking of Exchange in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  The digital currency Bitcoin plunged on Wednesday after Bitfinex, an exchange based in Hong Kong, said it had been hacked and funds stolen.

title: A Mothers Love? Of Course. Her Citizenship? Not So Fast.
description: Good enough to bear them, feed them, bathe them, and raise them  but in 27 countries around the world, by law, mothers cannot pass their citizenship on to their children, as fathers can.

title: Want to Relax in a New York City Park? Join the Crowd
description: Staircases were barred. People could barely move. Workers implored everyone to quit stepping on the flowers.

title: An Olympic Feat: Seeing Pictures Before They Happen
description: Being a top photographer at the Olympics takes meticulous planning, razor-sharp instincts, visual virtuosity and the ability to recognize drama  attributes that Chang Lee, a staff photographer for The New York Times, has in abundance. This week, he is in Rio de Janeiro covering his eighth Olympic Games. Despite that experience, he says he has found it more difficult to shoot each successive trip.

title: Review: Suicide Squad Chases Nihilistic Swagger but Trips Over Its Own Feet
description: Scholars of classical Hollywood sometimes speak of the genius of the system, a phrase coined by the French critic Andr Bazin to refer to the ability of the old studio machinery to turn out works of inventive and beautiful popular art. But times change. Suicide Squad, the latest product of the DC-Warner Bros. partnership, is a good example of the idiocy of the system.

title: Students and the Middle East Conflict
description: What some see as a celebration of culture through food, others see as a political statement, and an offensive one at that. Just slip an Israeli flag on a toothpick.

title: Katinka Hosszu and Her Husband Raise Eyebrows at the Pool
description: In the fall of 2012, Shane Tusup was asked to become more involved in Katinka Hosszus swimming career. That request came from his girlfriend, Katinka Hosszu, who suggested that he coach her. Deep down, he said, he knew it could work, but he also knew that someday they might come to regret it.

title: Living In Forest Hills, Queens
description: Home buyers are drawn to the Forest Hills neighborhoods relatively reasonable prices, excellent transportation, shopping and proximity to parks.

title: Forest Hills, Queens: City Life in a Suburban Setting
description: George and Chi Hae Chen carried out an exhaustive house hunt that took them to Westchester County and New Jersey before they settled on their two-bedroom two-bath co-op in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Exporting Terror: ISIS Defector Reveals Secrets
description: In this rare jailhouse interview, a former ISIS member from Germany tells his story and provides new insight into the militant groups plot to attack Western countries.

title: How a Secretive Branch of ISIS Built a Global Network of Killers
description: BREMEN, Germany  Believing he was answering a holy call, Harry Sarfo left his home in the working-class city of Bremen last year and drove for four straight days to reach the territory controlled by the Islamic State in Syria.

title: Exercise May Ease Hot Flashes, Provided Its Vigorous
description: Hot flashes are a lamentable part of reaching middle age for many women. While drug treatments may provide relief, two new studies suggest that the right type of exercise might lessen both the frequency and discomfiting severity of hot flashes by changing how the body regulates its internal temperature.

title: Hillary Clinton, African National Congress, Las Vegas: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Australia Allows Abuse of Refugees to Deter Others, Rights Groups Say
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Asylum seekers and refugees being held on Nauru under Australias harsh immigration laws are being deliberately subjected to suffering to deter others from trying to reach Australia, human rights researchers said after visiting the tiny island nation.

title: Appalachia on the Seine: Bluegrass Swings in Paris
description: PARIS  The rough-hewn sounds of clacking spoons, twanging banjos and humming fiddles might seem to be something of an anomaly in a city known more for Edith Piafs sensuous lullabies. But every month nearly 100 musicians and aficionados clamber aboard an old barge here for a nightlong conclave of Appalachian, old time and bluegrass music.

title: New York Today: Bratton Takes a Bow
description: Updated, 10:50 a.m.

title: Publicis Executive Is Out After Gender Diversity Remarks
description: Kevin Roberts, the executive at the advertising company Publicis Groupe who was recently put on leave over dismissive comments he made about gender diversity in the ad industry, said that he would leave the company on Sept. 1 so that we can all move forward.

title: Despite Sales, Harry Potter and the Cursed Child Isnt Magical to Some Fans
description: Scholastic had high expectations for Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, which arrived on July 31 with an enormous first printing of 4.5 million copies.

title: Morning Agenda: Profit at HSBC Plummets
description: Profit at HSBC Plummets The turmoil surrounding the vote by Britain to leave the European Union has left one of its banks reeling. HSBC said that its profit dropped 40 percent in the second quarter and announced that it would follow up the sale of its Brazilian business last month with a share buyback of $2.5 billion.

title: Frances President Says Trumps Excesses Make People Want to Retch
description: PARIS  President Franois Hollande of France has said that the excesses of Donald J. Trump made people want to retch, adding a scathing international voice to the chorus of those criticizing the Republican presidential nominee.

title: Tim Kaine, Straddling Dual Roles, Calls for Congress to Provide Zika Funding
description: Tim Kaines dual jobs, Democratic senator from Virginia and vice-presidential candidate, collided on Tuesday during a visit to Florida, when he called on Republicans to bring the Senate back into session to deal with the Zika threat given the outbreak in the states south.

title: 1916: Anxiety in Berlin Over War
description: LONDON  Strict measures have been taken by the Berlin authorities with a view to checking the spread of peace propaganda and with a view to netting those responsible for it. The proclamations scattered broadcast at night calling on the people to rise against the continuation of the war have had their effect, and signs of trouble in many towns are causing grave anxiety in Berlin.

title: Can I Put Down My Aging Pooch?
description: Our family dog, a 14-year-old terrier, is currently living with my wife and me in Paris. She has made the trans-Atlantic flight three times in the past year (crated in the belly of the plane) when we return home for various family events. The trip is stressful for her (and for me), but she has always rebounded quickly to her normal self, which is a pretty energetic and healthy dog. Recently, however, her health has declined a bit: less energy, hearing loss, brief moments of apparent confusion and an as-yet-unexplained brief seizure. But she is happy and devoted to my wife and me, enjoying meals and daily walks.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Roc
description: From the opening notes of its theme song  an a cappella version of God Bless the Child  I knew I was going to like Roc. That song was one Id heard my father croon my whole life, its lyrics cutting through the smoke from his cigarette as he grilled hamburgers or reclined on the couch and closed his heavy eyelids. To this day, God Bless the Child sounds like home to me. Ive also come to think it sounds like how I feel as a black person living in America: all at once hopeful, resigned, familial, lonely, beautiful, sad.

title: Chuck D Thinks Rage Is Good for America
description: Youre part of the new supergroup Prophets of Rage, which you call a collective task force of revolutionary musicians, along with some members of Rage Against the Machine and Cypress Hill. How is it different from performing with Public Enemy? Its like being in the Olympics. Theyre the best in the world. Im the weakest link. Ive never been part of something where I can play second fiddle.

title: The Brain That Couldnt Remember
description: Can you tell me who the president of the United States is at the moment?

title: Barbra Streisand Sets the Record Straight
description: MALIBU, Calif.  Barbra Streisand  whose coming album of duets, Encore: Movie Partners Sing Broadway, features a stellar supporting cast that includes Melissa McCarthy and Jamie Foxx  is talking about another duet with another celebrated singer, now long dead.

title: Why Useless Surgery Is Still Popular
description: Before a drug can be marketed, it has to go through rigorous testing to show it is safe and effective. Surgery, though, is different. The Food and Drug Administration does not regulate surgical procedures. So what happens when an operation is subjected to and fails the ultimate test  a clinical trial in which patients are randomly assigned to have it or not?

title: Lively Morgue Tumblr 725  729
description: Lively Morgue Tumblr 725  729

title: China Reins In Communist Youth League, and Its Alumnis Prospects
description: BEIJING  President Xi Jinping of China in effect wrote an epitaph to the shrunken influence of his predecessor and former rivals this week when the Communist Party announced major changes to its once-powerful Youth League, a training ground for many officials who have been marginalized under Mr. Xi.

title: The Evolution of the Lowly Leotard
description: Gymnastic leotards have gone from drab to high shine garments.

title: The Bedazzling of the American Gymnast
description: So it begins: the flag-waving excitement, the teeth-grinding anticipation, the blinding sparkle. The Olympics.

title: Not Forgotten: Henri Cartier-Bresson, Whose Decisive Moment Shaped Modern Photography
description: Cartier-Bressons concept of the split second that reveals the larger truth of a situation set the stage for hundreds of photojournalists to bring the world into living rooms.

title: Hong Kong Restricts Election Candidates, Renewing Fears of Lost Rights
description: HONG KONG  Moves by the government of Hong Kong to bar candidates from a coming legislative election over the issue of independence from China have raised worries in this semiautonomous city about the deterioration of political freedom and the potential for renewed conflict with Beijing.

title: Michelle Obama Chooses Creation by Lady Gagas Stylist for State Dinner
description: Continuing her efforts to fast-track the careers of young American designers on the global stage, Michelle Obama wore a gown by Brandon Maxwell, perhaps the newest and most up-and-coming of the names she has worn so far, to the White House state dinner for Singapore on Tuesday night.

title: Florida Company Gets Approval to Put Robotic Lander on Moon
description: A small start-up has received the green light from the federal government to do something that NASA has not done for more than four decades: land on the moon.

title: In Ireland, Chasing the Ghost of the Rebel Roger Casement
description: It didnt start with history, and it certainly didnt start with Roger Casement. After a trip a few years ago, during which I spent a few days each in Belfast, Cork and Dublin, I returned home feeling Id failed myself, and perhaps failed Ireland, by limiting myself to cities. Next time, I would find a cottage in the countryside, where I would read, and write, and take long head-clearing walks. That was the only mandate I gave myself: the promise of an Irish pastoral in real time.

title: Five Places to Go in Seattle
description: As Seattle becomes increasingly unaffordable to those raking in less than six figures, White Center, the unincorporated suburb to its south, has attracted a soulful blend of entrepreneurs, striking an elusive balance between gritty and friendly. It has an uncommonly diverse mix of residents and restaurants and a staggering number of pinball machines per capita. Some of its adult-oriented businesses  pornography, poker and marijuana  speak to its rough-and-tumble roots, flourishing there because of the tight restrictions of its more affluent neighbor to the north.

title: China Sentences Hu Shigen, Democracy Advocate, to 7 Years in Prison
description: BEIJING  An advocate for democracy and religious freedom in China was sentenced to more than seven years in prison on Wednesday, the state news media reported, as the government continued its prosecution of a group of rights activists accused of subverting state power.

title: How to Play Nice With an Angry Erdogan
description: The sweeping purges and mass arrests since last months failed military coup in Turkey have confirmed many of the worst fears about President Recep Tayyip Erdogans government. They are the most recent in a long history of abuses. Over the last few years, Mr. Erdogan has harshly repressed the Turkish press and civil society, supported extremist militant groups in Syria, broken off a promising peace process with his countrys Kurdish nationalists, and worked relentlessly to change his countrys Constitution so he can rule as a quasi-dictator.

title: $1,250,000 Homes in Hawaii, New York and Indiana
description: KEAUHOU, HAWAII

title: Time Warner Acquires 10% Stake in Hulu
description: Time Warner announced on Wednesday that it had joined forces with several rival media companies to chart a new future for the streaming television service Hulu, acquiring a 10 percent stake in it and committing programming for its new live TV offering.

title: Ben Brantley Answers Your London Theater Questions
description: Below are answers to reader questions about the London theater scene by  Ben Brantley, the chief theater critic of The New York Times.

title: 1966: U.S. Air Force to Leave France
description: WASHINGTON  All remaining U.S. flying units in France  six reconnaissance squadrons based at Chambley, Toul-Rosires and Laon  will be withdrawn between now and October, the Defense Department announced today [Aug. 4]. The squadrons are being removed because the French have asked that substantially all American forces be out of France by April 1, 1967.

title: The Hottest Start-Up Market? Baby Boomers
description: Boris Mordkovich, a 30-year-old serial entrepreneur, had never considered developing products for the aging baby boomer market. One day, however, he saw that his parents had started using an electric bike that his brother Yevgeniy had modified for his wife and himself.

title: A Villa With a Pool in Gibraltar
description: In a subdivision adjoining the Gibraltar Nature Reserve, this four-bedroom three-bath house is on the market for $4.62 million.
