title: Modi and Indias Dalits
description: A protest in the Indian state of Gujarats largest city, Ahmedabad, on Sunday by thousands of Dalits  members of Indias lowest castes  has brought to a head the contradiction between Prime Minister Narendra Modis promise of economic opportunity for all and a politics of division driven by right-wing Hindu ideology.

title: Trump Strategy: Win 3 Key States, and Warn About Rigged Election
description: Each week, Nate Cohn, The Upshots elections analyst, based in Washington, and Toni Monkovic, an Upshot editor in New York,  discuss the 2016 race and post a lightly edited transcript of their written exchange.

title: Prisma Adds an Artists Touch to Photos
description: STEP aside, Instagram. Theres a newer, smarter photo app taking social media by storm: Prisma.

title: Schooling Siri on Unusual Names
description: Q. How can I get Siri to stop mispronouncing my name?

title: Michael Phelps Chosen to Lead U.S. Team at Opening Ceremony
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Nathan Adrian was stressed, but for reasons unrelated to having to defend his Olympic 100-meter freestyle crown.

title: Dental Floss May Not Improve Your Health. But What Else Can You Do With It?
description: Weve all been there: Stranded on a sun-drenched island, needing to dry your wet clothes as quickly as humanly possible, with nary a branch or flat surface to be found.

title: Order in Fed Leak Case Against Goldman
description: The Federal Reserve forced Goldman Sachs to pay a $36.3 million penalty, escalating a long-running investigation into a 2014 leak of confidential government information.

title: Corey Lewandowski, Former Trump Campaign Manager, Dives Back Into Birtherism
description: It was one of the issues that propelled Donald J. Trump into politics: his  obsession with President Obamas birth certificate.

title: 5 New Sauces You Need to Master
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: In Guns on Campus, Tamron Hall Examines a Polarizing Issue
description: Investigation Discoverys lineup is heavy on true crime served sensationally (Wives With Knives, Deadly Affairs), but the journalist Tamron Hall sometimes brings more serious programming to the channel, as she does on Sunday, Aug. 7, with Guns on Campus: Tamron Hall Investigates. The program examines the debate over whether college students licensed to carry firearms should be allowed to bring them into class, but its jumping-off point is an attack 50 years ago at the University of Texas at Austin. Charles Whitman, after killing his wife and his mother at their homes, went to the schools signature tower and killed 14 more people, three inside and the rest sniper-style from the top of the structure. One of the men who helped end his rampage was an armed civilian, providing Ms. Hall with an avenue to discuss whether armed students might have stopped some of the more recent campus shootings in the United States. It is, of course, a polarizing issue, one that the program explores from both sides.

title: How Donald Trump and President Obama Put Republicans in a Bind
description: WASHINGTON  When Donald J. Trump goes low, congressional Republicans go quiet.

title: Twenty One Pilots, Bringing Rocks Pomp and a Lot More
description: The most important young mainstream rock band of the 2010s isnt much of a rock band at all. Twenty One Pilots is an amalgam of the sounds made by two decades of the disintegration of arena-size guitar rock. Its platinum 2015 album, Blurryface, is adventurous and ambitious; while remaining resolutely pop at its core, it aspires to rocks pomp without losing sight of how rocks energy now largely exists in other genres. The result is an album that nails familiar dynamics but with different inputs: nerdy rapping, Sublime-esque reggae-rock, head-bashing dance music, pop-punk, emo and industrial, with more than a dash of Broadway theatricality. The duo will headline a pair of shows at Madison Square Garden on Wednesday, Aug. 10, and Thursday. (thegarden.com.)

title: A Miracle Mosquito Repellent Is Hard to Come By
description: As tens of thousands of people arrive in Rio de Janeiro for the Summer Olympics this week, millions of mosquitoes, some perhaps carrying the Zika virus, await them.

title: Beloved Concertos at the Mostly Mozart Festival
description: The piano takes center stage at the Mostly Mozart Festival, when two pianists known for their probing musicianship join the festival orchestra in some of Mozarts most beloved concertos. On Tuesday, Aug. 9, and Wednesday, Richard Goode, a celebrated Mozartean, performs the concerto in A (No. 12) in a program conducted by Louis Langre that is framed by Mozarts first and final symphonies.

title: Photography and Feminism: Alice in Black and White at 59e59 Theaters
description: Alice Austen may not be a household name, but scholars of early photography or early feminism may be familiar with her remarkable life. Austen  who was born in 1866 and died in 1952  is now the subject of a play, Alice in Black and White, that explores both her early passion for the then-exotic medium of photography and her long relationship with her lover, Gertrude Tate. Over the course of her life, Austen amassed more than 8,000 images, of which 3,500 survive.

title: In Boston, a Major Della Robbia Show
description: When  it was revealed this year that the British sculptor Anish Kapoor had secured the exclusive use in the art world of a material called Vantablack, a substance blacker than the inkiest black ever dreamed of by Manet or Ad Reinhardt, it led to some grumbling among colleagues.

title: Fresh From Florida, Frederick Ashtons British Ballet
description: Its not uncommon for Americans to retire to Florida, but who knew that the British choreographer Frederick Ashton (1904-88) would end up there, too? The Sarasota Ballet has become a significant repository for his work, which will be showcased in style when the company appears at the Joyce Theater. Beginning on Monday, Aug. 8, A Knight of the British Ballet will survey Ashtons choreography, including Facade (1931), a tribute to popular songs and dances of the 1920s, and Valses nobles et sentimentales (1947). The program also features Tweedledum and Tweedledee (1977), a charming look at those characters; The Walk to the Paradise Garden, a homage to Romeo and Juliet, set to music by Frederick Delius (1972); and an excerpt from Jazz Calendar, called Fridays Child, originally created for Antoinette Sibley and Rudolf Nureyev in 1968. Theres never enough Ashton shown in New York, but mercifully, Florida has come to the rescue. (Through Saturday, Aug. 13; 212-242-0800, joyce.org.)

title: Robert J. Flaherty, Who Blurred the Line Between Nonfiction and Fiction in Film
description: Robert J. Flaherty is often called the father of the documentary: The term is said to have originated in a review of his Moana (1926). But veracity was not always his primary goal, as evidenced by his silent classic Nanook of the North (1922) and the talkie Man of Aran (1934), both heading to Anthology Film Archives.

title: Third Man Records Sends a Vinyl Record Into Space
description: Third Man Records, the label in Nashville that was founded by Jack White, celebrated its seventh anniversary last month by launching a record into space. A gold-plated vinyl copy of Carl Sagans A Glorious Dawn spun on a turntable attached to a high-altitude balloon, reaching 94,000 feet above the earth.

title: Mike Pence Splits With Donald Trump on Paul Ryan Endorsement
description: Gov. Mike Pence, aligning himself with the Republican establishment rather than his running mate, broke with Donald J. Trump on Wednesday by endorsing Speaker Paul D. Ryans re-election bid, a day after Mr. Trump roiled the party by declaring that he was not yet ready to support the speaker.

title: Daily Report: Venture Capitals Endangered Middle Class
description: Theres a lot of anxiety about the future of the middle class in America. There should be in Silicon Valley, too, but in a different sense: Its getting harder to see much of a future for midrange venture capital firms and midsize tech companies.

title: Nepal Elects Pushpa Kamal Dahal as New Prime Minister
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Nepals Parliament on Wednesday elected a Maoist and former rebel chief to lead the Himalayan nations coalition government as prime minister.

title: In a Victory for Modi, India Overhauls Its Tangled Tax System
description: BANGALORE, India  Lawmakers cleared the way on Wednesday for India to forge a single economic zone from its thicket of overlapping federal and state taxes, the most important economic measure since India opened its markets in 1991.

title: Runners Body Is Found in Queens Marsh; Police Look for Answers
description: It was part of Karina Vetranos routine to leave her home in Howard Beach, Queens, and go for a run along an expanse of undeveloped wetlands on the northern end of Jamaica Bay. She usually ran with her father, a retired firefighter, who had recently injured his back.

title: My Vacation With a Brain-Eating Amoeba
description: I expected a bumpy ride on a whitewater trip, so when I fell off my raft and coughed up the water Id inhaled, I wasnt afraid. But at the time I didnt know I was swimming with a deadly parasite.

title: James Houghton, Founder of Signature Theater, Showcase for Playwrights, Dies at 57
description: James Houghton, the founder and, until recently, the artistic director of the Signature Theater Company, one of Off Broadways essential nonprofit theaters and perhaps the nations leading safe house for playwrights, died on Tuesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 57.

title: Yankees Continue Call-Ups From a Newly Flush Farm System
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa.  Just as Al Pedrique was telling a few reporters late Tuesday night that he had not heard whether the Yankees were calling up catcher Gary Sanchez, his phone rang.

title: Federal Reserve Fines Goldman Sachs $36 Million in Document Leak
description: The Federal Reserve took action on Wednesday against Goldman Sachs and one of its former executives, escalating a long-running investigation into a leak of confidential government information.

title: Unfiltered Voices From Donald Trumps Crowds
description: New York Times reporters have covered Donald J. Trump's rallies for more than a year. His supporters at these events often express their views in angry and provocative ways. Here are some examples.

title: Voices From Donald Trumps Rallies, Uncensored
description: Kill her.

title: From A Tree Grows in Brooklyn to Little Men: A Boroughs Real Estate Crises, Onscreen
description: Youre gonna like this neighborhood, its become a very  bohemian area. So says the precocious tween Tony to his new friend Jake in the film Little Men, directed by Ira Sachs.

title: New Jersey Ties Graduation to Tests Aligned With Common Core Standards
description: The New Jersey Board of Education voted on Wednesday to require high school students to pass tests aligned with contentious standards, even as other states have moved away from these assessments.

title: Plans Take Shape for Franois Pinault Museum in Paris
description: PARIS  The 18th-century bourse in the pulsing heart of this city has long been something of a landmark, its central location a boon to its former use as a wheat and corn exchange, its iron cupola so distinctive that Victor Hugo said it resembled an English jockey cap. Now the luxury goods billionaire Franois Pinault is racing to meet a self-imposed deadline to turn the building into a private museum by the end of 2018, spurred by the hope, he says, that art can offer solace to a nation scarred by terror attacks.

title: Remaking Pennsylvania Ballet, ngel Corella Hires 17 New Dancers
description: The remaking of Pennsylvania Ballet is continuing. With the appointment of 17 new dancers on Wednesday  including Sterling Baca and Sara Michelle Murawski, who are joining as principal dancers  the companys artistic director, ngel Corella, has now overseen the departure and replacement of more than half of its dancers since his arrival in 2014.

title: Have Camper, Will Travel: A Starter Family Vacation
description: Looking to take an unconventional, and cheap, family vacation in the Florida Keys? Consider the camper van. Heres how to get started.

title: Washington Transit Officer Is Charged With Helping ISIS
description: A police officer with the Washington transit system has become the first American law enforcement officer to be charged with supporting the Islamic State, accused of trying to send financial help to the group after advising a friend on how to travel to Syria to join it.

title: The Florida Keys by Camper Van, With Baby
description: At $120 a night during Floridas notorious spring break, the Art Deco Hotel Shelley had seemed like a bargain. It even included a free airport shuttle to the hotels South Beach address, walking distance from where we would pick up our camper van rental the next morning before making a beeline for the Florida Keys. When the shuttle arrived, it was impossible to miss. Wrapped in a wheels-to-roof vinyl ad, the bus was a mobile billboard splashed with the racy, larger-than-life image of a buxom woman  her blond hair thrown back, her face flushed  being caressed by a masked man, red silk around his neck. Next to the door was a slogan: Quirky + Sexy + Chic No-Tell Hotels. My husband, infant daughter and I climbed aboard. I had, it seemed, booked my family at what in Mexico is artfully referred to as a love motel. Well, I thought, no Mom of the Year award for me.

title: Women, Men and Bias
description: To the Editor:

title: 33 U.S. Service Members Have Contracted Zika, Pentagon Says
description: WASHINGTON  More than 30 active-duty American service members  including a pregnant woman  have contracted the mosquito-borne Zika virus in countries where the disease has been identified, Pentagon officials said on Wednesday.

title: Aid to Central America
description: To the Editor:

title: Fueled by Small Donations, Donald Trump Makes Up Major Financial Ground
description: Donald J. Trump all but erased his enormous fund-raising disadvantage against Hillary Clinton in the span of just two months, according to figures released by his campaign on Wednesday, converting the passion of his core followers into a flood of small donations on a scale rarely seen in national politics.

title: Lethal Force by the Police
description: To the Editor:

title: Democrats, Looking Past Mere Victory, Hope to End the Trump Movement
description: Democrats had hoped the partys convention last week in Philadelphia would win over skeptical voters and ease concerns about Hillary Clintons trustworthiness, giving her a slight advantage in an unpredictable election year.

title: Video Games Where Its About Batmans Psyche, Not Whiz-Bang Action
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif.  In one scene of the new video game Batman: The Telltale Series, a sharply dressed Bruce Wayne is hosting a party for a friend when an underworld kingpin approaches and extends his hand.

title: Walmart Is Said to Be in Talks to Acquire Jet.com
description: Jet.com was born out of a dream of taking on Amazon and its grip on the world of e-commerce. But the online discount retailer may instead be poised for a humbling sale to the biggest traditional store chain around.

title: Read Books, Live Longer?
description: Reading books is tied to a longer life, according to a new report.

title: How the Coup Attempt Has Strained U.S.-Turkey Relations
description: After July's attempted military coup, the Turkish government is accusing the United States of supporting the military's failed takeover. Ceylan Yeginsu, The New York Times's Istanbul reporter, explains the tension between the countries.

title: Paris Partygoers, Bored and Short on Cash, Turn Suburbs Into Movable Fte
description: MONTREUIL, France  In a darkened makeshift theater in a former movie studio, dozens of 20-somethings recently sipped beer from plastic cups as they watched a film about their shared passion: the rise of suburban dance parties.

title: Mosquitoes on My Mind: Notes From Rio
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, the deputy sports editor Jay Schreiber introduces readers to the scene in Rio de Janeiro on the eve of the Summer Olympics.

title: The Best of Falls Military-Inspired Fashion
description: Rigid lines, tight corners and neat rows of buttons define the season.

title: Has Waiting for Things Become the Ultimate Luxury?
description: In the Tudor era, a lady-in-waiting provided noble counsel to the queen and could become the kings mistress or even, after a clutch beheading, the kings new wife. In waiting status gave such a woman access, power, clout. Meaning, even to be granted the opportunity to wait  to be possibly married to the king and maybe subsequently beheaded  was considered a great privilege.

title: U.S. Seeks to Protect Voting System From Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is weighing new steps to bolster the security of the United States voting process against cyberthreats, including whether to designate the electronic ballot-casting system for Novembers elections as critical infrastructure, Jeh Johnson, the secretary of Homeland Security, said on Wednesday.

title: What Hillary Clinton Faces on the Stump
description: One of the many difficult tasks facing Hillary Clinton as the first female major-party nominee is that of captivating American audiences with her words. Her husband and President Obama have been very good at this, but if Mrs. Clinton wants a female example, shell find that the list of women famous for their political speeches is not very long.

title: A Neglected Issue: The Politics of the Food We Eat
description: To the Editor:

title: Doors Around the World
description: We asked readers to submit their photos of a place they once overlooked  but now treasure.

title: The Doortrait Artists of Instagram
description: Every morning Tamara Yurovsky takes her wire fox terrier, Oliver, for a walk in Vinegar Hill, an enclave of Greek Revival homes built in the 1830s along the Brooklyn waterfront. Along the way he preens for photographs posted by Ms. Yurovsky on the Instagram account @oliver_thewirefox.

title: $400 Million Cash Payment to Iran Fuels Latest Campaign Dispute
description: WASHINGTON  A cash payment of $400 million delivered to Iran in January became part of the presidential campaign on Wednesday, as Donald J. Trump seized on the money transfer as a sign of what he called the administrations failed foreign policy  prompting a forceful White House rejection.

title: How Lowering Crime Could Contribute to Global Warming
description: It sounds simple: If something has a big carbon footprint and you get rid of it, you eliminate those carbon dioxide emissions. Right?

title: Kate McKinnon on Ghostbusters, S.N.L. and Hillary Clinton
description: Since its release last month, Ghostbusters, the reboot of the 1984 action comedy updated with a cast of female leads, has conjured up a series of heated debates about how women are depicted in movies and how they are treated online and in social media.

title: Fox News Sexual Harassment Inquiry Is Said to Look at What Others Knew
description: Investigators looking into sexual harassment accusations against the former Fox News chairman Roger Ailes are also examining whether other executives knew of alleged improper behavior by Mr. Ailes and failed to act on it, people briefed on the inquiry said on Wednesday.

title: Bipartisan Attacks on Donald Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: A Model-Turned-Musician Who Records on the Run
description: Nobody uses the iPhone voice recorder more than me, says the model Ian Mellencamp. I am that guy talking to himself on the subway, trying to record whatever melody or lyric that comes. He takes out his phone and presses play on a few saved memos: one recorded while he was running through East River Park, blurting out a melody while on a morning jog; another while walking down a crowded downtown sidewalk, humming chord progressions. Whenever the inspiration comes, I just need to save it somehow, you know? he says.

title: Pope Francis Remarks Disappoint Gay and Transgender Groups
description: Leaders of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender groups expressed dismay on Wednesday after Pope Francis said that schoolchildren are being taught they can choose their gender as part of what he called an ideological colonization.

title: The Tappan Zee Takes Shape
description: Over a mile of concrete road deck has been laid in the new Tappan Zee Bridge, the first major new bridge in the New York area in half a century.

title: Time Warner Deal Gives Hulu a Much-Needed $580 Million Lift
description: Time Warners willingness to serve as sous-chef in Hulus crowded kitchen could keep the broth from spoiling.

title: Milestone for New Tappan Zee Bridge: Its Halfway Done
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y.  The building of the twin-span Tappan Zee Bridge, the first major new bridge in the New York area in half a century, has reached the halfway point.

title: Review: Lori McKennas Gentle Rue Shimmers on The Bird & the Rifle
description: Halfway hidden in the hit factories of country music are songwriters like Lori McKenna, who quietly maintains her own recording career while others put her songs on the charts. The Bird & the Rifle is her 10th studio album in 17 years, and her most finely focused. It includes her own, scaled-down version of Humble & Kind, a No. 1 country hit earlier this year for Tim McGraw, which was also the first country No. 1 since 2012 credited to a lone songwriter, not a committee.

title: Jake Silverstein: Virtual Reality at The New York Times
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Spains Political Parties Fail to Agree on Coalition Government
description: MADRID  Spains political parties have not come to an agreement on creating a coalition government that would end seven months of political deadlock, the countrys acting prime minister said on Wednesday, potentially forcing an unprecedented third round of national elections.

title: What Donald Trump Gets Wrong About Sexual Harassment
description: As part of a nearly nonstop stream of inflammatory remarks in recent days, Donald Trump told USA Today that if his daughter Ivanka were sexually harassed in the workplace, I would like to think she would find another career or find another company.

title: Oberlin Professor Accused of Anti-Semitic Remarks Is Placed on Paid Leave
description: A professor at Oberlin College who made a series of Facebook posts that suggested that Israeli and United States intelligence services were behind terror attacks has been placed on paid leave while the college continues to review the case, the college said Wednesday.

title: Einojuhani Rautavaara, Composer, Dies at 87; His Lush Music Found Wide Appeal
description: Throughout most of his life, the Finnish composer Einojuhani Rautavaara wrestled with two shadow presences.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Gillian Jacobs Reads To Fall in Love With Anyone, Do This
description: In this episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, the actress Gillian Jacobs (Dont Think Twice, Community) reads the essay To Fall in Love With Anyone, Do This, about an experiment between strangers that leads to a deep connection. To try it yourself, download the 36 Questions app.

title: Mary Ann Madden, Creator of Wordplay Contests, Dies at 83
description: Mary Ann Madden, who for three decades challenged New York magazine readers to compose double dactyls, literary limericks, godawful puns and dexterous spoonerisms in a weekly competition that foreshadowed hashtag games on Twitter, died on July 26 at her home in Manhattan. She was 83.

title: Lets Get Intimate. Big Music Doesnt Need Huge Halls.
description: Smaller is better.

title: Last Atlantic City Casino Linked to Trump Is Closing Amid a Strike
description: The last of the Atlantic City casinos once operated by Donald J. Trump is set to close early next month.

title: The Rocky Relationship of Donald Trump and Paul Ryan, a History
description: Speaker Paul D. Ryan treads a fine line between disavowing some of the Republican presidential nominee Donald J. Trumps more inflammatory remarks and disavowing Mr. Trump himself. We mapped out Mr. Ryans rhetorical footwork:

title: Ackmans Hedge Fund Sells Off Big Stake in Canadian Pacific
description: William A. Ackman, the billionaire investor, is once again shaking up his underperforming hedge funds portfolio by selling off a big equity stake in the railway company Canadian Pacific.

title: Yahya Abdul-Mateen II Trades His T Square for a Netflix Role
description: A few years ago, things werent going so well for Yahya Abdul-Mateen II. Even with an architecture degree from the University of California, Berkeley, he found himself laid off and out of luck. Rather than look for another job in the fields of housing or public policy, where he had planned a career, he decided to take a risk.

title: Health Secrets of the Amish
description: In recent decades, the prevalence of asthma and allergies has increased between two- and threefold in the United States. These days, one in 12 kids has asthma. More are allergic.

title: Kyle Abrahams Untitled America Trilogy Reaches its Conclusion
description: The final installment of the Untitled America, by the choreographer and MacArthur fellow Kyle Abraham, will have its premiere during the coming Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater season, which runs from Nov. 30 through Dec. 31.

title: Hillary Clinton Campaign Takes First Steps in Presidential Transition
description: With her partys convention behind her, Hillary Clinton has started to officially plan for her White House transition, putting two longtime aides in charge of the effort.

title: Barnyard Dust Offers a Clue to Stopping Asthma in Children
description: Scientists say they may have found a sort of magic ingredient to prevent asthma in children: microbes from farm animals, carried into the home in dust.

title: Social Security Now Requires Cellphone to Use Online Services
description: (NOTE: In mid-August, the Social Security Administration reversed this decision. A subsequent column has later developments.)

title: Review: Hot Feet and Cool Bodies at Vail
description: VAIL, Colo.  The path to the Gerald R. Ford Amphitheater here in this Rocky Mountain resort town primes the ear with sounds of nature. But on Tuesday, it was the sound of shoes on wooden platforms that kept the audience rapt for nearly three-quarters of an hour.

title: Theyre Handsome, Talented and Famous Olympians. You Probably Dont Know Them.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Olympics is Michael Phelps returning to the pool, Simone Biles going for gymnastics gold and Ashton Eaton looking for another decathlon win.

title: For The Humans, Home Is Where the Set Moves
description: There goes the neighborhood.

title: What I Learned at the Conventions
description: In an election year upended by outsiders, weve brought in an outsider to help make sense of it. Declan Walsh, a foreign correspondent, tells us what he saw at the conventions before he heads out on the campaign trail.

title: Trying to Recognize America in a Wild Campaign
description: Something, it seems, is off in America. What is it?

title: A Tantalizing Offering From a Meal Kit Service: The Box
description: FreshRealm got its start as a meal kit business, sending customers all the fixings to make, say, chicken quinoa salad with arugula and pistachios, or lemon-Dijon salmon with potatoes and green beans.

title: Joe Dante: Gremlins Director Reflects on His Biggest Hits
description: For Joe Dante at the Movies, a retrospective at BAMcinmatek running Friday through Aug. 24, the programmers let that director pair his movies, including Gremlins, Innerspace, The Burbs and Gremlins 2: The New Batch, with gems and oddities ranging across cinemas past, including The Black Cat, Dial M for Murder and the W. C. Fields comedy Its a Gift.

title: What You Get for  $1,250,000
description: A house in Hawaii, a condo in an Indianapolis church and a contemporary in upstate New York

title: Minimal, Smartly Finished Leather Bags  From a Home Goods Designer
description: The accessories and home goods designer Mary L Chan puts it plainly: Its presumptuous to insist that customers are going to hand certain things down for generations. But, she continues, Im also not interested in designing landfill. She found an intersection between the too-precious and the disposable in 2014. She made her first handbag, the Trudis tote, after failing to find a carryall that satisfied her exact needs; the thought behind her subsequent leather pieces has centered on the experience of going out into the world. What do you need to bring with you and how do you need to carry it? How do you want to present yourself? Chan lists as considerations. And how does the bag become a functional object that has a life of its own, and lives with everything else in your space?

title: Supreme Court Blocks Order Allowing Transgender Student Restroom Choice
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday temporarily blocked a court order that had allowed a transgender boy to use the boys bathroom in a Virginia high school.

title: Pentagon Says Deso Dogg, Ex-Rapper and ISIS Recruiter, Survived Airstrike After All
description: The airstrike on Oct. 16 was touted as a battlefield success against a key figure loyal to the Islamic State group. American defense officials announced that a recruiter for the militants, Denis Cuspert, a German-born former rapper known as Deso Dogg, had been killed in Syria that day.

title: Ill Child Becomes Marine Before Dying
description: A boy diagnosed with a terminal illness at the age of 4, became the 96th recipient of the honor.

title: Baseball and Softball Returning to Olympics in 2020
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Baseball and softball will return to the Olympics in Tokyo in 2020, but there is no guarantee the sports will remain beyond that year.

title: Garage Sale and Art Auction in the Hamptons
description: Benefit fatigue yet? The Hamptons charity circuit is in full bloom. On July 30, the Ovarian Cancer Research Fund Alliance held its 19th annual garage sale known as Super Saturday. Hosted by Donna Karan, Kelly Ripa and Gabby Karan de Felice, the event in Water Mill featured boatloads of discounted designer duds. That night, the Watermill Center had its 23rd annual summer gala. Art-world insiders traipsed the wooded grounds, dotted with art installations and performances.

title: James Houghton, a Daring Champion of the American Theater
description: It could be argued that James Houghton, who died this week after a battle with cancer, did more for the American theater during the past quarter-century than anyone else  playwright, director or producer, man or woman, anyone the average theatergoer knows by name.

title: Boko Haram May Have a New Leader, ISIS Magazine Suggests
description: DAKAR, Senegal  A reference in a newly released Islamic State publication mentions an apparent new title for a key member of Boko Haram, raising questions about its leadership and future after a major Nigerian military offensive.

title: No Easy Target: U.S. and Russia Take On Nusra Front Fighters in Syria
description: The Nusra Front poses a challenge, in part because it frequently works in coordination with other rebel groups, making differentiation difficult.

title: Instagram Posts May Have Escalated Fatal Standoff, Police Say
description: A police standoff in Randallstown, Md., on Monday in which a 23-year-old woman with a shotgun was killed after the police say she had been encouraged by her online followers to defy their orders has highlighted an unexpected role of social media in violent encounters.

title: Snapchat Used to Spook Advertisers. Not Anymore.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Snapchats chief executive, Evan Spiegel, took the stage in June 2015 at a marketing conference in Cannes, France, to champion advertising on the ephemeral messaging service, advertisers were wary.

description: It is the rare Metropolitan Opera singer who must be told the following:

title: Teslas Big Loss Reflects Its Costly Ambitions
description: Tesla Motors said on Wednesday that its losses deepened in the second quarter, but the electric-car maker pledged to expand production and improve the profitability of its vehicles.

title: Tronc Raises Guidance for Year Despite Second-Quarter Revenue Drop
description: Tronc, formerly known as Tribune Publishing, raised its guidance for the year on Wednesday, a move that implied confidence in the companys stand-alone strategy as it fends off a takeover attempt from the Gannett Company.

title: Texas Agrees to Soften Voter ID Law After Court Order
description: An agreement reached Wednesday would weaken Texas strict voter identification law and allow residents to cast ballots in Novembers election even if they have none of the seven identifying documents that the law recognizes.

title: Sex, Drugs, Rock and Reminiscences
description: Dear Diary:

title: Uncovering the Chicago Police Cover-Up
description: The police scandal that has roiled Chicago for months entered a new phase last week when a Cook County judge appointed a special prosecutor to investigate the cover-up that followed the police execution of a black teenager two years ago. The lawyers who petitioned the court for an outside prosecutor argued persuasively that the states attorneys office, which would ordinarily handle such a case, had been effectively captured by the Police Department and was incapable of handling the matter objectively.

title: Floridas $82 Billion Tourism Industry Braces for Zika
description: After enduring the years of ups and downs that came with being a part of Wynwoods transformation from a struggling warehouse district into Miamis hot new neighborhood, the restaurateur Ivette Naranjo thought the worst was behind her.

title: Kansas Republicans Reject Gov. Sam Brownbacks Conservatives in Primary
description: Republican voters in Kansas rebelled against the policies of Gov. Sam Brownback on Tuesday, ousting his fellow conservatives in at least 11 state legislative primary races amid widespread angst about Kansass financial situation.

title: At the Trade Deadline, Some Players Fight a Battle Between Reality and Rumors
description: Brandon Nimmo, a Mets outfield prospect, did his best not to check his cellphone as Mondays nonwaiver trading deadline drew near, but the stream of updates was unavoidable.

title: Donald Trump, Perhaps Unwittingly, Exposes Paradox of Nuclear Arms
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trumps remarks on nuclear weapons have brought him, at times, to a question: Why should he be constrained from ever using them?

title: Voters in Kansas Send Message by Ousting Tea Party Firebrand Tim Huelskamp From House
description: WASHINGTON  Frustrated voters in a sprawling Kansas congressional district sent a blunt message on Tuesday that might yet break through the din of this election: At some point the government needs to do something for them.

title: Jim Northrup, Vietnam Veteran Who Wrote About Reservation Life, Dies at 73
description: Jim Northrup, a born storyteller, began his writing career by necessity: Sent to a government boarding school as a 6-year-old American Indian boy, he resisted assimilation by regularly exchanging letters with his family on the Minnesota reservation that would become his home again.

title: Ex-Students of St. Georges School Reach Pact on Sex Abuse Accusations
description: BOSTON  More than two dozen former students of St. Georges School, an elite boarding school in Rhode Island, have reached a financial settlement with the school over accusations of sexual abuse, much of it from decades ago.

title: Win for DraftKings and FanDuel Opens Door for Sports Betting in New York
description: Daily fantasy sports returned to New York on Wednesday when Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed into law a bill that said it did not matter that the popular pastime walks, talks and smells like good old-fashioned sports betting: It really is a game of skill (wink) and merely a form of entertainment, to boot (wink, wink).

title: Official Defends Cuomo Program That Has Created Only 408 Jobs
description: ALBANY  New Yorks chief economic development official faced sharp questioning on Wednesday from lawmakers who questioned the wisdom and effectiveness of one of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos signature initiatives.

title: London Knife Attack Kills Woman and Wounds 5 Other People
description: One person was killed and five were wounded Wednesday night in a knife attack in London, the Metropolitan Police said.

title: Tightrope Walk Awaits New Yorks New Police Commissioner, and de Blasio
description: In the hours before midnight on Tuesday, at Deninos Pizzeria on Staten Island, voices boomed with laughter from a private table in the front, strewed with paper plates, glasses and pizza crusts.

title: In Colorado, Hillary Clinton Leads Donald Trump in Polls and Presence
description: COMMERCE CITY, Colo.  With polls showing Colorado slipping from the grasp of Donald J. Trump, Hillary Clinton sought to close and bolt the door on him Wednesday, campaigning in a heavily Hispanic community, while the Trump campaign dispatched Mike Pence, to rally the states bloc of social conservatives.

title: Result of a Parking Violation
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  This is only the second of Jonathan Kayes New York Times puzzles to be published, yet hes already taking over the joint. Its one thing to get comfortable; its another thing altogether to feel so confident that he appoints himself parking monitor and jacks up our cars.

title: Jeers Dont Bother Hope Solo as United States Wins Rio Opener
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Just nine minutes into the United States womens soccer teams Olympic opener Wednesday night, Carli Lloyd headed in an arcing shot that eluded the New Zealand goalkeeper and gave the United States a 1-0 lead.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: My friend asked them about France. And they started laughing. But really serious laughing, with tears in their eyes. They said, Dont worry about France.

title: Teixeira Sends One Long for Yankees, Then Flies Off the Handle
description: With a parade of veterans leaving, a conga line of prospects arriving and Alex Rodriguez anchored to the bench, it is a head-spinning time in the Bronx.

title: Mr. Robot Season 2, Episode 5: Secret Lives
description: Have you ever wondered how the world would look if the 5/9 had never happened? How the world would look right now? This question is being posed by a minister of the Chinese state security to a guest attending a party in his home, a young F.B.I. agent whos investigating the attacks to which hes referring. Theyre standing before a closet full of amazingly intricate womens dresses. He says they belong to his sister. He does not have a sister.

title: Yoenis Cespedes Heads to Disabled List With Lingering Quadriceps Injury
description: After weeks of trying to play through a right quadriceps injury, Yoenis Cespedes is headed for the 15-day disabled list.

title: Lifeguards at the Olympic Pool? Yes, Its Necessary
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  At the Olympic swimming pool, the worlds best swimmers are never more than a few strokes from the pool wall and always within reach of a buoyant lane marker. They are constantly watched by countless coaches and assistants.

title: Corrections: August 4, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Race and Chariots of Fire
description: With just a day to go until Rio, run to the nearest screen for pulse-quickening films about the American Olympians Jesse Owens, Kerri Walsh Jennings and Steve Prefontaine, as well as a surefire winner, Chariots of Fire.

title: Chinas Straddling Bus, on a Test Run, Floats Above the Streets
description: BEIJING  If youre driving in a Chinese city in the none-too-distant future and your car is engulfed in a smooth, humming metallic belly, dont panic. It may feel like an alien abduction, but probably its only a colossal, street-straddling bus.

title: Trump Reflects White Male Fragility
description: Reports of Donald Trumps demise are an exaggeration, to paraphrase and repurpose Mark Twain.

title: Why Cant the G.O.P. Get Real With Black Voters?
description: Cambridge, Mass.  With every news cycle focused on Donald J. Trumps latest misstep, its easy to overlook the fact that his campaign has drawn record low support from African-Americans  and that this achievement, as it were, illuminates something worrisome within the Republican Party itself.

title: Another Defeat for G.O.P Voting Schemes
description: The scurrilous campaign by Republican lawmakers in a number of states to disenfranchise qualified voters suffered another setback this week, when a federal judge ordered North Dakota to halt voter identification restrictions he said were blocking thousands of Native Americans from exercising their right to vote.

title: Intervening Donald
description: Do you think its true that the Republicans are trying to get Rudy Giuliani and Newt Gingrich to do an intervention with an out-of-control Donald Trump?

title: Donald Trump and a C.I.A. Officer Walk Into a Room
description: The government is arranging classified intelligence briefings for Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump to prepare them for the White House. This longstanding practice of briefing nominees is controversial this year: Senator Harry Reid has urged the C.I.A. to give Trump a fake briefing, while House Speaker Paul Ryan has said Clinton cant handle classified material. But what would a Trump briefing look like, anyway?

title: When Sandra Day OConnor Broke Into the Mens Club
description: Before there was the first female presidential nominee of a major political party, before there was a female speaker of the House or a female attorney general or a female secretary of state, there was the F.W.O.T.S.C.  the first woman on the Supreme Court, the wry signature that Sandra Day OConnor has on occasion chosen for herself.

title: Turkeys New Anti-Americanism
description: Shaken by a failed coup attempt, Turkeys government and many of its citizens are desperate for someone to blame. Instead of undertaking a thorough investigation of the facts, though, they have accused the United States of complicity in the insurrection. This has ignited a new wave of anti-Americanism that, combined with a sweeping government crackdown against enemies real and imagined, poses a serious risk to NATO, relations with the United States and Turkeys long-term stability.

title: The Eternal Return of Unenlightened Despotism
description: Whatever else it does, the Trump campaign will test the willingness of the American electorate to support a candidate who asserts his right to run roughshod over the Constitution and flout traditional constraints on the exercise of power. Will voters fall in line behind a man who declares I am your voice and I am the law and order candidate, a man who looks more than 30 million television viewers in the eye as he says

title: Should We Care if Our Politicians Avoided the Draft?
On and Off Stage With Robin Williams
description: A routine magazine assignment sparked a long-running friendship between Robin Williams and the photographer Arthur Grace, whose new book showcases the access only a friend could have.

title: Hillary Clinton Leads Donald Trump in New Hampshire and Florida, Polls Show
description: Three months before the November election, voters in New Hampshire, long one of the purple swing states in presidential elections, clearly favor Hillary Clinton over Donald J. Trump, according to a new poll. And another poll shows Mrs. Clinton holding a narrower lead in Florida.

title: Their Favorite: A Bed-Stuy Two-Family
description: In 2008, after living in assorted apartments around Manhattan, Seth Burroughs bought a one-bedroom in an Upper West Side co-op building for $625,000. When he met Elli Papadopoulos a few years later, she was renting a two-bedroom with a roommate in Sunnyside, Queens.

title: Could Donald Trump Drop Out? Some Bettors Seem to Think So
description: The latest guessing game is whether Donald Trump will drop out of the presidential race before Election Day. Although his campaign has denied that this is a possibility, ABC News reports that senior Republican officials are taking the idea seriously enough that they are exploring how to replace him if he drops out.

title: Alma Thomas, an Incandescent Pioneer
description: Alma Thomas, whose joyful abstract paintings are the subject of an undersized but important and inspiring exhibition at the Studio Museum in Harlem, had one of the great, late-blooming careers in American art during the post-World War II era.

title: British Royal History, and Intrigue, in a Quaint German Town
description: The quaint timbered houses of the German town of Celle recall the center of Britains most picturesque towns and villages. What is less obvious to the naked eye is that Celle is an ancestral home of Britains royal family, the House of Windsor.

title: Olympic Spirit in Brazil? They Stoned the Torch Relay
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  How do Brazilians feel about their big Olympic moment?

title: Social Circles Collide on a Dance Floor. Then a Brawl Ends in Death.
description: Someone cut the music, and then from the kitchen came the crash of a utensil drawer being yanked out of a wooden cabinet. Vernon Hubbard stepped over tiles strewed with spatulas, spoons, purple plates and an unopened liter of soda. His eyelids were droopy, witnesses said, and in each hand he carried a steak knife.

title: On and Off Stage With Robin Williams
description: When you photograph politicians and celebrities, there is a ritual that sometimes happens at the end. You get along with someone and they give you their phone number, say Lets stay in touch, said Arthur Grace, who has photographed presidents and entertainers for Time, Newsweek and other publications. Usually, nothing ever comes of the overture. But with Robin Williams, whom Mr. Grace photographed in 1986 for the cover of Newsweek, that exchange of numbers turned out to be the start of a three-decade friendship and a uniquely intimate working relationship.

title: The Innovation Campus: Building Better Ideas
description: Where once the campus amenities arms race was waged over luxury dorms and recreation facilities, now colleges and universities are building deluxe structures for the generation of wonderful ideas. They and their partners in industry are pouring millions into new buildings for business, engineering and applied learning that closely resemble the high-tech workplace, itself inspired by the minimally partitioned spaces of the garage and the factory.

title: The Great Outdoors: Camping in It, Writing About It
description: UNDER THE STARSHow America Fell in Love With CampingBy Dan WhiteIllustrated. 401 pp. Henry Holt & Company. $28.

title: Michael Grosss Latest Investigation in the World of Fashion Photography
description: FOCUSThe Secret, Sexy, Sometimes Sordid World of Fashion PhotographersBy Michael GrossIllustrated. 400 pp. Atria Books. $28.

title: Running for Your Past and Future Self
description: Before a big race, I always feel more sensitive than usual. I feel as if I could cry any minute and also never cry again. I feel nervous. I notice the texture of the grass on the warm-up field more than I usually do  I also sense my heartbeat more than on a normal day when I dont notice it at all. Stray frizzy hairs tickle the back of my neck. I try my best to keep the thoughts positive and productive and inspiring. Or at least distracting in a good way. When I step on the starting line, I will need to be razor-focused and entirely present  more so than any other time in my life. But on the warm-up field, it is perfectly fine  in fact, encouraged  to daydream.

title: Donald Trump, ISIS, Zika Virus: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Investors Turn to Risky Regions for Rewards
description: Yield-starved investors are so desperate for returns that they have been willing to take on the risk of investing in a country that recently underwent a failed coup and an attack on its main airport. Turkish stocks and bonds have been rising, in spite of the countrys debt being downgraded. It seems a 10-year bond offering a 9 percent reward is too tempting to turn down, even if the inflation rate is 8.7 percent and the currency is heading south.

title: New York Today: A Drone Invasion
description: Updated, 11:53 a.m.

title: Breast-Fed Babies May Have Longer Telomeres, Tied to Longevity
description: Breast-fed babies have healthier immune systems, score higher on I.Q. tests and may be less prone to obesity than other babies.

title: Clinton to Discuss Jobs in Las Vegas, a Town With Trumps Name All Over It
description: Las Vegas, a city that practically mints money  especially for those who own a hotel or casino  is a favorite destination for Republican presidential nominees scratching for major donations.

title: Challenge No. 7: Try a New Sport or Craft
description: Challenge No. 7: Try a new sport or craft.

title: Man Held After London Knife Attack That Killed an American
description: LONDON  A 19-year-old Norwegian man was arrested on suspicion of murder after a knife attack in Central London that killed an American woman and wounded five people, the Metropolitan Police said on Thursday.

title: Jonah Hill Is No Joke
description: You can tell a lot about a person by watching him lose. I did not suggest Ping-Pong specifically because I thought Jonah Hill would lose at it, but rather because his initial suggestion for an interview activity  tennis  presented logistical complications: specifically, the problem of trying to talk with someone from 70 feet away across a net on a loud city court. So Hill agreed to Ping-Pong. Doesnt Susan Sarandon have a Ping-Pong place in New York? he mused while forming a plan. Ive heard that. I know people whove gone there. I dont really know what Susan Sarandons involvement is. I just know for certain that shes tangentially connected to the Ping-Pong industry.

title: Jeffrey Toobin: By the Book
description: The author of The Nine, The Run of His Life and, most recently, American Heiress wrote his senior thesis about Samuel Adams: Musical rights to this work are still available.

title: Judge John Hodgman on a Husbands Bikini Briefs
description: Nancy writes: My husband, Tom, feels way too comfortable in his bikini briefs. He goes outside in them and even got us blacklisted from a nearby restaurant because, when the delivery man arrived, he answered the door in them. Toms mother is German, so enough said about the comfort with nudity. But I think this needs to stop.

title: Hash Browns With Every Meal
description: I had one of the great breakfasts of my life a few years ago on San Juan Island, north of Seattle, in a waterside coffee shop that served commercial fishermen, hippie farmers, kayak tourists and boat builders in equal measure. The grated hash browns there were cooked in thin sheets and run under a broiler beneath a handful of grated cheese to create crisp pancakes that could be used as a platter on which to serve fried eggs, or as a hat to top them, depending on your mood. When I got home to New York, I started making them for dinner as well as breakfast, as a side dish for steaks or chicken or lamb. It was labor-intensive to make the dish and ultimately annoying because one of my children wanted it all the time. So together we worked out a hack.

title: Can Gary Johnson, the Libertarian Nominee, Swing the Election?
description: In Gary Johnsons first run for the presidency in 2012, as the Libertarian Party candidate, he won just under 1 percent of the popular vote. He did not surpass 3 percent in any state.

title: The Struggles of Third-Party Candidates Through the Years
description: Recent polls show the Libertarian Party nominee, Gary Johnson, at around 10 percent nationally, a relatively high number for a third-party candidate this late in the campaign season. Major third-party presidential candidates have never had an easy time of it, even when they were former presidents or billionaires. Heres a short history of their mostly quixotic campaigns.

title: Bank of England Cuts Interest Rate to Historic Low, Citing Economic Pressures
description: LONDON  The Bank of England said on Thursday that it would cut its main interest rate to its lowest point ever and expand other measures to bolster Britains economy over concern that the countrys decision to leave the European Union could weigh on growth.

title: 1916: Furious Fighting at Verdun
description: Again the centre of interest in the gigantic battle on the French front is Verdun, and again the Germans on the right bank of the Meuse have been dealt a staggering blow. Not only has the offensive of the Crown Prince been checked; but he is even powerless to hold ground that he had captured at a fearful price.

title: Going to Rio for the Olympics? Squeeze These Places In
description: Whats new in town? is an innocent enough question, unless you ask it in a city hosting the Olympics, where a complete answer might stretch out longer than the 50-kilometer race walk.

title: Melania Trumps Ljubljana, Then and Now
description: If you are going to have a guide for a walking tour of Ljubljana in the footsteps of the local girl Melania Trump, her ex-boyfriend is hard to beat. For starters, Peter Butoln, in gold ascot, blue blazer and blond hair pinned back under gold-framed glasses, dresses the part. And Mr. Butoln, a public relations man, is a font of information, about not only this charming medieval town with terra-cotta roofs and Baroque fountains, but also the potential next first lady of the United States, who attended high school here as Melanja Knavs nearly 30 years ago.

title: Not Forgotten: Sprung From Poverty, the Tales of Hans Christian Andersen Endure
description: Hans Christian Andersens stories, which were at least partly rooted in his difficult childhood, endure more than a century after his death.

title: Zhou Shifeng, Chinese Lawyer, Is Sentenced to 7 Years for Subversion
description: BEIJING  A lawyer who took on Chinas political system with uncustomary grit, giving voice to dissidents and seeking justice for poisoned children, was sentenced to seven years in prison on Thursday, the authorities announced.

title: Now Playing in Chicago: Game Shows
description: CHICAGO  When it comes to games, this citys not playing.

title: How Israels Modern-Orthodox Jews Came Out of the Closet
description: JERUSALEM  On July 21, a young Israeli woman posted an account on Facebook about falling in love with another woman. The young woman comes from a modern-Orthodox Jewish family. She had been hoping to have a traditional Orthodox family life  a husband and several children living in a community adhering to Jewish law. Yet after a decade of searching for love, she ended up finding it where she least expected. Her true love came tangled up with the heartbreaking realization that everything she was hoping for  the husband, the children, the community  was not going to happen the way she envisioned it.

title: Viacoms Profit Slumps 29%, Providing a Lens Into a Business in Turmoil
description: Viacom reported a 29 percent plunge in profit in the latest fiscal quarter, putting its management in the hot seat as it continues to wage a brutal fight for control of the entertainment company.

title: Israel Charges Aid Groups Gaza Branch Manager With Funneling Funds to Hamas
description: ASHKELON, Israel  The Palestinian manager of the Gaza branch of World Vision, a major Christian aid organization, was charged by Israeli prosecutors on Thursday with infiltrating the charity on behalf of Hamas and funneling about $43 million in the groups funds over the past six years to the military wing of the Islamist militant group.

title: College Students Protest, Alumnis Fondness Fades and Checks Shrink
description: Scott MacConnell cherishes the memory of his years at Amherst College, where he discovered his future mtier as a theatrical designer. But protests on campus over cultural and racial sensitivities last year soured his feelings.

title: In Shift, Australia Pledges More Resources for Climate Research
description: SYDNEY, Australia  In a surprising about-face, the Australian government said on Thursday that new resources would be allocated to climate research at the countrys science agency, months after the announcement of staff cutbacks that scientists said would jeopardize Australias important role in the field.

title: The Get Down on Netflix: A Superhero Fable About the Birth of Hip-Hop
description: In the first episode of The Get Down, the new Netflix series about the genesis of hip-hop in the South Bronx, there is a scene in which Shaolin Fantastic (Shameik Moore), a jack-of-all-trades cool guy, finds himself on the wrong side of attention from a local gang.

title: Disney Dismisses Alex Timbers as Director of Frozen Musical
description: Thats cold! Disney has dismissed the director of its Broadway-bound Frozen musical.

title: Frances Real State of Emergency
description: When, on July 14, Bastille Day, a 31-year-old man drove a rented truck through crowds thronging the Promenade des Anglais in Nice, killing scores and injuring hundreds, France had been in a declared state of emergency for eight months. This state of emergency was renewed shortly thereafter, just days before two men killed a Catholic priest in his church near Rouen.

title: Roma Womens Business Plan: Cook Their Way to a Better Life
description: ROME  On a muggy July evening, a handful of Italian hipsters milled around a food stand at an alternative music festival in Rome, trying to decipher some of the exotic offerings: mici, sarmale and dolma.

title: Thailand Junta Seeks to Extend Its Power With Constitutional Referendum
description: BANGKOK  Two years after seizing power, Thailands military junta will hold a national referendum Sunday on a new constitution that it casts as an essential step toward restoring democracy.

title: Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg on Sausage Party, Their R-Rated Animated Film
description: How did Pixars beloved Toy Story childrens movies lead to the foul-mouthed, sexually explicit comedy Sausage Party, from the screenwriting team of Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg?

title: Think Like a Doctor: The Boy With Nighttime Fevers
description: The challenge:  A healthy 7-year-old boy suddenly starts having fevers and night sweats. Can you figure out why?

title: Smartphones Bring More Mobility to the Rental Car Business
description: OWNING a car in a congested city like New York or San Francisco can mean more hassle than happiness, what with traffic snarls, limited street parking and expensive garages.

title: Girls Who Code Visit The New York Times
description: Girls Who Code students develop paper prototypes during their New York Times field trip. Sarah Bures/The New York Times

title: Video Review: Decent Handling in a Toyota Prius? Yes, the New One
description: Embraced by progressives. Not terribly fashionable. Very popular in Vermont. It has long been the automotive equivalent of Bernie Sanders: the Toyota Prius.

title: The Puppies of Curious Incident
description: A look at the puppies who have aged out of the show.

title: For the Scene Stealers of The Curious Incident, a Happy Second Act, in Dog Years
description: ONE puppy went home with the actress playing the teacher. Another is now living with the actor portraying the father. The stage manager took one, as did a hairdresser, and the parents of a publicist.

title: Donald Trump Risks Alienating Military Communities in Swing States
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H.  Donald J. Trump is locked in an explosive feud with Republicans in Washington and has already faced humiliating defections within his own party that have destabilized his campaign on the national level.

title: 1966: Post Buys Into Herald Tribune
description: The oldest American newspaper published in Europe will have a new and broader base of ownership with the acquisition by The Washington Post of a 45 percent interest in the European edition of the New York Herald Tribune, it was announced today. Joint publication of the paper  to be called the International Edition of the New York Herald Tribune-The Washington Post  will begin in the fall, after completion of necessary legal formalities.

title: Inside the Olympics With the Sports Editor Jason Stallman
description: Looking for some crude raw beauty? Seven electrifying minutes? The Sports editor Jason Stallmans pregame guide to the Summer Olympics.

title: Bangladeshi Police Arrest 2 Suspected of Terror Attack on Bakery
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  When the Bangladeshi police freed hostages after a harrowing July 1 terrorist attack on a Dhaka bakery that left 22 people dead, two men remained mysteriously unaccounted for.

title: Rene Flemings Favorite Cities
description: For the soprano Rene Fleming, 57, constant travel is a nonnegotiable part of her work. Though the four-time Grammy-winning artist has homes in New York City and Washington, she estimates she is on the road 80 percent of the year for recitals and operas in cities such as Amsterdam; Sydney, Australia, and Buenos Aires.

title: Some Millennials Are Not Having Sex. But a Vast Majority Are.
description: Everyone is drinking, peering into their screens and swiping on the faces of strangers they may have sex with later that evening.

title: Below Exhibition Park Lake
description: Using an underwater microphone, Chris Watson recorded the sound of an insect, the water boatman, hitting its penis against its stomach in a lake in Newcastle.

title: No Game: The Olympics, Rio and Terror
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils Olympics begin on Friday, and local leaders and Brazilian society are ill-prepared for the threat of a terrorist attack like those in Munich in 1972 and Atlanta in 1996. They lack experience with the issue and dont have sufficient human and financial resources. In addition, the structure of public security in the country is weak. International cooperation is helping, but Brazil must face the challenge and improve its institutions for the future.

title: The i360, Worlds Most Slender Tower, Opens in England
description: LONDON  It has been billed as the worlds tallest moving observation tower, a futuristic 531-foot-high structure that will give visitors an experience that one of its creators likened to floating in a hot-air balloon.

title: Plumes and Sunsets
description: Plumes and Sunsets is a track on Kate Carrs new album. It features the sound of birds in the shadow of a French nuclear power station. The hum is the sound of electricity pylons.

title: Daily Report: The Message From Snapchat
description: Snapchat is famous for its disappearing messages. Its financial success, however, may prove a very durable message.

title: How Do Texans Beat the Heat? With Water From Mexico
description: HOUSTON  Anyone who has survived a summer in Texas will tell you the heat has heft. It pushes back when you try to move through it, squeezes sweat from pores you didnt know you had and leaves your mouth so dry you could strike a match on your tongue.

title: Market Closing Time
description: Ian Rawes recorded the sounds of the New Spitalfields Market closing up in London.

title: Finding Alternatives to Microsoft Excel
description: Q. What other programs can open Excel files?

title: Government Forces Responsible for South Sudan Killings and Rapes, U.N. Official Says
description: GENEVA  Government forces were responsible for widespread killings and mass rapes after fighting broke out in Juba, the capital of South Sudan, last month, the top United Nations human rights official said on Thursday, deploring the lack of effective action to curb abuses.

title: Cleveland Gets an Art Triennial
description: If it can regularly bring tens of thousands of art lovers and international attention to a small, drab, industrial city in Germany, could art do the same thing for Cleveland?

title: Pipistrelle Bats
description: Chris Watson captured the sound of bats hunting at night in Newcastle.

title: Inside the Olympics With the Sports Editor Jason Stallman
description: Looking for some crude raw beauty? Nine electrifying seconds?

title: An Ancient Echo Hunter Provides Clues on Whale Evolution
description: In a newly-identified ancient species, scientists have found evidence that ultrasonic hearing  and use of the navigational technique of echolocation  goes back millions of years earlier in whales than previously known.

title: Wrenching Choice in South Sudan: Starve or Risk Rape
description: JUBA, South Sudan  At a sprawling displacement camp on the outskirts of the capital, women have faced a wrenching choice: risk starvation or sexual assault.

title: Finding Degass Lost Portrait With a Particle Accelerator
description: For decades, a mysterious black stain has been spreading across the face of an anonymous woman in Australia. She is the subject of a painting by Edgar Degas, the French Impressionist painter, and since the 1920s, the oil paints in her portrait have gradually faded, revealing the hints of another, hidden portrait underneath.

title: Mary Woronovs Imaginary Reality Paintings
description: The artist, writer, actress and illustrator (and alum of Warhols Factory) has a new show up at the of-the-moment Los Angeles gallery the Lodge.

title: An Under-the-Radar Warhol Alum, at One of Los Angeless Coolest Galleries
description: While studying sculpture at Cornell in 1963, Mary Woronov met Gerard Malanga, the Warhol confidant and chief gatekeeper of Andy Warhols Factory. Before long, she was performing as Hanoi Hannah in Warhols Chelsea Girls and in leather and whips in the Velvet Undergrounds dance troupe, The Exploding Plastic Inevitable. A multihyphenate long before it became a buzzword, the cult actress, writer, illustrator and artist would become one of the most indelible figures to emerge from the early years of the Factory. And while some of the passages in her autobiography, Swimming Underground, suggest a dystopian world, Woronov sees the Warhol years as the most nurturing and formative of her life. I have a very dark side, I cant help it, but to me that period was wine and roses. It was darkness with pinpoints of light, she says. My connection with Warhol was sort of like Lancelots connection to King Arthur.

title: Fall Fashions Raw, 90s Energy
description: The seasons styles, from maxi skirts and lean knits to bomber jackets and boots made for stomping, are full of teen spirit.

title: Is It O.K. to Date a Supervisor Who Isnt My Direct Boss?
description: I went to dinner with a supervisor from work, unsure what his intentions were. After dinner, he was direct: He is interested in me romantically and wants to date. He said that he had thought through the professional ramifications, and they were worth it for him. But I still have ambitions at the firm. And even though he would never be in a position to promote me, he is very much a boss. The date was amazing, and he is amazing. Should I continue seeing him?

title: With Billionaires Backing Her, Hillary Clinton Must Confront How to Deploy Them
description: Now that Hillary Clinton has assembled a bipartisan cadre of billionaires to support her candidacy, how does she disperse the moneyed elite to help her in a campaign focused on income inequality?

title: How a Justice Department Ruling Could Affect Your Favorite Musician
description: The Justice Department announced on Thursday that it had concluded a two-year investigation into the complex world of music licensing and decided against making changes to the regulatory agreements that govern Ascap and BMI, two large clearinghouses for performing rights that process about $2 billion in royalty payments each year.

title: N.I.H. May Fund Human-Animal Stem Cell Research
description: The National Institutes of Health announced on Thursday that it was planning to lift its ban on funding some research that injects human stem cells into animal embryos.

title: On the Campaign Trail, Love Doesnt Always Win
description: With every presidential election, there are stories of couples who fell in love while working long hours together to get their candidate elected.

title: Boko Haram Leader Speaks on YouTube, Deepening Signs of Split
description: DAKAR, Senegal  A new voice recording described by security experts as coming from the longtime leader of Boko Haram deepened speculation about a fracture in the militant group, which has pledged allegiance to the Islamic State and has terrorized Nigeria and its neighbors for years.

title: Questions and Answers on Voter Fraud
description: When Donald J. Trump suggested this week that recent court rulings against voter identification laws could contribute to a rigged election this fall, his comments ran counter to the findings of many judges and researchers, who say such statutes aim at a form of fraud that is rare and typically isolated.

title: Shocker! Facebook Changes Its Algorithm to Avoid Clickbait
description: Facebook says it plans to marginalize what it considers to be clickbait news stories from publishers in its news feed, in another step to keep its 1.71 billion members regularly coming back to its social network.

title: Everyone Despises SolarCity Deal, Except Tesla Shareholders
description: Its an understatement to say Tesla Motors proposed $2.6 billion takeover of SolarCity has been the most reviled deal of the year.

title: Of Thee I Read: The United States in Literature
description: National correspondents and editors suggest books that reveal something essential about the regions they cover.

title: The Metropolitan Museum of Art Announces Record Attendance
description: Even while struggling with its finances, the Metropolitan Museum of Art set a record for attendance, attracting 6.7 million visitors during the fiscal year that ended on June 30  the highest number since the museum began tracking admissions more than 40 years ago, the Met announced on Thursday.

title: Scientific Evidence of Flood May Give Credence to Legend of Chinas First Dynasty
description: Scientists have found evidence of a catastrophic flood that overwhelmed the upper Yellow River valley in China some 4,000 years ago, an event that they say may confirm the historical basis of Chinas semi-legendary first dynasty.

title: U.S.A. Gymnastics Failed to Notify Authorities of Sexual Abuse Allegations, Report Says
description: U.S.A. Gymnastics, the sports national governing body, which guides children from the neighborhood gym to the Olympics, routinely failed to notify law enforcement officials about allegations of sexual abuse by its coaches, according to an investigation by The Indianapolis Star.

title: Weight Has Greater Impact on Diabetes Than Heart Disease
description: Carrying excess weight may have a greater impact on the risk for diabetes than it does on the risk for heart disease or early death, a new study has found.

title: Tegla Loroupe Gives Refugee Olympians a Lesson in Hope
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Germans rolled luggage into the Olympic Village, Slovaks stood proudly at the raising of their national flag, and a delegation from Benin posed for photos in yellow floral prints and lobster-red hats. Nearby, a woman from Kenya, barely five feet and all but unnoticed, signed off on her project to give an Olympic home to athletes who had none of their own.

title: Judge Says Reporter for New York Times Must Testify at Baby Hope Trial
description: A state judge ruled on Thursday that a reporter for The New York Times must testify at a trial this fall about her jailhouse interview with a man accused of killing the toddler known as Baby Hope.

title: Donald Trump and Mike Pence Again Diverge on Endorsements
description: PORTLAND, Me.  Facing urgent calls to stabilize his candidacy and declining poll numbers, Donald J. Trump struggled on Thursday to refocus his message after threatening to withhold his endorsement from top Republican officeholders, including Paul D. Ryan, the speaker of the House.

title: An All-Star Lineup Celebrates Tony Bennetts 90th Birthday
description: Tony Bennett will be celebrating his 90th birthday for the rest of the year.

title: How the AK-47 and AR-15 Evolved Into Rifles of Choice for Mass Shootings
description: The weapons, ready amplifiers of rage, allow a few people to kill scores and menace hundreds, and fight head-to-head against modern soldiers and police forces.

title: Eight Studded (Vaguely Punk) Black Bags
description: With fringe, chains and lots of metal, these styles carry you from summer through the fall.

title: 11-Year-Old Grills Mike Pence on Softening Up Donald Trumps Words
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  In the feverishly manicured spectacle that is electoral politics, there are few distractions quite as imposing to candidates as a small child. Just this week, Donald J. Trump earned a wave of negative headlines after he confronted a crying baby at a rally in Virginia.

title: Appeals Court Upholds N.F.L.s Suspension of Adrian Peterson
description: The start of the regular season is about a month away, but the N.F.L. continues to rack up wins off the field.

title: Miss Saigon Revival Will Open on Broadway in March
description: This is the hour: The first Broadway revival of Miss Saigon will begin performances in March.

title: Before Taking the Plunge, Letting the Club Play Cupid
description: Some couples dream houses might include a white picket fence and a garden, but for David and Linda Gordon, their slice of summer heaven is LP-30. That is the unglamorous designation for their idyllic nest  a cabana facing the family pool at the Silver Gull Beach Club, an oceanfront summer colony near the western tip of the Rockaway Peninsula in Queens.

title: New York Citys Housing Gains
description: To the Editor:

title: Walmarts Bid for Jet.com Could Help It Compete Against Amazon
description: Walmart may be trying to hasten its pursuit of Amazon by acquiring an e-commerce start-up.

title: Photos That Beautifully Explore Human Fragility
description: In their upcoming book Beyond the Clouds, the photographic duo Hart + Lshkina use such ephemeral materials as ice, snow, flowers and human detritus to allude to the transience of life.

title: A Sprawling Battlefield in the Fight Against ISIS
description: To the Editor:

title: John Waters Tells the Story of His Mustache
description: John Waters doesnt remember exactly why he first grew his iconic pencil mustache, but he does remember when: 1970. It had only been six years since the Baltimore native graduated high school, and only four since he had been kicked out of NYU during a marijuana bust on campus. But he was already a prolific filmmaker, then working on his fifth film and what he calls his real first feature, Multiple Maniacs (1970), which will receive a theatrical rerelease at New Yorks IFC Center beginning on August 5. I dressed like a hippie pimp, he says of his sartorial style during the period when he made the film. I had long hair and wore ridiculous thrift-shop shirts. The mustache just went along with my sleazy look.

title: Suspend Security Briefings
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trump and Long Lost Tales of the Draft
description: To the Editor:

title: Lits Dynamic Duo, Will and Jane, Shared Path to Pop Stardom
description: THERES something about pop culture that loves a coupling. Kim and Kanye. Brad and Angelina. Bill and Hillary. Batman and Robin.

title: Phoenix Rattled as Serial Gunman Leaves 7 Dead and 2 Injured
description: On a recent summer evening, a young man and a toddler were in a car stopped in a residential neighborhood in Phoenix when gunfire erupted. The two were not hurt, but investigators later said that it slowly dawned on them that they had a larger crime on their hands: A serial shooter had struck again.

title: Paul, Weiss Hires 4 Partners to Bolster Antitrust Practice
description: As regulators continue to clamp down on deals they believe will harm competition, the small group of lawyers who focus on antitrust have become even more in demand.

title: Lest We Forget, the U.S., Too, Spent Time in the Doping Wilderness
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Early in 1987, Kerry Lynch, a bright hope of the American ski team for an Olympic medal, boarded a plane for Germany.

title: Colombias New, Legal Drug Barons Focus on Medical Marijuana
description: RIONEGRO, Colombia  Like many drug barons in Colombia, Federico Cock-Correa wants to sell his product globally. Just 15 miles outside Medelln, Mr. Cock-Correa is looking to replace vast acres of flowers with marijuana plants, with plans to export the harvest.

title: Review: Olympic Pride, American Prejudice Recalls Black Athletes in 1936
description: The Olympic Games have never been immune from politics, and they certainly werent in 1936, when Berlin was the host city and Hitler sought to present the Third Reich in a flattering light. That the United States thwarted him is largely because of the black athletes who receive their due in Deborah Riley Drapers deft and comprehensive documentary Olympic Pride, American Prejudice. As the movie makes clear, racial politics played a major role, both domestically and abroad.

title: Racism in the Research Lab
description: You are too smart to be Mexican and Congratulations! You probably got the award because you are Latino are two of many remarks we, as scholars and professionals, heard at some of the top academic centers in the country.

title: Two Artists Built a Spinning House, and Then Moved In
description: For Alex Schweder and Ward Shelley, the term artist in residence is often a very literal one: Collaborators since 2007, the pair practice what Schweder describes as performance architecture, or the exploration of how inhabiting a space affects us, psychologically. So they build interesting structures, and then move in.

title: Review: In The Tenth Man, Contending With a Father and a Traditional Upbringing
description: The Tenth Man, a modest charmer from Argentina, breathes considerable life into the rather trite scenario of a man discovering his religious roots, in part because it seems genuinely curious about the community in which its set.

title: How a Suicide Bomber Made His Way From Syria to Strike in Ansbach, Germany
description: MUNICH  To the German authorities, he was Mohammad Daleel, a 27-year-old Syrian traumatized by war who arrived in Europe seeking refuge.

title: Wet, Wild and Wholesome: Dynamic H2O at the Childrens Museum of Manhattan
description: The Childrens Museum of Manhattan is inviting young visitors to get to know the citys most industrious commuter: one that travels 125 miles from the Catskill Mountains every day, ascends countless high-rise floors to serve New Yorkers and leaves only after long hours, thoroughly dirty.
