description: As the music world eagerly awaits the inscrutable R&B singer Frank Oceans sophomore album, Boys Dont Cry  which could arrive digitally at any moment via Apple Music  its worth considering how we got to this point of nail-chewing uncertainty about big records release dates.

title: NBCs Rio Plans: A Focus on Prime Time and a Flood of Streaming
description: NBCUniversals broadcast of the Summer Olympics from Rio de Janeiro is showing a media giant more than ever straddling two approaches  old-style television and live video streaming  to attract viewers to its prized sports property.

title: Doping Sample Bottles, No Longer Seen as Tamper-Proof, Endure
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Most of the key figures involved in Russias elaborate doping scheme at the 2014 Sochi Olympics will not participate in the Rio Games. The lab director who blew the whistle is living in the United States, and implicated government officials were told not to attend.

title: Think Like a Doctor: The Boy With Nighttime Fevers Solved!
description: On Thursday we asked Well readers to take on the case of a 7-year-old boy whod been having fevers and drenching sweats nightly for over a month. More than 300 of you wrote in, and although 20 of you came up with the right diagnosis, only three of you figured out both the diagnosis and the test needed to confirm it.

title: Conversations: Why Many Turks Blame the United States for the Coup
description: Turkey is making a full-court press to get the United States to extradite Fethullah Gulen, a Muslim cleric who has lived in exile in Pennsylvania for nearly 20 years and is accused by the government of masterminding the July 15 aborted coup. As part of that effort, a delegation of Turkish parliament members held talks with American officials in Washington, D.C., this week. Three of them  Taha Ozhan, chairman of the foreign affairs committee, delegation leader and a member of President Recep Tayyip Erdogans AK Party; Oguz Kaan Salici of the main opposition Republican Peoples Party; and Kamil Aydin, of the Nationalist Movement Party, another opposition party  also met The New York Times Editorial Board, which recently published an editorial criticizing Turkey for accusing the United States of complicity in the insurrection and fueling a new wave of anti-Americanism.

title: Taking Fun Home to Orlando, for a Catharsis Onstage and Off
description: Six weeks after the mass shootings at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Fla., the cast of Fun Home left Broadway to put on a special benefit performance there. Fun Home, which won the Tony Award for best musical last year, is a poignant exploration of family relationships, sexuality and suicide adapted from a graphic memoir by the cartoonist Alison Bechdel, who is represented in the show by three actresses playing her at different stages of her life.

title: How The Little Prince Came to Animated Life
description: When the director Mark Osborne was asked to adapt Antoine de Saint-Exuprys popular 1943 novella The Little Prince into a computer-generated animation film, he was skeptical about the chances of success.

title: How Dell Raised $67 Billion for the Biggest Tech Deal Ever
description: MENLO PARK, Calif.  When Dell first announced its $67 billion deal to buy the fellow technology giant EMC last year, the transaction faced no small amount of skepticism  in large part because it was simply so expensive.

title: U.S. Could Exceed Goal of Accepting 10,000 Syrian Refugees
description: BALTIMORE  When Madiha Algothany and her family, Syrian refugees who had fled to Jordan, arrived in the United States in June, they braced for rejection from a new culture and country they feared did not want them.

title: The Problem With Slow Motion
description: Watching slow-motion footage of an event can certainly improve our judgment of what happened. But can it also impair judgment?

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Colson Whitehead
description: In a sneak preview of next weeks podcast, Colson Whitehead talks about what he read (and couldnt read) while writing The Underground Railroad.

title: 13 Killed in Separatist Attack in Northeastern India
description: NEW DELHI  Militant separatists armed with grenades and assault rifles attacked a crowded market in the northeast state of Assam on Friday, killing at least 13 people and wounding 16, police officials said. It was the first major assault in the restive region in nearly two years.

title: Sandbaths, a Huge Butterfly Net and More Choreographed Whimsy
description: The American Dance Festival, six weeks of performances and classes in Durham, N.C., wrapped up in July. But this summer, the festival has had a New York coda of sorts, presenting two artists from its 82nd season at the Joyce Theater: Tatiana Baganova and her company Provincial Dances Theater, from Yekaterinburg, Russia, and the Cuban-American choreographer Rosie Herrera, whose troupe is based in Miami.

title: Hillarys New Go-To Gesture: Hand to the Heart
description: When Hillary Clinton told her audience at a rally in Las Vegas on Thursday Heres what I believe, she punctuated those words with not just a vocal flourish but a physical one. Up went her hand, placed over her heart.

title: What I Love | Joshua Bergasse and Sara Mearns
description: Joshua Bergasse, the Emmy-winning choreographer, lives with Sara Mearns, the New York City Ballet principal dancer, in a Lincoln Square high-rise.

title: Sara Mearns and Joshua Bergasse, Pirouetting on the 27th Floor
description: Dancers on Broadway are known as gypsies because of the itinerant nature of their profession; they go from show to show to show. But their nomadic ways arent limited to the stage.

title: David Huddleston, the Title Lebowski in The Big Lebowski, Dies at 85
description: David Huddleston, a burly, cantankerous and prolific character actor who had the title role opposite Jeff Bridges in The Big Lebowski, Joel and Ethan Coens 1998 mistaken-identity noir comedy, died on Tuesday in Santa Fe, N.M. He was 85.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Jesse Eisenberg on the Surprising Success of The Spoils in London
description: LONDON  Importing Jesse Eisenbergs The Spoils to this city was not exactly a no-brainer. Written by and starring Mr. Eisenberg, this lacerating comedy of humiliation  about a whiny, rich, hyper-articulate and terminally narcissistic young New Yorker who impulsively sabotages his own life and that of his Nepalese roommate  appeared destined to be lost in translation.

title: State Department, Citing Security, Suspends Teaching Program in Turkey
description: Joanna Birkner was looking forward to teaching English in Turkey on a Fulbright award this year. But last week, she received an email from a program official saying that teaching assistant placements in Turkey had been suspended for the school year.

title: Review: In Nine Lives, a Mans Life Is Like a Litter Box
description: Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Garner and Christopher Walken at least chose to be in Nine Lives. The cast member you really feel bad for is the cat. It presumably was forced into the job by its manager, or agent, or whatever. Its rsum may never recover.

title: Trumps Economic Team: Bankers and Billionaires (and All Men)
description: Donald J. Trump may rail against Wall Street and business elites at his campaign rallies, but that has not stopped him from turning to many of them for economic advice. On Friday, Mr. Trump announced his economic team, just days before he is expected to give a speech in Detroit on Monday about what he would do to improve American growth.

title: Ruling May Allow Russia to Add Seven Athletes
description: After weeks of debate over Russias participation in the Rio Games, Olympic officials announced Thursday  less than 24 hours before the opening ceremony  that 271 Russian athletes would compete in Rio. They excluded more than 100 others, branding them tainted by a government doping program.

title: Latest to Quit Googles Self-Driving Car Unit: Top Roboticist
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A roboticist and crucial member of the team that created Googles self-driving car is leaving the company, the latest in a string of departures by important technologists working on the autonomous car project.

title: London, as Youve Never Heard It Before
description: LONDON  On a recent Saturday, Ian Rawes, a part-time deliveryman, spent several hours walking around London with two microphones strapped to his head. He went into a vegetable market and got so caught up recording the sound of birds in its rafters that he almost got hit by a cabbage-laden forklift hurtling toward him.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Rio, Trump, African National Congress: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: In the Latest Turn for Harry Potter and Company, Letting All the What Ifs Out to Play
description: HARRY POTTER AND THE CURSED CHILDParts 1 and 2A play by Jack ThorneBased on a story by J. K. Rowling, John Tiffany and Jack Thorne327 pp. Arthur A. Levine Books/Scholastic. $29.99. (Young adult; ages 12 and up)

title: Friday Night Music: Lucius, Gone Insane
Highlights: Rio Olympics Opening Ceremony
description: Samba stars, abstract performances and Gisele Bundchen. New York Times reporters and photographers detailed the opening ceremony as it happened.

title: What Price to Keep France Safe? Perhaps a Nations Core Values, Many Fear
description: PARIS  Soldiers are patrolling French beaches through the August holiday. There has been talk of Guantnamo-style holding pens for thousands of terrorism suspects. The prime minister has suggested ending foreign funding for mosques.

title: As Job Growth Goes, So Goes the Election?
description: The jobs report for July, showing that employers added 255,000 positions last month, is good news in several ways. It shows that slow economic growth in the second quarter did not prevent the economy from adding jobs in July.

title: 8 Olympians Whove Got Social Media Game
description: Over 11,000 athletes have spent much of their lives preparing for the Rio 2016 Olympics, which begin with tonights opening ceremony. Somehow, between training, competing, eating and sleeping, many of them have managed to build social media presences that reflect their sportsmanship and their personalities. Below are a few to watch as the games kick off.

title: Moment in Convention Glare Shakes Up Khans American Life
description: Six minutes and one second. That was all it took for the 66 years of Khizr Khans life to become an American moment.

title: Ahmed H. Zewail, Nobel-Prize-Winning Chemist, Dies at 70
description: Ahmed H. Zewail, an Egyptian-American who won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1999 for developing a revolutionary technique to observe the dance of molecules as they break apart and come together in chemical reactions, died on Tuesday. He was 70.

title: Black Activists Dont Ignore Crime
description: IT has become a standard conservative talking point: Black activists focus on police brutality but ignore violent crime in black neighborhoods. Last month Rudy Giuliani said on Fox News: If they meant Black Lives Matter, they would be doing something about the way in which the vast majority of blacks are killed in America, which is by other blacks.

title: The Olympic Events to Watch: Saturday
description: Womens Soccer: The United States figures to get an early challenge from France in its second preliminary game. The French were in line to face the Americans in the semifinals of last years World Cup with six minutes to go in Frances match with Germany. France had a 1-0 lead, but a controversial hand-ball call enabled Germany to tie the score on a penalty kick. Germany then went on to win in a shootout, 5-4, delaying Frances coming-out party.

title: Starlin Castro Hits His First Grand Slam as the Yankees Top the Indians
description: During parts of two seasons with the Yankees, reliever Andrew Miller kept with tradition and stayed perpetually clean-shaven. When he returned to the Bronx on Friday as a member of the Cleveland Indians, Miller sported a noticeable swath of facial hair, looking more relaxed.

title: Donald Trump Endorses Paul Ryan and John McCain in Bid for G.O.P. Unity
description: GREEN BAY, Wis.  Donald J. Trump belatedly endorsed the re-elections of Speaker Paul D. Ryan and Senators John McCain and Kelly Ayotte on Friday, moving to heal a deepening rift within the Republican Party touched off by Mr. Trumps feud with the parents of a slain American soldier.

title: Why We Ask to See Candidates Tax Returns
description: Boston  Lost in the debate over Donald J. Trumps refusal to release his tax returns is the story of where the custom of disclosure comes from  and why it can be so valuable as a measure of character. Its a tale of presidential tax shenanigans, political scandal and one of the most famous quotations in American history: Richard M. Nixons I am not a crook.

title: Orlando Gunman Was Shot at Least 8 Times, Autopsy Finds
description: The authorities in Florida said Friday that Omar Mateen, whose June 12 rampage  at an Orlando nightclub left 49 other people dead, was shot at least eight times by police officers who responded to the deadly mass shooting.

title: Stuck in Platitudes on Migration Crisis
description: Diplomats at the United Nations spent several months trying to come up with a comprehensive plan to address todays flow of refugees and migrants, the largest since World War II. So far they have failed, as became clear last month when they released a platitude-laden blueprint for a discussion of the crisis by world leaders who will convene in New York in September.

title: The Stranger Things School of Parenting
description: When the middle-schoolers on the Netflix show Stranger Things ride their bikes through the woods around their small town, its a clear nod to E.T. But those scenes are also reminders of something else: unsupervised childhood.

title: A Gilded Olympics Begin With the Opening Ceremony in Gritty Rio
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  If there was a nation in need of an uplifting spectacle at this moment, even in the form of a public relations exercise, it was Brazil.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The Khans didnt become bitter when they lost their son or become angry with the military. The exact opposite. They showed tremendous pride in us.

title: Desperately Avoiding Donald
description: Look, theres a limit to how long we can talk about Donald Trump. Lets talk about the big Senate races.

title: Paris Attraction
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Youve made it through the solving week and youve made it through the Friday, slightly bruised but none the worse for wear. Youre still smiling. Do you think you have what it takes to crush a Saturday New York Times crossword?

title: New York State Test Scores Inspire Conflicting Interpretations
description: When the New York State Education Department announced scores last week from this years standardized tests, it led with the good news  nearly 38 percent of students statewide were proficient in English and about 39 percent were proficient in math, up from the previous years results. But it also warned that the scores could not be compared with previous results apples to apples, because of changes in the way the tests were written and given.

title: Broken Promises to Homeless Vets
description: Speaking to disabled veterans on Monday in Atlanta, President Obama discussed his administrations efforts to end the tragedy, the travesty of veteran homelessness. He proudly declared the glass half full. We have now reduced the number of homeless veterans by 47 percent, he said. The number of homeless veterans is now under 40,000.

title: Olympic Swimmer Elizabeth Beisel Has Music Dripping From Her Fingertips
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  This city pulses with an energy that compels a bus driver to fill the silence with song as he sits idly in traffic. It pulses with a rhythm that prompts a woman on a custodial crew in Olympic Park to thrum on a garbage can lid to music only she can hear as an elevator sweeps her off the ground floor. Like her Brazilian hosts, the United States Olympian Elizabeth Beisel has the music in her, too.

title: Thousands of Roaming Dogs Are Cited as Problem in Poor Areas of Dallas
description: As consultants drove through the streets of southern Dallas this summer to document the citys increasing population of loose dogs, they found some residents walking with sticks in hand, in case they had to fend one off.

title: Jets Practice Turns Testy as Two Stars Get Into a Skirmish
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The Jets have practiced eight times this training camp, which means that eight times  in the humidity of their field house inside, or the scorching temperatures outside  they have competed against one another for balls, for attention, for roster spots. Five of those practices, including Fridays, were conducted in pads.

title: Even on NBC, Rios Colors Cant Be Airbrushed Out
description: Brazils signature contribution to world culture is its popular music, and the characteristic mood of that music is the melancholy yearning called saudade. That is not the mood NBC wants you in while youre watching its coverage of the 2016 Rio Olympics, however.

title: Spotted in Rio: Gisele Bndchen, Bermuda Shorts, and Michael Phelps as a Lightning Bug
description: Sulu, gho, kera, kalpak, dishdasha and dashiki sound more like crossword puzzlers than words in common parlance. Yet they are the names of elements of costumes that, for centuries, denoted national identity and are now taken out of cultural mothballs for the Olympics.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: The Peanuts Movie and the Rio Olympics
description: The Peanuts Movie updates the Charles M. Schulz classic for 21st-century youngsters. Prime-time coverage of the Rio Olympics dives in with swimming, beach volleyball and mens gymnastics. And some Scandinavian films show off the darker sides of Alicia Vikander and Noomi Rapace.

title: A Grand Entrance on a Global Stage
description: During the opening ceremony of the 2016 Rio Olympics, controversy was set aside for celebration.

title: Corrections: August 6, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: A Grand Entrance on a Global Stage
description: During the opening ceremony of the 2016 Rio Olympics, controversy was set aside for celebration.

title: He Wasnt Profiteering During the Conflict
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: A Surreal Life on the Precipice in Puerto Rico
description: Its official: America now has a failed state within its borders, just the way Europe has Greece.

title: Working From Home With a Spouse in the Next Room
description: Megan Hustad, an author who runs an editorial consultancy in New York, had worked from home for about a decade, relishing hours of solitude that boosted productivity.

title: Why Self-Help Guru James Altucher Only Owns 15 Things
description: It was around 10 a.m. on a sun-drenched summer morning, and James Altucher, perhaps the worlds least likely success guru, was packing his worldly possessions, about 15 items, into a small canvas carry-on bag.

title: A Birthday Party With 2 Dope Queens and One Jon Stewart
description: Last Thursday at the Bell House in Gowanus, Brooklyn  as Hillary Clinton accepted her partys presidential nomination at the Democratic National Convention  the comedian Phoebe Robinson acknowledged the event not with a political button but a tank top that read Dad Bod 2016.

title: Where Grit Meets Glam
description: Despite the heat, well-dressed downtowners converge where the Lower East Side and Chinatown meet.

title: What the Kids Are Wearing Downtown
description: The hip grit of the Lower East Side and the vibrant flare of Chinatown meet on Division and Ludlow Streets. The Metrograph screens classic films, Dimes dishes out healthy Californian bites and Kikis attracts stylish groups for family-style Greek feasts. Despite the sweaty conditions on a recent Sunday, there was no shortage of thoughtfully dressed Chinese grandmothers and chic European models on a casual stroll.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took Instagram followers from Rio de Janeiro to Broadway.

title: The Piano Man of Yarmouk
description: Aeham Ahmad became a YouTube star by playing piano in the ruins of a Damascus, Syria, neighborhood. This video follows his journey to Europe through a single song, starting in Syria and ending at a performance in a Berlin.

title: From Syrian Rubble to German Concert Halls With a Piano, a Mission and Survivors Guilt
description: WIESBADEN, Germany  The pianist starts his show abruptly, with a wail. The words and music are Arabic, but the pain is clear in any language.

title: Were in a Low-Growth World. How Did We Get Here?
description: One central fact about the global economy lurks just beneath the years remarkable headlines: Economic growth in advanced nations has been weaker for longer than it has been in the lifetime of most people on earth.

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Rio Olympics: Heres What Happened Saturday
description: The only gap in Katinka Hosszus swimming rsum was an Olympic medal, but she rectified that in resplendent fashion on Saturday night, winning the 400-meter individual medley in 4 minutes 26.36 seconds at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium. The time broke the world record of 4:28.43 set at the London Games by Chinas Ye Shiwen.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: Facebooks Headline Rules
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: When Every Company Is a Tech Company, Does the Label Matter?
description: Apple, Google, Microsoft and Amazon have created something of a watershed moment in the stock market.

title: Meegan Brooks and Michael Kimiecik: Falling for the Man Without a Face
description: Meegan Bay Brooks and Michael Gregory Kimiecik were married Aug. 6 at Los Laureles Lodge in Carmel Valley, Calif. Brenda Hwang, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Marcy McCullaugh and Joel Mendel: From 0 to 100 in No Time
description: Marcy Elisabeth McCullaugh and Joel Peter Mendel were married Aug. 6 in Yosemite National Park in California. Matthew Weiner, a friend of the groom who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Majestic Yosemite Hotel.

title: The Smell of Cat Urine From Next Door
description: In recent months, an overwhelming smell of cat urine has been seeping into my co-op apartment from the adjacent one. I can smell it emanating from the floor in every part of my space that shares a wall with the neighboring unit. I can also hear a cat crying all day. I warned the neighbor twice, in writing, to rectify the situation, but received no response. Eventually Id like to sell the apartment, but I cant until this situation is resolved. So I need to build a case against the neighbor to bring to the co-op board or to initiate a lawsuit. How do I begin? What sort of professional could give me an estimate for the damage done to my wood floors? Should I call the Queens County health inspector?

title: Myanmar Measles Outbreak Kills 40 in Remote Villages
description: MANDALAY, Myanmar  At least 40 people, nearly all of them children, have died from an outbreak of measles in a remote, impoverished region of Myanmar where there is little available health care, officials said on Saturday.

title: Ready to Snap at Work? Get in Touch With Your Inner Animal
description: Ever experienced a bout of anxiety at work?

title: A Rabbi Who Keeps Things Kosher at Manischewitz
description: Rabbi Aron Yonah Hayum is the plant manager and rabbinical supervisor at Manischewitz in Newark.

title: Bjoern Fischer of Stihl: Chain Saws and the Sound of Freedom
description: The sound of freedom

title: Talks to End War in Yemen Are Suspended
description: CAIRO  More than three months of peace talks to end the war in Yemen came to a halt Saturday, leaving in doubt the future of a shaky cease-fire and threatening to deepen what has a become one of the worlds worst humanitarian crises.

title: Proxy War in Syria: U.S. vs. Russia
description: A look inside a fight for power behind the battlefield scene in Syria. Who is winning the proxy war between Moscow and Washington?

title: Military Success in Syria Gives Putin Upper Hand in U.S. Proxy War
description: WASHINGTON  The Syrian military was foundering last year, with thousands of rebel fighters pushing into areas of the country long considered to be government strongholds. The rebel offensive was aided by powerful tank-destroying missiles supplied by the Central Intelligence Agency and Saudi Arabia.

title: A.N.C. Loses Pretoria, South Africas Capital, as Setbacks Mount
description: JOHANNESBURG  The African National Congresss losses in local elections worsened on Saturday as results showed that the party had lost control of Pretoria, the capital, in a continuing realignment of South Africas post-apartheid political order.

title: U.S.A. Basketball Is Already Cruising in Rio. Now, to Take the Court.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Every four years, the same questions tend to surface before the Summer Olympics: Will the host city be ready? Is Usain Bolt still the worlds fastest man? And what sort of cushy digs will the United States basketball players find for themselves?

title: A Question Lingers on the Irish Border: Whats Next?
description: DUNDALK, Ireland  Gerard McEvoys daily commute across the border between his home in the United Kingdom and his workplace in Ireland takes just 10 minutes, and the only hint that he is in a different country is when the road signs change from miles to kilometers.

title: Variety Puzzle: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  The Broadway musical Hamilton has captured the imaginations of many people, including our constructors Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon. One of the characters in the play by Lin-Manuel Miranda, HERCULES MULLIGAN, appears in todays acrostic quote as a hero who never made it to the history books, but whose contributions to the founding of our nation should be remembered.

title: From a Dacha Wall, a Clue to Raoul Wallenbergs Cold War Fate
description: MOSCOW  The 1945 disappearance of Raoul Wallenberg  a Swedish diplomat who  saved thousands of Hungarian Jews from Nazi gas chambers  ranks among the most enduring mysteries of World War II.

title: U.S. Fencer Attacks and Parries. Then, Whoa, What Was That?
description: A fencing bout, even at the Olympics, is generally fairly straightforward. The two combatants face each other, a tone sounds, they lunge, and a few seconds later someone has scored a point.

title: As Donald Trump Incites Feuds, Other G.O.P. Candidates Flee His Shadow
description: After a disastrous week of feuds and plummeting poll numbers, Republican leaders have concluded that Donald J. Trump is a threat to the partys fortunes and have begun discussing how soon their endangered candidates should explicitly distance themselves from the presidential nominee.

title: Machete Attack in Belgium Injures Two Police Officers
description: PARIS  A man carrying a machete and shouting Allahu akbar injured two police officers outside a police station in central Belgium on Saturday afternoon.

title: Ad Paints a Portrait of a Republican Party in Disarray
description: As military veterans and other Republicans assailed Donald J. Trump last week, Priorities USA, a Democratic super PAC supporting Hillary Clinton, piled on with two ads, one featuring a former prisoner of war, and one, showing prominent Republicans denouncing their partys standard-bearer, entitled Danger.

title: Bomb Wounds Russian-Backed Leader of Ukraine Separatist Region
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The Russian-backed president of a separatist region in Ukraine was wounded on Saturday in an assassination attempt, highlighting rising violence in the countrys east.

title: For the Rio Olympic Games, Theres No Turning Back Now
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Its too late to cancel the Rio Olympics.

title: Air of Graft Around Ex-Argentine Government Arouses Fury
description: BUENOS AIRES  One former minister was caught in a convent with about $9 million in cash and luxury watches stuffed into duffel bags. Two others have been indicted on corruption charges, as has a former vice president. Then there is Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner, the former president, whose hotel and real estate businesses are being investigated for alleged involvement in a kickback scheme.

title: Show Trials in China
description: Thursday was Zhou Shifengs turn to take the stage in the Chinese inquisition. Mr. Zhou, a lawyer who worked with people who challenged the Communist Party, was charged with spreading subversive thoughts under the influence of anti-China forces and sentenced to seven years in prison.

title: Treating Heroin Addicts
description: Naloxone saves lives after a heroin overdose, but does it also encourage addiction?

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: To Teach a Child to Read, First Give Him Glasses
description: Half a dozen police cars ring the entrance to the Morris Educational Campus in the Bronx. To enter this venerable Gothic-style building, I have to make my way through a phalanx of policemen and be scanned by a metal detector.

title: When Blood Pressure Is Political
description: I teach a medical school course on homeostasis: how organ systems work together to maintain physiological balance. For example, when blood pressure drops acutely, the heart speeds up and the kidneys retain sodium and water, propelling blood pressure back to normal. If body temperature falls, we shiver to generate heat, blood vessels constrict to conserve heat, and we warm up. Homeostasis is about preserving constancy in the face of changing conditions. As a model for explaining human physiology, it does remarkably well.

title: A New York Paper Takes a Look in the Mirror
description: The New York Times gave readers a somewhat longer version of the report above last April. A reporter was sent to the scene. An editor was moved into place. And the Metro pages of the newspaper were torn up to make room for a late-breaking story.

title: Are We Loving Our National Parks to Death?
description: WALPOLE, N.H.  THOUSANDS of people are expected to gather at the north entrance to Yellowstone National Park on Aug. 25 to celebrate a uniquely American idea. The National Park Service turns 100 years old, and its birthday party will take place under a stone arch emblazoned with the words For the benefit and enjoyment of the people.

title: Mercy Is Far Too Slow at the Justice Department
description: President Obama last week commuted the prison terms of 214 federal inmates who were sent to prison under draconian, 80s-era laws that have since been revised. Among them were 67 people serving life sentences, nearly all of them for nonviolent drug offenses.

title: Hillarys Summer of Love
description: Its looking more and more like Donald Trump is the best thing that ever happened to Hillary Clinton.

title: Dinner, Disrupted
description: SAN FRANCISCO  At a fancy Silicon Valley restaurant where the micro-greens came from a farm called Love Apple, I got a definitive taste of California in the age of the plutocrats. This state  and this native of it  have long indulged a borderline-comic impulse toward self-expression through lifestyle and food, as if success might be a matter of nailing the perfect combination of surf trunks, grilled lamb hearts and sunset views.

title: Crazy About the Presidency
description: WASHINGTON  IT is Inauguration Day, Jan. 20, 2017.

title: My Fathers Hackberry Tree
description: Minneapolis  I spent the entire month of May sorting through the past, and throwing away old fruit. The discarded material filled several Dumpsters in total, but I was careful to space it out, so as not to overload the universitys trash pickup schedule. It was fruit that I had collected more than 20 years ago, as part of my dissertation research, which was to study the mineralization processes within the hackberry (Celtis occidentalis) seed.

title: Do Your Friends Actually Like You?
description: THINK of all the people with whom you interact during the course of a day, week, month and year. The many souls with whom you might exchange a greeting or give a warm embrace; engage in chitchat or have a deeper conversation. All those who, by some accident of fate, inhabit your world. And then ask yourself who among them are your friends  your true friends. Recent research indicates that only about half of perceived friendships are mutual. That is, someone you think is your friend might not be so keen on you. Or, vice versa, as when someone you feel you hardly know claims you as a bestie.

title: The Rage Against Trade
description: One of the unusual features of this very unusual election year is that both candidates have made major trade agreements an important issue in their campaigns. Donald Trump has been particularly vociferous on the matter, blaming trade for hollowing out the middle class and promising to rip up existing agreements with other countries. Though his talking points are nothing more than hot air, he has struck a chord with millions of angry voters.

title: Raising American Muslim Kids in the Age of Trump
description: Im up at 3 a.m., burping my new baby girl, Nusayba, smelling her fresh, new baby skin and rubbing her soft, bald head.

title: Boon Hui Tan
description: Boon Hui Tan was named vice president for global arts and programming for the Asia Society last year following a decade shaping the art scene in his native Singapore, where he curated major exhibitions, commissioned public art and served as director of the Singapore Arts Museum.

title: Fifty States of Anxiety
description: Feeling worried? These days, much of America is.

title: Clintons Fibs vs. Trumps Huge Lies
description: ONE persistent narrative in American politics is that Hillary Clinton is a slippery, compulsive liar while Donald Trump is a gutsy truth-teller.

title: The Meaning of a Martyrdom
description: IN the days since Father Jacques Hamel, an 85-year-old French priest, was slaughtered at the altar by two jihadists, his murder has become a contested symbol in his country, continent and church.

title: On Field and in Hometown, Neymar Tries to Change the Narrative
description: PRAIA GRANDE, Brazil  A Summer Games for children held its opening ceremony here Friday at the Neymar Jr. Institute, founded by the Brazilian soccer star who has accepted two Olympian responsibilities.

title: Congressman Backs Libertarian Presidential Candidate in Campaign First
description: Representative Scott Rigell of Virginia says he plans to vote for the Libertarian Partys presidential ticket, becoming the first member of Congress to express support for Gary Johnsons third-party campaign.

title: New Medicare Law to Notify Patients of Loophole in Nursing Home Coverage
description: WASHINGTON  In November, after a bad fall, 85-year-old Elizabeth Cannon was taken to a hospital outside Philadelphia for six and a half days of observation, followed by nearly five months at a nearby nursing home for rehabilitation and skilled nursing care. The cost: more than $40,000.

title: U.S. Releases Rules for Airstrike Killings of Terror Suspects
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has disclosed its rules and procedures for targeting individuals for killing outside conventional war zones  including with drones  further lifting the secrecy surrounding one of its most disputed tactics for fighting terrorism.

title: Obama Arrives in Marthas Vineyard for Two-Week Vacation
description: CHILMARK, Mass.  President Obama arrived in Marthas Vineyard on Saturday for his last summer vacation as president, bringing his wife, both daughters and even the family dogs along.

title: His Latest Innovation: The Worlds Best Swimmer
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Before he became a full-time swim coach, Bruce Gemmell was an engineer and inventor whose oeuvre included toilet paper products. Among the 11 American patents on which his name appears is one for an adapter and dispenser for coreless rolls.

title: The People vs. Global Trade
description: To the Editor:

title: Making Olympic Boxing Safer by Eliminating Head Guards
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Olympic boxing has taken on a new look. In the 2016 Summer Games, there is a revised point system, the inclusion of a number of professional fighters and, perhaps most noticeably, the elimination of head guards for male boxers.

title: A Yankees Rookie Is Impressive in Defeat
description: During spring training, the Yankees rookie Gary Sanchez had an opportunity to secure a roster spot backing up catcher Brian McCann. But Sanchez appeared to press, had trouble reaching base during games and was sent to Class AAA Scranton/Wilkes-Barre for more seasoning.

title: Heres a Record Even Katie Ledecky Cant Match (Yet)
description: Katie Ledecky is the queen of the pool right now, a colossal favorite to win the 400- and 800-meter freestyles and a good bet in the 200, too.

title: Swiping a Screen Rather Than Flip a Page in Baseball
description: If a major league coach or player is scrolling through an iPad in the dugout, he is probably not perusing Facebook but rather accessing his scouting reports.

title: Brewers, Like Yankees, Trade With Eye on Future
description: The big winner at the nonwaiver trading deadline, at least among the sellers, was a fourth-place team that has gone a few years since its last playoff series. This team dealt multiple relievers and a top position player for a haul that included three of the top eight prospects who switched organizations before the deadline.

title: Anchor Lines
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  The puzzle constructor Samuel Donaldson created quite a stir when his first crossword appeared in The New York Times in 2008. Solvers thought that the news anchor and journalist, Sam Donaldson, had added crossword puzzle construction to his already impressive list of accomplishments.

title: Learning to Cross the Line in Doubles
description: I hit one backhand after another crosscourt but could not get the ball where it was supposed to go. I couldnt bring myself to cross the line, to hit my shots wider, into that dreaded doubles alley on the tennis court I had always avoided.

title: Baseball Campaign Puts the Accent on Spanish Names
description: Shortstop Eduardo Nez was sitting in the locker room at Major League Baseballs All-Star Game last month when a clubhouse employee walked in. The man was holding Nezs jersey but calling out an unfamiliar name. It sounded like Noonez.

title: Womens Gymnastics Day 1: Simone Biles Is the One to Beat
description: For Simone Biles, the wait is over. Her Olympic competition begins Sunday with the womens artistic gymnastics qualifying round. She and her American teammates are all but assured spots in the team final, the all-around final and event finals: vault, uneven bars, balance beam and floor exercise. Heres what to know as the competition kicks off.

title: U.S. Womens Field Hockey Team Pushes Toward Recognition, Defeating Argentina
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The United States womens field hockey team, seeking an Olympic medal and maybe, just maybe, a boost in national recognition, played its first game Saturday against the powerhouse Argentina, and did just what it needed to, pulling off a 2-1 victory.

title: He Tackled Vanderlei de Lima, Then Fumed During Caldron Lighting
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Alone in his apartment in south London, a 69-year-old man named Neil Horan watched a middle-of-the night broadcast of the opening ceremony for the Summer Olympics. Like other viewers, he wondered which Brazilian would get the honor of lighting the Olympic caldron.

title: Pete Fountain, 86, Dies; Clarinetist Popularized Spirited New Orleans Jazz
description: Pete Fountain, a clarinetist who brought the traditional jazz of his native New Orleans to a national audience through frequent appearances on the Lawrence Welk and Johnny Carson television shows, died on Saturday in New Orleans. He was 86.

title: Green Party Sees Opportunity Amid Wide Voter Discontent
description: HOUSTON  Minutes before she addressed a boisterous crowd at the Green Party convention here on Saturday, Jill Stein sat in a mirror-walled room backstage, gazing at her reflection with a look of dumbstruck bliss.

title: U.S. Womens Soccer Team Fights to Quiet What-Ifs in Tough Win Over France
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  In winning the 2015 womens World Cup, the United States was fortunate to avoid a surprisingly strong French club that lost to Germany in a quarterfinal game in which France seemed to be the better team.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Same thing wed do in a hotel. It just floats.

title: A Classified Matter at the White House: Obamas Star-Studded Galas
description: WASHINGTON  There are plenty of perks to being president of the United States. One of them is glamorous birthday parties.

title: Alex Rodriguez and Yankees May Soon Part Ways
description: The relationship between Alex Rodriguez and the Yankees, filled with triumph and tribulation for more than a dozen years, seems likely to reach a resolution on Sunday.

title: Close Call at the Plate Leaves the Mets With Regret
description: DETROIT  It happened too quickly for Jay Bruce to absorb: the two-out, ninth-inning single by Travis dArnaud that sent Bruce, the potential tying run, heading home from second; J. D. Martinezs muscular, on-target throw from right field; the dusty slide and the tag by Detroit catcher Jarrod Saltalamacchia.

title: Sara Feldenkris, Joseph Cohen
description: Sara Katherine Feldenkris, a daughter of Nancy L. Feldenkris and Howard M. Feldenkris of Solon, Ohio, was married Aug. 6 to Joseph Michael Cohen, a son of Della R. Cohen and Morton A. Cohen of Woodbury, N.Y. Rabbi Allison Vann officiated at the Glidden House, an inn in Cleveland.

title: Margaret Chadbourn, David Clarke
description: Margaret Lynn Chadbourn and David Charles Clarke were married Aug. 6 at Christ Church in Alexandria, Va. The Rev. Dr. Diane G. Murphy, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Meghan McAnaney, Brian Doelger
description: Meghan Claire McAnaney, a daughter of Deborah R. McAnaney and Edward G. McAnaney of Suffield, Conn., was married Aug. 6 to Brian Paul Doelger, a son of Patricia A. Doelger and Paul J. Doelger of Kings Park, N.Y. The Rev. Robert L. Beloin, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Thomas More, the Catholic chapel and center at Yale University in New Haven.

title: Jessica Baker, Michael de la Merced
description: Jessica Jane Baker and Michael John de la Merced were married Aug. 6 at Bathhouse Studios, a photography studio in New York. Peter Eavis, a reporter for The New York Times who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Rachel Wang, Mark Levey
description: Rachel Heather Wang and Mark Edward Levey were married Aug. 6 at the Hilton Pearl River in Pearl River, N.Y. Rabbi Jonathan Blake officiated.

title: Caroline Rubin, Jason Schulweis
description: Caroline Alexa Rubin, the daughter of Laura D. Rubin of New York and Barry S. Rubin of Delray Beach, Fla., was married Aug. 6 to Jason Brett Schulweis, the son of Carol D. Schulweis of New York and Harvey Schulweis of Purchase, N.Y. Rabbi Tom Weiner officiated at Tribeca Rooftop, an event space in New York.

title: Pravina Rao, Sanjay Setty
description: Pravina Jagdish Rao and Sanjay Narayana Setty were married Aug. 6 in Hartford. Sri Mahesh Bhatt, a Hindu priest, officiated at the Hartford Marriott Downtown.

title: Miriam Muscarella, Steven Press
description: Miriam Boyd Muscarella and Steven Michael Press were married Aug. 6. The Rev. Dr. H. Gregory Waldrop, an uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony at the Broadway United Methodist Church in Paducah, Ky.

title: Dana Feinstein, Eduardo Gouva
description: Dana Elizabeth Feinstein, the daughter of Ellen Newman Feinstein and Neil H. Feinstein of Maple Glen, Pa., is to be married Aug. 7 to Eduardo Siqueira Rocha Gouva, a son of Maria Aparecida Rocha and Jandir Sebastio Gouva, both of Volta Redonda, Brazil. Rabbi Bradley Bleefeld is to officiate at the Merion Tribute House in Merion Station, Pa.

title: Margaret Smith, Joseph Brazauskas Jr.
description: Margaret Whitaker Smith and Joseph Anthony Brazauskas Jr. were married Aug. 6 in Owings Mills, Md. The Rev. Dr. Malcolm Ellis, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Thomas Episcopal Church. William Senft, a Roman Catholic deacon and an uncle of the bride, provided the homily.

title: Phyllis Lally, Leonard Seevers II
description: Phyllis Marie Lally, a daughter of Valerie Maggos Lally and Dr. Patrick T. Lally of Greensburg, Pa., was married Aug. 6 to Leonard William Seevers II, the son of Angela Tang Seevers of New York and Gary L. Seevers of Westport, Conn. Canon Alan Godfrey Dennis, an Episcopal priest, officiated at Blue Hill at Stone Barns in Pocantico Hills, N.Y.

title: Lindsey Kremer, William Ruben
description: Lindsey Alexandra Kremer, a daughter of Suzan R. Kremer and Arthur J. Kremer of New York, was married Aug. 6 to William Marc Ruben, a son of Amy S. Ruben and Richard G. Ruben, also of New York. Rabbi Angela Warnick Buchdahl performed the ceremony at Central Synagogue in New York, where she is the senior rabbi.

title: Vanessa Agard-Jones, Shayla Sellars
description: Vanessa Lauren Agard-Jones and Shayla Anitra Sellars were married Aug. 6 in the event space at Atlas Studios, a warehouse in Newburgh, N.Y. Canon Dr. Sandye A. Wilson, an Episcopal priest, officiated.

title: Wendy De La Rosa Felipe, Jonathan Jean-Pierre
description: Wendy Johmar De La Rosa Felipe and Jonathan Michael Jean-Pierre were married Aug. 5 in Manhattan. The Rev. Ambiorix Rodriguez, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated at the Loeb Boathouse in Central Park.

title: Julia Kiefer, Patrick Corrigan
description: Julia Whaley Kiefer, a daughter of Mary Whaley Kiefer and Dr. Jay F. Kiefer of Hudson, Ohio, was married Aug. 6 to Patrick Donnelly Corrigan, a son of the Rev. Michael Corrigan of Colrain, Mass., and the late Patricia Vallone Corrigan. The grooms father, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Johns Episcopal Church in Northampton, Mass.

title: Emily Dull, Patrick Somers
description: Emily Anne Dull, the daughter of Alan T. Dull of Elmira, N.Y., and the late Jean A. Dull, was married Aug. 6 to Patrick James Somers, the son of Lorraine F. Somers and Robert J. Somers of Gloucester, Mass. Colleen McMahon, the chief judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, officiated at the IAC companys headquarters in New York.

title: Brooke Heidecorn, Brian Waldman
description: Brooke Illyse Heidecorn, the daughter of Deborah J. Heidecorn and David Heidecorn of Armonk, N.Y., was married Aug. 6 to Brian Todd Waldman, the son of Frances G. Waldman and Bruce D. Waldman of Orangeburg, N.Y. Rabbi Joui Hessel officiated at Sleepy Hollow Country Club in Briarcliff Manor, N.Y.

title: Alexandra Stevenson, Enrico Mills
description: Alexandra Stevenson, the daughter of Monika Jensen-Stevenson of Toronto and the late William H. Stevenson, was married Aug. 2 to Enrico Kevin Mills, the son of Frances Mills and Kevin J. Mills of Palo Alto, Calif. Monica Balmer, a civil officer in Zollikon, officiated at the Civil Registry Office in Zollikon, Switzerland.

title: Ashley OBrien, Sean Reilly
description: Ashley Rose OBrien and Sean Patrick Reilly were married Aug. 6 at St. Agnes Cathedral in Rockville Centre, N.Y. The Rev. Thomas A. Cardone, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Brian Mosteller, Joseph Mahshie
description: Brian Douglas Mosteller and Joseph Kamal Mahshie were married Aug. 1 at the residence of Vice President Joe Biden in Washington, where Mr. Biden led the ceremony after being granted temporary permission by the Superior Court of the District of Columbia Marriage Bureau.

title: Ruth Jackson, William Graves Jr.
description: Ruth Rebecca Jackson and William M. Graves Jr. were married Aug. 6 at the Lady Chapel, a log chapel on the Graves family property in Grand Isle, Vt. The Rev. Dr. Frederick P. Moser, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Allison Harris, Yonit Bousany
description: Allison Earley Reed Harris, a daughter of Lori B. Reed and Timothy D. Harris of Englewood, Colo., was married Aug. 6 to Yonit Clara Bousany, the daughter of Sherry A. Steiner of Brookline, Mass., and the late Meir Bousany. Catherine A. Wagner, a friend of the couple who became a minister of the American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated at a farm owned by Ms. Harriss family in Cumberland, Wis.

title: Lindsay Roth, Gavin Jordan
description: Lindsay Jill Roth, the daughter of Cheryl W. Roth and Andrew B. Roth of Lattingtown, N.Y., was married Aug. 6 to Gavin Alexander Jordan, the son of Rosemary I. Jordan of Barnet, England, and Peter A. Jordan of New Ash Green, England. Lisa Traina, a Universal Life minister, led a ceremony incorporating Jewish and Church of England elements at the St. Regis in New York.

title: NaSheena Porter, William Poznansky
description: NaSheena Davon Porter and William Daniel Poznansky were married Aug. 6 at the Galloping Hills Golf Course in Kenilworth, N.J. Rabbi Marsha Jane Kleinman officiated.

title: Day 1: First Medals and a World Record
description: The wait for the Summer Olympics is over. The competition got underway in earnest in Rio de Janeiro, with more than 200 nations participating.

title: Mario Nievera, Travis Howe
description: Mario Fenie Nievera and Travis Scott Howe were married Aug. 6. The Rev. William H. Critzman, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated at 620 Loft & Garden, an event space at Rockefeller Center in New York.

title: Karen Blumenthal, Howard Winokur
description: Dr. Karen Jane Blumenthal and Howard Lev Winokur were married Aug. 6. Rabbi Ilene Harkavy Haigh officiated at the Four Seasons Hotel in Boston.

title: Megan Brandt-Meyer, Matthew Moretz
description: Megan Irene Brandt-Meyer and the Rev. Matthew John Moretz were married Aug. 6. The Rev. Susan C. Harriss, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomews Church in New York.

title: Tanea Cooper, Christopher Manning
description: Tanea Jezelle Cooper, a daughter of Valerie A. Cooper of Silver Spring, Md., and George C. Cooper Jr. of Long Beach, Calif., was married Aug. 5 to Christopher Stephen Manning Jr., a son of Monica Y. Manning and Mr. Manning Sr. of Clinton, Md. The Rev. Dr. Joseph W. Lyles performed the ceremony at Fort Foote Baptist Church in Fort Washington, Md.

title: Alexandra Rizk, Michael Keane
description: Alexandra Michelle Rizk, the daughter of Linda J. Rizk and Thomas A. Rizk of Franklin Lakes, N.J., was married Aug. 6 to Lt. Michael Edward Keane, a son of Renee M. Keane and Edward G. Keane II of Wayne, N.J. The Rev. Dominic Obour performed the ceremony at St. Peters Roman Catholic Church in New York.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Inspector Lewis and Simone Biles at the Rio Olympics
description: Inspector Lewis ends its run on PBSs Masterpiece Mystery! Simone Biles leads the United States womens gymnastics team at the Rio Olympics. And a young woman turns back time in Being Erica.

title: Corrections: August 7, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: With Katie Ledecky Added to Mix, U.S. Relay Wins Silver
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The United States won a silver medal in the womens 4x100-meter freestyle relay on Saturday night with an unexpected anchor.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Rio Olympics, Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Brookings Institution and Its Corporate Donors
description: The Brookings Institution  long recognized as one of the most prestigious think tanks in the world  has aggressively courted corporate donors over the last decade, particularly for its Metropolitan Policy Program, which formed partnerships with JPMorgan Chase, Lennar Corporation, K.K.R., Hitachi and others. Here is an examination of the deals with these donors, based in part on thousands of pages of internal Brookings documents.

title: Atlantic Council and Corporate Donors
description: The Atlantic Council, which has seen its annual revenue grow to $21 million from $2 million in the last decade, offers access to United States and foreign government officials in exchange for contributions. Individual donors, like FedEx, have also helped fund specific reports that align with their agendas.

title: C.S.I.S. and the Military Drone Maker
description: As General Atomics was lobbying for a change in export rules governing its unmanned aerial vehicles, it helped fund a report at the Center for Strategic and International Studies that also pushed for the change.

title: The Aircraft Carrier Industrys Lobbying and Think Tank Plan
description: Huntington Ingalls, the sole builder of nuclear-powered aircraft carriers in the United States, and other players in the shipbuilding industry were looking for ways to increase or maintain funding for the construction of these giant ships. They turned to think tanks for help. Here is a look at the strategy, which involved the Hudson Institute and others.

title: This Is Thinly Disguised Lobbying
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren, Democrat of Massachusetts, explains how some think tanks engage in thinly disguised lobbying to influence lawmakers.

title: How Think Tanks Amplify Corporate Americas Influence
description: WASHINGTON  As Lennar Corporation, one of the nations largest home builders, pushed ahead with an $8 billion plan to revitalize a barren swath of San Francisco, it found a trusted voice to vouch for its work: the Brookings Institution, the most prestigious think tank in the world.

title: On Games First Full Day, Beach Volleyball Keeps Rio Celebrating Into the Night
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Just at 10 a.m., with the waves at Copacabana Beach crashing close enough to be heard, an Italian man hit a high, spinning ball toward the sun, and the premier sport at the Summer Olympics was underway.

title: Homes That Sold for $900,000 or More
description: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.

title: 1916: 7,000 Worker Strike in New York
description: NEW YORK  Seven thousand motormen and conductors employed by six of the large companies holding surface-line franchises ceased work entirely to-day [Aug. 7]. Their action was the result of a conference of the union leaders held late last night. All traffic between Manhattan, the Bronx and many parts of Long Island is seriously hindered.

title: Rodrigo Duterte, Philippine President, Links 150 Public Servants to Drugs
description: MANILA  The Philippines new president, Rodrigo Duterte, on Sunday publicly accused scores of judges, mayors, lawmakers, military personnel and police officers of involvement with the illegal drug trade, giving them 24 hours to surrender for investigation or, he said, be hunted down.

title: Donald Trumps Allies Battle for Favor of G.O.P. Givers He Mocked
description: Carl Icahn was late, but he still had something to say.

title: Voters in Thailand Endorse Militarys Proposed Constitution
description: BANGKOK  In its first test at the polls, Thailands military government won overwhelming approval Sunday of a new Constitution that aims to reduce the power of political parties and extend the influence of the military.

title: Rio Olympics Today: U.S. Swimmers Restock Their Trophy Case
description: It was quite a night for the American swim team. Katie Ledecky, the most dominant female swimmer in Rio, demolished her own record in the 400-meter freestyle. Ledecky finished the 400 with a time of 3 minutes 56.46 seconds.

title: Chumleys Is Set to Come Back, and It Still Wont Be Easy to Find
description: It is a question that has been asked before: Whatever happened to Chumleys?

title: 1966: U.S. Antiwar Parades Mark Hiroshima Anniversary
description: New York  Some 15,000 demonstrators paraded through midtown Manhattan yesterday to mark the 21st anniversary of the Hiroshima atomic bombing with bitter denunciations of the war in Vietnam.

title: Alex Rodriguez to Retire and Join Yankees as an Adviser
description: Wednesday morning, not long after a struggling Alex Rodriguez had made the final out in a loss to the Mets, Hal Steinbrenner, the Yankees managing general partner, sent him a text message: It was time, he said, for them to speak face to face.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Democrats Hope for a Wave, but Republicans Doubt Clintons Coattails
description: In 1980, the Democratic pollster Peter D. Hart warned Gaylord Nelson, Wisconsins champion vote-getter as governor and senator, that he was going to lose.

title: Public Speaking? Woof!
description: At American Universitys Kogod School of Business, students can hone their public speaking skills in front of nonjudgmental audience dogs.

title: Islamic State Claims Responsibility for Belgium Machete Attack
description: PARIS  The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack on Saturday against two police officers in Charleroi, Belgium, according to a statement issued on Sunday by the groups Amaq News Agency.

title: This Fan May Beat Phelps in Rio
description: A new generation of Olympians has aspired to be like Michael Phelps. Now some aspire to beat him.

title: The Chocolate Factory Announces Premieres for New Season
description: Nine premieres are in store for the coming season at the Chocolate Factory, the experimental performance space in Long Island City, Queens.

title: Threats Over Police Radios Have Officers and Scanner Buffs on the Case
description: A male voice came over the police radio, speaking in standard departmental jargon as he asked to be patched through to the duty captain in the Midtown South Precinct in Manhattan on July 30. The captain responded.

title: A Potent Endorsement Could Use More Transparency
description: The Op-Ed ran in The New York Times opinion section on Friday under the headline, I Ran the C.I.A. Now Im Endorsing Hillary Clinton, and the piece delivered the kind of public support a campaign cherishes:

title: Foreign-Born, Adopted and Seeking a Comeback in Rio
description: GLENVILLE, N.Y.  Seven years ago, Nick Delpopolo took a family trip back to Montenegro, the country where he was born. He met a young man who had lived with him at an orphanage  and still lived there.

title: Narendra Modi, Indias Leader, Condemns Vigilante Cow Protection Groups
description: NEW DELHI  As his party prepares for elections in key states, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has distanced himself from right-wing cow protection groups that have proliferated since his government came to power. These vigilante groups have carried out violent attacks on Muslims and, more recently, low-caste Hindus suspected of slaughtering cows, which are considered sacred in Hinduism.

title: Tim Kaine Says Hillary Clinton Has Learned From Email Mistake
description: Hillary Clinton will be real transparent with Americans after learning lessons from the controversy over her use of a private email server, her running mate, Tim Kaine, said on Sunday, expressing optimism that she could improve her trust deficit with voters over the next month.

title: La MaMa Announces an Eclectic and International 55th Season
description: For its 55th season, La MaMa, the East Village hub of avant-garde performance, has assembled a cosmopolitan smorgasbord of more than 70 productions of plays, puppet shows and dance.

title: Mike Pences Response to H.I.V. Outbreak: Prayer, Then a Change of Heart
description: AUSTIN, Ind.  On the evening of March 24, 2015, Sheriff Dan McClain got an unexpected voice mail: This is Gov. Mike Pence calling. I would welcome the opportunity to get your counsel on whats going on in Scott County.

title: For This Choreographer, the Olympics Are the Zenith
description: Brazilians know how to put on a good show on a shoestring  this is the country of Carnival, after all. So despite Zika fears and reports about murky water in Guanabara Bay, the colorful and ecologically conscious Olympics opening ceremony in Rio de Janeiro on Friday night went off without a hitch, and even more: It felt like a giant street party.

title: After Drug Tests, Is Anyone Left in the Weight-Lifting Room?
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The brothers Dan and Anthony Rigney of Australia attended the Olympic weight lifting competition on Sunday and were not exactly mortified that the sport is more polluted than Guanabara Bay.

title: Making Suicide Squad a Smash, Despite Withering Reviews
description: Backed by a meticulously executed marketing campaign, Suicide Squad pushed through abysmal reviews to set box office records for Warner Bros. over the weekend.

title: A Water Bomb of a Storm Kills 21 in Macedonias Capital, Skopje
description: SKOPJE, Macedonia  A freakishly violent rainstorm that Macedonias top weather official called a water bomb ravaged Skopje during the weekend, collapsing streets, inundating vehicles and drowning trapped motorists and homeowners, most of them caught by surprise.

title: Michael Phelps Relishes the Cheer and Challenge of His New Reality
description: Michael Phelps, headphones in, was listening to music on his smartphone to pump himself up for a race at the United States Olympic trials when he felt the phone vibrate in his hoodie pocket. Phelps has faced plenty of distractions in his 16 years as an Olympic swimmer, but nothing like this.

title: Election Shows Many South Africans Losing Faith in Pompous A.N.C.
description: CHANTELLE, South Africa  A week before South Africas local elections on Wednesday, the Zithas held a family meeting inside their entertainment room to decide how to vote. Loyal backers of the African National Congress in every election since the end of apartheid, the family decided it was time for a change.

title: An All-Star Dance Gala Takes Risks and Soars
description: VAIL, Colo.  Often the greatest excitement at an all-star dance gala comes from reading the list of illustrious participants. The programs, too commonly a numbing pileup of tired showpieces and frustrating excerpts, disappoint. But the International Evenings of Dance at the Vail International Dance Festival here on Friday and Saturday night were not that kind of gala.

title: Rebel Offensive in Syria Challenges Government Siege of Aleppo
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Rebel forces and their jihadist allies challenged the Syrian governments siege of opposition-held districts of Aleppo over the weekend, seizing military facilities in the citys southwest and tentatively opening a road to the besieged area.

title: Playing Dead, a Disappearing Act for the Fraudulent-Minded
description: There is but one truly serious philosophical problem, Camus wrote, and that is suicide. Judging whether life is or is not worth living amounts to answering the fundamental question of philosophy. Camus was silent, as far as I know, on the subject of pseudocide, the term for faking ones own death.

title: Review: For Agatha Raisin, Playing Detective in an English Village
description: Not all detectives have to be brooding, whiskey-swilling clouds of gloom. Not all of them even have to be real detectives. The delightful Agatha Raisin is the latest proof.

title: Prudential Macro Policy
description: A few years ago, it was easy to say what U.S. monetary and fiscal policy should be doing. The economy was still obviously depressed, so the indicated demand policy was pedal to the metal all the way  no need to worry about inflation, no reason to believe that deficit spending would cause any crowding out (in fact it would almost surely crowd in private investment, because such investment depends on demand.)

title: A Cri de Coeur From Jazz Musicians in a Black Lives Matter Age
description: The emotional climax of Terence Blanchards SummerStage concert on Friday night, at Clove Lakes Park on Staten Island, arrived precisely one hour in, like a timed detonation. It was the title track of his most recent album, Breathless  an elegy for Eric Garner, who died at the hands of police officers on Staten Island just over two years ago. Mr. Blanchard, in his trumpet solo over the plaintive theme, struck a careful tonal balance, sounding haunted but unflinching.

title: At Seattle Art Fair, the Interaction Between Technology and Modern Life
description: SEATTLE  Physicists, picking up where Einstein left off, say the titanic impact of two black holes colliding can make a sound detectable through gravitational waves that wash across space and time. Dawn Kasper, in trying to create her version of that sound as a project for the Seattle Art Fair, said she thought it might be a little like the fading echoes of a great Seattle rock show, in the resonant hum of a crashing cymbal.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Aug. 8
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: In Alice in Black and White, a Pioneering Photojournalist
description: Alice Austen loved her Staten Island estate, Clear Comfort. If somebody made me go away, it would be like a chunk torn out of my body, she says early in the new biographical play Alice in Black and White.

title: Long View
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  For some solvers, themes get in the way of a good free-form crossword puzzle, one where the really cool entries stretch across and down the grid with abandon. Admittedly, themes put constraints on constructors because it takes a lot of skill to place a set of entries in a symmetrical grid without sacrificing other things. For my money, though, themes are bonus content that not only present a challenge to the puzzle maker, but are also a leg up to the crossword solver.

title: Alex Rodriguezs Future Resolved, Yankees Settle In and Beat Indians
description: Luis Severino sat in the Yankees clubhouse Sunday morning, inquisitively viewing several televisions that were broadcasting speculation about Alex Rodriguezs future. Late Saturday night, the Yankees had announced a news conference with Rodriguez to be held before Sundays game against the Cleveland Indians.

title: How an Iranians Spy Saga Ends, 6 Years Later: Hes Executed
description: When Shahram Amiri emerged from the shadows into the spotlight six years ago, he was a young Iranian scientist who suddenly appeared on YouTube from a safe house, telling a bizarre story of having been kidnapped by the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Ichiro Suzuki Reaches 3,000 Hits, Again Breaking Ground for Japanese Players
description: Ichiro Suzuki, the baseball pioneer who proved 15 years ago that Japanese hitters could succeed in Major League Baseball, reached a hallowed milestone Sunday when he became the 30th player to compile 3,000 hits.

title: Amazon Has Big Plans for Alexa: Running the Star Trek Home
description: SEATTLE  Amazon surprised a lot of people when its Echo, a $180 so-called smart speaker, became a hit, giving them a novel way to play music, turn on the lights in their homes and set thermostats with voice commands.

title: Expulsions of Protesters at Rio Olympics Draw Rebukes
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The expulsions of ticket holders from Olympic sites after they protested Michel Temer, Brazils interim president, is fueling a debate over the limits of freedom of expression in a country that remains on edge amid a period of extraordinary political upheaval.

title: Colorado Fracking Limit Deadline; Valeant and Disney Earnings Reports
description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead.

title: This Is Your Brain on Drugs, Tweaked for Todays Parents
description: For a generation of commercial-watching adolescents, it was an indelible image: an egg, sizzling in a frying pan, representing your brain on drugs. It was a straightforward message, and the ads final line  Any questions?  asked as the egg white clouded and cooked, was strictly rhetorical.

title: Alex Rodriguezs Orchestrated Move May Not Be His Last
description: This is how it ends for Alex Rodriguez? With a Yankees-orchestrated whimper instead of an all-out public relations war?

title: South Korean Missile Defense Deal Appears to Sour Chinas Taste for K-Pop
description: BEIJING  Has K-pop become one of the first victims of a recent fraying of relations between China and South Korea?

title: Left Behind on Billionaires Row
description: My commute to work includes a walk on West 57th Street (a.k.a. Billionaires Row), a street laced with new high-rise condominiums and others under construction. A competition seems to be in progress: Which will be the highest and most expensive?

title: Erdogan Seizes Failed Coup in Turkey as a Chance to Supplant Ataturk
description: ISTANBUL  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has always had ambitions of surpassing Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the founder of modern Turkey, as the countrys most consequential figure.

title: A Maoists Burden in Nepal
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Ten summers ago in Nepal, the Maoist leader Pushpa Kamal Dahal emerged from hiding just as the decade-long insurgency he had directed was pushing the countrys monarchy to its knees. The rebel chief was picked up by a government helicopter, then whisked to the prime ministers residence in Kathmandu to begin official peace talks.

title: Heng on Thailands Military Referendum
description: No matter the outcome of Sundays national referendum, the junta will remain in control until it decides to hand power back to an elected government.

title: How to Give Rural America Broadband? Look to the Early 1900s
description: ZENA, Okla.  From the sofa in his living room, Clinton Creason can see the electric pole outside that his father staked 70 years ago to bring power to this remote area of hilly cattle pastures.

title: Once Taunted by Steve Jobs, Companies Are Now Big Customers of Apple
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In the primordial days of computing, IBM machines were so common inside corporations that there was a running joke in the industry: Nobody ever got fired for buying IBM.

title: Township Saw a Zoning Issue. The Justice Dept. Saw Religious Discrimination.
description: WASHINGTON  For nearly 10 months, a Muslim congregation in the Philadelphia suburb of Bensalem, Pa., pleaded with township officials to allow the construction of a mosque, paying for expensive traffic studies, repeatedly explaining Islamic practices, revising and re-revising design plans, and then receiving the final word: No.

title: Security Force of 85,000 Fills Rio, Unsettling Rights Activists
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  If battling pickpockets were an Olympic sport at the current Summer Games, the Brazilian authorities might qualify for a medal.

title: TV Networks Try to Win Over the Critics
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  With the number of scripted television shows swelling each year  there were more than 400 last year, and that number is expected to go up this year  anxious network executives are once again attending a news media event here to make the case that their stuff is just a wee bit better than the next guys.

title: After Ailes and Cosby, a Moment for More Women to Speak Up
description: In the fall of 1991, an obscure law professor named Anita Hill pushed the issue of sexual harassment into the public consciousness when she accused her former boss, the Supreme Court nominee Clarence Thomas, of having repeatedly made lewd overtures toward her.

title: Neil Walker and Michael Conforto Homer as Mets Top Tigers
description: DETROIT  Neil Walker had someplace to go Sunday afternoon. His wife, Niki, is expected to deliver their first child next week, and Walker needed to drive about four and a half hours to spend Mondays day off with her at their home near Pittsburgh.

title: Trump Is Testing the Norms of Objectivity in Journalism
description: If youre a working journalist and you believe that Donald J. Trump is a demagogue playing to the nations worst racist and nationalistic tendencies, that he cozies up to anti-American dictators and that he would be dangerous with control of the United States nuclear codes, how the heck are you supposed to cover him?

title: A Nuclear Legacy Within Reach
description: The Air Force has formally begun the process of asking defense contractors to submit proposals for a new long-range cruise missile and a new land-based intercontinental ballistic missile. These two weapons, capable of carrying nuclear payloads, will cost billions of dollars. The first is unnecessary; the second, debatable.

title: At 82, Emperor Akihito of Japan Wants to Retire. Will Japan Let Him?
description: TOKYO  The Japanese have acknowledged that their emperor is not a god and he has been stripped of all political power, but the nation still views its monarch as so central to the sense of identity that he is not permitted to resign.

title: Ivo Pitanguy, Plastic Surgeon to the Stars and a Celebrity Himself, Dies at 93
description: Dr. Ivo Pitanguy, a pioneering Brazilian plastic surgeon who performed face lifts, tummy tucks and other procedures on the rich, famous and royal, becoming rich, famous and celebrated in his own right, died on Saturday at his home in Rio de Janeiro. He was 93.

title: Elliot Tiber, Who With a Permit Brought Forth Woodstock, Dies at 81
description: In July 1969, the town of Wallkill, N.Y., dealt a potentially mortal blow to Woodstock Ventures, a group of rookie promoters hoping to organize a grand festival of rock music in rural New York.

title: The Night Of Season 1, Episode 5: Seeing Naz in a New Light
description: In Jacques Audiards superb 2009 thriller A Prophet, a French teenager of Algerian descent begins serving a six-year sentence for attacking police officers, but quickly discovers that he has no allies in prison. Needing protection in order to survive, he carries out a soul-coarsening atrocity on behalf of a Corsican mob boss who runs a criminal operation within the prison walls. By committing this heinous act of violence, however, he crosses a moral Rubicon that forever changes him and the audience follows his transformation into a vicious, calculating gangster. He enters prison a lamb and leaves a lion.

title: Review: A Femme Fatale, a Private Eye and Dorm Mates, at Summer Shorts
description: By the time things turn dizzily theatrical, in a noir-style romp called The Dark Clothes of Night, the audience is well primed. This delicious little play, by Richard Alfredo, is the third of three one-acts in Series B of this years Summer Shorts festival at 59E59 Theaters, and its the first that feels unmistakably like a work for the stage  dressed up though it is as a love letter to classic cinema.

title: As Alex Rodriguez Prepares to Retire, Fans Grapple With a Complicated Legacy
description: In the moments after Alex Rodriguez announced that Friday would be the end of his turbulent yet stellar playing career, fans outside Yankee Stadium on Sunday cheered for different reasons  some in relief, and others in solidarity with a player they will always consider one of the greats.

title: Katie Ledecky Smashes Her Own World Record in 400 Freestyle
description: After finishing, having roared through the last 50 meters of the 400-meter freestyle at a sprinters pace, Katie Ledecky turned around to see the scoreboard. It told her what she surely already knew: she had won gold, her first of the Rio Games, and she had crushed her own world record.

title: Novak Djokovic Upset in First Round by Juan Martn del Potro
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Novak Djokovic, the worlds dominant tennis player, had made the Olympic gold medal in singles one of his big priorities for 2016.

title: Brooklyn Church, Over a Century Old, Likely to Make Way for Affordable Housing
description: A seven-year battle between preservationists and the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn over the fate of a church more than a century old will likely end with the arrival of a wrecking ball.

title: Trial by Jury, a Hallowed American Right, Is Vanishing
description: The criminal trial ended more than two and a half years ago, but Judge Jesse M. Furman can still vividly recall the case. It stands out, not because of the defendant or the subject matter, but because of its rarity: In his four-plus years on the bench in Federal District Court in Manhattan, it was his only criminal jury trial.

title: Competition, in a Swirl of Color
description: On the second full day of events at the 2016 Summer Games in Rio de Janeiro, foils flashed, water splashed, bodies crashed and horses dashed.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its hugely disappointing. A trial is the one place where the system really gets tested. Everything else is done behind closed doors.

title: Simone Biles Has Just One Peer in Rio, but Rejects the Comparison
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  In the hours before the preliminary round of Olympic gymnastics, members of the United States womens team were at the cafeteria in the athletes village, goofing around. Telling jokes. Making funny faces. Laughing so hard that Martha Karolyi, the womens national team coordinator, approached Aly Raisman, the team captain, to tell them to quiet down.

title: Michael Phelps Powers U.S. to Victory in 4x100 Relay, Winning a 19th Gold
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Michael Phelps won his 19th Olympic gold medal as the United States won the 4x100 relay at the Olympics on Sunday. The Americans traditional rival in the event, France, was second, and Australia third.

title: Russia Not Allowed to Compete in Paralympics
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Paralympics officials have done what Olympics officials chose not to do, barring all Russian athletes from their Games after an elaborate cheating scheme.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | arcade
description: arcade  \r-kad\  noun

title: Corrections: August 8, 2016
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Whats on TV Monday: Hitchcock/Truffaut and Michael Phelps at the Rio Olympics
description: Hitchcock/Truffaut recalls the directors 1962 meeting of the minds. Michael Phelps swims a signature event, the 200-meter butterfly, at the Rio Olympics. And Michael Shannon glowers as an outlaw on the lam with an unusual child in Midnight Special.

title: Landslides in Mexico Kill at Least 39 After Rains From Tropical Storm Earl
