title: Review: Sarasota Ballet Shows Its Mastery of Frederick Ashtons Marvels
description: As the Joyce Theater curtain descends at the end of the Sarasota Ballets production of Frederick Ashtons Valses Nobles et Sentimentales, a softly dazzling masterstroke of choreography is still occurring. There are just three dancers center stage. But each faces a different screen  left, center back, and right  and behind these transparent screens are seven other dancers.

title: Michael Phelps vs. Michael Phelps
description: Cmo se ha adaptado Phelps para participar en cinco juegos olmpicos?

title: Disney Bets on Streaming, Joining With Major League Baseball
description: LOS ANGELES  The Walt Disney Company, facing stiff challenges in the traditional television business, is making a $1 billion bet on video streaming.

title: Justice Department to Release Blistering Report of Racial Bias by Baltimore Police
description: The Justice Department has found that the Baltimore Police Department for years has hounded black residents who make up most of the citys population, systematically stopping, searching and arresting them, often with little provocation or rationale.

title: Review: Jay McInerneys Bright, Precious Days
description: Jay McInerney has now written three novels about Corrine and Russell Calloway, a couple who met in their teens at Brown University and arrived in the 1980s on the Upper East Side of New York, thrumming with ambition yet also pre-bored. (From the first book: Corrine was getting so tired of parties: dinner parties, birthday parties, pre-publication parties, housewarming parties; holiday and theme and opening-night parties, closing-night parties.) He followed them through the crisis of 9/11. And now he is back to watch them reach 50 and hit amplified fiscal, marital and existential crises.

title: Redefining Hawaiian Fine Dining
description: For decades, Hawaiis high-end restaurants have been dominated by outsiders. At first glance, Senia, serving ambitious small plates in Honolulus still pleasantly seedy Chinatown, might seem like more of the same: Its co-owned by the chef Anthony Rush, a Brit who arrived from London mere months ago. But Rushs partner is Chris Kajioka, a Honolulu native with intimate knowledge of local ingredients. Together the chefs, who met working at Per Se, have created a menu that centers on the islands most elemental staples, re-envisioned as haute cuisine. Red snapper, which in Hawaii is often served simply with ginger and soy sauce, is baked in a sourdough crust and cracked tableside; backyard fruits like mountain apples and guavas are prepared with traditional French techniques; and lowly starches like taro, sweet potatoes and breadfruit are given center stage. This is not meant to be intellectual food, Kajioka says. We really want to represent Hawaii  just in a different way.

title: Let the Emperor Retire
description: It says a lot about Japans constitutional monarchy that Emperor Akihito, 82 and in failing health, would be stepping out of bounds if he were to say he wanted to retire. Under the Constitution laid down by the victorious United States after World War II, the emperors role is strictly restricted to being the symbol of the state and of the unity of the people, and since the law says the monarch rules until he dies, to utter words like abdicate or even retire would be seen as a forbidden sortie into politics. Yet in a televised address on Monday remarkable for its circumlocution, the emperor was clear about what he couldnt say. And if it wasnt clear, well say it for him: Hed really, really like to retire.

title: Donald Trump, Michael Phelps, Zika: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing

title: Justice Department to Streamline Tracking of Police Killings
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is moving forward with a plan to better track killings by police officers, as heightened national scrutiny of such deaths has reinforced criticism of its reliance on self-reporting by state and local law enforcement agencies.

title: In China, Rejuvenating a Classical Music Heritage Linked to a Jewish Community
description: HARBIN, China  In winter, tourists flock to Harbin, in northeastern China, for its world-renowned ice sculpture festival. But with summer in full bloom, this city is working overtime on behalf of a less publicized part of its heritage: classical music.

title: Lenny Bruce Shattered Taboos, but Was He Funny?
description: Last week, on the 50th anniversary of Lenny Bruces death, a small crowd gathered at the New York Society for Ethical Culture on the Upper West Side of Manhattan to watch videos of his stand-up. Mr. Bruce appeared on a large screen and told jokes for 40 minutes, and hardly anyone laughed.

title: The Justice Departments Report
description: A Justice Department investigation into the practices of the Baltimore police department found "reasonable cause to believe that the BPD engages in a pattern or practice of conduct that violates the Constitution or federal law."

description: During a morning walk through her East Harlem district on Tuesday, the speaker of the New York City Council noticed a pedestrian crossing signal hanging precariously from a light pole, partially disengaged.

title: Review: An Art That Nature Makes, an Illuminating Look at Rosamond Purcell
description: An Art That Nature Makes: The Work of Rosamond Purcell is the portrait of an artist who is not interested in portraits. Early in her career as a photographer, Ms. Purcell remarks, she stopped taking pictures of people. In the years since  shes 74 now  she has established herself as a visual poet of the inanimate, a still-life painter with a camera.

title: Perjury Trial Begins for Kathleen Kane, Pennsylvania Attorney General
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa.  The perjury trial of the state attorney general, Kathleen G. Kane, began Tuesday with prosecutors accusing her of illegally releasing details of a secret grand jury investigation to the news media, and her defense lawyer arguing that she would not have risked her career by doing such a thing.

description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: German Police Detain Asylum-Seeker Suspected of Plotting Terrorist Attack

description: The great scripted-TV boom is showing no signs of abating.

title: U.C. Davis Chancellor Resigns Under Fire
description: The chancellor of the University of California, Davis, who was placed on administrative leave amid allegations that she used university money to eliminate negative online search results about the institution, resigned on Tuesday after an investigation found that she had violated several university policies.

title: Final Bow for Martha Karolyi, the Woman Who Lifted U.S. Gymnastics
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  In her 11 Olympics as a coach or leader of a gymnastics team, Martha Karolyi, the often stone-faced and certainly serious coordinator of the United States womens gymnastics national team, has cried only twice.

title: Jefferies, Free of the Restraints of Bigger Banks, Is Emboldened
description: When the activist investor Carl C. Icahn bought 15 percent of the organic and natural products maker Hain Celestial in 2010, the companys chief turned for advice to Mr. Icahns own Wall Street banker, Richard Handler, the chief executive of the investment bank Jefferies.

title: Serena Williams Knocked Out of Olympics
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Serena Williams lost in the round of 16 of the tennis tournament at the Rio Olympics on Tuesday, capping a disappointing Games for the Williams sisters.

title: Russia Allows Rare Protest Against New Antiterrorism Laws
description: MOSCOW  In a mass public protest with a rare permit, hundreds of critics of the Russian government gathered in Moscow on Tuesday evening to demonstrate against a new set of so-called antiterrorism laws.

description: Dear Diary:

title: Zika Cases Rise in Miami, and Officials Try to Soothe Fears
description: MIAMI  As the number of locally acquired Zika cases in Miami climbed a notch on Tuesday, county officials held an emergency meeting to blunt concerns about an epidemic and to underscore that local infections remain well contained.

title: Red Bulls Biggest Midseason Acquisition, Omer Damari, Is a Little-Known Israeli Striker
description: HARRISON, N.J.  The Red Bulls traditionally live by the ripple, not the big splash. So when the team introduced its biggest midseason signing Tuesday, the striker in question was a little-known Israeli, Omer Damari, and not any of the larger names bandied about recently.

title: Emails Renew Questions About Clinton Foundation and State Dept. Overlap
description: WASHINGTON  A new batch of State Department emails released Tuesday showed the close and sometimes overlapping interests between the Clinton Foundation and the State Department when Hillary Clinton served as secretary of state.

title: Chicago Police Department Warns of Gangs Threats to Attack Officers
description: The Chicago Police Department has alerted its officers that gang members are plotting to shoot police officers in retaliation for the killing last month of Paul ONeal, a black man who was chased by the police through a residential neighborhood before being shot by an officer whose body camera was not recording.

title: It Absolutely Has Created Fear: 2 Killings Prompt Female Joggers to Alter Routines
description: The two deaths occurred just days apart and had eerily similar details  each time, a woman went jogging during the day in an isolated area and wound up dead.

title: Alex Rodriguez Finds a Place in the Game, if Not the Lineup
description: BOSTON  More than 18,000 people have played major league baseball, and only 14 have come to bat more than Alex Rodriguez. Yet he never gets tired of it, not even now, when his skills have vanished. Of course he wanted to start every game this week at Fenway Park. If Rodriguez had his way, he would go out like Kobe Bryant, shooting and shooting and shooting until the clock ran out on his career.

title: Donald Trumps Support Among Republican Women Starts to Slide
description: Of all the tribulations facing Donald J. Trump, perhaps none is stirring as much anxiety inside his campaign as the precipitous decline of support from Republican women, an electoral cornerstone for the partys past nominees that is starting to crumble.

title: Further Into the Muck With Mr. Trump
description: Three months from the presidential election, and one day after his running mate promised specific policy proposals for how we rebuild this country at home and abroad, Americans find themselves asking whether Donald Trump has called for the assassination of Hillary Clinton.

title: Alex Rodriguez Stays on Bench for Yankees in Lineup Dispute
description: BOSTON  Late in the ninth inning of Tuesdays game, fans at Fenway Park began to chant loudly, We want A-Rod.

title: Katie Ledeckys Gold Medal Haul Continues
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Katie Ledeckys pushed herself so hard on the first 150 meters of the 200 freestyle on Tuesday night that she swam the final length of the pool on the brink of exhaustion, with bile rising in her throat, she said. Somehow, she got to the wall first.

title: Trumps Wink Wink to Second Amendment People
description: And that, ladies and gentlemen, is how Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin got assassinated.

title: Message Sent: 21 and Counting for Michael Phelps
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Michael Phelps won a gold medal on Tuesday night, which is almost ordinary by now. It was his 20th Olympic gold.

title: California Utility Found Guilty of Violations in 2010 Gas Explosion That Killed 8
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A federal jury on Tuesday found Californias major utility company, Pacific Gas and Electric, guilty of safety violations at the time of a 2010 gas pipeline explosion that killed eight people and destroyed a neighborhood in a San Francisco suburb.

title: During Diving Event, Pool Transforms From Crystal Blue to Garishly Green
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  An unsettling thing happened at the Olympic diving pool on Tuesday: the water inexplicably turned green, just in time for the womens synchronized 10-meter platform diving competition.

title: Paul Ryan Wins Republican Primary in Wisconsin
description: WASHINGTON  The House speaker, Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin, easily won his Republican primary on Tuesday, defeating a political newcomer who had received a late surge of attention after being praised by Donald J. Trump.

title: Review: Troilus and Cressida, a Trojan War Love Story
description: When you find yourself marveling that Troilus and Cressida makes sense, it means you are at a very special show, indeed.

title: Like 100 Vis--Vis 20
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  The term Scrabbly has been applied to certain crosswords that make prolific use of the high-value Scrabble letters, like J, K, V, Q, W, X and Z, but todays puzzle by David C. Duncan Dekker is Scrabbly on steroids. Its not only a pangram, which, for those of you just joining us, is a crossword where every letter of the English alphabet is used at least once. This is a QUINTUPLE pangram, which means that each letter is used, at minimum, five times. Thats quite a feat.

title: Robert Kiley, Mass Transit Chief in Boston, London and New York, Dies at 80
description: Robert Kiley, who oversaw the revival of long-neglected subway and bus lines that carry millions of commuters daily in Boston, New York and London, died on Tuesday at his home in Chilmark, Mass. He was 80.

title: Fred Schwartz, 84, Furrier, Philanthropist and Television Pitchman, Dies
description: Fred Schwartz, the fur dealer who redefined luxury by marketing affordable pelage as the television pitchman Fred the Furrier, died on Sunday at his home in Great Neck, on Long Island. He was 84.

title: Katinka Hosszu Wins Third Gold at Rio Olympics
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Even as they chase history, Katie Ledecky and Michael Phelps could be overshadowed by Katinka Hosszu, who won the 200-meter individual medley on Tuesday, adding to her wins in the 100-meter backstroke and 400-meter individual medley.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If she gets to pick her judges, nothing you can do, folks. Although the Second Amendment people  maybe there is, I dont know.

title: Mets Waste Solid Effort by Steven Matz in Loss to Diamondbacks
description: For weeks, the Mets have prayed for a hot streak like the one that powered them into the playoffs last season. But with Tuesdays 5-3 loss to the struggling Arizona Diamondbacks at Citi Field, the Mets summer inconsistency continued. They have not won consecutive games since July 6 and 7.

title: Hope Solo Struggles in Goal, but U.S. Womens Soccer Advances
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Twenty-five minutes into Tuesday nights steam bath of a soccer match in the Amazon, Hope Solo stood in front of the United States net, awaiting a free kick by Colombias Catalina Usme from about 20 yards away.

title: All-Around Effort
description: While Michael Phelps was winning his 20th and 21st career gold medals,other Olympians shared the spotlight, including the United States womens gymnastics squad, which also captured gold.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: World Lion Day and Kerri Walsh Jennings in Rio
description: Celebrate World Lion Day with Animal Planet, then stream the enchanting wildlife tear-jerker Born Free. American swimmers, meanwhile, continue their quest for gold at the Rio Olympics. And Javier Bardem plays a Brazilian to great effect in Eat Pray Love.

title: Corrections: August 10, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | titter
description: titter  \ti-tr\  verb and noun

title: Leaks Detail Abuse of Asylum Seekers Sent to Nauru by Australia
description: Leaked documents published Wednesday reveal extensive details about the harsh conditions faced by asylum seekers who have tried to reach Australia by boat and are being held on the remote Pacific island of Nauru.

title: Trumponomics Is Reform Conservatisms Evil Twin
description: Long before Donald Trump, the Republican Party had an obvious problem. Its core economic agenda  tax cuts, free trade, deregulation and a promise to shrink the federal leviathan  was seen by many Americans, including many of the partys own voters, as distant from their concerns and too skewed toward the rich.

title: Moving Past Broken Windows Policing
description: Heres one good thing about having a new police commissioner to succeed William Bratton: Maybe New York can finally stop arguing about broken windows policing.

title: What Intelligence Briefings Can Tell Us About Candidates
description: The no-longer-presumptive nominees of the Democratic and Republican parties will soon start receiving periodic classified intelligence briefings, with the first one coming perhaps this week. Rarely has this routine ritual received so much public attention  and with good reason.

title: Michael Phelps Made Me Cry (Good Tears)
Save the Refugees on the Berm
description: For millions of Syrian civilians trapped for five years by a relentless war, mere lifesaving aid, let alone refuge, is out of reach. But for the 75,000 displaced people caught on Jordans desert frontier with Syria, salvation is only yards away. Unlike many of their fellow citizens, they can be saved. So why have they been effectively abandoned?

title: Tapping a Troubled Neighborhoods Inner Strength
description: First of three articles

title: Picture Prompt | Beware of Zombies
description: Whats the story behind this photo?

title: Compromised Think Tanks
Valuing Culture Over Money in an Ancient Chinese City
description: Members of Chinas Uighur ethnic group are resisting Chinese efforts to placate them through economic development, opting to preserve their culture and religion.

title: The Fire That Shaped London
description: LONDON  In the early hours of Sept. 2, 1666, a small fire broke out in a London bakery owned by Thomas Farriner. Stoked by easterly winds, the blaze engulfed timber-framed houses and warehouses stocked with brandy, wine and oil. By the time it was extinguished four days later, about 13,000 buildings had been destroyed  including the 500-year-old St. Pauls Cathedral  and nearly 80 percent of the ancient city of London had been wiped out. As many as 100,000 people were left homeless.

title: Watching Your Daughter Win Gymnastics Gold Looks Like This
description: Photos of the parents of the United States womens gymnastics team as they watched their daughters perform.

title: A Sidewalk Vendor Amasses Books, Summonses and Lawsuits
description: Since the first flimsy folding table appeared in 1986 bearing a few tattered paperbacks, Kirk Davidsons book-vending displays have become part of the permanent landscape along a sidewalk on the Upper West Side of Manhattan.

title: A Space-Age Food Product Cultivated by the Incas
description: What did the Incas and NASA have in common?

title: Stress Over Family Finances Propelled Hillary Clinton Into Corporate World
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.  Losing the governors race here in 1980 so shattered a young Bill Clinton that he could not face his supporters, so he sent his wife around to thank campaign workers instead. He later gathered with close friends for dinner but quietly sulked, playing the country song I Dont Know Whether to Kill Myself or Go Bowling on the jukebox.

title: Findings of Police Bias in Baltimore Validate What Many Have Long Felt
description: BALTIMORE  As a black man and a lifelong resident of this city, Ray Kelly has been stopped by the police more times than he can count. And as a community organizer who tried to document police bias after the death of Freddie Gray, Mr. Kelly, 45, had always expected that a federal investigation would uncover a pattern of racial discrimination.

title: Think Amazons Drone Delivery Idea Is a Gimmick? Think Again
description: Amazon is the most obscure large company in the tech industry.

title: Ai Weiweis Animal Heads Offer Critique of Chinese Nationalism
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  On summer days at Princeton University, children splash in a fountain next to an unlikely piece of art: 12 large bronze heads of animals sitting atop poles in a line.

title: Many Soldiers, Few Signs, Long Lines: The Rio Games Beyond the TV Screen
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  At the womens 3-meter synchronized diving final on Sunday, there seemed to be two events occurring at once. There was the one displayed on a large video screen at the outdoor arena, and there was the live one in front of your eyes. The events were identical except for one notable detail: On the screen, the sun appeared to be shining, and in real life, it was not.

title: Valuing Culture As Much As Money in an Ancient Chinese City
description: | Read in Chinese

title: Echoing a Film Plot, Chinese Gangs Kill Drifters in an Elaborate Mining Ruse
description: SHISUN VILLAGE, China  The three miners befriended a lonely, luckless man and offered him work down an iron mine in eastern China.

title: Modest to Majestic: A Look at Hillary and Bill Clintons Homes Over the Years
description: Hillary and Bill Clintons shift over the years from middle class to multimillionaires has been perhaps most pronounced in the places they have called home.

title: Living in Stuyvesant Town
description: The 1940s-era Stuyvesant Town and its sister complex, Peter Cooper Village, once provided housing for returning World War II veterans.

title: Stuyvesant Town: An Oasis Near the East River
description: Monica Watters and her husband, Ash Aviles, are seasoned New Yorkers, having lived in the city for several years. Yet they knew very little about Stuyvesant Town and its sister complex, Peter Cooper Village, and when they viewed the outer boundary of buildings in passing, I thought it might be a womens prison, Ms. Watters said.

title: A Fire Happened in the Newborn Unit, and Your Baby Died
description: BAGHDAD  If there were one safe place in Iraq, it should be a hospital nursery, locked down for the night with dozens of babies nestled inside.

title: Musicians in a Refugee Camp in France Record The Calais Sessions
description: PARIS  I am happy, like a myna/Life in a caravan, thinking about my friends/Lets go to the garden, go the upbeat lyrics from Khandahar, a poem first written in English and then translated to Farsi by two Afghan sisters, ages 9 and 12, who were living in a trailer in the sprawling migrant and refugee camp in Calais, France, that is known as the Jungle.

title: Jesmyn Wards Anthology of Race Builds on the Legacy of James Baldwin
description: THE FIRE THIS TIMEA New Generation Speaks About RaceEdited by Jesmyn WardIllustrated. 226 pp. Scribner. $25.

title: The Run of Her Life: Jeffrey Toobin on the Odyssey of Patty Hearst
description: AMERICAN HEIRESSThe Wild Saga of the Kidnapping, Crimes and Trial of Patty HearstBy Jeffrey ToobinIllustrated. 371 pp. Doubleday. $28.95.

title: Do Olympians Get Too Much Exercise?
description: Many of us watching the Olympics are feeling inspired now to exercise harder and more often. But exercise scientists have long been intrigued  and worried  by the question of whether, over months and years, someone can exercise too much. It has not been clear if there is a safe upper limit to exercise beyond which you can irreparably injure your body, and in particular your heart.

title: Article of the Day | 50 G.O.P. Officials Warn Donald Trump Would Put Nations Security at Risk
description: Article: 50 G.O.P. Officials Warn Donald Trump Would Put Nations Security at Risk

title: Michael Phelps, Katie Ledecky, Zika: Your Morning Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Jefferies, Small and Emboldened
description: The investment bank Jefferies, which never took federal bailout money and is not hemmed in by the restrictions imposed on banks that did, has developed an appetite for risk. And it is matching its appetite with bold moves, bolstered by some helpful relationships.

title: For Teenage Girls, Swimsuit Season Never Ends
description: How do you get a young woman to bomb a math test? Have her take it while wearing a bathing suit.

title: How to Find the Spirit of H.P. Lovecraft in Providence
description: To walk through the streets of Providence, particularly those of the citys verdant, historic East Side, is to be deep in Lovecraft-land.

title: On the Bauhaus Trail in Germany
description: The Bauhaus Building rises over Dessau, a small, postindustrial city in eastern Germany, like a futuristic message from the past. With its suspended glass facades, exposed steel gridding and asymmetrical layout, the three-wing complex feels both modern and familiar. But when it was finished in 1926, it was downright alien.

title: New York Today: Beachside Baseball
description: Updated, 10:02 a.m.

title: Australia Stops Online Collection of Census Data After Cyberattacks
description: Australia has halted online collection of national census data after a website where citizens could upload information was subjected to repeated cyberattacks.

title: Britains Paper Tigers
description: LONDON  Last week, two reporters for a small Scottish newspaper left Fleet Street for good. Their departure means that the London home of Britains unseemly press since 1702 now no longer houses any newspaper offices at all. A neighborhood once dominated by printers and reporters, all working and (more often) drinking within half a mile of one another, has become the haunt of lawyers, insurers and other soulless creatures.

title: Donald Trumps Red-State Problem
description: If you looked only at the blue states, you probably wouldnt think that Donald J. Trump was in huge trouble. The recent 10-point polling deficits in states like Michigan or Pennsylvania may sting but arent jaw-dropping.

title: Chinese City Backs Down on Proposed Nuclear Fuel Plant After Protests
description: BEIJING  Bowing to days of passionate street protests, a city government in eastern China said Wednesday that it had halted any plans to build a nuclear fuel plant there. The reversal was the latest indication of how public distrust could hold back Chinas ambitious plans for expanding its nuclear power industry.

title: Brazils Senate Votes to Move Ahead With Dilma Rousseffs Trial
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils Senate voted in the early hours of Wednesday to begin the last phase in the impeachment trial of Dilma Rousseff, the president who was suspended in May, setting the stage for her final removal from office.

title: Putting Politics Aside, Korean Gymnasts Pose for Olympic Selfie
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Lee Eun-ju was not expected to be one of South Koreas big names at the Rio Olympics. She joined the countrys gymnastics team as a last-minute replacement after another athlete was injured. Indeed, she failed to advance to the finals.

title: Not Forgotten: No Matter the Game, Babe Didrikson Zaharias Played to Win
description: Babe Didrikson Zaharias was a brash competitor in practically any sport who became internationally famous after winning three medals at the 1932 Olympics.

title: FOIA, Subpoenas and Singapores Libel Laws: All in a Days Work
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, David McCraw, a newsroom lawyer for The Times, describes the mosaic of legal issues that he encounters on a typical day.

title: Hillary Clinton Hopes to Capitalize on Republican Defectors
description: Hillary Clintons campaign would like to turn the drip-drip-drip of Republican defectors abandoning Donald J. Trump into a deluge.

title: 1891: Bicyclists Claim Right to Road
description: The bicyclists have addressed a petition to both Chambers of the Legislature, complaining that they are tolerated in many municipalities, instead of being recognized as lawful occupants of the road. They therefore pray that the bicycle may be declared by law to be a carriage, with all that the name implies.

title: What You Get for  $740,000
description: Contemporaries in Vermont and North Carolina and an adobe in New Mexico

title: $740,000 Homes in Santa Fe, North Carolina and Vermont
description: COLCHESTER, VT.

title: Get Ready for the Perseids Meteor Shower: It Will Rival the Stars in the Sky.
description: Prepare for the Perseids.

title: 'We Dont Need to Be Alone: A Political Shift Has Poland Assessing Its Values
description: WROCLAW, Poland  Mayor Rafal Dutkiewicz of Wroclaw has presided over city hall in the magnificent old center since 2002. As he watches Polands politics take a rightward and nationalistic turn  a phenomenon playing out to varying degrees across much of Europe  Mr. Dutkiewicz, an early supporter of Solidarity, cites history ancient and modern to argue that Europe is good for Poland.

title: Middle Class and Hungry in Venezuela
description: CIUDAD GUAYANA, Venezuela  I was hanging out with some neighbors in the hallway recently. We live in one of the short turquoise buildings of a mixed commercial-residential complex in this northeastern city, supposedly a model of urban development.

title: Woman Is Accidentally Killed by Police Officer Playing Bad Guy at Training Academy in Florida
description: Mary Knowlton knew that the key to enjoying retirement in Punta Gorda, Fla., was to stay active, her friends say, and they had no idea how she kept so busy. When she signed up for a citizens academy held by the local police department, she and her husband were among 35 people hoping to learn more about law enforcement tactics.

title: The Most Dangerous Eight Seconds in Sports, on Fearless
description: If bull riding were an Olympic event, the Brazilians might sweep the medals and win bonus points for bravery. Adriano Moraes, Ednei Caminhas, Guilherme Marchi, Renato Nunes and Silvano Alves: Each has been a world champion of what are considered the most dangerous eight seconds in sports. Fearless, a Netflix documentary series debuting Friday, Aug. 19, depicts wiry cowboys straddling tornadoes of muscle, horn and hoof more than 10 times their weight and hanging on as if their existence depended on it.

title: An Olympics of Spirit at the Battery Dance Festival
description: The stage for the Battery Dance Festival, in its 35th year, faces spectacular views of New Yorks harbor. Thats appropriate as the free performances there this summer include 35 companies, 38 choreographers and an estimated 160 performers who embrace the world.

title: Atlanta Rappers Join Fools Gold Day Off Party
description: Two distinct tangents of Atlantas flamboyant, overflowing rap scene will take over the Manhattan waterfront on Saturday, Aug. 20: Migos, the three-headed hydra of euphoric, rapid-fire catchphrases, and Lil Yachty, the self-proclaimed king of the teens, with his singsong flow and constantly bouncing red-beaded braids. Both will bring the joyful youth contingent to the seventh annual Fools Gold Day Off party, which also features the promising local rappers Leaf, Meyhem Lauren and Dave East.

title: Collector Helper at Anthony Philip Fine Art
description: Part of the mission of Anthony Philip Fine Art in Bushwick, Brooklyn, is to connect emerging artists with aspiring collectors. So the gallerys latest show, opening Friday, Aug. 12, aims specifically at young and novice collectors. Life Sized: A Small Works Invitational features more than 140 artworks that are under 12 inches by 12 inches and priced under $750. Our hope is that there will be something here for anyone looking to jump-start their collection, Mr. Philip said. The 35 artists in the show work in a range of media, including painting, sculpture, photography, abstract art and traditional drawing. Among them are Kristen Balouch, Jonathan Quinn and Tariku Shiferaw from New York; Amy Lottes, Jeff Kapfer and Barb Flunker from Missouri; and artists from Kansas, South Carolina and Washington. (Through Sept. 3; anthonyphilipfineart.com.)

title: In the Garden, With Strings, at the Noguchi Museum
description: There are few lovelier places to hear music in New York City than in the sculpture garden of the Noguchi Museum in Queens. The museum has a partnership with the new-music collective Bang on a Can, which on Sunday, Aug. 14, brings the American Contemporary Music Ensemble to the garden. On the program are string quartets by Philip Glass and Meredith Monk as well as the premiere of a cello solo by Caleb Burhans, played by Clarice Jensen, the ensembles artistic director. (3 p.m., 718-204-7088, noguchi.org.)

title: Pioneers of African-American Cinema: Black Filmmaking Aborning
description: From the perspective of cinema history  and American history, for that matter  there has never been a more significant video release than Pioneers of African-American Cinema, a five-disc collection funded with a Kickstarter campaign and released by Kino Lorber on Blu-ray and DVD.

title: The Comic Nikki Glaser at Carolines on Broadway
description: The dynamic stand-up comic Nikki Glaser has produced a popular podcast, co-hosted a short-lived talk show on MTV and starred in several memorable sketches on Inside Amy Schumer. But the best example of her wry and raunchy sense of humor may be in Not Safe With Nikki Glaser, a cheerfully sex-obsessed series on Comedy Central. The show, which includes high-concept videos that take her places like a porn shoot (where she feeds lines to actors) and a foot fetish party, helps Ms. Glaser come off as forever game, if also a little startled by her own chutzpah. This tension between her bluntness and her anxiety has long been the engine fueling her charismatic, assured stand-up, the bedrock of her prolific young career. She headlines six shows at Carolines on Broadway, starting on Thursday, Aug. 18. (212-757-4100, carolines.com.)

title: A Fellini Summer. A Conquistadors, Too.
description: In its Weekend Classics series, the IFC Center has been hosting a stealth Federico Fellini festival this summer, with screenings at the un-Fellinilike hour of 11 a.m. Amarcord, the directors most nostalgic memoir, evoking the small coastal Italian town where he grew up, is on Sunday, Aug. 14; on Friday and Saturday is Roma, a valentine to the city to which he is eternally wed. (ifccenter.com.)

title: Polls: What They Do and Dont Tell Us
description: Times Insider shares insights into the working and thinking at The New York Times. Today, David Leonhardt talks about polls and what they do and dont measure.

title: House Hunting in ... Lima
description: A TRADITIONAL FIVE-BEDROOM HOUSE IN CENTRAL LIMA

title: Mediterranean-Style House in Lima, Peru
description: The five-bedroom four-bath sits on a hill in Casuarinas, a gated neighborhood in the central Lima district of Santiago de Surco.

title: Even Superheroes Punch the Clock
description: In summertime, you can count on two things. There will be a lot of sequels and reboots in theaters, and there will be a lot of critics complaining about that. Its just part of the job. And after 2015, when a handful of reboots and sequels landed on Top 10 lists, were back to a familiar routine. The movies range from pretty good to outright terrible, they open to mixed reviews and big box-office numbers, and before we know it, the Oscar race is heating up. Its the end of civilization, and its also business as usual.

title: 1966: Lunar Sites to Be Photographed
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Florida  The United States today [Aug. 10] rocketed the Lunar Orbiter spacecraft toward an intended orbit about the moon, hoping to obtain clear pictures of the hidden farther side and nine potential astronaut landing sites. An Atlas-Agena rocket thundered away from Cape Kennedy to start flying on its planned 235,446-mile journey.

title: Kubo and the Two Strings Blends Animation and Origami
description: Kubo and the Two Strings (in theaters Aug. 19) may be the most ambitious film the stop-motion animation company Laika has made. It is a sweeping tale of a young Japanese boys adventures, featuring fierce samurai warriors battling evil spirits and journeys across oceans and harsh winter landscapes.

title: Self-Service Checkouts Can Turn Customers Into Shoplifters, Study Says
description: Self-service checkout technology may offer convenience and speed, but it also helps turn law-abiding shoppers into petty thieves by giving them ready-made excuses to take merchandise without paying, two criminologists say.

title: Struggling to Break Out of Chinese Internet
description: American internet companies, be they Google, Facebook or Uber, have had a hard time breaking into the Chinese market. But there is a flip side to that: Chinese internet companies have had a hard time breaking out of it.

title: What Were Cooking
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Justice Department Report on the Seattle Police Department
description: The Justice Department issued this report on the Seattle Police Department in 2011 after the fatal shooting of Native American.

title: Sharing the Laptops Screen With the TV
description: Q. I dont have a tablet or internet television and I want to stream video from my laptop to my TV. How do I do that?

title: Weight Lifting Her Way From Fiji to Rio
description: On a Wednesday morning in July, the weight lifter Apolonia Vaivai leaned against the cinder-block wall of a crowded bus stall in the South Pacific port city of Suva, Fiji. Vaivai, who is 25 and just over five feet tall and thick with muscle, was wearing turquoise workout shorts and a matching T-shirt and cap bearing a Monster energy-drink logo that covered the tips of her ears. She had come to town to arrange a visa for the Rio Olympic Games, even though she was not yet sure if she was going. Fiji had earned one spot in the womens weight lifting program, but Weightlifting Fiji, the countrys governing body for the sport, had yet to reveal who would fill it. Rather than wait in Suva for the announcement, Vaivai decided to make the jarring, four-hour bus-and-ferry trip home to Ovalau, a nearby island. In three days, she told me later on the ferry, Ill find out if Im going to the Olympics.

title: Safari Guide Accused of Killing Tourist in Masai Mara Reserve in Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  In the vaulted dining room of the Keekorok Lodge, guests gathered Monday night for a feast overlooking one of the most spectacular vistas in Africa: the game-studded Masai Mara National Reserve.

title: Gay and Transgender Egyptians, Harassed and Entrapped, Are Driven Underground
description: CAIRO  The last days of the government of Hosni Mubarak and the turbulent revolution that followed were tense, occasionally gut-wrenching times for many in Egypt. But for gay and transgender Egyptians, it was also a period of unaccustomed freedom.

title: Christie Flat Out Lied in George Washington Bridge Case, Aide Said
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey lied to reporters when he said he did not believe any senior member of his staff knew about the plot to block traffic to the George Washington Bridge, one of his aides told a colleague in a text message included in a federal court filing on Wednesday.

title: Vikings Possibly Spread Smooth-Riding Horses Around the World
description: This week, equestrian athletes at the Rio Olympics are competing in an event called dressage, in which they guide their horses to perform complex combinations of different gaits, including the walk, trot and canter.

title: Seena Hamilton, a Pioneer in Youth Tennis, Is Dead at 92
description: Seena Hamilton, a tennis mom who founded and directed the junior tennis tournament known as the Easter Bowl, a leading testing ground for young players on their way to college and pro careers, died on Saturday in Kingston, N.Y. She was 92.

title: One Artists Very Symbolic New Work, Explained  Sort of
description: The paintings in the artist Ryan McGinnesss new series, Signals, immediately invite interpretation  and then, just as quickly, elude it. Each of the pieces is a circular wood panel, 18 inches in diameter and ringed by a thick red outline. Inside are a handful of stark, graphic black-and-white symbols (a bomb with a seedling sprouting from it; a string tied around a middle finger) that strongly evoke meaning, without giving it all away. They use the visual language of universal sign systems and therefore give the illusion that they are communicating blunt pedestrian information, McGinness notes, but they undermine that same visual language by evading elucidation.

title: Five Places to Go in Bali
description: Tucked between beaches and rolling green rice paddies north of the flashy tourist hub of Seminyak, the bohemian enclave of Canggu (pronounced CHANG-oo) has always lived below the radar. A peaceful haven for expat surfers, Canggus mellow vibe and surf breaks have been luring backpack-toting travelers since the 80s. Recently however, hip new options including vegan cafes, music bars and housewares shops have sprouted among the local staples like Old Mans bar, Betelnut Caf and Deus Ex Machina, a cafe and motorcycle shop. Dont wait too long before heading this way. With a smattering of hotels in the pipeline, this laid-back area may soon see more bustle.

title: 'He Just Flat Out Lied,' Aide Says of Christie and the Bridge Lane Closings
description: A filing in United States District Court in Newark detailed a text that Christina Renna, an aide to Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, sent to a colleague during the governor's news conference on Dec. 13, 2013. Ms. Renna accused Mr. Christie of lying about his staff members not having knowledge of the George Washington Bridge lane closings.

title: An Elegant Piece Thats Part Jewelry  and Part Cape
description: Part cloak, part exquisite body armor, this Boucheron capelet woven from 18-karat gold drapes around the shoulders like a jewel version of haute couture. The Art Deco-inspired pattern, which took over 900 hours to hand-fabricate, is embroidered with more than 800 round diamonds and clasped by a dangling pear-shaped citrine of 82 carats. Engineered to move with the body, this hybrid masterpiece conjures the bold glamour of the 1930s screen sirens and the technical wizardry of today.

title: The Twilight Zone of Home Staging
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.  On a recent Friday evening I pulled into the driveway of the weekend home in Santa Barbara that my partner and I have shared for the last couple of years  and registered the first in a series of Twilight Zone-ish shocks. The car headlights swept the glass sliders of our modern house, illuminating a reconfiguration of the living room furniture so curious, I half-suspected slippage on the Ventura Fault.

title: Wealthy Donors Dangle a Huge Payday in Front of U.S. Wrestlers
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  For most athletes at the Olympics, a gold, silver or bronze medal is the ultimate payoff for years of training and sacrifice.

title: 8 Gold-Worthy Olympics Movies
description: Cue the majestic music. With the Olympics in full swing in Rio, we look back at a handful of movies over the years that have captured the bright, dark and comic sides of the Games.

title: Rio Olympics: Heres What Happened Wednesday
description: Katie Ledecky and the U.S. 4x200 relay team won the gold medal Wednesday, to the surprise of no one. Since the event became a part of the Olympics in 1996, the Americans have won five of six.

title: Mike Pence Hints at Trumps Muslim Ban Extending to Other Religions
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana suggested in a radio interview on Monday that Donald J. Trumps proposed ban on Muslims from entering the country could be broadened to include other religions, not just Muslims.

title: Searching for Feelings  An Intern Works on Topic and Sentiment Analysis
description: Despite the prestige of an internship with The New York Times, when I signed on to do software development with the Search team  before I ever stepped in the building  I assumed Id be working on small projects, fixing bugs that needed to be fixed, and essentially coding only in whatever spare quantity was required. I was perfectly happy to do so, of course, but I was quite prepared to receive piecemeal assignments for completion in small fragments of time.

title: The Wolves Uses Soccer to Visit a World of Teenage Girls
description: The afternoon of the soccer scrimmage was sweltering, one of those beastly July days with humidity like a damp rag. On the Vassar College campus in Poughkeepsie, N.Y., hours before they took the stage at the Powerhouse Theater, the Wolves took the field.

title: After Presidential Debates, Stephen Colbert to Go Live Again
description: Stephen Colbert is going live again.

title: Donald Trumps Second Amendment Comment Was Part of a Pattern
description: When Donald Trump implied on Tuesday that Second Amendment advocates could use their weapons if they didnt like Hillary Clintons Supreme Court picks, Americans were justifiably shocked. But the comment was only the latest in a long series of remarks the candidate has made that support and even praise the use of violence.

title: A Long Island Bars Age Policy Differs for Men and Women. Is It Legal?
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, N.Y.  It is a nightly ritual. Men and women head to the rooftop bar at Kaseys Kitchen and Cocktails here on Long Island, only to be turned away because they are not old enough. But there is a quirk in the establishments policy for its rooftop bar, which states men must be at least 30 and women, just 25.

title: John Saunders, a Measured Voice at ESPN, Dies at 61
description: John Saunders, a widely known ESPN and ABC sportscaster who guided viewers through many premier sporting events over the last 30 years, has died, ESPN announced on Wednesday. He was 61.

title: Olympic Bodies: Can You Guess Their Sport?
description: Members of the United States Olympic and Paralympic teams shed some clothing  whatever they thought was appropriate  to let you try to guess their sport.

title: On assignment with: Michelle Agins
description: On assignment with: Michelle Agins - behind the scenes video in the Haitian church, Queens NY

title: How Did People Migrate to the Americas? Bison DNA Helps Chart the Way
description: Two teams of scientists have succeeded in dating the opening of the gateway to America, only to disagree over whether the Clovis people  one of the first groups from Siberia to reach the Americas  ever used the gateway to gain access to the New World.

title: Off to College? Maybe These Devices Should Go Along
description: WHEN Vanessa Arreola, 18, starts her freshman year at Stanford University this fall, the top item on her back-to-school wish list is a MacBook Pro.

title: Sir Paul on Fans, the Beatles and Himself
description: When youre an artist who started releasing albums in the 1960s and never stopped, you face a decision when going on tour: How do you select a set list?

title: Sailing in Rio? Compared With Nature, the Pollution Is a Breeze
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  After all the concern about what might be floating in Guanabara Bay during the Olympics, it was finally time on Monday for the sailors to start competing.

title: Homes and Cars? No Thanks
description: To the Editor:

title: Putin Accuses Ukraine of Plotting Terrorist Attacks in Crimea
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia accused the Ukrainian government on Wednesday of plotting terrorist attacks in Crimea, and threatened to respond. His Ukrainian counterpart called the accusations fantasies.

title: What Do Jennifer Lopez and Gwen Stefani Have in Common? Their Stylists Know
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  When Jennifer Lopez hits the stage of the Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino in Las Vegas on Saturday night, riding a makeshift No. 6 subway car and belting out that she is still Jenny from the block, she will rotate through 11 shimmering, bedazzled outfits, some layered on top of one another so that she can morph from hip-hop vixen to bedroom crooner in mere moments. The shortest costume change: 26 seconds.

title: Bias by Computer
description: To the Editor:

title: Bridgewater Hedge Fund Settles Harassment Claim That Described a Caldron of Fear
description: The worlds biggest hedge fund, Bridgewater Associates, said it had resolved a harassment claim filed against it by an employee who recently left the firm.

title: ESPN Streaming Deal Helps Disney Step Into the Future
description: Robert A. Iger, the chief executive of the Walt Disney Company, finally got back to playing offense in TV.

title: Alumni Giving at Amherst
description: To the Editor:

title: Build High-Speed Rail
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trump and the Second Amendment People
description: To the Editor:

title: A Beauty Makeover With One Tool: Your Phone
description: IN addition to being a flashlight and camera, the smartphone has another nifty feature: It is a digital mirror that can help you apply makeup.

title: A Start-Up Turns to Saffron to Help Afghanistan Regrow
description: Bomb-blasted roads, frequent blackouts, shortages of basic equipment and an untested consumer market are hardly conditions that make for natural entrepreneurial opportunities.

title: Review: In Hillbilly Elegy, a Tough Love Analysis of the Poor Who Back Trump
description: In late July, The American Conservative ran an interview with J. D. Vance that drew so much traffic it briefly crippled the central nervous system of the magazines website. The interviewers last line implored readers to have a look at Mr. Vances publishing debut, Hillbilly Elegy: A Memoir of a Family and Culture in Crisis. Ever since, his book has hovered at high altitude on Amazon, seldom dipping below No. 10.

title: In Take My Wife, Two Comics Seek the Punch Lines in Life
description: Quite a few comedians have turned their own lives into television series lately. Fortunately, that didnt discourage Rhea Butcher and Cameron Esposito from giving it a try. Their Take My Wife isnt the most polished show in the genre, but it has a D.I.Y. charm and a perspective that have long been underrepresented on the small screen.

title: U.S.-Backed Militias in Libya Claim to Retake ISIS Stronghold of Surt
description: CAIRO  Pro-government Libyan militias backed by American air power said Wednesday that they had seized the Islamic States last stronghold in the country, in the seaside city of Surt.

title: Bernard Farrelly, Surfings First World Champion, Dies at 71
description: Bernard Farrelly, a pioneering Australian surfboarder who won the sports first world championship, in 1964, died on Saturday. He was 71.

title: Earlier Date for Filing Fafsa Form for College Aid
description: As college-bound students prepare for a new school year, they should be aware of a new date thats important for future financial aid: Oct. 1.

title: Hair Meets Heirs
description: Its sort of being put into the background by little stuff like death threats against Hillary Clinton, but Im still kind of fascinated by how populist Donald Trump came out for elimination of the estate tax, which hits only a tiny number of yuuge estates. Of course, he probably doesnt know that. Still, it was clearly a sop to the GOP establishment, which considers tax-free inheritance the linchpin of the conservative movement.

title: The Divorce Diet? Losing a Spouse and Some Pounds, Too
description: Wedding season is here, and many brides and grooms will find themselves in the best shape of their lives. Through a combination of adrenaline, dieting and hard-core exercise, they will walk the aisle as slim and buff as they will most likely ever be.

title: Before Simone Biles, These Women Broke Barriers
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  When Simone Biles joyfully bounded onto the floor Sunday in the preliminary round for womens gymnastics, she did so as theoverwhelming favoriteto win the Olympic all-around gold medal and to lead the U.S. womens team to victory. So far, she has lived up to the hype, placing more than 1.5 points ahead of her closest competitor, American Aly Raisman, in the qualifying round, and leading the U.S. team to gold on Tuesday in the team competition.

title: Westfield Opens at the World Trade Center. Festivities Abound.
description: On Friday from 4 to 7 p.m., meet the designer Jonathan Simkhai at the East Hampton pop-up of Tenet, the Southampton boutique known for its cool mix of up-and-coming labels like Ellery, Lisa Marie Fernandez and Soludos. Mr. Simkhai, a CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund winner, will show pieces from his pre-fall collection, like a neon-pink bubble dress in artfully embroidered organza ($845). At 51 Newtown Lane, East Hampton, N.Y.

title: A New Way to Reach Obama: Facebook Messaging
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass.  The White House receives thousands of letters each day, but now people have another way to send notes, advice, criticism or well wishes to President Obama, officials at the White House said on Wednesday in announcing the opening of a Facebook messaging account.

title: Olympians Views on Lilly Kings Doping Spat
description: The current Olympians Dana Vollmer and Cody Miller and past winners weighed in on the doping controversy at the Rio Games that has resulted in tiffs between Lilly King and Russian swimmers who were booed.

title: How to Beat the Heat and Stay Chic
description: When youve lost hope of staying chic, consider a caftan, a sexy Brazilian swimsuit, sandals like those Jackie wore in Capri, and a straw bag that can say anything.

title: Stephen Petronio Continues Tributes to Postmodern Dance-Makers
description: The choreographer Stephen Petronios Bloodlines series, in which he revives classic works of the dance-makers who influenced him, will return for a third year, to pay homage to the postmodern masters Yvonne Rainer, Steve Paxton and Anna Halprin.

title: Can Germany Win Back the Watch Snobs?
description: These watches are made in Germany, but they are worthy competitors to the venerable Swiss brands.

title: Yusuf to Play Shows in New York on A Cats Attic Tour
description: Yusuf, the singer-songwriter best known as Cat Stevens, will play what his representatives are calling his first public shows in New York City since 1976 this fall at the Beacon Theater. The concerts, scheduled for Sept. 19 and 20, are part of a short tour called A Cats Attic, which promises a stripped-down night of songs, storytelling and good will meant to celebrate 50 years since the release of Cat Stevenss first single.

title: Grim Sleeper Serial Killer Gets Death Sentence
description: A Los Angeles man whose sporadic murders of nine young women and a teenager over a three-decade period earned him the nickname the Grim Sleeper was sentenced to death on Wednesday.

title: At the After-Party for the Premiere of Florence Foster Jenkins
description: Meryl Street, who plays a would-be opera star, managed to elude the press.

title: A Garbo-Like Meryl Streep Celebrates Her New Movie
description: And in a flash  well, several hundred flashes  she was gone.

title: Another Pool Turns Green; Chemical Imbalance Is Blamed
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The problem of the suddenly green water in the Olympic diving pool worsened Wednesday as whatever was ailing the pool migrated (albeit in a lighter shade of green) to the nearby pool used for water polo and synchronized swimming. But Olympic officials said that after extensive tests, they had finally pinpointed the reason: a chemical imbalance caused by too many people using the water.

title: Mary Chapin Carpenter Reads The Race Grows Sweeter Near Its Final Lap
description: In this episode of the Modern Love podcast, the singer and songwriter Mary Chapin Carpenter (The Things That We Are Made Of, Come On Come On) reads the essay The Race Grows Sweeter Near Its Final Lap, about the challenges  and advantages  of love that blooms later in life.

title: The Art of Preservation, in a New Food Magazine
description: Last fall, the founder and editor of the James Beard Award-winning journal Gastronomica, Darra Goldstein, was busy constructing a life without obligation. She had left her own publication after closing the Fall 2012 issue; finished producing three books (High Society Dinners: Dining in Tsarist Russia, The Oxford Companion to Sugar and Sweets and Fire and Ice: Classic Nordic Cooking); and was phasing into her 2017 retirement from Williams College, where she has been teaching since 1983 and is the Willcox and Harriet Adsit professor of Russian. But an invitation from Joe Caterini, the managing partner at Zero Point Zero Production, the media company responsible for shows like Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown and the wildly popular Mind of a Chef, got in the way.

title: Trump Tower Climber Snatched by Police as the Internet Watches
description: A lone mans climb up the side of Trump Tower became a New York City spectacle on Wednesday afternoon after thousands watched his ascent in real time on television, through social media and in person.

title: Review: SremmLife 2 by Rae Sremmurd Has Flashes in Its Darkness
description: To turn up, in Southern rap parlance, is to go over the top, to celebrate wildly, to more or less explode with vim. For the last two years, no hip-hop artists have taken this idea as a mandate more than the two brothers, Swae Lee and Slim Jxmmi, who form Rae Sremmurd.

title: JonBenet Ramsey Case to Resurface on CBS and Lifetime
description: Call it the O. J. Effect.

title: Appeals Court Prevents Voting Without ID in Wisconsin
description: A federal appeals court on Wednesday blocked a lower court from allowing voters in Wisconsin to cast ballots without photo identification, stating that the lower court had been too lenient in loosening a state voter ID law that had already been declared discriminatory.

title: Nice Tote, but Wheres My Pen?
description: An urgent bulletin (well, email) came in the other day from Madeline Weeks, the fashion director of GQ. While in Los Angeles for a shoot, Ms. Weeks had dropped into Barneys New York in Beverly Hills for some occupational reconnaissance and got a jolt when she stepped off the escalator at the third-floor shoe department only to find that it had disappeared.

title: In Brazil, Where Mens Soccer Once Was King, the Womens Game Rules
description: MANAUS, Brazil  Late Tuesday evening, as the Amazon temperature danced at 90 degrees with humidity in step, Janine van Wyk, a defender with South Africas womens soccer team, paused just a second to take in the packed and throbbing Amaznia Arena, filled with 43,000 gloriously nuts fans.

title: A Clothing Line Inspired by Skaters  and Studio 54
description: When asked whom she would like to see in her clothing, the designer Lara Pia Arrobio lists the rapper ASAP Rocky, Chlo Sevigny and most importantly her friends  people who, like Arrobio herself, have been photographers, waitresses, interns and bloggers on the way to finding their creative niche.

title: One Ally Remains Firmly Behind Donald Trump: The N.R.A.
description: Donald J. Trumps candidacy has driven away throngs of Republican elected officials, donors and policy experts. But not the National Rifle Association.

title: A Poker Game, a Missing Gun and a Mayor Divide Stockton, California
description: First, the residents of Stockton, Calif., learned that their mayor was the owner of a stolen gun linked to a homicide. Days later, he was arrested at a camp he runs for disadvantaged youths, accused of secretly recording teenagers playing strip poker, providing alcohol to minors and endangering children there a year earlier.

title: U.S. Presidential Race, Baltimore, Olympics: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Lethal Weapons for Chinese Feet, but Without a Feminist Debate
description: BEIJING  Theresa May barely had her feet under the table as Britains new prime minister when Chinese fashionistas began discussing her shoes, her gender and her power, in that order.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Why Its Not Enough Just to Be Disruptive
description: Walmarts $3.3 billion purchase of Jet.com, an online retailer, and Unilevers $1 billion acquisition of Dollar Shave Club, a company that mostly sells razor blade subscriptions online, were home runs for brilliant entrepreneurs (and, of course, their backers).

title: At the Olympics, Everyones Looking. Especially at the Men.
description: Call them the Magic Mike Olympics.

title: Brussels Airport Lifts Emergency Precautions After Bomb Scare
description: PARIS  Belgium took emergency precautions at the Brussels international airport on Wednesday evening after receiving threats that bombs were on incoming planes, but within a couple of hours the measures were lifted.

title: Syrian Swimmer Vows to Aid Fellow Refugees
description: Yusra Mardini, an 18-year-old Syrian swimmer, is one of 10 athletes who competed as part of the first refugee Olympic team. Although she didnt win a medal, her story has caught the worlds attention.

title: At the Out Hotel in New York, the Light Is Almost Out
description: It was a bright and sunny Wednesday afternoon in August, the kind that calls for a relaxing glass of ros, enjoyed at an Instagram-worthy spot at your vacation hotel.

title: Donald Trump Calls Obama Founder of ISIS and Says It Honors Him
description: SUNRISE, Fla.  A day after remarks that appeared to suggest that gun rights advocates harm Hillary Clinton, Donald J. Trump sprayed his fire at President Obama on Wednesday, accusing him of creating the Islamic State and saying the terrorist group honors him.

title: Consent Decrees, Racial Bias and Policing
description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions has announced that the Justice Department is rethinking its approach to the federal agreements, known as consent decrees, that have been reached with dozens of law enforcement agencies.

title: Obama Administration Set to Remove Barrier to Marijuana Research
description: The Obama administration is planning to remove a major roadblock to marijuana research, officials said Wednesday, potentially spurring broad scientific study of a drug that is being used to treat dozens of diseases in states across the nation despite little rigorous evidence of its effectiveness.

title: Patrice Munsel Dies at 91; Soprano Became a Star at the Met as a Teenager
description: Patrice Munsel, a coloratura soprano who as a teenager became one of the Metropolitan Operas youngest stars and later crossed over into television and musical theater, died on Aug. 4 at her home in Schroon Lake, N.Y. She was 91.

title: Teammate Lends Phelps Cap in 4x200 Relay
description: Conor Dwyer said he was proud to lend his swimming cap to Michael Phelps in the freestyle relay final, with their team going on to win gold medals.

title: Why Are Olympians Cupping?
description: The ancient healing method of cupping is being used by several Olympians in Rio de Janeiro. The technique is intended to stimulate blood flow.

title: A Light Across the Rooftops
description: Dear Diary:

title: Greek Crisis, the Book. Or Actually Several of Them.
description: In May last year, James K. Galbraith, a left-leaning American economist, sent an email to Greeces finance minister, Yanis Varoufakis, in which he argued that an exit from the eurozone would benefit Greece.

title: A Policing Culture Built on Racism in Baltimore
description: The scathing federal report this week on the reality of racist abuse by the police in Baltimore was hardly news to the African-American neighborhoods most victimized by ironhanded law enforcement. Community leaders have been complaining for years about police policies that swept up innocent black citizens beyond all bounds of constitutional justice  stopping, frisking and arresting residents without justification, then releasing them without criminal charges or so much as an apology.

title: In Baltimore Report, Justice Dept. Revives Doubts About Zero-Tolerance Policing
description: The Justice Department has criticized a string of police departments nationwide for unfairly targeting blacks, but in its report on the Baltimore police, issued Wednesday, it used its most scathing language to date to denounce the zero-tolerance policing approach that has spread from New York to many departments big and small.

title: Alex Rodriguez Gets an At-Bat. Unrelated: The Yankees Win.
description: BOSTON  Toward the end of a sometimes tense news conference on Wednesday about Alex Rodriguezs lack of playing time, Joe Girardi noted that he often is concerned about a starting pitchers health early in a game.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The dilemma for police chiefs is how do you impact crime in high crime neighborhoods without the overreach of violating the rights of people who have done nothing wrong.

title: Clutch Home Run Not Enough as Hit-Starved Mets Fall to Diamondbacks
description: Before Wednesdays game, Manager Terry Collins said the Mets needed to start getting some big hits.

title: Harassment Crisis Builds at Fox News, Despite Its Swift Response
description: When the anchor Gretchen Carlson filed a bombshell lawsuit accusing the Fox News chairman Roger Ailes of sexual harassment, Foxs corporate masters moved fast.

title: Weakened de Blasio May Be Vulnerable to 3rd-Party Bid by a Democrat
description: Maybe it was Mayor Bill de Blasios rough week at the Democratic National Convention, when he was relegated to a daytime speaking slot and upstaged by his archrival, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, and his predecessor, Michael R. Bloomberg.

title: Hack of Democrats Accounts Was Wider Than Believed, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  A Russian cyberattack that targeted Democratic politicians was bigger than it first appeared and breached the private email accounts of more than 100 party officials and groups, officials with knowledge of the case said Wednesday.

title: As Olympic Viewership Falls, NBC Thinks of the Bigger Picture
description: In the weeks before the Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, NBC officials believed that the prime-time audience for its 17-day event would match or exceed that of the London Games four years earlier. With stars like Michael Phelps, Katie Ledecky and Usain Bolt returning and a formidable United States womens gymnastics team, NBC saw Londons overall viewership of 31 million as an attainable goal.

title: Airbnb and Others Set Terms for Employees to Cash Out
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Technology start-ups have long wrestled with a conundrum of how to reward their employees. Many of their workers are compensated with lucrative piles of a start-ups stock, but cannot cash it in because the shares do not trade publicly.

title: Owners of Grand Central Drop Lawsuit, Clearing Way for a 1,401-Foot-Tall Skyscraper
description: The owners of Grand Central Terminal ended a long-running feud on Wednesday with the developer of a planned 1,401-foot-tall skyscraper across Vanderbilt Avenue on 42nd Street in Manhattan.

title: Kristin Armstrong Registers Two Cycling Firsts by Winning a Third Straight Gold
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Move over, Michael Phelps. Sort of.

title: Better to Give Than to Receive
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  One reason people resist learning to solve crosswords, I believe, is because they have a fundamental misunderstanding of what crossword puzzles are. People resistant to solving look at a crossword puzzle and assume that the main action and maximum reward come merely from reading a clue and dutifully entering in the synonymous equivalent of the answer. Or they believe that the information the puzzle contains is beyond their ken, or some combination of the two.

title: Ben McAdoo, Giants New Coach, Sets a Thumping Practice Rhythm
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The soccer balls at the end of practice were the best demonstration that this seasons Giants training camp would be unlike any other in the 91-year history of the franchise.

title: New York Citys Medical Schools Will Stop Using Unclaimed Bodies
description: The eight medical schools in New York City will no longer accept the citys unclaimed bodies as cadavers, forswearing a practice that dates back to the 19th century, the schools announced on Wednesday. And a group representing the 16 medical schools in the state is withdrawing its opposition to a recently passed bill that would end the educational use of bodies with no known survivors.

title: 2009 Emails Reveal Intersection of Clinton Family Interests
description: WASHINGTON  Douglas J. Band, a longtime aide to Bill Clinton after he left the White House, sent an email to two of Secretary of State Hillary Clintons top aides with a Very imp  message: The State Department needed to make one of its senior officials available for a conversation with a billionaire businessman  who also was a major donor to the Clinton Foundation.

title: Katie Ledecky Leads U.S. to Gold Medal in 4x200 Freestyle Relay
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Katie Ledecky-led U.S. team struck gold in the womens 4x200 freestyle relay. So what else is new? Since the event became a part of the Olympic program in 1996, the Americans have won five of the six golds.

title: Sam Esmail on Mr. Robot, His Special Guest Star and That Opening Segment
description: This interview contains spoilers for Wednesdays episode of Mr. Robot.

title: Mr. Robot Season 2, Episode 6: I Love Elliot
description: To truly appreciate how good Rami Malek is on Mr. Robot, you just might need to see him on the least Mr. Robotlike television show imaginable. Improbably, disturbingly, delightfully, thats precisely how this weeks episode of Mr. Robot begins. After vintage USA Network bumpers touting the Word Up Wednesday programming block on Americas Favorite TV Network roll, we suddenly see Mr. Maleks Elliot Alderson dropped into an 1980s family sitcom, with all the VHS picture quality and canned laughter that entails. Excised from the shows painstaking, painterly cinematography  explicitly developed to capture Mr. Maleks every facial nuance, right down to using curved lenses to accentuate his beautifully bulbous eyes  Elliot finally looks as out of place in the world as he feels.

title: Bill Maris Leaving as Chief of GV, Googles Venture Finance Arm
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Bill Maris has stepped down as chief executive of GV, the onetime venture finance arm of Google, in another prominent departure for its parent company, Alphabet.

title: Fractured Lands: How the Arab World Came Apart
description: The story of more than a decade of war, terror and revolution in the Middle East, seen through the eyes of six people whose lives were changed forever.

title: U.S. Women Stay Perfect in Olympic Field Hockey, Routing Japan
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  In case you were wondering, field hockey games are not called on account of rain. And rain is what it did on Wednesday, a slow drip that went on for a good while as the United States womens field hockey team played its third game of the Olympics.

title: Corrections: August 11, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Simone Biles in Rio and Triumphs Summer Election Special 2016
description: Simone Biles, the Final Fives not-so-secret weapon, goes for the all-around gold in womens gymnastics at the Rio Olympics. Triumph the Insult Comic Dog returns to the presidential campaign trail. And for pure summer fun, screen all of Idris Elbas Luther.

title: Green and Gold
description: The changing color of the water in two pools drew attention at the Rio Olympics, but the color of the most treasured medal was more important in athletes minds.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | slipshod
description: slipshod  \slip-shd\  adjective

title: Picture Prompt | Meteor Shower
description: This week, a meteor shower will light up the night sky with cosmic fireworks. It will be a dazzling display for skygazers across the Northern Hemisphere.

title: What Russia and Turkey Bring to Syria
description: President Vladimir Putin of Russia and President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey are major players on opposite sides of the Syrian civil war. Mr. Putin has provided the crucial military support that is keeping Syrias president, Bashar al-Assad, in power; Mr. Erdogan has helped arm opposition groups seeking Mr. Assads overthrow.

title: Helping Rape Victims After the Brock Turner Case
description: What should we do with the anger inspired by Brock Turner, the former Stanford swimmer who was sentenced to just six months in jail for sexual assault?

title: You Choose or You Lose
description: If youre a Republican politician, announcing youre not going to vote for Donald Trump is a little like declaring that youre not going to rob a bank to finance your next campaign. Really, you dont get any credit unless you say what youre going to do instead.

title: A V.P. Candidates New Job? Apologize.
description: In 2008, Sarah Palin assured Republicans backing John McCain that the only difference between a hockey mom like her and a pit bull was lipstick. In 2012, Vice President Joseph Biden Jr. warned an African-American audience that Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan were gonna put yall back in chains.

title: Obamas Worst Mistake
description: A crazed gunmans attack on an Orlando club in June, killing 49 people, resulted in blanket news coverage and national trauma.

title: Stop Killing Coyotes
description: One morning in the late 1930s, the biologist Adolph Murie stood near a game trail in Yellowstone National Park and watched a passing coyote joyously toss a sprig of sagebrush in the air with its mouth, adroitly catch it, and repeat the act every few yards. At the time, Mr. Murie was conducting a federal study intended to prove, definitively, that the coyote was the archpredator of our time. But Mr. Murie, whose work ultimately exonerated the animals, was more impressed by that sprig-tossing  proof, he believed, of the joy a wild coyote took in being alive in the world.

title: Were So Confused: The Problems With Food and Exercise Studies
description: Nearly everything you have been told about the food you eat and the exercise you do and their effects on your health should be met with a raised eyebrow.

title: Driving Tips: How You Can Help Limit Traffic Jams
description: Its summer, and more Americans are on the road. Crowded roads. So here are a few tips you may never have learned or have forgotten.

title: Driven to Suicide by an Inhuman and Unnatural Pressure to Sell
description: INDORE, India  Leaving his wife and two young children home on a recent Sunday, a 27-year-old salesman for Abbott Laboratories operations in India  in fact, one of the American health care companys top performers there  rode his motorcycle to a remote railroad track and jumped in front of a train.

title: Whiteness and Race, Between the Storms
description: Pete Mauney asks viewers to look at race relations through white eyes in order to confront unspoken privilege and the lack of diversity in their lives.

title: Australia Rejects Bids From Chinese Investors for Electricity Provider
description: HONG KONG  Citing national security concerns, the Australian government on Thursday rejected competing bids from Hong Kong and mainland Chinese groups for control of a company that supplies electricity to Sydney and neighboring areas.

title: Julian Assange to Be Questioned by Sweden Over Rape Claim, Ecuador Says
description: LONDON  Ecuador and Sweden have agreed to allow Julian Assange to be questioned by Swedish prosecutors inside the Ecuadorean Embassy in London, in a possible breakthrough to a four-year impasse, Ecuador said on Thursday, but no date for the interview was announced.

title: Is Trump Wrecking Both Parties?
description: On Aug. 7, Lee Drutman, a senior fellow at New America, a center-left Washington think tank, posted some of the findings from an Aug. 1 CNN survey on Twitter with a succinct comment:

title: O.C.D. in N.Y.C.
description: Youve seen me. I know you have.

title: An Army Veteran With a Housing Mission
description: Three years ago, Daneilia Francis settled in a brick apartment house in East Flatbush, Brooklyn. In time, the monthly rent on her one-bedroom climbed to around $1,600 from around $1,400.

title: Sausage Party Is an Animated Sex Comedy About Food ... and God
description: The first word uttered in Sausage Party is a popular synonym for excrement, which is a bit counterintuitive. In a movie about food, youd expect that to come at the end. But while the next 88 minutes supply plenty of scatology  including a blessedly discreet toilet-paper joke  this potty-mouthed movie has higher matters in mind. You will come for the kind of humor promised in the title and the well-earned R rating, but stay for the nuanced meditations on theology and faith.

title: The Senate Is in Play. Is There a Trump Effect?
description: Republican Senate seats that were considered to be tossups before Donald J. Trump became the Republican nominee may be even more vulnerable now.

title: The Millions of Americans Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton Barely Mention: The Poor
description: WASHINGTON  The United States, the wealthiest nation on Earth, also abides the deepest poverty of any developed nation, but you would not know it by listening to Hillary Clinton or Donald J. Trump, the major parties presidential nominees.

title: Article of the Day | Smoke, Fire and Human Evolution
description: Article: Smoke, Fire and Human Evolution

title: 36 Hours in Minneapolis
description: Urban edginess, cultural authenticity, not to mention spiced meatballs in lingonberry sauce: the perfect formula for a weekend away.

title: Sending Mail in Mongolia? Dissident.sloth.ploy Could Be the Address
description: If you happen to be invited to a party at the United States Embassy in Ulan Bator, Mongolia, you might address your R.S.V.P. to eyebrows.conforms.zebra. Have a care package for a student at the Institute of Finance and Economics of Mongolia? Writing during.snapper.housework on the parcel will get it there.

title: Beyond Olympic Glow, a Vicious Drug War Rages in Rio
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Fans were lining up to watch an American beach volleyball duo square off against Mexico on the alluring sands of Copacabana Beach.

title: Getting New Yorkers Into the Citys Wilderness. All 10,000 Acres of It.
description: All too often, Ebenezer Owusu does not get to relax at his neighborhood parks in the Bronx. He has to cram onto busy basketball courts and run laps around walkers and people riding bikes.

title: Golf Isnt Big in Brazil. So Rio Organizers Took Lessons From the U.S.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Last summer, a handful of Brazilian law enforcement officers traveled to Washington State on an unusual mission: to learn the etiquette and nuances of golf.

title: Whiteness and Race, Between the Storms
description: A group of photographs from the 1940s and 1950s, thought to be from an Oklahoma photo studio, show white people in a range of situations: awkward portraits, basketball teams and ballroom dancers, people at work, in church, at leisure, even a dead man in an open coffin.

title: For Migrants, an Olympic Village in Ruins
description: ELLINIKO, Greece  Until the torch was lit and world records began falling in Brazil, the poor condition of the Olympic Village in Rio de Janeiro was a favorite theme of the news media. But Rio isnt the only place with a housing problem at its Olympic sites.
