description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  In March 1954, Rafael Cancel Miranda smuggled a gun into the United States Capitol and, with three other Puerto Rican nationalists, opened fire from the visitors gallery. Five members of Congress were wounded.

title: Is Teff the New Super Grain?
description: When Laura Ingalls, an avid runner from Boston, found out after a routine blood test that she was iron-deficient, she turned to the kitchen instead of the medicine cabinet: She started eating teff.

title: Hillary Clinton Puts White House Transition Team in Place
description: PHILADELPHIA  Hillary Clintons campaign announced on Tuesday that Ken Salazar, the former interior secretary and Colorado senator, would become chairman of Mrs. Clintons transition planning team.

title: Osteoporosis, a Disease With Few Treatment Options, May Soon Have One More
description: A large clinical trial of a new osteoporosis drug found that it stimulates bone growth and prevents fractures at least as well as the only other such drug on the market. The new drug, expected to win approval from federal regulators, would offer another much-needed treatment for some of the 10 million Americans, 80 percent of them women, who have a disease that weakens bones and often leads to years of pain, disability and early death.

title: Rio Olympics Today: Simone Biles Soars to Fourth Gold Medal
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  For anyone who doubted her after a subpar performance on the balance beam, Simone Biles sent an emphatic message on Tuesday: She is unbeatable in the floor exercise.

title: U.S. Mens Basketball Teams Latest Foes See Flaws, Not Routs
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The United States mens basketball team began its summer schedule on a roll, hammering Argentina by 37 points in Las Vegas on July 22. Through four more exhibition games, its winning margins were just as garish: 49, 50, 35, 44.

title: How Do Trumps Conspiracy Theories Go Over in the Middle East? Dangerously.
description: In November 2015, a cartoon in Al-Ahram, an Egyptian state-owned newspaper, depicted an Islamic State ogre with Made in America emblazoned on his back. It wasnt unusual. A look at Middle Eastern news media shows that this idea is startlingly common. Even prominent officials in the region, from Egypts former culture minister to a former deputy prime minister of Iraq, have publicly ventured conspiracy theories that Washington created the Islamic State.

title: Linde Confirms Merger Talks With Its Rival Praxair
description: Linde of Germany confirmed on Tuesday that it was is in talks to combine with Praxair, a deal that could bring together two of the worlds largest providers of industrial-gas products.

title: Five Style Classics, Repurposed for Fall
description: Straightforward signifiers of specific eras in fashion history return anew.

title: Where Olympic Athletes Unwind in Rio: The Bin Laden Bar
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  After a long day trying to set world records, win a medal or just finish a strenuous event, even the worlds top athletes want to unwind.

title: 1891: A Dogomaniac Near Paris
description: Comtesse Potocka, a Polish lady, living at St. Cloud, has a mania for stealing dogs. She lives quite alone and the neighbors were for a long time annoyed by the noises and smells which proceeded from her dog-haunted premises. At last her neglect to pay her rent gave the police an opportunity of forcing their way into the house. In the various rooms and the garden there were found forty-one dogs, some tied to trees, others shut up in rooms. As their meals had been regulated more by the good humor of the Comtesse than by their own natural cravings, some of the animals were in a painful condition, and had to be shot.  The New York Herald, European Edition, August 17, 1891

title: 1966: Iraqi Defects to Israel
description: TEL AVIV  An Iraqi Air Force captain defected to Israel today [Aug. 16] in his Russian-built MiG-21 supersonic jet fighter. Israeli military officers here said it was the first time a MiG-21 had been deposited intact in Western hands. The 30-year-old pilot said he was a Catholic, and that religious discrimination had affected his chances for promotion. He said that he began planning his defection 18 months ago, and had decided to fly to Israel because that was the only country within flying range which would not hand him back to Iraq.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Aug. 17, 1966

title: Roger Ailes Is Advising Donald Trump Ahead of Presidential Debates
description: Roger Ailes, the former Fox News chairman ousted last month over charges of sexual harassment, is advising Donald J. Trump in preparation for the all-important presidential debates this fall.

title: Argentinas Juan Martn del Potro Receives Wild Card Into U.S. Open
description: MASON, Ohio  Juan Martn del Potro, the Argentine who recently completed an inspired run to the silver medal at the Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, was awarded a wild card into the United States Open, which begins Aug. 29.

title: Chattanoogas Innovation District Beckons to Young Entrepreneurs
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.  From Boston to Seattle, cities across the country are vying to create technology hubs, spurring real estate developments to attract start-ups and young entrepreneurs.

title: Gramercy Tavern
description: The seasonal bounty of the farmers market is the nightly star at this Flatiron classic.

title: Gramercy Tavern: A Classic Still on the Move
description: Long before it turned 22 last month, Gramercy Tavern had settled into classic status. It is a classic, but theres a downside to putting a restaurant in that category. The more familiar something is, the harder it is to see.

title: Will Gary Johnson Make the Presidential Debates?
description: The Libertarian candidate must receive at least 15 percent in polls leading up to the first debate.

title: Mark Twain Found Inspiration in Germany (Though Not German)
description: Heidelbergs only Mark Twain impersonator takes his work seriously. His eyebrows and mustache are unruly, and his long gray hair overlaps his ears. He wears a white suit that is too warm in summer and not warm enough in winter. The only obvious problem with Klaus Mombreis performance, as he leads tour groups through the city, is something Twain himself would have found amusing: He speaks not Missouri-twanged English but his native German.

title: China Launches Quantum Satellite in Bid to Pioneer Secure Communications
description: BEIJING  China launched the worlds first quantum communications satellite from the Gobi Desert early Tuesday, a major step in the countrys bid to be at the forefront of quantum research, which could lead to new, completely secure methods of transmitting information.

title: Barclays Shrinks, but Says Its Core Business Is Stronger
description: LONDON  Barclays has been a bit of a punching bag among British banks in recent years.

title: Its a Bird! No, Its a Crocodile! Synchronized Swimming Themes Can Be Mystifying
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Down in the pool, the Australian synchronized swimming duo was performing a three-minute whistle-stop tour of the animals of the outback  kookaburras, emus, centipedes  to music from Crocodile Dundee. In the stands, the American mother-daughter duo of Ruth and Emily Thunstrum was trying to figure out what, exactly, was going on.

title: Home and Work: Gabriela Hearst
description: The roots of the designers refined designs are surprisingly rugged  a working ranch on the pampas of Uruguay.

title: Gabriela Hearst at Home, in Uruguay
description: When Gabriela Hearst began dating her future husband Austin Hearst, scion of the publishing clan, they shared memories of growing up on their families ranches. Austins, of course, was San Simeon, the well-groomed coastal California spread (including the now-public Hearst Castle) where he rode the Arabians his family breeds. Gabriela recalls smiling back at him indulgently. It sounded so nice, she says, but I was thinking, No, I meant I grew up on a ranch.

title: Tech Giants Gobble Start-Ups in an Antitrust Blind Spot
description: Walmarts $3.3 billion acquisition of Jet.com can be expected to sail through antitrust review, eliciting barely a peep of objection from the federal government.

title: Sharing a Life, but Not a Worldview: Readers React to Trump-Clinton Couples
description: On Facebook, commenters share their thoughts about marriages where politics differ.

title: Inspiring Her Daughter, an Olympic Runner, Was No Sweat for a Fitness Guru
description: When Kate Grace, the top American entrant in the Olympic womens 800 meters, races on Wednesday, her first cheerleader will be her mother: Kathy Smith, a leading American aerobics instructor of the 1980s.

title: Brazil Bureau Chiefs Notebook: When the Olympics Media Circus Comes to Town
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. In this article, Simon Romero explains how his job as Brazil bureau chief has evolved to include all sorts of additional (and unlikely) roles since friends and colleagues from around the world descended on Rio de Janeiro for the Olympic Games.

title: Tim Kaine Lets Loose on the Campaign Trail, With Music, Beer and Fun
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C.  Senator Tim Kaine played the harmonica. His wife gave an impromptu clogging performance.

title: Why Donald Trumps Test for Immigrants Wont Work
description: Donald Trumps foreign-policy speech on Monday was more staid than some of his recent outings, but it didnt necessarily make any more sense. In a recent interview, Anthony Cordesman, who holds the Arleigh A. Burke Chair in Strategy at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, helped evaluate some of Mr. Trumps more unusual proposals. Mr. Cordesman, who focuses on national security and has worked on Middle Eastern issues for years, explained why an ideological test for immigrants wont work, why the United States couldnt have kept Iraqs oil and what really led to the rise of ISIS.

title: Hillary Clintons Advantage Widens in Florida, New Poll Shows
description: Hillary Clinton has opened a nine-percentage-point lead over Donald J. Trump in Florida, according to a new poll released on Tuesday that shows minority voters and women buttressing her presidential campaign.

title: In Praise of the Double Feature
description: There are times when one plus one equals three  at least at the movies. Return of the Double Feature!, a 26-day retrospective series opening on Friday at Film Forum, offers proof.

title: Pennsylvania Attorney General Quits on Heels of Perjury Conviction
description: Even by Pennsylvanias unbuttoned standards, it was a scandal of exhausting length and tawdriness, a seemingly endless parade of pornography, personal and political vendettas, smear tactics, barely veiled threats, conspiracy and cover-up. So when the states attorney general, Kathleen G. Kane, announced on Tuesday that she was resigning, one day after her conviction for perjury and conspiracy, among other charges, even her supporters might have been excused for welcoming a sense of closure.

title: Fashion, Food and Fitness Greats Give Back to Rio
description: The chef behind the worlds best restaurant, a heavyweight Brazilian designer and Nike do good by the host country of this summers Olympic Games.

title: Bus in Nepal Plunges Off Mountain
description: A bus slipped off a narrow mountain road in Nepal, killing dozens of people on Monday. Many of them were survivors from last years earthquake.

title: Brian Williams Is Said to Get MSNBC Show
description: Brian Williams is getting his own show on MSNBC  at least for a couple of months.

title: Stocking the New Native Pantry
description: You dont have to forage for these staple ingredients, indigenous to the Upper Midwest.

title: Flooding in the South Looks a Lot Like Climate Change
description: Climate change is never going to announce itself by name. But this is what we should expect it to look like.

title: New Native American Cuisine
description: An effort to revitalize native food cultures in contemporary kitchens is underway in the Midwest.

title: The Movement to Define Native American Cuisine
description: LAKE TRAVERSE INDIAN RESERVATION, N.D.  The moon was full and the chokecherries were ripe in the southeastern corner of North Dakota. Its the one smell that shoots me back to being young, said Sean Sherman, as the berries boiled under a red-veined froth.

title: Joo Havelange, Who Built and Ruled World Soccer With Firm Hand, Dies at 100
description: Joo Havelange, the Brazilian businessman who built soccer into a multibillion-dollar international enterprise over his 24 years as the autocratic head of the sports world governing body but who was later implicated in a scandal involving millions of dollars in kickbacks, died on Tuesday in Rio de Janeiro. He was 100.

title: A New Special From George Carlin  Sort Of. (Its Complicated)
description: The great stand-up comic George Carlin famously said that its the duty of the comedian to find the line and then cross it deliberately. But even he had his limits.

title: As Louisiana Floodwaters Recede, the Scope of Disaster Comes Into View
description: DENHAM SPRINGS, La.  Kathryn Morgan, 18, stood on the shore of the neighborhood, waiting for a boat and taking stock.

title: New Rules Require Heavy-Duty Trucks to Reduce Emissions by 25% Over the Next Decade
description: The Obama administration on Tuesday issued aggressive new emissions standards for heavy-duty trucks. The rules are expected to achieve better fuel efficiency and a bigger cut in pollution than the version that was first proposed last year.

title: ValueActs Bet on Morgan Stanley Bet Goes Only So Far
description: The activist investor ValueAct Capital Management has paired its new $1 billion-plus stake in Morgan Stanley with support for the banks chief executive, James P. Gorman. But ValueActs logic for investing in the Wall Street bank goes only so far.

title: Irish Fighter Accuses Amateur Boxing Body of Being Corrupt
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A boxer for Ireland accused the sports officials of corruption after losing a bout against a Russian opponent at the Rio Games on Tuesday, reviving an issue that has long troubled boxing at the Olympic level.

title: Former Goldman Sachs Trader Fined $400,000 and Barred for 2 Years
description: A former senior trader at Goldman Sachs has agreed to pay $400,000 and be barred from the securities business for at least two years for misleading customers into paying more for residential mortgage-backed bonds in the years after the financial crisis.

title: China Launches First Quantum Satellite
description: Researchers hope to beam transmissions from space to earth with quantum technology, a type of communication that could prove to be the most secure in the world.

title: An Invitation to Share Ideas: How Will You Be Teaching Election 2016?
description: As we get ready to bring you new lesson plans for a new school year, including many more resources for Election 2016, were curious: How will you be teaching about the candidates, issues and controversies in a contest that has been anything but business as usual?

title: Its Science, Not Fishing
description: The organization Ocearch and other agencies are on an expedition off Long Island, hoping to prove that its a breeding ground for great white sharks.

title: Searching for a Great White Shark, in the Waters Off Long Island
description: ABOARD THE RESEARCH SHIP THE MV OCEARCH, off Long Island  Brett McBride lined up his fishing wires in the ships tackle room, carefully ensuring that all knots were tied and all hooks were in place.

title: On Gulf Coast Flooding, The Times Is Late to the Scene
description: Updated, 3:41 p.m.

title: Anjem Choudary, Islamist Activist in Britain, Is Convicted of Supporting ISIS
description: LONDON  One of Britains best-known Islamist activists has been found guilty of inviting support for the Islamic State and could face a prison term of up to 10 years, officials announced on Tuesday.

title: Jason Sudeikis to Star in Stage Version of Dead Poets Society
description: Its the question that almost immediately followed the announcement of a stage adaptation of Dead Poets Society earlier this year: who would play the role of John Keating, the unconventional literature teacher who inspires his students at an all-boys preparatory school, and who was famously portrayed by Robin Williams in the 1989 film?

title: The Cuban-American Generation Gap
description: Last Christmas, Michael and Gisel Davila, a Cuban-American couple who live in Queens, N.Y., were talking to her mother, Maria C. Castillo, while visiting her in Miami. It was a casual conversation, full of small talk about the holidays and work and the weather, until Ms. Davila, 30, mentioned that she and her husband were thinking about booking a trip over a long weekend to Cuba.

title: Portraying Muslims as a Threat to Women, Donald Trump Echoes Us vs. Them Refrain
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trump, reiterating his call to restrict Muslim immigration to the United States, has adopted a tactic that has long been a mainstay of strongmen and sectarian provocateurs: portraying outsiders as a threat to womens safety.

title: A New Therapy for Insomnia: No More Negative Thoughts
description: Weve all heard about the power of positive thinking. But will it help me sleep?

title: Bankruptcy for Banks: A Sound Concept That Needs Fine-Tuning
description: The House of Representatives is pushing to enact a bankruptcy act for banks.

title: A Brooklyn Cocktail Bar Dedicated to One Unexpected Ingredient
description: Deep in Brooklyns artisanal hinterlands, where East Williamsburg and Bushwick converge on Scott Avenue, a new alcoholic enterprise is brewing  with a twist. Enlightenment Wines, New Yorks self-proclaimed first meadery, is a distinctly DIY undertaking that seeks to elevate the profile of honey wines beyond their knee-jerk associations with the Game of Thrones milieu. To do so, this summer its founders quietly opened a front-of-house tasting room and cocktail bar called Honeys adjoining the meadery, where visitors can sample brews like Memento Mori (drawn from foraged dandelion flowers) and Jewels Into Flowers (an apple mead made from chrysanthemum and chamomile flowers), as well as a menu of bar snacks and cocktails devised by the mixologist Arley Marks of Mission Chinese and Dimes.

title: Lenny Bruces Legacy
description: To the Editor:

title: A Plea for Civility in Politics
description: To the Editor:

title: Patient Surveys and Pain
description: To the Editor:

title: Tracking Bill McKibben
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trumps Anti-Terrorism Plans
description: To the Editor:

title: Airstrike in Yemen Kills 17 Civilians, Witnesses Say
description: CAIRO  An airstrike on a residential area near the Yemeni capital, Sana, on Tuesday killed 17 civilians, most of them women and children, as international criticism continued to build over a deadly bombing the day before of a hospital run by Doctors Without Borders.

title: PartyNextDoor Is Finding His Voice, and a Bigger Spotlight
description: After hours at the Brooklyn Museum on Friday night, hundreds of young people bopped along while a D.J. cycled through the summers hottest rap and R&B songs. As the event reached its climax, the ubiquitous opening notes of a guaranteed crowd pleaser  Work, by Rihanna, featuring Drake  vibrated through the room.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $16 MILLION

title: Samui Brings Northern Thailand to Fort Greene
description: SAMUI The chef and an owner of this Southeast Asian restaurant goes by the name A Napadol. Ms. Napadol grew up working with her grandmother, who had a restaurant in her northeastern Thailand home, and is now cooking again after careers in real estate and as a jewelry designer. The design background is evident in the fancy details of the restaurant, which occupies what was a garage with soaring brick walls and is named for a Thai resort island. Ms. Napadols interpretive menu stretches through categories like small plates, sliders, soups, noodles, curries and big plates. It touches on tradition with the inevitable papaya salad and pad Thai, but adds new ideas, not strictly Thai, including black potato fritters, crispy smelts, a mussel pancake and grilled black cod in a miso-jalapeo marinade: 15 Vanderbilt Avenue (Flushing Avenue), Fort Greene, Brooklyn, 917-909-1032, samuibrooklyn.com.

title: Broad Hints of Modern Angst at a Festival of Indian Dance
description: Practitioners of Indian classical dance are rightly proud of the ancient heritage they embody. As devoted as they are to gurus and lineage and tradition, though, they are also artists of the present, and many of them, especially the young, long to be innovative, up-to-date, relevant. Whether updating is more positive or more perilous was a live question during this years Erasing Borders Festival of Indian Dance.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Donald Trump Wants to Cut Visa Program He Used for His Own Models
description: WASHINGTON  On the campaign trail, Donald J. Trump has excoriated the nations visa program for high-skilled workers as a job killer, pledging to end it with no exceptions. But his own companies have used it to bring in hundreds of foreign workers, including fashion models for his modeling agency who need exhibit no special skills.

title: When the Pilot Is a Mom: Accommodating New Motherhood at 30,000 Feet
description: Boarding a flight can feel like stepping into a time capsule  men typically fly the plane, while most flight attendants are still women. Which is why a female pilot from Delta Air Lines did something dramatic at a union meeting recently.

title: Ethnic Kurds Find Haven, but No Home, in Insular Japan
description: KAWAGUCHI, Japan  Mahircan Yucel moved to Japan a dozen years ago as a teenager fleeing sectarian violence in Turkey. He learned Japanese, got married, had two children and grew to love his adopted homeland. But Japan has refused to accept him and could force him to leave.

title: What We Know About the Cyberattack on Democratic Politicians
description: Officials say that Russian hackers may have breached the email accounts of more than 100 officials and groups.

title: Review: The Fire This Time, Stoked by Baldwins Legacy
description: When the Mississippi-born writer Jesmyn Ward was in high school, she and five members of her class visited the office of Trent Lott, one of her states senators, in Washington.

title: David Crosby on Politics, Culture, Aging and a New Album
description: David Crosbys Croz, released in 2014, was his first solo studio album in 20 years. He didnt wait as long for a follow-up. Lighthouse, due out on Oct. 21, is a collection of new songs performed in a sparse acoustic setting, with a warm, bright light trained on his voice and guitar.

title: Finding Some Treasures at FringeNYC
description: Part of me wondered where everyone was. Late on Saturday night, at the fifth production of what would be a dozen-show dive into the New York International Fringe Festival, I had finally found something rather glorious  but the house looked more empty than not. It hardly seemed right.

title: Donald Trumps Latest Jab at Hillary Clinton: No Stamina
description: First there was low energy. Now increasingly its no stamina.

title: In Police Misconduct Lawsuits, Potent Incentives Point to a Payout
description: When lawsuits against the police are settled, like the one announced this week in which New York City agreed to pay $4 million to the family of Akai Gurley, people tend to focus on the amount of money changing hands. Sometimes overlooked are the institutional reforms embedded in the deals, and the difficult decisions made by plaintiffs and their lawyers in trading a full public airing of the facts for the recovery of damages.

title: F.B.I. Gives Congress Documents Related to Hillary Clinton E-Mail Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. on Tuesday handed over to Congress documents related to its investigation of Hillary Clintons private email server after House Republicans pushed the bureau to surrender material it had gathered before it concluded last month that she should not face criminal charges.

title: Bus of Nepal Earthquake Survivors Plunges Off a Road, Killing 27
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  The second time the overloaded bus stalled, passengers stayed put. They had already exited once to push. With the bus stuck on a one-lane mountain dirt road, its occupants stuffed inside and on the roof amid luggage and rice sacks, the driver backed up first to regain uphill momentum.

title: Louisiana, Simone Biles, U.S. Presidential Race: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: When Two Worlds Collide Portrays a Battle for the Amazon
description: During his second term as president of Peru, from 2006 to 2011, Alan Garca made deals and pushed through laws allowing for greater corporate and industrial incursions into the Amazon than the government had ever permitted. Various factions rose up to oppose his administrations actions, including Aidesep, the interethnic association for the development of the Peruvian rain forest, an organization of indigenous Amazonians led by Alberto Pizango.

title: In Water Polo, the Real Action Is Under the Water
description: The United States womens water polo team has dominated in the Rio Olympics. We asked Natalie Benson, a two-time Olympian, to tell us how players get an advantage.

title: Germans Arrest Suspected Supplier of Gun Used in Fatal Munich Rampage
description: BERLIN  The police have arrested a 31-year-old German man suspected of selling a gun and bullets to a teenager who killed nine people in a rampage last month in Munich, which sent the city into a panicky lockdown amid fears of a terrorist attack.

title: Review: Groundhog Day, All Over Again, Now With Song and Dance
description: LONDON  Who knew that dj vu could smell this fresh all over again? On paper, the happy new musical Groundhog Day, which opened on Tuesday night at the Old Vic Theater here, seemed like one of those shows that elicit instant groans of been there, done that among jaded theatergoers.

title: I Am Cait Has Been Canceled
description: Amid low ratings, I Am Cait, Es documentary series  chronicling Caitlyn Jenners life as a transgender woman, is finished after two seasons.

title: Trump, Rallying White Crowd for Police, Accuses Democrats of Exploiting Blacks
description: WEST BEND, Wis.  Forty miles north of the racially charged unrest unfolding in Milwaukee, Donald J. Trump spoke to a nearly all-white crowd here on Tuesday, accusing Hillary Clinton of complicity in violence against police officers and claiming to reject the bigotry of Democrats, who he said were responsible for the plight of many black neighborhoods.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: How the Stranger Things Soundtrack Became the Shows Secret Weapon
description: Two of the stars of Stranger Things, the 80s-inspired Netflix series, never show their faces onscreen. The show, a mixture of science fiction, fantasy and horror, has attracted attention for its use of popcorn cinema touchstones. But its score is perhaps the secret ingredient, a mixture of icy new-wave hooks, spooky ambient textures and menacing drones made by Kyle Dixon and Michael Stein, both Austin, Tex., musicians who play in a synth-driven quartet called Survive.

title: Gawker Is Said to Be Sold to Univision in a $135 Million Bid
description: Gawker Media, whose fierce independence afforded it an unsparing approach to web journalism that influenced news organizations across the internet and the wider media world, was sold to Univision at auction on Tuesday, giving the freewheeling company an outside owner for the first time since its founding 14 years ago.

title: Twins Finish Marathon Hand in Hand, but Their Country Says They Crossed a Line
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Olympics are as much about what warms the heart or initiates debate as who wins the medals. But what warms the heart or initiates debate can be a matter of perspective in a sprawling event that brings together more than 200 nations and territories.

title: Trump Casinos Tax Debt Was $30 Million. Then Christie Took Office.
description: By the time Chris Christie became governor of New Jersey, the states auditors and lawyers had been battling for several years to collect long-overdue taxes owed by the casinos founded by his friend Donald J. Trump.

title: Ford Promises Fleets of Driverless Cars Within Five Years
description: In the race to develop driverless cars, several automakers and technology companies are already testing vehicles that pilot themselves on public roads. And others have outlined plans to expand their development fleets over the next few years.

title: Yankees Drop Game to Blue Jays and Lose Pitcher Nathan Eovaldi
description: The Yankees rickety chances of making a postseason run incurred two staggering body blows on Tuesday.

title: Ronald D. Boire Steps Down as Chief of Barnes & Noble
description: Ronald D. Boire, the chief executive of Barnes & Noble, is leaving the company after a tumultuous tenure that lasted a little less than a year, the bookstore chain announced on Tuesday.

title: A Familiar Walk With Eyes Wide Open
description: Dear Diary:

title: Dilma Rousseff, Brazils Suspended President, Appeals for Reprieve
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils suspended president, Dilma Rousseff, made a last-ditch appeal to lawmakers and voters on Tuesday, promising to hold new elections should she survive an impeachment trial that is scheduled to begin next week.

title: John McLaughlin, TV Host Who Made Combat of Punditry, Dies at 89
description: John McLaughlin, a former Roman Catholic priest who became an aide to Richard M. Nixon in the White House and parlayed his fierce defense of the president into a television career as host of The McLaughlin Group, the long-running Sunday morning program of combative political punditry, died on Tuesday at his home in Washington. He was 89.

title: Bribery Arrest May Expose African Mining Rights Scandal Tied to Och-Ziff
description: The arrest of a Gabonese man on charges of bribing African officials may help pull back the curtain on a long-running foreign corruption scandal that has ensnared the giant hedge fund founded by Daniel Och.

title: Obamacare Will Survive Aetnas Retreat
description: Die-hard opponents of the 2010 health reform law, the Affordable Care Act, have often used its real and imagined problems to argue that it is fatally flawed. Now they are seizing on an announcement by Aetna that it will reduce its participation in the health insurance marketplaces set up by the law. Donald Trumps campaign  called Aetnas move the latest blow to this broken law that is slowly imploding under its regulatory red tape.

title: Marthas Vineyard Longs for a President Who R.S.V.P.s Yes
description: CHILMARK, Mass.  Wearing khakis and a button-down shirt, President Obama stepped before a crowd of donors on Monday evening on this wealthy island retreat and acknowledged that he did not have to make a hard sell for Hillary Clinton.

title: Hillary Clintons Warning to Supporters: Dont Be Complacent
description: PHILADELPHIA  Hillary Clinton does not dispute that the presidential campaign is going well for her at the moment.

title: First-Degree Murder Charge Added in Killing of Queens Imam and Aide
description: The Queens district attorneys office on Tuesday upgraded the charges against a man accused of gunning down an imam and his assistant on a sidewalk, adding a single count of first-degree murder for an attack that a prosecutor described in court as a coldblooded and premeditated assassination.

title: For U.S. Men in Triple Jump, a Gold, a Silver and a Yes
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  It was a win-win competition for the Americans in the triple-jump final: Christian Taylor got the gold and Will Claye got the girl. And while breakfast at Olympic Stadium failed to produce a world record, it supplied a buffet of ambrosial outcomes.

title: Meet Simone Biles's Family
description: Simone Biles has continued her dominance of gymnastics by winning four gold medals and a bronze at the Rio Games. We sat down with her family to discuss their Olympic journey.

title: Navajo Nation Sues E.P.A. in Poisoning of a Colorado River
description: DENVER  The Navajo Nation filed a lawsuit on Tuesday against the Environmental Protection Agency and several corporations, saying that poisoned water that flowed from a punctured Colorado mine last year disrupted hundreds of lives near a critical watershed.

title: Slowdown but No Shutdown for New York City Council in August
description: In the New York City Council, the peoples business never stops. But it does slow down.

title: Shadow Brokers Leak Raises Alarming Question: Was the N.S.A. Hacked?
description: The release on websites this week of what appears to be top-secret computer code that the National Security Agency has used to break into the networks of foreign governments and other espionage targets has caused deep concern inside American intelligence agencies, raising the question of whether Americas own elite operatives have been hacked and their methods revealed.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This didnt even happen under the shah.

title: A Defensive Stand Propels Sweden to Another Shootout Win
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Contrary to Hope Solos assertions, it takes courage and discipline to retreat into a defensive stance for 90 minutes of a soccer game and maybe 30 minutes of overtime and hope that by doing so, you can beat an opponent who has more talent.

title: Ex-Detectives New Assignment: Investigating the Science of the Brain
description: In a few weeks, Christian Saffran will turn 46, which means it is not a minute too soon for him to be starting studies this week that will lead to doctorates in both neuroscience and medicine.

title: What Sorcerers Practice
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Were used to seeing the black squares in our crossword puzzle inside the grid, but what do we do when they get together and leak into our clues?

title: Son of El Chapo Is Kidnapped at Gunpoint From a Party in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY  The abduction was notable for how and where it took place  during a birthday party at a restaurant in the Mexican Pacific Coast resort of Puerto Vallarta  and because the kidnappers and the victims are criminals.

title: Nicholas Dirks Resigns as Chancellor of University of California, Berkeley
description: The chancellor of the University of California, Berkeley, announced his resignation on Tuesday amid criticism over how he had handled sexual harassment cases involving high-profile faculty members and the universitys budget.

title: Before and After Photos of the Damage From Historic Flooding in Louisiana
description: Photographs and maps show the scale of the disaster in southern Louisiana.

title: 1999 Rape Case Swirls Around Nate Parker and His Film The Birth of a Nation
description: The Birth of a Nation, a drama about the Nat Turner slave rebellion, upended the Sundance Film Festival, selling for a record $17.5 million and instantly vaulting to front-runner of next years Oscar race.

title: On Set | Kristen Stewart
description: The actress ponders what she would do if she werent famous for a day  and owns up to one very strange habit.

title: Louisiana Flooding in Pictures
description: Severe flooding in southern Louisiana has forced thousands of people to flee and damaged about 40,000 homes.

title: A Shocker for Sweden; the Usual for Simone Biles
description: The Swedish womens soccer team upset Brazil to advance to the Olympic final, and Biles won the floor exercise to earn her fourth gymnastics gold medal.

title: Kristen Stewart, in All Black
description: The actress is on the cover of Ts Aug. 21 Womens Fashion issue in the seasons most minimal, 90s-inspired silhouettes.

title: Walsh Jennings and Ross Fall in Beach Volleyball Semifinals
description: Brazil beat the United States in the womens beach volleyball semifinals and ended the gold medal run of the three-time Olympic champion Kerri Walsh Jennings.

title: 49ers Sign Ponder to a One-Year Deal
Number of Women in Jail Has Grown Far Faster Than That of Men, Study Says
description: When Dolfinette Martin was convicted of shoplifting more than $700 worth of clothes in Louisiana in 2005, she had five children, no money and an addiction to cocaine.

title: More Head Injuries Reported for Babies in Stroller Accidents
description: An average of 50 children a day end up in hospital emergency rooms because of stroller or baby carrier accidents, and it appears far more of them are suffering brain injuries than previously believed.

title: Kristen Stewart, the Good Bad Girl
description: Its hard to not be charmed by Kristen Stewarts Los Feliz home, even harder to believe that it belongs to a movie star and not a college freshman. The basement den of her four-bedroom property, which hovers above Los Angeles  at once belonging to and separate from the hazy city below it  is a study in random: a stop sign on one wall, three metal letters  A, S and S  on another, a Batman action figure, a Winnie the Pooh-themed Pez dispenser, a Playboy pinball machine. The rooms centerpiece, an imposing bookcase, is packed with fashion tomes, a few to do with Chanel, for whom she models; monographs featuring the work of Basquiat, Eggleston and Mapplethorpe; books about food, travel and the Beatles; and novels by Dostoyevsky, Hesse and Kafka. A chunk of shelf is devoted to Jack Kerouac, whose character Marylou she played in a film version of On the Road.

title: When Fashion Becomes a Form of Protest
description: At the fall 2016 shows back in March, the fashion designer Rei Kawakubo presented a collection for her Comme des Garons label that was an ode to the 18th century. Its shapes were grandly outsize: gargantuan balloons of brocade and jacquard malforming the body, hair piled high and frizzed. Anna Cleveland, daughter of Pat, strode with her unusual gait, toes pointed outward, nose pointed upward. Eighteenth-century punk was Kawakubos stated inspiration. The 18th century was a time of change and revolution, she said. This is how I imagine punks would look, if they had lived in this century.

title: Shaking Up Italys Most Popular Museum
description: FLORENCE, Italy  Eike Schmidt, the new director of the Uffizi Gallery here and the first non-Italian to hold the job, took what seemed a logical step. In the spring, he set up loudspeakers warning visitors about scalpers and pickpockets who target tourists waiting in the perennially long lines outside Italys most-visited museum, famous for its magnificent treasures by Botticelli and Raphael.

title: Editors Note: August 17, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Southern California Fire Flared Up at 5 Acres. A Day Later, It Covered 25,000.
description: FONTANA, Calif.  The fire in Cajon Pass was first reported as a five-acre blaze along a highway 13 miles northeast of San Bernardino.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Me Before You and A Young Doctors Notebook
description: Emilia Clarke moves beyond Game of Thrones as a quirky caregiver who chooses life in the romantic weepie Me Before You. Jon Hamm and Daniel Radcliffe play the same morphine-addicted Russian in A Young Doctors Notebook. And Vice Does America visits a village in South Carolina that celebrates African culture.

title: Syndergaards Bat, and Arm, Lift the Mets
description: PHOENIX  At 6 feet 6 inches and 240 pounds, Noah Syndergaard often looks better suited for a football field than a baseball diamond. His large frame and quick arm generate the power behind his high-octane fastballs, which have been clocked as high as 102 miles per hour. His strong body also helps him at the plate.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | abstemious
description: abstemious  \ab-ste-me-s\  adjective

title: Alexander Fury: Ts New Chief Fashion Correspondent
description: Please join T in welcoming our new chief fashion correspondent, Alexander Fury.

title: Capturing the Drama in Olympic Moments
description: A conversation with Doug Mills, a New York Times staff photographer who has been covering the presidential campaign trail and is now photographing the Rio Olympics.

title: How Community Networks Stem Childhood Traumas
description: Liberals and conservatives often disagree about the causes of poverty and other social ills. Broadly speaking, liberals point the finger at structural factors and advocate for policy changes, while conservatives look to individuals and families and favor behavior changes. Clearly, both points of view have validity. But whats often overlooked is what lies between these two poles  communities and neighborhoods  and the value of focusing on this middle zone.

title: A Break in the Assange Saga
description: Ecuador and Sweden finally agreed last week that Swedish prosecutors could question Julian Assange at the Ecuadorean Embassy in London, where he has been holed up since 2012. The sooner the better.

title: America Is Complicit in the Carnage in Yemen
description: A hospital associated with Doctors Without Borders. A school. A potato chip factory. Under international law, those facilities in Yemen are not legitimate military targets. Yet all were bombed in recent days by warplanes belonging to a coalition led by Saudi Arabia, killing more than 40 civilians.

title: The Pull of Racial Patronage
description: Think of a Donald Trump voter, the kind that various studies have identified as his archetypal backer: a white man without a college education living in a region experiencing economic distress.

title: Dont Give Away Our Wildlife Refuges
description: Tucked into the fiscal relief package for Puerto Rico this spring was a provision to give away a national treasure that belongs to all Americans  3,100 acres of the Vieques National Wildlife Refuge. The proposal had nothing to do with the economic recovery of Puerto Rico. But it would have handed an important victory to extremists in Congress and state legislatures who want to grab national lands and turn them over to the states to be sold or leased.

title: Love. Labor. Lost.
description: It has not, by any measure, been a Summer of Love; more like a Summer of Anxiety, Fear and Hate. It would be facile to respond to recent events  political upheaval, mass murder, police violence and festering racism  with a call to love. But in extreme times, its worth considering: Can love (as we know it) act as a radical force rather than a distraction? Does our current idea of love need revision? Is there a new kind of love emerging in new social movements, one that works against the narrow kind of love fostered by capitalism? I discussed these and other matters with Moira Weigel, the author of Labor of Love: The Invention of Dating.  Natasha Lennard

title: Why Las Vegas Is a Great Place for Working-Class Women
description: Las Vegas  THIS summer I worked as a seasonal cocktail server, a job that came with a membership in the largest union local in Nevada, Culinary 226. In my first week on the job, I chatted with a co-worker in the elevator. I asked how long she had been working there. Twenty-eight years, she said. And I just got my dream shift last week!

title: How Can Police Do a Better Job of Recruiting Officers?
Donald Trump Appoints Media Firebrand to Run Campaign
description: Donald J. Trump named as his new campaign chief on Wednesday a conservative media provocateur whose news organization regularly attacks the Republican Party establishment, savages Hillary Clinton and encourages Mr. Trumps most pugilistic instincts.

title: Capturing the Drama in Olympic Moments
description: Doug Mills is photographing the Rio Olympics for The New York Times. He joined The Times in 2002 after working for The Associated Press and has shot almost every Olympics since the 1992 Winter Games. Based in Washington, Doug covers the White House when not photographing athletes.

title: Picture Prompt | Mysterious Doors
description: Pick one of these doors and write the first paragraph of a story about what happens when you open it.

title: Revamped Chinese History Journal Welcomes Hard-Line Writers
description: BEIJING  For most of its 25 years, the Chinese history magazine Yanhuang Chunqiu has been loved by moderate liberals and detested with equal passion by devotees of Mao Zedong, who reviled it as a refuge for heretical criticisms of the Chinese leader and the Communist Party.

title: Cross-Border Fire From Yemen Kills 7 in Saudi Arabia
description: CAIRO  Seven people were killed in Saudi Arabia when a missile fired from Yemen struck a commercial district in the city of Najran, the kingdoms official news media confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Marine Park, Brooklyn: Block Parties, Bocce and Salt Air
description: The neighborhood of Marine Park, a compact enclave in southeast Brooklyn, has a major claim to fame. It sits next to the boroughs largest park, Marine Park, which has 798 acres sweeping across salt meadows, wide lawns and remote shoreline.

title: Killed by a Stranger: A Rare Event, but a Rising Fear
description: A man stabbed to death by an intruder in his home. A motorist double-parked in front of a deli, shot dead in a case of mistaken identity. A man fatally beaten at a bus stop.

title: Davids Ankles: How Imperfections Could Bring Down the Worlds Most Perfect Statue
At Least 44 Table Tennis Players in Rio Are Chinese-Born. Six Play for China.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Ni Xialian helped the Chinese team win a gold medal at the world championships of table tennis in 1983. But even that was not enough to convince her coaches that she could forge a career alongside the best players in her country. So she left.

title: A Charming Alternative Universe of You, Your Friends and No News
description: This column is about escapist social networks, but lets start with Donald J. Trump because he seems more or less inescapable right now.

title: Stardom in India Has Its Price: Thousands of Gallons of Milk
description: In a country where movie stars are treated like gods, some actors are worshiped like deities.

title: No Matter What You Did, You Are My Son: Afghan Fighters Reunite as Family
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Around 20 guests gathered in a dusty corner of northern Afghanistan on Sunday night to break bread in celebration of a miraculous truce: the coming together of two bitter enemies who had been on opposite sides of the war.

description: WAR AND TURPENTINEBy Stefan HertmansTranslated by David McKayIllustrated. 290 pp. Pantheon Books. $26.95.

description: FLORENCE! FOSTER!! JENKINS!!!The Life of the Worlds Worst Opera SingerBy Darryl W. BullockIllustrated. 198 pp. The Overlook Press. $24.95.

title: An Easy Way to Stay Cool During Hot Weather Exercise
description: Cue your favorite heat-related tune: maybe its Buster Poindexters Hot, Hot, Hot, Coolios Too Hot or Cole Porters inevitable Too Darn Hot, because it has been almost too darn hot to exercise outside in many areas lately. You might also include the Rio Olympics theme song. It was very hot, the womens Olympic marathon champion Jemima Jelagat Sumgong of Kenya told reporters on Sunday after the 26-mile race, which featured withering temperatures in the 80s and drenching humidity.

title: California Fires, Donald Trump, Louisiana: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Univision Wins Gawker Auction
description: Is it the end of an era? The bids are in, and it looks as if Gawker has been sold to Univision, a Spanish-language network with an appetite for online offerings in English. If a bankruptcy judge approves the sale this week, Gawker will come under outside ownership.

title: New York Today: Return of the Rats
description: Updated, 10:29 a.m.

title: Donald Trump to Get First Classified Briefing in Manhattan
description: Donald J. Trump, who has again reorganized his staff in an effort to right his faltering campaign, will receive his first classified briefing on Wednesday since becoming the Republican presidential nominee, according to a person briefed on the meeting.

title: What Fueled Louisianas Deadly Flood?
description: As news media fixated on athletic achievements at the Rio Olympics, and of course remained fixated on Donald Trump, different corners of the United States were confronting weather-related hazards  includingrelentless steamy heat in the Eastanddrought-fueled wildfiresall around California, including the explosively spreading Blue Cut Fire east of Los Angeles. But nothinghas comeclose to the deadly off-the-chart deluges and flooding in southern Louisiana, which the Red Crosssays have produced the countrysworstnatural disaster since Hurricane Sandy.

title: North Koreas No. 2 Diplomat in London Defects to the South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  He enjoyed a bit of tennis at the local club. He indulged in curry at an Indian restaurant in the west London neighborhood where he lived. As the No. 2 North Korean diplomat in Britain, he chaperoned a brother of his countrys reclusive leader to an Eric Clapton concert last year.

title: How France and Monaco Inspired Francis Bacon
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco  The glamorous Mediterranean principality of Monaco is not usually viewed as a cradle of pioneering modern art. Yet in the 1940s, the painter Francis Bacon spent three productive years here, developing his best-known pictorial theme: the screaming popes, inspired by a Velzquez portrait.

title: Judge John Hodgman on What to Call a Trench Coat
description: Samantha writes: My boyfriend and I were on one of our evening walks, and we saw a man wearing a long black trench coat. I called it a Matrix coat, while my boyfriend insisted that it was a vampire hunter coat. Which is the correct cultural association to use upon seeing such a coat?

title: Letter of Recommendation: Cheddar and Sour Cream Ruffles
description: About 12 years ago, my partner and I decided to wow our friends on Thanksgiving by ordering a heritage-breed turkey from a small farmer in Pennsylvania. For weeks we watched the turkey  our turkey  on the farmers webcam, a cluster of pixels frolicking inside a chicken-wire enclosure. It was butchered and shipped overnight (the FedEx shipping cost nearly as much as the bird) and when it emerged from the oven, marinated and basted decadently in butter, the turkey tasted so unspeakably bland that much of it was left on our friends plates, camouflaged awkwardly under brussels sprouts. The feel-good narrative of our lovingly raised, hormone-antibiotic-and-G.M.O.-free certified-organic turkey became supplanted with a more ambiguous one. We felt both duped and morally abject: Not only were we out nearly $200, but our ethical gambit put an end to the birds bucolic life.

title: When a Friend Cheats Often on Her Husband, Should You Keep Quiet?
description: More than two years ago, my best friends husband discovered that she was cheating on him with her business partner. They decided to work on their marriage and go to counseling, together and separately. Ive had long conversations with my friend, and she confessed to me that she has slept with more than 10 other men while being married and even slept with an ex-boyfriend while she was engaged. She has gone to addiction support groups; however, shes still seeing and sleeping with the man she was caught cheating with, engaging in threesomes with him and sleeping with other men. She even brought him to my birthday party, where there were only a few friends celebrating (none of whom know her or her husband).

title: Pinterest Follows Rivals Into Selling Video Ads
description: Pinterest is finally taking the plunge that many other tech companies already have: It has started selling video advertising.

title: 1916: Threat of Railroad Strike
description: WASHINGTON  President Wilson, deeming the situation in connection with the threatened railroad strike to be so acute that it must needs demand prompt and decisive action to avert a national disaster, has issued a call for all railroad presidents throughout the country to meet him in conference at the White House.

title: An Ecosystem Where Start-Ups Help Other Start-Ups
description: When start-ups begin, its akin to Joseph Campbells mythical heros journey. Instead of battling hydras and gorgons alone, entrepreneurs often help each other face obstacles like entrenched markets, financing and abject fear of failure.

title: In Slovakia, a Wine Region Waiting for the Spotlight
description: Leaves on the main road on a sunny September afternoon were a sure sign that summer in Slovakia was nearly over and that the grape harvest was about to begin. But although I expected a lot of buzz around the main Tokaj village called Mala Trna, there wasnt a person in sight. Just some bees going about their business. In France and Italy, wine-producing regions like this one are full of tourists and winery owners promoting their products.

title: Australia Will Close Detention Center on Manus Island, but Still Wont Accept Asylum Seekers
description: SYDNEY, Australia  A detention center in Papua New Guinea where Australia has sent hundreds of asylum seekers will be closed, the governments of both countries said Wednesday. But neither side said when it would be shut down or what would be done with the people held there.

title: Beyond Coal: Imagining Appalachias Future
description: PIKEVILLE, Ky.  Here in the heart of central Appalachian coal country, an economic experiment is underway inside an airy renovated Coca-Cola bottling plant. Most days, Michael Harrison, a former mine electrician and buggy man who once drove trucks 700 feet underground, can be found hunched over a silver laptop, designing websites for clients like the Pikeville tourism board.

title: Rio Olympics: U.S. Basketball, Swimmers Detained, and the Womens 200
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Argentine fans were waving flags, imploring their compatriots to jump along, and singing that anyone who did not join the fun was Brazilian.

title: Auschwitz Survivors, in Their 90s, Urge Germany to Act on War Crimes Case
description: BERLIN  Nonagenarian survivors of Auschwitz, including two who recently met Pope Francis when he visited the former Nazi death camp, have asked Germanys highest court to swiftly resolve the case of a former SS soldier who was convicted of complicity in the murder of 300,000 prisoners.

title: What You Get for  $1,150,000
description: A clapboard house in Delaware, a contemporary in San Antonio and a loft in Maine

title: $1,150,000 Homes in Texas, Maine and Delaware
description: WILMINGTON, DEL.

title: Living in Marine Park, Brooklyn
description: The neighborhood, in southeast Brooklyn, is home to many families that have lived there for generations.

description: The four-bedroom home on 4.74 acres is on the market for $1.54 million.

title: House Hunting in ... New Brunswick, Canada
description: AN OCEANFRONT HOME NEAR ST. ANDREWS

title: Brooklyn Bridge Study Sizes Up Expansion
description: A seven-month engineering study will assess how much weight the Brooklyn Bridge can carry and consider options for expanding its walkway and bike lane.

title: Vietnam Changes Course and Will Allow Veterans Ceremony at Long Tan
description: SYDNEY, Australia  After an appeal by Australias prime minister, Vietnam reversed an earlier decision and will allow war veterans from Australia and New Zealand to hold a commemoration at the site of the Battle of Long Tan, one of the bloodiest battles fought by troops from the three countries, the Australian government said on Thursday.

title: Apps That Warm the Heart and Avoid Bad News
description: For many people, social media has become an icky sludgefest of inanities, trolling and adolescent behavior. So it is not all that often nowadays that you hear social media being described as a place that inspires the warm-and-fuzzies.

title: Greek Villagers Rescued Migrants. Now They Are the Ones Suffering.
description: SKALA SIKAMINIAS, Greece  Stratis Valamios revved the motor on his small white boat and steered under a thumbnail moon out of the harbor of this fishing village, perched on the northern tip of Lesbos, Greeces third-largest island.

title: 1966: Mayors Face Racial Troubles
description: CHICAGO  Troubles in the big cities across the country have put his honor the mayor on the firing line this summer. The mayor no longer can leave it to the president or the governor to solve his problems.

title: Converting Spreadsheets in Apples Numbers to Excel
description: Q. My wife and I have used Apples Numbers program to open and edit Microsoft Excel files. But how can Excel subsequently be used to open and edit the same file after its been opened in Numbers?

title: Did the Soviet Union Really End?
description: Aug. 22 is a holiday in Russia: Its Flag Day. But it ranks low in the hierarchy of holidays. There will be no parade, like there is on Victory Day. Russians will not get a day off, like they do on May Day, Russia Day, International Womens Day, Defenders of the Fatherland Day and a half-dozen other holidays. A visitor to the country would be unlikely to notice that this month Russia is marking the 25th anniversary of a historical milestone.

title: Losing Readers
description: Even by the newspaper industrys standards, readers of Australias print newspapers have been declining at an unusually rapid rate.

title: Sydney Morning Herald Faces Uncertain Print Future in Australia
description: They pushed for women to get the vote in Australias national elections. They brought down a central bank board member. And they helped convict a state official.

title: No-Recipe Recipes for Tomato Season
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Olympian Style Inspires Kids  and Some Adults
description: Maddy Wiederkehr, 11, who lives in Westchester County, has been putting her hair up in a tidy Aly Raisman-style topknot since watching the Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro.

title: No Way Around Rios Gridlock, Even for Olympic Officials
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  This is how Olympic officials expect it to work at the Summer Games: They step outside their hotel or a sports venue, and an official Olympic vehicle  usually a Nissan Versa branded with the colorful logo of the Rio Games  is waiting to take them to their next destination.

title: Flooding Compounds Pain of Tragic Summer in Baton Rouge
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  Few can appreciate the scale of devastation and loss here quite like the tow truck driver.

title: Apps That Help Take the Guesswork Out of Grilling
description: COOKING with fire is a technique dating to our prehistoric ancestors, but today it can feel high tech with the many apps that take the guesswork out of grilling.

title: A Cultural Hub Takes Form in Mlaga
description: Mlaga has long been a vacation spot for sun lovers in search of an affordable beach getaway. The metropolis of about 600,000 in southern Spain and the capital of the eponymous Andalusian province is part of the countrys tourist-heavy Costa del Sol and full of beachside resorts offering all-inclusive packages at wallet-friendly prices.

title: Tylenol in Pregnancy Tied to Behavior Problems in Children
description: Taking acetaminophen (Tylenol) during pregnancy was associated with an increased risk of behavioral problems in children, a new study has found.

title: American Swimmers Pulled Off Plane in Rio
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Two American swimmers were pulled off their flight to the United States by the Brazilian authorities and detained for several hours on Wednesday night, Olympic officials said. It was the latest indication that the police were skeptical of the swimmers claims that they had been held up at gunpoint during the Rio Games.

title: The Back-to-School Coloring Event
description: The New York Times Book Review invites children to color.

title: Turkey to Release Tens of Thousands of Prisoners to Make Room for Coup Suspects
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey said on Wednesday that it would empty its prisons of tens of thousands of criminals to make room for the wave of journalists, teachers, lawyers and judges rounded up in connection with last months failed coup.

title: Ten Things We Learned About Kristen Stewart From Her T Cover Story
description: In her cover story for Ts Aug. 21 Womens Fashion issue, the actress invited T into her L.A. home  and opened up about anxiety, her sexuality and lots more.

title: Calling Al Qaedas Bluff
description: WASHINGTON  The battle for Aleppo could be a turning point in Syrias civil war  not simply because it may prove a decisive moment in the struggle between the government and the opposition, but because the leadership of the rebel forces is at stake.

title: Mens Basketball: U.S.A. Dominates Argentina
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The United States men finally looked like the team everyone expected to see in Rio.

title: Jeremy O. Harris, a Young Actor and Playwright, Asks Big Questions
description: Age 27

title: Top Irish Olympic Executive Arrested Over Ticket Scalping Allegations
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Patrick Hickey of Ireland, Europes top Olympic official, was arrested here suddenly Wednesday morning, accused of selling tickets to the Rio Games on the black market.

title: How Periods Might Affect Womens Athletic Performance
description: When the outspoken Chinese swimmer Fu Yuanhui casually told reporters at the Olympics that she was suffering from period pain during a swimming relay, her comments raised eyebrows and lit up Twitter.

title: What Is Breitbart News?
description: The Republican presidential nominee, Donald J. Trump, has hired a top executive from Breitbart News, Stephen Bannon, as his campaigns chief executive, raising expectations that Mr. Trump will adopt the more aggressive style that the site has championed.

title: Does the U.S. Ignore Its Civilian Casualties in Iraq and Syria?
description: LONDON  In barely a generation, air power has shifted from indiscriminate to discriminating. Thanks to advances in precision guidance, American bombs and missiles now generally get to where theyre intended. But human or machine error, bad luck or faulty military math still lead to unforeseen civilian deaths. And as the United States and its allies continue their bombing campaign against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, many more noncombatants are perishing than they seem prepared to admit.

title: Laura Benanti to Make Caf Carlyle Debut
description: Fresh off a Tony-nominated performance and an  impersonation of Melania Trump that went viral, Laura Benanti will make her Caf Carlyle debut in September. Her musical revue, Tales From Soprano Isle, kicks off a Carlyle season that includes stints from Judy Collins and Christine Ebersole.

title: Not Forgotten: Whom Would You Dine With?
description: Dominique Dawes, the retired Olympic gymnast, chooses Mother Angelica, the superstar of religious broadcasting, as we revisit some of the 200,000 obituaries that have appeared in The Times.

title: Debate Flares on Chinas Use of Prisoners Organs as Experts Meet in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  An acrimonious debate over Chinas use of prisoners organs for transplant  a practice Chinese officials say has ended  has flared anew as an international transplant conference gets underway in Hong Kong, with some doctors and ethicists saying the meeting should not be held in China given the controversy.

title: From Fins Into Hands: Scientists Discover a Deep Evolutionary Link
description: To help his readers fathom evolution, Charles Darwin asked them to consider their own hands.

title: Invincible, a Comic by Robert Kirkman, Writer of The Walking Dead, to End
description: Rest in peace, Invincible (2003-2017).

title: A.N.C., Losing Its Hold on Cities, Fails to Form Coalition in Johannesburg
description: JOHANNESBURG  In a continuing shake-up of South Africas political order, the long-governing African National Congress on Wednesday appeared at risk of losing power in Johannesburg, the nations commercial capital, after failing to form a coalition government.

title: Fighting Frizz? Then You Shouldve Put a Shower Cap on It
description: Aly Walansky doesnt care how ridiculous she may look.

title: Stephen Bannon, a Rookie Campaign Chief Who Loves the Fight
description: As the American financial system collapsed in the fall of 2008, Stephen K. Bannon began to fantasize about destroying something else: the elite economic and political establishment that he believed had created the crisis.

title: Five Places to Go in Amsterdam
description: In northwestern Amsterdam, an old gasworks complex has spurred a revival of the industrial neighborhood of Westerpark. Built in the 19th century, the Westergasfabriek hasnt produced gas in decades, but its handsome red brick buildings have been repurposed to house creative projects ranging from an art house cinema to a trendsetting nightclub. Spruced-up outdoor areas host regular flea and food markets, and new bars, restaurants and shops now attract Amsterdammers from across the city. Meanwhile, the surrounding urban park beckons with its large grassy meadows, petting zoo and benches that double as art installations.

title: How Brexit Could Change Business in Britain
description: Britain has started the clock on leaving the European Union, and will be out of the bloc by March 2019. Here is how Brexit has affected business so far.

title: A Distracted-Driving Ban in New Jersey? Some Say It Threatens a Way of Life
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J.  Texting, we have all come to admit, is the enemy of road safety everywhere. Applying makeup behind the wheel: more or less universally frowned upon. Few would condone driving while reading a book, rooting around in the back seat or eating anything that involves utensils.

title: Visiting Beijing, Myanmars Aung San Suu Kyi Seeks to Mend Relations
description: BEIJING  Hillary Clinton considers her a friend. President Obama has invited her to the White House next month. But on her first visit to a major capital since becoming leader of Myanmar, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi chose a different destination: Beijing.

title: Boxing Judges and Refs Removed After Suspicious Results
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Several referees and judges have been removed from the Olympic boxing competition after officials reviewed their decisions, fueling suspicion of dubious results in some matches at the Rio Games.

title: Louisiana Residents Face the Flooding
description: Residents in southern Louisiana began to assess the damage from the severe flooding that submerged the region over the last week. Thousands have sought shelter or have had to be rescued.

title: For Freshmen, Campus Life Poses New Risks
description: The conventional wisdom after college drop-off is to wait and let your freshman reach out to you, but parents may want to rethink that advice. Growing research shows this is a high-risk time for depression, alcohol abuse and sexual assault.

title: An Obsessive Collector Whos Drawn Royalty to Brooklyn
description: Put your feet up on the coffee table, and you might knock over those pieces by Kakurezaki Ryuichi and Mori Togaku, or that vase by Matsui Kosei.

title: German Who Plotted to Bomb U.S. Targets in Europe Gets Out of Prison Early
description: A German man who trained in Pakistan with an offshoot of Al Qaeda and confessed in 2009 to plotting to bomb American targets in Germany was released from prison this week.

description: To the Editor:

title: Intel Seems to Have a Stronger Hand Than Cisco Systems
description: Intel and Cisco Systems are facing divergent futures. Intel is swallowing its pride and licensing intellectual property from its chip-making rival ARM. Cisco is planning to cut 7 percent of its workers. Intel may have the strong hand.

title: Security Briefings for Candidates
description: To the Editor:

title: Living Without the L Train
description: To the Editor:

title: A Gift of Artworks by Women for Florida Museum
description: In the early 1990s, when many galleries virtually ignored female artists, Francie Bishop Good and David Horvitz began buying art predominantly by women  work that Ms. Good, an artist herself, found inspiring for her own practice.

title: Escape to the Hamptons. Check Out the Many Pop-ups.
description: Headed out East this weekend to escape the heat like everybody and their mother? The pro surfer Quincy Davis and her mom, Paulette, will be at the Carbon38 Beach House in Bridgehampton on Thursday from noon to 3 p.m. Stop by the luxury activewear e-tailers pop-up to shop pieces perfect for catching waves, like a Vitamin A cropped rashguard ($140), and get free beach waves from Warren Tricomi stylists. At 2393 Main Street, Bridgehampton, N.Y.

title: 2015 Law School Graduates Got Fewer Jobs in Private Practice
description: Last years law school graduates landed fewer jobs in private practice than any class in the last two decades, according to the National Association for Law Placement, which tracks developments in the legal profession.

title: The Fed Is Searching for a New Framework. New Minutes Show It Doesnt Have One Yet.
description: The quandary facing the Federal Reserve this summer is the same as it was back in the spring, and winter, and last fall: By traditional guideposts like the unemployment rate, it looks as if it is time for the Fed to be raising interest rates. Yet the global economy seems to be locked in a low-growth, low-inflation world in which raising interest rates is at best unnecessary and at worst dangerous.

title: Groundhog Day Musical to Come to Broadway
description: Groundhog Day is coming to Broadway. For the first time. Again.

title: Joye Cottage
description: A lovingly restored cottage in Aiken, S.C.

title: John F. Timoney, Police Official Who Pushed Innovative Tactics to Curb Crime, Dies at 68
description: John F. Timoney, a blunt Irish-born cop who could outrun crooks and quote Yeats and who, as a ranking police official in New York, Philadelphia and Miami, plotted innovative strategies that helped reverse years of skyrocketing crime, died on Tuesday in Miami. He was 68.

title: Luck Unites a Couple for a Lifetime of Great Collaborations
description: AIKEN, S.C.  Two years ago last April, Gregory White Smith turned to Steven Naifeh, his partner in business and life, and asked, Whats next? It was a good question, though those were Mr. Smiths last words.

title: Trumps Campaign Chief
description: In August, Donald J. Trump shook up his presidential campaign for the second time in two months, hiring Stephen K. Bannon, the executive chairman of Breitbart News, as the Republican campaigns chief executive.

title: For Locals, by Locals
description: It is not uncommon to spot a farmer who supplied food to Almond also dining at the Long Island restaurant.

title: A Taste of Paris in the Hamptons
description: Is it really Wednesday? asked Candy Yasser on a recent evening as she brushed past Eric Lemonides, the tall and gregarious co-owner of Almond, in Bridgehampton. With a phone in each hand, his eyes darting from the dining room to the computer, Mr. Lemonides juggled reservations while welcoming walk-ins with his operatic laughter.

title: Sneakers for That Sprint Down the Aisle
description: Brides who once may have looked forward to walking down the aisle dressed to the nines are now bouncing down it dressed to the eights, or maybe a seven and a half (narrow).

title: Review: Ryley Walker Is Unsettled in a Chicago Way on Golden Sings
description: Not long ago it was possible to peg Ryley Walker as a pastiche agent, a fingerstyle guitarist and singer-songwriter with a taste for revivalist modes of yesteryear. His breakout 2015 album, Primrose Green, evoked the pastoral British psychedelia of the late 1960s and early 70s  Tim Buckley, John Martyn, Nick Drake  with a coy precision that probably went a little too far. From the title to the cover illustration, it sold a convenient fiction: the idea that Mr. Walker was a torchbearer, rather than a trickster.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Tituss Burgess Reads A Prince Charming for the Prom (Not Ever After, Though)
description: In this encore episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, the actor Tituss Burgess (Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, 30 Rock) reads the essay A Prince Charming for the Prom (Not Ever After, Though), about a gay student who forgoes the prom of his dreams to help his female friends realize theirs.

title: Keri Russell on Her First Emmy Nomination, for The Americans
description: In 1999, after a single season as the bountifully curled college student at the helm of WBs Felicity, Keri Russell won a Golden Globe. Seventeen years and countless hairstyles later, Ms. Russell has finally earned recognition for the strongest role of her career  an Emmy Award nomination for playing Elizabeth Jennings, the K.G.B. agent and master of disguise, on FXs The Americans. The 68th Emmy Awards will be held on Sept. 18.

title: Prosecutors Say Trump Tower Climber Wanted Publicity
description: The man who scaled Trump Tower last week told investigators he did so for the publicity, which he hoped would earn him a meeting with Donald J. Trump, Manhattan prosecutors said in court on Wednesday.

title: Where Mao Meets the Mundane: Everyday Life in a Bygone China
description: Covell Meyskens is a historian of modern China at the Naval Postgraduate School, an educational institution in California mainly aimed at active-duty military officers. He is working on a book about the Third Front, the gargantuan defense project China began in 1964 to build an industrial base in its interior, far from the more vulnerable coastal region. He also runs the photo blog Everyday Life in Maos China, a website with more than 5,000 photos and paintings depicting life in China during the first decades of Communist rule.

title: Larry Wilmore Discusses the End of The Nightly Show
description: On Monday, Comedy Central announced that it was canceling The Nightly Show With Larry Wilmore. The final episode of the 11:30 p.m. show will be on Thursday.

title: Leading the Edinburgh Fringe: Im Not Intimidated
description: EDINBURGH  A storefront on High Street  the fast-beating heart of the massive Edinburgh Festival Fringe, which this month offers over 3,200 shows  is where T-shirts, souvenirs and tickets are sold. And in the back of that shop is an office, a quiet refuge from the madness of the street, where Shona McCarthy sat the other day, talking about her new job.

title: T.J. Rivera Shows Why the Mets Called Him Up
description: PHOENIX  Long before T. J. Rivera built a reputation for hitting in the Mets minor league system, and long before he reached the majors, he was a baseball-loving kid growing up in the Throgs Neck section of the Bronx. When he was not on the diamond, Rivera could often be found in the street, smashing tennis balls with a bat or playing whiffle ball with friends.

title: Four Polished Men's Creepers for Fall
description: The classic  and just a little bit punk  mens shoe returns this season.

title: Broadways Dirty Secret: How an Artisan Turns Costumes From Riches to Rags
description: The nicest thing you can say to Hochi Asiatico is that his work looks like hell.

title: Review: Sixty Recounts a 61st Year, Complete With Humor, Rue and Hemorrhoid
description: In 1950 the psychoanalyst Erik Erikson proposed that we tender, fallible humans pass through eight stages of development, each defined by a different conflict. The final stage: Ego Integrity Versus Despair.

title: Arthur Hiller, Love Story Director and Box-Office Magnet, Dies at 92
description: Arthur Hiller, an Academy Award-nominated director whose long career began in live television and flourished in the movies in the 1970s with crowd-pleasers like the phenomenally successful Love Story, died on Wednesday in Los Angeles. He was 92.

title: Review: Eccentricity and Offbeat Humor by BalletX
description: Ballet tends to be the most orthodox of the art forms, and often the most reactionary. How heartening to renew acquaintance with the uninhibited and adult eccentricity that BalletX, a company devoted to new choreography, seems to encourage. This Philadelphia company, appearing this week in a program of three works at the Joyce Theater, also has vividly appealing, highly individual dancers. Its easy to miss how meticulous they are in style  but impossible not to recognize their richness and immediacy.

title: John Legend Performs at Westfield World Trade Center Opening
description: Joined by Gayle King and other V.I.P.s, the singer celebrates the new luxury mall next to ground zero.

title: John Legend Performs at Westfield World Trade Center Opening
description: At the World Trade Center Transportation Hub, a glossy ode to spending was in full display on Tuesday, as shoppers spent the day celebrating the grand opening of Westfield World Trade Center, and V.I.P. guests ended the night with a dinner of caprese salads and pan-seared halibut at Eatalys downtown outpost.

title: Rookies Continue Hot Hitting for Yanks, but C.C. Sabathia Falters in a Loss
description: Managers are often careful when handling their organizations prized prospects and try to avoid putting too much pressure on them upon their arrival, even when a team is ushering in a core of young talent and shifting away from relying on aging veterans.

title: Why Blacks Loathe Trump
description: So now Donald Trump is campaigning for the black vote. (Long, awkward pause.)

title: Louisiana, U.S. Presidential Race, Ryan Lochte: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Phil Collins Is Very Much Alive
description: The return of Phil Collins has been extraordinarily slow. Thats on purpose.

title: Who Says Romance Is Dead?
description: A sense of decadent romance permeated the fall runways. Heres how to get the look for everyday.

title: Fighting for the Soul of France, More Towns Ban a Bathing Suit: The Burkini
description: PARIS  The debate is now so heated in France that one could be forgiven for assuming that the burkini  the full-body bathing suit worn by some Muslim women  had invaded French beaches. Five towns have banned them. Three more are in the process of doing so. Prime Minister Manuel Valls supported the prohibitions on Wednesday, calling the garment part of the enslavement of women.

title: I Took Some Advice From Donald Trumps New Campaign Manager
description: Kellyanne Conway was supposed to help Donald Trump appeal to women.

title: New York Police Certain They Caught Imams Killer; Motive Still a Mystery
