description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The last hope for Cameroon to win a 2016 Olympic medal arrived in the wrestling arena on Thursday night in the stern and determined form of Annabel Laure Ali, a 31-year-old who would vie for a bronze in the womens freestyle competition. Gladiatorial rock music blasted from loudspeakers as Ali walked to the mat a few feet behind her opponent, Ekaterina Bukina of Russia.

title: More of Kremlins Opponents Are Ending Up Dead
description: MOSCOW  From a certain perspective, certainly the Kremlins, Vladimir Kara-Murzas behavior in Washington could be seen as treasonous, a brazen betrayal of his homeland.

title: Poverty, Drought and Felled Trees Imperil Malawi Water Supply
description: DZALANYAMA FOREST RESERVE, Malawi  Out of desperation, soldiers were dispatched to the national forest here last year to defend the capital, Lilongwe, less than 30 miles away. Their mission was not to save it from an invading force, but to keep water flowing to its taps.

title: Ryan Lochtes Evolving Story Faced Little Resistance From NBC
description: NBC, the exclusive television home of the Olympics, became the exclusive repository of the Olympic swimmer Ryan Lochtes dubious tale of a gunpoint robbery in Rio de Janeiro last Sunday morning. At once sensational, then debunked, Lochtes terrifying yarn resurrected memories of Notre Dame linebacker Manti Teos strange story three years ago about a dead girlfriend, one that Deadspin exposed as a hoax.

title: Conquering the Freshman Fear of Failure
description: Although its been a long time, I vividly recall my reaction when I learned that I had been admitted to Amherst College: The admissions office must have made a terrible mistake.

title: Want an All-Access Pass to the Rio Olympics? Being Royalty Helps.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  His Royal Highness Tunku Imran of Malaysia was sitting in the media center at the badminton arena recently, holding his Olympic credential with both hands. To untrained eyes, it looked like little more than a piece of laminated paper. But the princes eyes are anything but untrained.

title: Donald Trump Focuses on Immigration in His First Ad of General Election
description: After months of ceding the airwaves to Hillary Clinton, Donald J. Trump has returned to broadcast advertising, with his first general election ad of the 2016 campaign. The spot focuses on a familiar issue, the one that has set the tone for his campaign: illegal immigration.

title: Affluent and Black, and Still Trapped by Segregation
description: MILWAUKEE  Their daughter was sick and they needed family around to help care for her, so JoAnne and Maanaan Sabir took an unexpected detour.

title: An Olympic Wrap-Up Show That Doesnt Quite Translate
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  At 12:30 a.m. every day since the start of the Olympics, a cable channel called SporTV has broadcast a wrap-up show with some very familiar American faces.

title: Milwaukees Divide Runs Right Through Me
description: In Milwaukee, I lived two lives. On the East Side was the liberal Catholic school I attended for nine years; on the North Side was everything else.

title: This Land Is My Land (And Yours, Too!)
description: NOT to boast, but that image is me enjoying a pristine alpine lake I own in the California Sierras. Its property so valuable that Bill Gates could never buy it. Yet its mine.

title: Olympic Hosts Who Arent Invited
description: Not everyone gets to go to the Olympics in Rio. For those who live in the favelas, the stadiums are a distant next-door neighbor. They can nearly reach out and touch the action, but they feel unwelcome to attend.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: A Yellow Fever Epidemic Made Worse by a Vaccine Shortage
description: As Zika was moving north from Brazil to the United States, a different mosquito-borne disease  yellow fever  was cutting a devastating trail through Angola and the Democratic Republic of Congo, killing more than 400 people and sickening thousands. This epidemic is not yet over, and, like Ebola in West Africa, it has exposed glaring weaknesses in how the world confronts infectious diseases.

title: I Criticized the Olympics. That Doesnt Make Me a Traitor.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  I thought of beginning this column by praising Brazils friendly and open-minded people, the natural beauty of our landscape and the supreme delight that are Globo biscuits. But perhaps sarcasm isnt the best response to those who blame me for writing only bad things about my country, ruining the image of our beloved land of samba and caipirinhas.

title: A Rare Agreement on Climate Rules
description: With most of President Obamas efforts to combat climate change tied up in litigation, it is heartening, if not downright astonishing, to see an industry targeted by an aggressive rule to reduce greenhouse gases welcoming that rule. It is also heartening to be able to provide proof to a reflexively hostile Congress  whose members yap incessantly about job-killing regulations and executive overreach  that regulators and industry can, in fact, produce a mutually acceptable result.

title: The Virtues of Reality
description: SINCE the 1990s, weve seen two broad social changes that few observers would have expected to happen together.

title: Zika: The Millennials S.T.D.?
description: I am a millennial; half my peers are single and on Tinder, half are getting ready to start families. Im also a scientist, working toward a masters degree in bioethics. And I am more and more worried about Zika.

title: How Can America Recover From Donald Trump?
description: Donald Trump is heading to November like a certain zeppelin heading to New Jersey, in a darkening sky that crackles with electricity. He is fighting crosswinds and trying new tacks  hiring the head of Breitbart News to run his campaign, trying on a new emotion (regret) in a speech on Thursday night, promising to talk more this week about immigration, his prime subject. Theres still no telling what will happen when the gasbag reaches the mooring.

title: An Open Letter From Mr. Trump
description: To Whom It May Concern:

title: My Parents Mixed Messages on the Holocaust
description: My childhood was privileged and fortunate. My mother was a court stenographer in criminal court, and my father was a professor of sociology at Syracuse University, who had written his doctoral thesis on British colonialism in Kenya. My parents divorced when I was young. But they each happily remarried, and in any case, when I was growing up in Syracuse in the 1970s and 80s, it was the kids of non-divorced parents who were weird. I was on the cross-country team, the math team. And my mother and my father survived the Holocaust.

title: Why Values Voters Value Donald Trump
description: As the number of Republican politicians and conservative pundits who renounce Donald J. Trump continues to rise, one important contingent remains steadfast in its support: conservative white evangelicals.

title: Dismissal of Rio Boxing Judges Robed in Secrecy
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The International Boxing Federation has tried to calm the furor over several controversial bouts last week by tossing out a handful of their judges and reassigning an executive in charge of supervising them.

title: Donald Trump Takes Aim
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  The Second Amendment people have tremendous power because they are so united. So said Donald J. Trump in North Carolina on Aug. 9, in an interview that followed controversial comments hed made earlier that day. Warning his audience of the danger of Hillary Clintons choosing new Supreme Court justices, he seemed to suggest that gun rights activists could take action to stop her.

title: Can the States Save American Democracy?
description: WASHINGTON  In this tumultuous election year, little attention has focused on the groundswell of support for political reform across grass-roots America. Beyond Bernie Sanderss call for a political revolution, a broad array of state-level citizen movements are pressing for reforms against Citizens United, gerrymandering and campaign megadonors to give average voters more voice, make elections more competitive, and ease gridlock in Congress.

title: Think Its Hot Now? Just Wait
description: July wasnt just hot  it was the hottest month ever recorded, according to NASA. And this year is likely to be the hottest year on record.

title: Night Tube, a First for London, Brings All-Night Service to Two Subway Lines
description: LONDON  The London Underground, the worlds oldest subway system, opened a new chapter in its storied history on Friday night and Saturday morning: For the first time, trains on two lines kept operating all night.

title: A Natural Cure for Lyme Disease
description: Every year, at least 30,000 people  and possibly 10 times that  are infected with the bacterium that causes Lyme disease, most in the Northeast and upper Midwest. Symptoms can include fatigue, joint pain, memory problems and even temporary paralysis. In a small minority of cases, the malaise can persist for many months.

title: Handwriting Just Doesnt Matter
description: I thought politicians had enough to fight over. Apparently not: Legislatures around the country are now debating the future of cursive penmanship.

title: Who Wants to Marry an Emperor?
description: Tokyo  A parasite who lives off taxpayers money. That was how my father disparaged the emperor of Japan. Back then, our emperor was Hirohito and my fathers antipathy toward him was typical of Japanese intellectuals. I grew up thinking that the sooner the emperor was thrown out into the street, the better.

title: Facebook Live: Too Much, Too Soon
description: ITS been just over four months since The New York Times started producing live video for Facebook, but already the scoreboard is flashing. A few earned gold medals. Several others finished strong. And a lot should never have made the team.

title: At the Olympics, the Thrill of Victory, the Agony of Defeat and the Lure of the Dance Floor
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  It was 1:30 a.m. Saturday, and Mathieu Peisson, a French water polo player, had just come through the security gates at Club France  the same Olympic gathering spot where Ryan Lochte had started a night that became a diplomatic incident.

title: U.S. Policy in Syria: Are We Doing Enough?
description: Should the United States be doing more to end the civil war, as Nicholas Kristof urges?

title: Dominique Perrault
description: Dominique Perrault is a French architect respected for his minimalist sensibility and projects that comfortably meld environment, culture and utility. He is perhaps best known for an expansion of the National Library of France and the newly completed extension to the  Pavillon Dufour at the Palace of Versailles.

title: Its Children Against Federal Lawyers in Immigration Court
description: TUCSON  After a long, scary trek through three countries to escape the gang violence in El Salvador, a 15-year-old boy found himself scared again a few months back, this time in a federal immigration court here. There was an immigration judge in front of him and a federal prosecutor to his right. But there was no one helping him understand the charges against him.

title: Foundation Ties Bedevil Hillary Clintons Presidential Campaign
description: The kingdom of Saudi Arabia donated more than $10 million. Through a foundation, so did the son-in-law of a former Ukrainian president whose government was widely criticized for corruption and the murder of journalists. A Lebanese-Nigerian developer with vast business interests contributed as much as $5 million.

title: The Beat, and the Bug Spray, Go On in South Beach Despite Zika Threat
description: MIAMI BEACH  Michal Keren David stood alone amid the confectionery swirl that draws millions to the adult playground of South Beach, clutching not a minty mojito or even a ubiquitous cellphone, but one of the very latest symbols of life here: mosquito repellent.

title: After a Gold Medal at the Rio Olympics, Disney World? Maybe Not. Perhaps Parades. Definitely Fries.
description: Its become a sports clich that when an athlete or a team wins a championship, the default response to Whats next? is Im going to Disney World! But thats old news for Olympic medalists. Michael Phelps did that way back when he had only eight gold medals, after Beijing in 2008.

title: For Seattle Mariners, Patience Plus Promise Could Equal Playoffs
description: Jerry Dipoto was a rookie executive in 2001, the last time the Seattle Mariners reached the playoffs. Dipoto had just finished his pitching career, and his work for the Colorado Rockies kept him from visiting Safeco Field, which drew more than 3.5 million fans that season as the Mariners rolled to 116 victories.

title: An Unusual Quarterback Vacancy, and Unlikely Candidates, for the Denver Broncos
description: ENGLEWOOD, Colo.  In a parallel universe, Trevor Siemian would be working in commercial real estate, and he thinks hed be pretty good at it, too. A torn knee ligament two years ago ended his football career at Northwestern, fostering a week or so of existential angst.

title: Steve Johnson Reaches a U.S. Apex, With a Bronze Medal in Tow
description: MASON, Ohio  Amid full-throated chants of U-S-A! around the grandstand at the Western & Southern Open on Thursday, Steve Johnson did what he does best: He ran around a backhand to slug a forehand return to beat ninth-ranked Jo-Wilfried Tsonga.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: What Is TPP? Behind the Trade Deal That Died
description: On his first full workday in office, President Trump delivered on a campaign promise by abandoning the enormous trade deal that had became a flashpoint in American politics.

title: Excerpt from Playing God
description: The New York Times and Radiolab collaborated on this four part look at the thorny ethics of medical triage. Here, ordinary Marylanders decide life and death over coffee. Listen to the full podcast on iTunes and elsewhere.

title: Trying for Less Carbon
description: To the Editor:

title: The Rising Cost of Insurance
Brazil Gets an Ounce of Revenge on Germany
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  An Olympic gold medal in soccer for Brazil will not undo the embarrassment of the 2014 World Cup. Perhaps nothing will. But Saturday provided a dramatic recovery, a tense rekindling of joy where before there was national shame.

title: China Helps Aung San Suu Kyi With Peace Talks in Myanmar
description: BEIJING  As Myanmars leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, met this past week with Chinese officials during her five-day visit here, China helped arrange a gift for her back home, a reminder that it wants to make itself Myanmars new best friend.

title: U.S. Breezes to 6th Straight Gold Medal in Womens Basketball
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The United States womens basketball team completed another impeccable journey through the Olympics on Saturday, winning its sixth straight gold medal and not letting a single opponent stay close over the course of four quarters.

title: Wonder-ful!
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  As we continue Jeff Chen Week, a celebration that I totally made up but which should be a real thing, we also welcome Kathy Matheson, a relatively new constructor who makes her New York Times crossword debut today.

title: Crowds Cheer a New Governing Council in Yemen
description: Thousands gathered in Sana, the capital, to celebrate the formation of a new coalition governing body and to denounce airstrikes by a Saudi-led coalition.

title: History of Corruption Charges Dogs Brazils Gold Medal Soccer Run
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazil became the most decorated nation in Olympic soccer last week, winning its eighth medal Saturday and its first gold when the mens team defeated Germany in a shootout.

title: Gerina Pillers Quest for a Medal in Womens Golf Ends in Tears
description: Gerina Pillers tear ducts sprang a leak on the 18th green when she tapped in for a par after missing her fourth birdie attempt in four holes. She cried as she left the green and cried as she left the scoring area.

title: Shakur Stevenson Wins Silver in Boxing, but Defeat Leaves Him in Tears
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The light flyweight Nico Hernandez left the arena with a bronze medal last Sunday, giving the American mens boxing team its first Olympic medal in eight years. On Saturday, his teammate Shakur Stevenson, a bantamweight, took silver after losing a split decision to the favored Robeisy Ramirez of Cuba.

title: Matt Centrowitz Wins First Gold in 1,500 Meters for U.S. Since 1908
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  With all its success in track and field over the years, the United States always seemed incapable of winning one marquee event: the mens 1,500 meters  the so-called Metric Mile.

title: Mo Farah Lands a Double-Double, Winning Gold in 5,000
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  There were no missteps this time  no falls, no stumbles, no alarming moments of insecurity.

title: Mets Bats Heat Up in Victory Over Giants
description: SAN FRANCISCO  At this point of the baseball calendar, when the weeks left in the season can be counted nearly on one hand, the Mets still have much to prove. There were encouraging signs on Saturday in a 9-5 victory over the San Francisco Giants.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Captains of industry and lawyers are not dying left, right and center like this in the West.

title: Paralyzed Afghan, His Family Ripped Apart, Bears Pain of Perpetual War
description: LASHKAR GAH, Afghanistan  Long before the mortar shell landed, killing half of Ezzatullah Khans immediate family, their lives had turned into a cruel and extended race with death.

title: Condemnation of Charter Schools Exposes a Rift Over Black Students
description: With charter schools educating as many as half the students in some American cities, they have been championed as a lifeline for poor black children stuck in failing traditional public schools.

title: From the Slowest Swim to the Fastest Bike, Gold Medal Racing Speeds on the Same Scale
description: The speeds of dozens of races across Olympic sports.

title: Frank Ocean Finally Delivers His Album, and a Pop-Up Surprise
description: After a yearslong wait, compounded by additional delays and release-date feints, the much-heralded, often inscrutable R&B singer Frank Ocean managed to deliver more than one new album.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,366 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Eliud Kipchoge of Kenya Wins Marathon; Galen Rupp Takes Bronze
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The favorite Eliud Kipchoge of Kenya won the Olympic marathon on Sunday, drawing away over the final four miles to win in 2 hours 8 minutes 44 seconds.

title: Rounding the Bend in Rio
description: Trudging on land and sea, Olympians shared their lumps, bumps and glory along the way.

title: Samantha Greenblatt, Scott Lexton
description: Samantha Lauren Greenblatt, a daughter of Lisa K. Greenblatt and Jeffrey N. Greenblatt of New York, was married Aug. 20 to Scott Randall Lexton, the son of Cheryl O. Lexton and Michael L. Lexton of New York. Rabbi Peter Rubinstein officiated at the Metropolitan Club in New York, with assistance from Rabbi Joshua Davidson.

title: Melissa Duren, Sean Conner
description: Melissa Ann Duren, a daughter of Annie Duren and Michael A. Duren of Danbury, Conn., was married Aug. 19 to Sean Hanif Conner, the son of Elizabeth Z. Conner and Steven J. Conner of Manhattan. Josh Wand, a friend of the couple, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at the Liberty Warehouse, an event space in Brooklyn.

title: Erica Holland, Alex Orquiza
description: Dr. Erica Holland, a daughter of Mary J. Holland and John Holland of Lexington, Mass., was married Aug. 20 to Alex Orquiza Jr., the son of Dr. Asuncion P. Disini Orquiza and Dr. Ren S. Orquiza of San Jose, Calif. Shiri B. Sandler, a friend of the couple, who received temporary permission from Massachusetts, officiated at the Pozen Center for Interrelated Media at the Massachusetts College of Art and Design in Boston. Vanessa Orquiza, a sister of the groom, who also received temporary permission from Massachusetts, assisted in leading the ceremony, which incorporated both Filipino and Jewish cultural traditions.

title: Aline Markarian, James DerHagopian
description: Aline Kristy Markarian, a daughter of Vesna J. Markarian and Alex P. Markarian of Cliffside Park, N.J., was married Aug. 20 to James Jacob DerHagopian, a son of Susan S. DerHagopian and Gary DerHagopian of Mount Laurel, N.J. The Very Rev. Mamigon Kiledjian, the dean of St. Vartan Armenian Cathedral in New York, performed the ceremony there, with Archbishop Khajag Barsamian, the primate of the Eastern Diocese of the Armenian Church in North America.

title: Andrea Taylor, James Lindsay
description: Andrea Kristen Taylor, a daughter of Coralyn A. AndresTaylor and Peter J. Taylor of Los Angeles, was married Aug. 20 to James Pitchlyn Lindsay, a son of Teresa E. Lindsay and Robert D. Lindsay of Locust Valley, N.Y. The Rev. Nathaniel Katz, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at All Saints Church in Beverly Hills, Calif.

title: Bridget Deiters, Matthew Ince
description: Bridget Kathleen Deiters and Matthew Geoffrey Ince were married Aug. 20 at the St. James Chapel in Chicago. James Deiters, a Roman Catholic deacon and an uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: Nicole Blumenkehl, Andrew Ligon
description: Nicole Jean Blumenkehl, the daughter of Andrea Blumenkehl and Charles Blumenkehl of Montville, N.J., was married Aug. 20 to Andrew David Ligon, the son of Ellen B. Ligon of Jacksonville, Fla., and Bruce F. Ligon of Richmond, Va. Rabbi Arthur Starr officiated at the Pierre hotel in New York.

title: Vivien Gay, Loretta Redd
description: Vivien Ann Gay and Loretta Redd are to be married Aug. 21 at the Kunde Family Winery in Kenwood, Calif. Patrick ONeill, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate.

title: Leslie Schuster, Daniel Stolper
description: Leslie Erin Schuster, the daughter of Ellen R. Schuster and Mark L. Schuster of Calabasas, Calif., is to be married Aug. 21 to Daniel Aaron Stolper, the son of Lauren B. Stolper and Edward M. Stolper of Pasadena, Calif. Rabbi Stewart L. Vogel is to officiate at the Bel-Air Bay Club in Pacific Palisades, Calif.

title: Sarah Norman, Thomas Jamison
description: Sarah Townsley Norman and Thomas Mead Jamison were married Aug. 20 at the Berry Hill Mansion in Frankfort, Ky. The Rev. Dr. Bunny Alexander, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Michael Miklovic, Tomas Griebling
description: Michael Albert Miklovic and Dr. Tomas Lindor Griebling were married Aug. 20 at the Bar Harbor Inn and Spa in Bar Harbor, Me. The Rev. Victor C. Stanley, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated.

title: Danielle Kennedy, Markus Fischer
description: Danielle Colleen Kennedy, the daughter of David F. Kennedy of East Syracuse, N.Y., and the late Dr. Zella M. Small, was married Aug. 20 to Markus Georg Fischer, a son of Nadia Fischer and Jrgen Fischer of Dubai, United Arab Emirates. The Rev. Janet M. Shortall, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated at the Inns of Aurora in Aurora, N.Y.

title: Christy Esposito, Benjamin Leess
description: Christy Ann Esposito, a daughter of JoAnn Esposito of Huntington, N.Y., and the late Joseph M. Esposito Jr., was married Aug. 20 to Benjamin Ehren Leess, a son of Lynelle S. Leess and Jonathan M. Leess of San Francisco. Rabbi Michael Ehrlich officiated at the Carltun, an event space in East Meadow, N.Y.

title: Alexis Zimberg, David Lerner
description: Alexis Monique Zimberg, a daughter of Debra P. Fixler of White Lake, Mich., and Steven M. Zimberg of Huntington Woods, Mich., is to be married Aug. 21 to David Jerome Lerner, a son of Sandra J. Gutman of Southfield, Mich., and Larry B. Lerner of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. Rabbi Daniel Nevins is to officiate at the Masonic Temple Theater in Detroit.

title: Alexis Fields, Brian Mapel
description: Alexis Ingrid Fields and Brian Frank Mapel were married Aug. 20 at the Lawrence Hall of Science in Berkeley, Calif. Leonard Sucsy, the grooms godfather and a minister of American Marriage Ministries, officiated.

title: Lindsay Sher, Mark Frenkel
description: Dr. Lindsay Gail Sher, the daughter of Marcy D. Sher and Dr. William H. Sher of Setauket, N.Y., was married Aug. 20 to Dr. Mark Benjamin Frenkel, a son of Patty Frenkel and Dale P. Frenkel of Huntington Woods, Mich. Rabbi Alan C. Stein officiated at the Garden City Hotel in Garden City, N.Y.

title: Ellen Freedman, Ethan Baron
description: Ellen Colleen Freedman and Ethan Robert Baron were married Aug. 20 at the College of Physicians of Philadelphia, a museum and event space. The Rev. Heather M. Wenrick, an Episcopal priest, officiated.

title: Michelle Behrens, Geoffrey Brown
description: Michelle Hicks Behrens and Geoffrey Mackay Brown were married Aug. 20. The Rev. Dr. Don Ashburn performed the ceremony at Calvary Presbyterian Church in San Francisco.

title: Erica Bland, Matthew Lear
description: Erica Grodd Bland and Matthew Robert Lear were married Aug. 20. Rabbi Lisa Rubin officiated at Park Avenue Summer, a restaurant in New York.

title: Julie Mond, Aaron Himelman
description: Julie Elyssa Mond, a daughter of Nancy E. Mond and Mitchell Mond of East Brunswick, N.J. is to be married Aug. 21 to Aaron Tyler Himelman, the son of Mindy Himelman and David B. Himelman of East Brunswick, N.J. Rabbi Joshua Finkelstein is to officiate at the Wilshire Grand Hotel in West Orange, N.J.

title: Latoya Herring, Marcus Williams
description: Latoya Dee Herring, a daughter of Maria I. Escoto of Perris, Calif., and Larry D. Herring of Moreno Valley, Calif., was married Aug. 20 in Santa Barbara, Calif., to Marcus Jordan Williams, the son of Terilyn R. Williams and Larry J. Williams of South Orange, N.J. The ceremony, at the Unitarian Society of Santa Barbara, was led by Alex Torpey, a former mayor of South Orange and a childhood friend of the groom, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion.

title: Elizabeth Denniston, Seth Palmer
description: Elizabeth Foley Denniston, a daughter of Kathleen Foley Denniston and Brackett B. Denniston III of Duxbury, Mass., was married Aug. 20 to Seth Doren Palmer, a son of Nancy Feingold-Palmer and Dr. Allen Palmer of Newton Highlands, Mass. Ronnie Abrams, a judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, officiated at the Adirondack Camp on Lake George in Putnam Station, N.Y.

title: Geraldine Prasuhn, Harker Rhodes
description: Geraldine Kim Prasuhn and Charles Harker Rhodes IV were married Aug. 20. The Rev. D. Andrew Olivo performed the ceremony at St. Johns Episcopal Church in Washington, where he is an assistant rector.

title: Annabelle Caufman, Maximilian Moehlmann
description: Annabelle Caufman, the daughter of Jane Seskis Soudavar of New York and Olivier Caufman of Paris, was married Aug. 20 to Maximilian Christopher Moehlmann, the son of Priscilla Rattazzi Whittle of New York and Claus C. Moehlmann of London. Paul Rickenbach, the mayor of East Hampton, N.Y., officiated there at the home of the grooms mother and stepfather, Christopher Whittle.

title: Corrections: August 21, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Fear the Walking Dead and the Olympics
description: Did you miss zombies on TV? Welcome back Fear the Walking Dead, which returns to AMC with the recap talk show Talking Dead. If you prefer less grisly fare, Whit Stillmans droll Jane Austen adaptation, Love & Friendship, is streaming on iTunes.

title: Luis Cessa, Like Fellow Call-Up Chad Green, Proves Sound Choice for Yankees
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  The first time Chad Green met Luis Cessa, it was shortly after they had been traded together to the Yankees. They were at the teams facility in Tampa undergoing physicals when they ran across each other. They exchanged hellos.

title: Syrias Horrors Visit Turkey Again as Bomber Attacks Kurdish Wedding
description: ISTANBUL  The wedding on Saturday night was winding down, and some guests had already left. But the music was still playing and people were still dancing in the narrow streets of Gaziantep, a city not far from the Syrian border.

title: Homes That Sold for $900,000 or More
description: 15 East 26th Street, Flatiron district

title: Zika, Olympics, U.S. Presidential Race: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: One Photo of a Syrian Child Caught the Worlds Attention. These 7 Went Unnoticed.
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Omran Daqneesh, a small Syrian boy from the embattled rebel-held section of Aleppo, somehow snapped to attention millions of people around the world, who watched and shared the arresting video of him as he wiped dried blood and thick soot from his face.

title: 1966: Ex-Editor Gets Life Sentence in Cairo
description: CAIRO, Egypt  A former newspaper editor was sentenced to life at hard labor yesterday [Aug. 21] for passing military and other information to a foreign country the United States. Mustafa Amin, 51, former editor of the Cairo daily Al-Akhbar, reiterated his innocence when the sentence, approved by President Gamal Abdel Nasser, was handed down more than seven months after the Supreme State Security Court trial. He was acquitted of passing on defense secrets.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Kim Severson is filling in for Sam Sifton, who emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: A Once-Declining British Resort Town Sees New Life, Post-Brexit
description: BLACKPOOL, England  Blackpools coat of arms highlights the motto Progress.

title: 1916: Thieves Mistaken for Film Actors
description: DETROIT, Michigan  While half-a-dozen burly firemen and fully 500 other men looked on, five unmasked men armed with rifles and revolvers held up an automobile of the Burroughs Adding Machine Company here this afternoon [Aug. 21] and took $37,000 in cash. Then they escaped in an automobile.

title: Donald Trump, a Rigged Election and the Politics of Race
description: As he seeks to revive his embattled candidacy, Donald J. Trump has seized on a new argument to rally his supporters and to explain away a possible defeat in November: that Democrats are preparing to exploit weak voter identification laws to win a stolen election through fraudulent voting.

title: English Village Becomes Climate Leader by Quietly Cleaning Up Its Own Patch
description: ASHTON HAYES, England  This small village of about 1,000 people looks like any other nestled in the countryside.

title: For Some Athletes, Olympic Rings Give Way to the Circus Ring
description: After competing in trampoline at the 2000 Olympics, Lee Brearley of Britain went on to performing double flips on stage in a zoot suit, and tumbles in full zombie attire. He staggered around like a drunk in one scene and sported a sarong in the next.

title: U.S. Dominates Serbia in Gold Medal Basketball Game
description: The United States got its first gold of the Rio Games from a teenager who wasnt expected to medal and its last from the mens basketball team, an All-Star collection of N.B.A. players who came into the Olympics as the overwhelming favorite.

title: Mongolian Wrestling Coaches Undress at Rio in Public Protest
description: Two Mongolian wrestling coaches stripped off their clothing Sunday in front of judges, athletes and fans  one all the way down his underwear  to protest the result of a bronze medal match at the Rio Games.

title: Criminal Justice Reforms Stall in a Liberal Capital: New York
description: Utah, a state where even regular beer is considered too intoxicating, has made possession of heroin or cocaine a misdemeanor rather than a felony. Mississippi has reduced its prison population by 15 percent with new legislation.

title: Ben-Hur Is Latest Flop for Paramount
description: LOS ANGELES  During new pressure on Viacom to turn around Paramount Pictures, the studio misfired again over the weekend: Ben-Hur, which cost Paramount and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer about $100 million to make, not including marketing expenses, arrived to a disastrous $11.4 million in domestic ticket sales.

title: Suicide Bombing Kills at Least 20 in Somalia
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A suicide bomb rocked the Somali town of Galkayo on Sunday, killing at least 20 people and showing that Islamist militants, despite recent setbacks, can still plan and execute deadly attacks anywhere in the country.

title: New York Theater Ballet to Open Fall Season With a Work Inspired by Danspace
description: The New York Theater Ballet will open the coming season with a world premiere by the former New York City Ballet dancer Antonia Franceschi. Set to original music by Claire van Kampen, the currently untitled piece is inspired by the 40-year history of the Danspace Project.

title: Iraq Executes Dozens for 2014 Massacre by ISIS
description: BAGHDAD  Hatam Kareem received the telephone call on Sunday that he had been waiting for, saying the men who killed his brother had been executed by hanging.

title: How to Link Rio Games Top Stories: Just Add Water
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Now that the Rio Olympics are finally over, you can imagine how the organizers of these Games might celebrate.

title: The Power of Gold
description: In 2012, the Brazilian judoka Rafaela Silva was a medal favorite, but she was disqualified. At the Rio Games, she sought to show that her humble background could not squelch her dreams.

title: Highlights From the Rio Olympics Closing Ceremony
description: New York Times reporters and photographers covered the closing ceremony for the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

title: At Mostly Mozart, a Self-Effacing Magnetism
description: A perfect table, a cabinetmaker once told me, isnt one that draws attention to itself: It just makes the rest of the room feel right. A similar thought came to me at David Geffen Hall on Saturday during an exquisite performance of Mozarts Mass in C minor at the Mostly Mozart Festival when the soprano Jolle Harvey began to sing.

title: The Art of Rivalry Dissects Four Jostling Pairs of Artists
description: A famous portrait of Francis Bacon brazenly stolen off a museum wall. Manet stabbing through an image of his wife painted for him by Degas. Lucian Freud declining a wedding invitation because he found himself in the unusual position of having been involved sexually not only with the bride but also the groom and the grooms mother.

title: Queens Woman Is Charged With Strangling 9-Year-Old Stepdaughter
description: In the packed apartment complex in Queens, the woman saw Shamdai Arjun, whose family shares a ground-floor apartment with hers, leaving on Friday evening. Ms. Arjun took her two young grandchildren with her and rode off with a man in a white car.

title: Heng on the Philippines President and His War on Drugs
description: More than 800 people have been killed since the May election of Rodrigo Duterte, who has repeatedly called for killing drug dealers and users.

title: Woman Is Killed by a Stray Bullet at a Harlem Playground
description: A 61-year-old woman was killed on Saturday night after she was struck by a stray bullet at a playground near her home in Manhattan, where she had been playing dominoes and cards with her friends, the police said on Sunday.

title: Kirsten Dunst, on Her Emmy Nomination and Life After Fargo
description: As a child actor turned Hollywood star, Kirsten Dunst has done her share of soul-searching. So to play Peggy Blumquist, a beautician on the road to self-actualization who veers off course after committing a hit-and-run in FXs Fargo, she turned inward.

title: How Matt Centrowitz Won a Historic 1,500 Meters
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  When Matt Centrowitz crossed the finish line of the Olympic 1,500 meters on Saturday night, becoming the first American to win the metric mile since 1908, the look on his face was one of disbelief.

title: Review: Three Ballets at City Center Honor Two Impresarios
description: Ardani Artists, an institution run by the husband and wife Sergei and Gaiane Danilian and presenting ballet dancers and companies internationally, is enjoying a protracted silver jubilee. Ardani 25 was celebrated in Moscow in 2014, in London in July 2015, and then on Friday and Saturday nights at City Center Theater in New York. London seems to have got the right age; Ardani was founded in 1990.

title: Gord Downie, Frontman for the Tragically Hip, in His Final Act
description: In an unparalleled moment of national pride laced with sorrow, Canada stopped for a few hours on Saturday night to venerate the Tragically Hip, the band that for many has come closest to defining that countrys cultural identity.

title: Frank Ocean Ends His Long Silence With a Variety of Works
description: In this time of relentlessness and ubiquity, there is no art more potent, or shocking, than the art of disappearance. Silence may not be Frank Oceans greatest gift, but its one the R&B singer has wielded effectively for most of the four years since his last album, Channel Orange. The reactions to his evaporation from public life have been most intriguing to watch  his denial has been seen as a necessary balm against the scrutiny of fame, and then, after a while, a sort of insult, and finally, in the run-up to his just-released projects, a possible sign of failure on the horizon.

title: Influential Sorts
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Weve seen a lot of people make their New York Times Crossword debuts, but I wonder how many of those constructors took up this endeavor in their fourth year of medical school. Talk about taxing ones brain.

title: Rio Olympics Medals
description: The United States finished the 2016 Rio Olympics atop the medals standings with 121 medals.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Aug. 22
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Rent-to-Own Homes
description: A new breed of landlord is blurring the line between renter and homeowner, but these firms claim theyre bringing homeownership to those who cant get mortgages.

title: Consulting the Rent-to-Buy Crystal Ball
description: When reporters visited a major player in the rent-to-buy market, they found intense efforts at corporate polish. It was a strong contrast with the complaints leveled by hopeful homeowners.

title: Rent-to-Own Homes: A Win-Win for Landlords, a Risk for Struggling Tenants
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Alex Szkaradek is a landlord who seems to have the best of both worlds.

title: Looking to Gain Ground, Yankees Offense Sputters
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  When Gary Sanchez took a walk with one out in the eighth inning, he trotted to first base, where he joined on the basepaths Jacoby Ellsbury, who was stationed at second. They represented the tying and go-ahead runs with the cleanup and No. 5 hitters coming up.

title: To Crack Down on Securities Fraud, States Reward Whistle-Blowers
description: In the aftermath of the financial crisis, a growing army of confidential informants  better known as whistle-blowers  has helped federal securities regulators identify and prosecute wrongdoers.

title: The Debate Over Taxes That Isnt Happening
description: Imagine if Donald J. Trump hadnt turned the presidential campaign into an argument over who founded the Islamic State or whether there should be ideological entrance tests for foreign visitors and immigrants. Then he and Hillary Clinton could have a debate over taxes, a serious topic on which they have clear differences.

title: Ethiopian Marathoners Protest Puts Him at Odds With His Government
description: As Feyisa Lilesa of Ethiopia crossed the finish line in his silver-medal marathon run at the Rio Olympics on Sunday, he raised his arms and crossed them in an X, a gesture of protest against his countrys government that he said could get him killed if he returned home.

title: For Donald Trumps Family, an Immigrants Tale With 2 Beginnings
description: In the middle of the night, Friedrich Trump left his house in Kallstadt, a small town spotted with vineyards and a Lutheran church, for a northern port city that served as Germanys gateway to America.

title: Lessons From Rio, as Live Events Make the Leap to Streaming
description: IN THIS ERA of cord-cutting and streaming services, there has remained one constant for television networks and advertisers looking to draw a crowd: live events.

title: Obama Readies One Last Push for Trans-Pacific Partnership
description: WASHINGTON  His successor, whether Democrat or Republican, opposes it, as does most of his party. Delegates at the Democratic National Convention waved signs saying T.P.P. slashed by a bold line, while the Republican Party platform opposed any vote on it in Congress this year.

title: After Olympics, Rio Is Altered if Not Reborn
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  There have been cost overruns and complaints about spending billions on a mega-event when teachers have gone unpaid. Critics say upscale areas have been favored at the expense of slum dwellers. A pledge to clean up Rio de Janeiros polluted bay went unfulfilled, while the promise of law and order now feels like a cruel taunt in the face of rising crime.

title: D.A. Henderson, Doctor Who Helped End Smallpox Scourge, Dies at 87
description: Dr. Donald A. Henderson, a leader of one of mankinds greatest public health triumphs, the eradication of smallpox, died on Friday in Towson, Md. He was 87.

title: Terry Collins Dwells Only on the Job, Not on Job Security
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Away from the noise of a sputtering season, Mets Manager Terry Collins finds his solace in exercise. Collins, at 67 the oldest manager in the major leagues, arrived at AT&T Park five hours before Saturdays game against the San Francisco Giants to jog on the treadmill.

title: Dj Vu at the World Trade Center
description: Dear Diary:

title: As Homeless Find Refuge in Forests, Anger Is Palpable in Nearby Towns
description: NEDERLAND, Colo.  Gerald Babbitt lives in these woods, in a pop-up trailer on cinder blocks that he bought for $250. His toilet is a bucket, and when he and his wife need to refill their water jugs, they drive their creaky green Jeep a mile down the mountain and into town. Most people are kind, but the other day someone called them homeless vagrant beggars, Mr. Babbitt said.

title: Hewlett-Packard to Share Financial Report as Janet Yellen Addresses Symposium
description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead:

title: New York City Wages War on the Zika Virus
description: It was well after midnight on a hot and sticky weeknight in Washington Heights in Upper Manhattan when the hunt got underway.

title: Bay Area Start-Ups Find Low-Cost Outposts in Arizona
description: PHOENIX  Three years ago, Kate Rogers was caught in the Bay Area struggle. She paid the astronomical rents. She did the crushing commute. She lived the frustration of always thinking about money even though she was a well-paid professional in the booming technology industry.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: In this area, we live in a ring of fire. We live in a place where mothers are weeping for their dead children just hours after crying tears of joy at a wedding.

title: U.S. Basketball: The Dreamy Enough Team
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Perhaps the world is a touch further behind the United States in basketball than we realized.

title: Angelique Kerber Loses Match and Her Bid for the No. 1 Ranking
description: MASON, Ohio  On a day of possible regime change, only smaller breakthroughs were achieved.

title: Sean Hannity Turns Adviser in the Service of Donald Trump
description: During major inflection points in Donald J. Trumps campaign, the advisers, family members and friends who make up his kitchen cabinet burn up their email accounts and phone lines gaming out how to get his candidacy on track (and what counsel he might go along with).

title: Donald Trump, With Bare-Bones Campaign, Relies on G.O.P. for Vital Tasks
description: Donald J. Trump is leaning heavily on Republican Party organizations to provide crucial campaign functions like getting out the vote, digital outreach and fund-raising, at a time when some leading Republicans have called for party officials to cut off Mr. Trump and focus instead on maintaining control of Congress.

title: Like a Furnace: New Yorkers Sweat It Out as Reports of Hot Subway Cars Rise
description: In the sweaty days of August, when stifling subway platforms become almost unbearable, riders are even more anxious than usual for their trains to arrive so they can cool off inside.

title: Connie Crothers, Jazz Pianist, Composer and Instructor, Dies at 75
description: Connie Crothers, a jazz pianist who carried the mantle of her famous mentor, Lennie Tristano, but built her own identity as an inventive composer, improviser and instructor, died on Aug. 13 in Manhattan. She was 75.

title: Youve Reached Baggage Claim, but Why Hasnt Your Luggage?
description: Your plane reached its destination along with your checked bags.

title: Chip Technology Keeps Checked Luggage in Check
description: On a recent Southwest Airlines flight from Baltimore, Shvilla Rasheem arrived in Indianapolis, but her luggage did not.

title: The Night Of Season 1, Episode 7: A Test of Faith
description: In the classic 1955 Douglas Sirk melodrama All That Heaven Allows, the grown children of an affluent widow, along with her high-society friends, share the tacit expectation that she will remain a widow for the rest of her life. When she falls in love with a gardener many years her junior, these outside forces conspire to tear their relationship asunder. As a Christmas gift, the widows son gives her a television set, despite her earlier insistence that she had no interesting in owning one. Sirk frames her reflection in the TV like its a prison, confining her to a retirement of docile complacency while denying her the vibrant passion outside its borders.

title: Fear the Walking Dead Season 2, Episode 8: The Zombie Code
description: When last we saw our group, their hard won respite at the Abigail compound had ended in literal flames, and families were split apart.

title: Whose Lives Should Be Saved? Researchers Ask the Public
description: BALTIMORE  In a church basement in a poor East Baltimore neighborhood, a Johns Hopkins doctor enlisted residents to help answer one of the most fraught questions in public health: When a surge of patients  from a disaster, disease outbreak or terrorist attack  overwhelms hospitals, how should you ration care? Whose lives should be saved first?

title: Concerns Over Rule Banning Sex Offenders From Playing Pokmon Go
description: The list that most sex offenders must sign in order to be granted parole in New York State includes many stipulations, all written in the first person. There are promises to register with local law enforcement, to complete therapy if it is required and to not pick up hitchhikers or visit schools or playgrounds.

title: Ex-Cuomo Aide Is Among 5 Dead in Long Island Car Crash
description: Five people were killed and six were injured on Sunday when a car traveling east on the Long Island Expressway crossed a median, went airborne and struck two other cars, the Suffolk County police said. Among the dead was a former aide to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo who had recently worked as an aide to the county executive, Steve Bellone.

title: As Games End, Rio Celebrates While Looking Warily to Future
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The skies opened on Sunday night over Maracan, the stadium where Brazil bade farewell to the Rio Olympics with a spectacle celebrating everything from the giants of Brazilian music to the rock art drawn by tribesmen thousands of years ago, as if the heavens were lamenting the end of the 17-day sports extravaganza.

title: Brazilian Men Put Exclamation Point on Rio Games With Volleyball Gold
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The final day of the Rio Games was a gloomy mix of clouds and rain, but it was something else entirely inside the Maracanzinho volleyball arena.

title: A Different Kind of Curse
description: Dear Diary:

title: Syndergaard Helps Mets Shut Out Giants as Cespedes Homers Again
description: SAN FRANCISCO  At the initial contact with the ball, it did not appear that the Mets Yoenis Cespedes would launch a long home run. His arms were extended, and his back hand was barely clinging to the bat. But the ball was low in the strike zone, which, for an avid golfer like Cespedes, was in his sweet spot.

title: Dont Call Them Tricks
description: Acts in the Coney Island Circus Sideshow in Brooklyn include a sword swallower, a fire eater and a yo-yo master.

title: Restoring a Churchs Pinnacle
description: Workers repairing the outside of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church in New York are also reconstructing its cross.

title: Dressing Up, and Stripping Down, as Games End
description: An angry protest by disrobing coaches was just a small part of the fireworks on the final day of the 2016 Summer Olympics, which also featured the mens marathon and the mens basketball final.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Law & Order and James Bond
description: The 17th season of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit, with its gnarly plots ripped from the headlines, arrives on Netflix for your binge-watching pleasure. And Skyfall, one of the best James Bond films in recent years (do we have Adele to thank?), is on Syfy.

title: No Corrections: August 22, 2016
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | chalice
description: chalice  \cha-ls\  noun

title: Should You Charge Your Phone Overnight?
description: Chances are, you plug in your phone before you go to bed at night, thinking its best to greet the morning with a fully charged device.

title: Fighting Hatred With Rock
description: Syd Sheltons photos capture the rise of the Rock Against Racism campaign  with glimpses of bands like The Clash, Matumbi and Sham 69  that arose in 1970s Britain.

title: Is the Campaign to Kill Coyotes Justified?
description: To the Editor:

title: In Honduras, U.S. Aid Contributes to the Violence
description: To the Editor:

title: Trumps Hollow Regrets
description: Donald Trump is the candidate who is so rigid in his perverted self-righteousness that he doesnt like to have to ask for forgiveness. He says he has never even sought forgiveness from God, the divine author and inspiration of his favorite book, from which he struggled to name a favorite verse.

title: First Step in Shutting Private Prisons
description: The Justice Department instructed the Bureau of Prisons on Thursday to start phasing out the use of private detention facilities, a watershed step that should be the beginning of the end of an industry that has had an insidious effect on the American justice system.

title: John Kasich: 20 Years After Reform, Welfare Is Still Broken
description: Columbus, Ohio  TWO decades ago, Republicans and Democrats in Congress came together to make historic changes to our nations welfare program, working to strike the right balance between helping people in need while setting standards for personal responsibility. Twenty years ago today, President Bill Clinton signed their bill into law, famously declaring, Today, we are ending welfare as we know it.

title: Dodging Accountability at the United Nations
description: It shouldnt have taken five years and a scathing report by an internal human rights watchdog for the United Nations to acknowledge that it bears responsibility for the cholera epidemic in Haiti sparked by its peacekeepers deployed after the 2010 earthquake.

title: Altruism and College Admissions
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Hillary Clinton Might Win Georgia
description: Atlanta  Recent polls show something that has caught even the most optimistic liberals by surprise: Hillary Clinton is tied with Donald J. Trump in Georgia, catching up with him in South Carolina and generally showing strength in traditionally Republican parts of the South. It seems like the Democratic dream come true  demographic changes are turning Southern states purple.

title: The Water Next Time
description: A disaster area is no place for political theater. The governor of flood-ravaged Louisiana asked President Obama to postpone a personal visit while relief efforts were still underway. (Meanwhile, by all accounts, the substantive federal response has been infinitely superior to the Bush administrations response to Katrina.) He made the same request to Donald Trump, declaring, reasonably, that while aid would be welcome, a visit for the sake of a photo op would not.

title: Governor Hobbles Voting Reform in Illinois
description: Invoking Republicans phantom fear of voter fraud, Gov. Bruce Rauner has vetoed a bipartisan measure to make Illinois a pioneer in one of the truly innovative reforms of modern politics  the automatic registration of citizens as they conduct routine business at motor vehicle departments and other state agencies.

title: Hospitals That Feel Like Hotels
A Morning Surprise for Japan: Shinzo Abe as Super Mario
description: TOKYO  Everyone knew that Shinzo Abe, the prime minister of Japan, was headed to Rio to represent the country that will host the 2020 Summer Olympics. But viewers who tuned into the broadcast of Rios closing ceremony on Monday morning Japan time were surprised to see their normally sober leader pop out of an oversize green drainpipe dressed as Super Mario, the star of the popular Nintendo video game series.

title: The Radical British Musicians Who Fought Racism With Rock
description: In the mid-1970s, alarmed by the rapid rise of a neo-fascist political party that was embracing white supremacism, a radical coalition of socially engaged artists and leftist activists emerged in Britain. Infused by the international counterculture of the 1960s and with close tiesto the Socialist Workers Party, this group sought to fight fascism through music.

title: Picture Prompt | National Pride
description: These photos show fans at the Rio Olympics dressed up to represent the countries they come from. You can see them in a larger size here.

title: Extremist Pleads Guilty in Hague Court to Destroying Cultural Sites in Timbuktu
description: PARIS  An Islamic extremist pleaded guilty on Monday at the International Criminal Court to destroying shrines and damaging a mosque in the ancient city of Timbuktu, Mali, in the courts first prosecution of the destruction of cultural heritage as a war crime.

title: The Life-Changing Magic of Choosing the Right Hospital
description: Theres an exceedingly simple way to get better health care: Choose a better hospital. A recent study shows that many patients have already done so, driving up the market shares of higher-quality hospitals.

title: Supreme Court to Consider Legal Standard Drawn From Of Mice and Men
description: WASHINGTON  In 2002, the Supreme Court barred the execution of the intellectually disabled. But it gave states a lot of leeway to decide just who was, in the language of the day, mentally retarded.

title: The Song in the Heart of Many Chinese Comes From Insects
description: Mosquitoes. Flies. Cockroaches. The bugs that thrive in the heat of summer vex Chinese urban dwellers just as they do in most of the world.

title: After Shake-Up by Trump, Clinton Camp Keeps Wary Eye on Conspiracy Theories
description: It took just a few hours, after Donald J. Trump announced a major staff shake-up last week, for Hillary Clintons campaign team to settle on a new buzzword.

title: Ukrainian-Americans, Long Fond of the G.O.P., Greet Donald Trump With Despair
description: PARMA, Ohio  As a proud Ukrainian-American, Taras Szmagala has worked for decades to elect Republicans, the party he associates with freedom. He ran an ethnic outreach program for Richard M. Nixons 1972 campaign and advised President George Bush as the Soviet Union crumbled, when Ukraine became an independent nation.

title: Restoring a Cross High Above Manhattan, Stone by Stone
description: The great Celtic cross of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church, which usually soars 286 feet nearer my God than thee, was lashed to the scaffolding that encloses the churchs brownstone spire. It was so hard to make out among the metal struts that I didnt recognize it at first.

title: Article of the Day | Crossing Income Boundaries But Not Geographic Ones
description: Article: Affluent and Black, and Still Trapped by Segregation

title: Reflections From Rio
description: Two weeks ago, Pita Taufatofua gained a sudden, if fleeting, international fame.

title: U.S. Regulator Signs Off on ChemChina-Syngenta Deal
description: LONDON  The state-owned China National Chemical Corporation said on Monday that it had received clearance from a regulator in the United States for its $43 billion acquisition of Syngenta, a giant in farm chemicals and seeds.

title: How to Raise a Mensch
description: MAMALEH KNOWS BESTWhat Jewish Mothers Do to Raise Successful, Creative, Empathetic, Independent ChildrenBy Marjorie Ingall245 pp. Harmony Books. $25.

title: Overselling A.D.H.D.: A New Book Exposes Big Pharmas Role
description: ADHD NATIONChildren, Doctors, Big Pharma, and the Making of an American EpidemicBy Alan SchwarzIllustrated. 338 pp. Scribner. $28.

title: Turkey, Rio Olympics, the Tragically Hip: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Pop Arts Undersung Hero
description: Tom Wesselmann was too sexy for museums and feminists. Now hes influencing a new generation of figurative artists.

title: The Most Famous Pop Artist You Dont Know
description: The New York art world of the 60s can seem impossibly small to us now, almost sitcom-size. Everybody knew everybody, drinking and arguing and exchanging ideas in their now anachronistic suits and ties: Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein and James Rosenquist, Robert Indiana and Claes Oldenburg and a guy named Tom Wesselmann, the most famous artist that you dont know.

title: Morning Agenda: Tenants Struggle in Win-Win Contracts for Landlords
description: If you pay rent to a property management company with the aim of eventually owning the place, are you a renter or a homeowner? Some companies are blurring that line.

title: Trump Said to Begin Preparation for First Debate Against Clinton
description: Donald J. Trump prides himself on his debate performances in the Republican primaries, and he has often boasted about his lack of serious preparation for them.

title: With the Olympics Over, Six Former Host Cities Worth Visiting
description: Now that the Rio Olympics are over, inevitable questions about the citys post-Games legacy have surfaced.

title: The Cost of Holding On
description: Lets start with a story from Jon Muths book Zen Shorts:

title: New York Today: Sideshow School
description: Updated, 9:18 a.m.

title: My Daughter the Pole
description: The British vote to leave the European Union has had many consequences, among them a plunge in sterling, sagging business confidence, an identity crisis in Britains two main political parties, confusion and uncertainty. One of its less-known results is that my daughter Adele is now contemplating becoming a Pole.

title: 1966: Surging Popularity for Kennedy
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  Sen. Robert F. Kennedys rise in political appeal with the American people over the last several months has been spectacular. Last November, the Gallup Poll reported that Sen. Kennedy, D., N.Y., posed a threat to Hubert H. Humphrey for renomination as vice-president in 1968.

title: 50 Years of Electoral College Maps: How the U.S. Turned Red and Blue
description: The beginnings of the blue-red regional alignment in todays American politics can be traced to 1964, when Republicans broke through in the South after almost 100 years of Democratic domination.

title: Excerpt of 634 Minutes Inside a Volcano
description: Fifteen musicians gathered at the base of an active volcanic crater on an island in the Aegean Sea to perform an improvised composition.

title: Toots Thielemans, Who Won Jazz Renown With the Harmonica, Dies at 94
description: Toots Thielemans, one of the only musicians to have a successful career as a jazz harmonica player, died on Monday in Brussels. He was 94.

title: Not Forgotten: Hero, Criminal or Both: Huey P. Newton Pushed Black Americans to Fight Back
description: Huey P. Newton, who helped found the Black Panthers, unapologetically argued that black Americans needed to patrol their neighborhoods.

title: Can Leicester Do It Again?
description: Leicester, England  If you ever wonder why English soccer is so popular around the world, despite its lack of recent international success, you should come to Leicester City F.C.s training ground and meet the teams manager, Claudio Ranieri.

title: Pfizer to Buy Cancer Drug Maker in $14 Billion Deal
description: Medivation, which makes the big-selling drug Xtandi to treat prostate cancer, has finally found its buyer in a fellow American drug maker, Pfizer.

title: The Underused HPV Vaccine
description: Youd think that when parents are told of a vaccine that could prevent future cancers in their children, theyd leap at the chance to protect them. Alas, that is hardly the case for a vaccine that prevents infections with cancer-causing human papillomavirus, or HPV. The vaccine, best given at age 11 to 12, is currently the most underutilized immunization available for children.

title: Are You a Muslim Woman in Europe? Share Your Thoughts on Veil Restrictions
description: As full-body bathing suits become a new source of division in France, and Germany considers restrictions on Muslim veiling, we are looking for voices from Muslims in Europe who have lived with these issues.

title: A Year Without Merl
description: SPECIAL POST  Exactly one year ago, the puzzle worlds heart collectively broke when Merl Reagle died unexpectedly at the age of 65.

title: Exit the Dragon? Kung Fu, Once Central to Hong Kong Life, Is Waning
description: HONG KONG  Bruce Lee was 14 years old, and on the losing end of several street fights with local gang members, when he took up kung fu.

title: Can Thailand Really Hide a Rebellion?
description: On Aug. 11 and 12, coordinated bombings and arson attacks in tourist destinations in seven provinces of peninsular Thailand killed four people and injured 35. No group claimed responsibility, and senior officials of the military government almost immediately decided that the bombings were not acts of terrorism. They also dismissed any link to Malay-Muslim militants who have been waging a separatist insurgency for the past 13 years in the four southernmost provinces.

title: 1916: Hurricane Hits Jamaica
description: LONDON  A despatch from Kingston, Jamaica, to the Morning Post states that the havoc wrought by the hurricane, which swept over the island on Tuesday, August 15, greatly exceeded the first estimates. General Sir W. H. Manning, Governor of Jamaica, in a telegram to Mr. Bonar Law, Secretary of State for the Colonies, says that the whole of the banana plants have been destroyed.

title: Nearly 1,800 Killed in Dutertes Drug War, Philippine Police Official Tells Senators
description: MANILA  Killings by the police and vigilantes in the Philippines war on drugs have soared to nearly 1,800 in the seven weeks since President Rodrigo Duterte was sworn into office, the nations top police official told a Senate hearing on Monday.

title: Heartbreak Lurks Everywhere: Covering Losing Teams at the Olympics
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, Jay Schreiber, The Timess deputy sports editor, describes his coverage of heartbreaking losses at the Rio Olympics.

title: Pie Night at Dominique Ansel Kitchen
description: The pastry chef Dominique Ansel is holding a pie marathon next month, with 11 kinds of pie to sample, including a few savory kinds. Salted-caramel apple, flambed banana cream, blackberry and gin with roasted hazelnut crumble, and heirloom tomato with fresh ricotta are a few of the choices. Homemade ice cream, warm apple cider and a sneak peek at a new treat are included: Pie Nights; Sept. 14, 15, 21, 22, 28 and 29; one-hour sessions from 7 to 10 p.m.; tickets, $45 a person starting at noon on Wednesday from daevents.tocktix.com, Dominique Ansel Kitchen, 137 Seventh Avenue South (West 10th Street).

title: A Heralded Wine Instructors Last Class Before Retiring
description: Kevin Zraly, whose verve, passion and energy as a wine instructor are unparalleled, will teach just one more course before he retires. Hes been at it for 40 years with his Windows on the World Wine School, so-called because his classes started at that legendary restaurant. Since Sept. 11, 2001, they have been in Midtown, but he has kept the name. This is your last chance to experience Mr. Zraly on his favorite subject. Grab it: Windows on the World Wine School, Mondays from Sept. 26 to Oct. 24, and Nov. 1, 7 and 14, 7 to 9 p.m., JW Marriott Essex House, 160 Central Park South (Seventh Avenue); $1,200 a person from kevinzraly.com, 845-255-1456.

title: How #BlackLivesMatter Came to Define a Movement
description: It had existed as a phrase for some time, but it wasnt until two black men died in the summer of 2014 that Black Lives Matter began to flicker to life as a Twitter hashtag.

title: From a Liqueur, a Vegetal Aroma and a Sweet Heat
description: Add a soupon of intrigue to your next cocktail or glass of sparkling wine with a splash of poblano green chile liqueur from Mexico. Its the new sibling of Ancho Reyes Chile Liqueur, and delivers a clean, deeply vegetal aroma and sweet but not punishing heat. The green bottle is deceptive because the spirit itself is light amber. Its made from chiles that are less ripe than the ones used in the more toasty Ancho Reyes, a spirit that was introduced in 2014 after being developed from a Puebla recipe dating from 1927. The new version will transform a margarita: Ancho Reyes Verde Chile Liqueur, $35.99 at Astor Wines & Spirits, astorwines.com.

title: Donald Trump, Shifting Immigration Tone, Stresses a Fair Approach
description: Donald J. Trump, tempering the tone of his hard-line approach to immigration for a general election audience, avoided repeating his previous call for mass deportations on Monday and instead said he wants to come up with a really fair plan to address the millions of undocumented immigrants now in the country.

title: One Tool for Peeling It All
description: The serrated vegetable peeler that can tackle soft foods like tomatoes and peaches was first introduced in 2003 and quickly became a favorite in my kitchen. Now theres a new peeler, with both serrated and straight blades, an all-in-one treasure: Urban Trend peeler, $14.99 at Bed Bath & Beyond, bedbathandbeyond.com.

title: Spanish Cheese With a Subtle Hint of Cider
description: The Asturias region of northern Spain produces most of that countrys cider. So it is no wonder that its also the source of a cheese subtly flavored through the addition of cider to the milk before the curd is finished. This plump cylinder of deep ivory cheese has apple notes in the nose and on the palate, with the kind of dry finish you get from good cider. It melts beautifully, so use it for grilled cheese with a thin slice of apple tucked inside, shave some on top of baked apples, or serve it with an apple tart: Rebolln Cider Fusion, $15.75 for a cheese, about one pound, at Despaa Foods in Manhattan 212-219-5050, and in Jackson Heights, Queens, 718-779-4971.

title: Preliminary Injunction Order
description: A judge in Texas ruled that the Obama administration had not complied with federal law when issuing its directives on bathroom access.

title: Federal Transgender Bathroom Access Guidelines Blocked by Judge
description: A federal judge has blocked the Obama administration from enforcing new guidelines that were intended to expand restroom access for transgender students across the country.

title: A Japanese Fish Market in Williamsburg
description: A good way to kick the farmed salmon/Chilean sea bass/shrimp habit is to visit Yuji Haraguchis serene little fish market. There is succulent swordfish belly to grill and the freshest bluefish to set you straight about this much-maligned variety, as well as marinated dogfish, mackerel and other Atlantic fish. I want to change how we sell and eat fish, Mr. Haraguchi said. His manager, Luke Davin, put it this way: We live in a city on the water, but we dont eat a lot of local species. Mr. Haraguchi, who owns the nearby restaurant Okonomi and financed the market through a Kickstarter campaign, works with local fishermen who learn how to care for their catch so as to inflict the least amount of damage to the flesh, enhancing the flavor and texture. Prices are moderate; that swordfish belly, so rich that you need only about three ounces a person, is about $16 a pound. Theres a kitchen in the back where the fish is cut, and classes are held daily, afternoons and evenings: Osakana Japanese Fish Market, 290 Graham Avenue (Powers Street), Williamsburg, Brooklyn; osakanabk.com.

title: Lets Talk Breakfast (and Dinner Too)
description: Kim Severson is filling in for Sam Sifton, who emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: How Streaming Is Changing Sports Watching
description: Something amazing may be happening: Television broadcasters may start viewing their content the way the rest of us do  as something you watch, plain and simple, without caring what screen its on. And as something you want to see on your terms. Now.

title: Get Your Photos Looking Better on Facebook
description: Q. I have a great camera on my phone, but whenever I upload photos to Facebook, the pictures look decidedly lower in quality online. How do I get Facebook to display the photos I upload in higher definition?

title: A Book Adds Rigor to the Laid-Back World of Tiki Cocktails
description: One of the richer paradoxes of the cocktail world is that, for all their Hawaiian shirts and beach-bum bonhomie, tiki aficionados are among the most doctrinaire pedants youll find in any bar.

title: Japan, Seeking to Regain Manufacturing Might, Bets on Aerospace
description: GIFU, Japan  Kato Manufacturing, based in the blue-collar enclave of Gifu Prefecture, in central Japan, is a microcosm of the countrys industrial evolution.

title: Numberplay Has a New Home
description: Looking for Numberplay? The weekly math puzzle blog can now be found at its new location

title: Lou Pearlman, Svengali Behind Backstreet Boys and NSync, Dies at 62
description: Lou Pearlman, the music executive who built a pop empire on boy bands like the Backstreet Boys and NSync before going to prison for running a Ponzi scheme that stole hundreds of millions of dollars from investors, died on Friday in the Miami area, where he was in federal prison. He was 62.

title: Ang Lee Is Embracing a Faster Film Format. Can Theaters Keep Up?
description: After a four-year absence from theaters, Ang Lee will return this fall with a searing film about young American war heroes that may land him in the Oscar race. But the movie, billed as a cinematic leap forward because of the digitally radical way it was shot, has faced a major question.

title: Whats Next for the New York Subway? Toronto Already Knows
description: TORONTO  Step on board, and the subway car immediately feels different.

title: Fake ISIS Attack in Prague, Intended as Protest, Causes Panic
description: Sporting detachable beards, the men drove a Humvee onto Old Town Square in Prague on Sunday, wielding fake submachine-style BB guns and waving an Islamic State flag. Accompanied by a camel and a goat, they shouted Allahu akbar and fired guns without pellets.

title: Suicide Squad Soundtrack Locks Down a Second Week at No. 1
description: So far, August has belonged to Suicide Squad. The new movie has been No. 1 at the box office for the last three weekends, and its soundtrack is now the best-selling album for a second week in a row.

title: The Multifaceted Burkini Debate
description: PARIS  What is it about the head scarf? Or the burkini, the head-to-ankle bathing suit that serves as a demure covering for female Muslims now lighting up the political sphere in France?

title: Firing of Teacher Battling Cancer Prompts an Outcry in China
description: BEIJING  She was a face that people passed on the sidewalk without noticing, a sickly young woman with red lipstick and a pile of clothes. She hawked skirts for $15 and scarves for $10, joking with passers-by about the tedium of life.

title: Dick Assman, Briefly a Late Show Celebrity, Dies at 82
description: Dick Assman, a Canadian gas station owner who received his 15 minutes of fame  actually, about a month of it  through the Late Show With David Letterman, died on Monday in Regina, Saskatchewan. He was 82.

title: Americas First Offshore Wind Farm May Power Up a New Industry
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R.I.  The towering machines stand a few miles from shore, in a precise line across the seafloor, as rigid in the ocean breeze as sailors reporting for duty.

title: The Problem with SET
description: This weeks puzzle was suggested by Jordan Ellenberg, professor of mathematics at the University of Wisconsin, and author of How Not to be Wrong, one of Bill Gatess recommended summer reads. Our current challenge is based on SET, the highly-addictive visual perception card game.

title: Ryan Lochte Dropped by Speedo USA and Other Retailers
description: The fallout from Ryan Lochtes story about being robbed at gunpoint in Rio  a tale the Brazilian police said was not true  continued Monday when four companies said they would end business partnerships with Mr. Lochte, an American swimmer and 12-time Olympic medalist.

title: What Do The Simple Folk Do?
description: Brad DeLong writes about pundits like Niall Ferguson who fantasize about a vast class of regular people  Real Americans  who practice traditional values, dont eat fancy food, and vote for good, family-values Republicans who promise war. Im surprised that he doesnt mention Andrew Sullivan after 9/11:

title: What You Should Watch: The Profit and Gomorrah
description: Welcome to Watching, The New York Timess what-to-watch guide. We comb through releases big and small to email readers twice a week with our timely recommendations. You can browse previous guides here, and to receive recommendations straight to your inbox, sign up here. Stay tuned for our coming website.

title: Report Accuses Mexicos President of Plagiarism in Law School Thesis
description: Already reeling from corruption scandals and a declining security situation, President Enrique Pea Nieto of Mexico was accused on Sunday of plagiarizing nearly a third of his law school thesis, according to a report by an investigative journalist.

title: Britain Moves to Separate Radicalized Inmates From Other Prisoners
description: LONDON  Convicts in British prisons who preach terrorism and extreme ideology to fellow inmates will be held in high-security specialist units, the government announced on Monday, amid efforts to crack down on Islamic radicalization in jails.

title: Michael C. Bernardi Channels His Father for a Day as Tevye in Fiddler
description: His father was among the most famous Tevyes of all time, playing the role for years on Broadway and on tour. His grandparents were mainstays of the Yiddish theater, at times performing from the Sholom Aleichem stories that became Fiddler on the Roof.

title: Why Do Schools of Fish Seem to Know One Hand From the Other?
description: Q. I observed a school of fish swirling around in a clockwise manner. Do they all do that?

title: John Kerry Calls for Speedy Deployment of South Sudan Protection Force
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A new protection force intended for South Sudan that was authorized by the United Nations this month needs to be deployed there as soon as possible to safeguard civilians, especially women and girls, Secretary of State John Kerry said on Monday.

title: Our Election 2016 Unit: An Overview
description: While the 2016 presidential election, with its unprecedented level of alarming rhetoric, may feel less straightforward or easy to bring into your classroom than elections of the past, we believe that it also offers unique opportunities to engage students with real and pressing questions about our democracy and how it works.

title: Iran Revokes Russias Use of Air Base, Saying Moscow Betrayed Trust
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Iran on Monday annulled permission for Russian planes to fly bombing runs into Syria from an Iranian base, only a week after having granted such extraordinary access, saying that the Kremlin had been unacceptably public and arrogant about the privilege.

title: The Known: Cancer Is Really, Really Old. The Unknown: How Common It Was.
description: Carcinogens abounded 1.7 million years ago in Early Pleistocene times when a nameless protohuman wandered the South African countryside in what came to be known as the Cradle of Humankind.

title: Britains Huge Investment in Summer Olympic Sports Pays Off
description: Twenty years ago, Britains athletes returned from the Olympics branded as the team of shame.

title: British Production of Sweeney Todd to Set Up Shop Off Broadway
description: The pies served in the Broadway musical Waitress come with a main dish of romance. But a new batch arriving downtown in February will be much more sinister. The Barrow Street Theater will be reconfigured into an imitation pie shop to host a British production of the musical Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.

title: Hillary Clintons 15,000 New Emails to Get Timetable for Release
description: WASHINGTON  The dispute over Hillary Clintons email practices now threatens to shadow her for the rest of the presidential campaign after the disclosure on Monday that the F.B.I. collected nearly 15,000 new emails in its investigation of her and a federal judges order that the State Department accelerate the documents release.

title: A Shadowed Climate Watcher
