description: Last fall, Questlove, of the Roots, visited Pandora Medias headquarters in Oakland, Calif., for what he assumed would be a perfunctory outreach meeting. Pandora, the internet radio giant, was one of several digital music outlets then trying to curry favor with him, Questlove said.

title: How a Hong Kong Filmmaker Came Across a New Kind of Tibetan Business
description: BEIJING  Several years ago, Ruby Yang, an Academy Award-winning documentary filmmaker based in Hong Kong, began working with Siemens, the German engineering company, on a corporate video about sustainable development.

title: 1966: De Gaulle Taking World Tour
description: President Charles de Gaulle of France visited Cambodia in 1966. British Path.

title: Moscow Crushes an Uprising, This Time an Artistic One
description: PERM, Russia  Perm, a provincial Russian city on the western edge of Siberia, is defined these days not by what it is, but by what it was supposed to be by now and isnt.

title: A Four-Bedroom Condominium in Puerto Madero
description: The 46th-floor apartment, in one of the citys most affluent neighborhoods, is on the market for $4 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Buenos Aires
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM CONDOMINIUM IN PUERTO MADERO

title: After Earthquake in Italy, Half the Town No Longer Exists
description: AMATRICE, Italy  The chaos came in the middle of the night. People were screaming and dying in the darkness across Amatrice, a summer getaway in central Italy famous as the birthplace of a pasta dish made with tomatoes and pork cheeks.

title: North Korean Missile Test Brings Temporary Unity in East Asia
description: TOKYO  The missile that North Korea test-fired from a submarine off its east coast on Wednesday momentarily brought together three nations that have recently had reasons to squabble.

title: Daily Report: More Clean Energy, Brought to You by the Cloud
description: The cloud, as it turns out, may have a very green lining.

title: Ken Thompson, Brooklyn District Attorney, Is Fined for Misusing Funds on Meals
description: When a food order came in from the Brooklyn district attorney, Ken Thompson, the officers in charge of protecting him knew the drill: Go pick it up  a bagel or a burger or, at least once, a piece of salmon  and pay out of their own pocket. Later, the district attorneys office would reimburse them.

title: Walter Scheel, Leading Figure in West German Thaw With the East, Dies at 97
description: Walter Scheel, who as foreign minister and deputy chancellor of West Germany under Chancellor Willy Brandt from 1969 to 1974 helped foster dtente with the Soviet bloc and rapprochement with Communist East Germany, died on Wednesday in Bad Krozingen, in southwest Germany. He was 97.

title: Why the Italy Quake Was So Severe
description: The combination of a shallow fault and old, unreinforced masonry buildings led to widespread devastation in the earthquake that struck central Italy early Wednesday.

title: Burkini Inventor Says Sales Have Skyrocketed on Heels of Controversy
description: HONG KONG  The woman credited with creating  the so-called burkini said the controversy over efforts to ban the full-body bathing suit worn by some Muslim women has helped bolster demand for her invention, which she said was not meant to be a political statement.

title: At 52 Portraits, the Stories Behind the Dancers
description: It can be hard to articulate all that goes into becoming and being a dancer, but the project known as 52 Portraits does so on a refreshingly human scale, without oversimplifying. A collaboration among the choreographer Jonathan Burrows, the composer Matteo Fargion and the video artist Hugo Glendinning, the digital series, produced by Sadlers Wells in London, captures the thoughts and histories of its subjects through short autobiographical solos, one released every Monday of 2016.

title: Time to Follow Teddy Roosevelts Advice: Drop Politics and Enjoy a Park
description: Somewhere not far from any American, its possible to visit one of this countrys most remarkable assets  its national parks. And from August 25 to 28, as part of this years celebration of the 100th year of the National Park System, you can do so free of charge. Of the 400-plus parks in the system,124 normally charge an entrance fee. You can find the nearest park here.

title: Election 2016 Unit, Part 2: What Are the Issues?
How to Get Twitters Blue Badge of Authenticity
description: Q. How do you get verified on Twitter? Are there specific requirements?

title: Emeril Lagasse Takes Bite-Size Steps Across the World
description: How does a chef divine the connection between food and place? He asks another chef, naturally. In Eat the World With Emeril Lagasse, a six-episode Amazon series that begins Friday, Sept. 2, Mr. Lagasse (of Food Network fame) nibbles his way around the globe with guidance from some well-traveled colleagues. In China, Mario Batali joins him on a quest for the best dumpling soup. In Sweden, the teacher is Marcus Samuelsson, and the lesson is New Nordic cuisine. Danny Bowien provides an introduction to Jeong Kwan, a Zen Buddhist nun in South Korea known as the Philosopher Chef. And Jos Andrs takes Mr. Lagasse to Barcelona, where the modernist genius Ferran Adri and his army of thinkers dissect food down to the molecule. It might be Amazons answer to Netflixs Chefs Table, with enough food porn and zesty banter to keep viewers aroused. But fears of a loud American prowling the globe should be laid to rest: Not a single bam! resounded in the two episodes I watched.

title: The Women Who Helped Create Abstract Expressionism
description: Abstract Expressionism is usually treated as a boys-club affair. But it wasnt, as an exhibition called Women of Abstract Expressionism at the Denver Art Museum proves. Not that entry for women was easy. Of the 12 artists in the show, only a few, like Helen Frankenthaler and, to some degree, Grace Hartigan, got to take an early turn in the mainstream spotlight before being shouldered out by men. Others, like Jay DeFeo and Lee Krasner, had to wait years for attention, which came after they died. Many other artists  Mary Abbott, Sonia Gechtoff and Judith Godwin among them  are waiting still.

title: Laura Mvula Sings the Complicated Truth
description: I can only be who I am, Laura Mvula sings on the opening track of her stunning second album, The Dreaming Room (Columbia). The track, Who I Am, lyrically consists of just four short lines, leading irresistibly to this assertion. Ms. Mvula means for the message to stick.

title: Bartok, by Heart, From the Chiara String Quartet
description: By heart is a funny term when you think about it. After all, the act of memorization is done by the head. But the members of the Chiara String Quartet, who have made it their mission to perform without sheet music in front of them, say something special happens in the act of internalizing an entire quartet; connections deepen  with the music, with fellow players and with the audience.

title: 11 Ideas for Midweek Cooking
description: Kim Severson is filling in for Sam Sifton, who emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: The Congresswoman Who Wasnt
description: Last Friday a member of Congress tweeted at me.

title: Worlds Largest Aircraft Crashes, Gently, in 2nd Test Flight
description: It was a slow and gentle plunge: The worlds largest aircraft, the Airlander 10, crashed in southern England on Wednesday during its second test flight.

title: Infrared Saunas: Why Some Like It Hotter
description: Tippi Clark, a 24-year-old nutritionist who lives in Manhattan was describing a mission that tested her endurance. You reach the peak, she said, And its like, Oh, my gosh, can I make it through the last 20 minutes?

title: Flash Card, Math and Organizer Apps for the 21st Century Student
description: When youre not distracted playing Pokmon Go, your smartphone can be a great study buddy with apps that help you meet deadlines, do homework and take notes  especially now that it is back-to-school season.

title: French Manufacturer Building Indian Submarines Suffers Major Data Leak
description: Detailed plans for stealth submarines built by a French military manufacturer for the Indian navy have been leaked, raising concerns over the companys digital security just months after it signed a multibillion dollar deal to build submarines for Australia.

title: Before Downton, There Was Howards End. See It at Film Forum.
description: Howards End, the 1992 movie adapted from E. M. Forsters 1910 novel about upper-middle-class British life at the turn of the century, was the artistic pinnacle of what became known as the Merchant-Ivory brand. With a cast featuring Emma Thompson, Helena Bonham Carter, Vanessa Redgrave and Anthony Hopkins, this third adaptation of a Forster novel made by Ismail Merchant (producer), James Ivory (director) and Ruth Prawer Jhabvala (screenwriter) received nine Academy Award nods. (Ms. Thompson won for best actress.)

title: Explosion and Gunfire Erupt at American University in Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The American University of Afghanistan in Kabul came under attack by bomb and gunfire on Wednesday night, in a siege that lasted for hours as pockets of people trapped on campus tried to escape.

title: 1891: Terrible Colliery Explosion
description: LONDON  About 2.30 yesterday afternoon, a terrific explosion occurred in the Abercanaid pit, belonging to Hills Plymouth Company, near Merfhyr. The detonation was so great as to alarm the whole neighborhood, and people rushed to the pits mouth. There were between fifty and sixty men in the pit at the time, and fears were entertained lest the whole had perished. Events, however, proved that excepting two men all were safe.  The New York Herald, European Edition, August 25, 1891

title: BRIC JazzFest Marathon: 27 Bands in 3 Nights
description: Last fall the BRIC JazzFest had a successful first run, capped by two nights of marathon programming at BRIC House in Downtown Brooklyn. The festival will be back this year, expanding to a full week, Oct. 8 through Oct. 15, with events including a jazz-related film series.

title: Italian Towns Before and After the Earthquake
description: Towns in a mountainous stretch of central Italy were severely damaged by an earthquake that killed hundreds of people and trapped scores under debris.

title: Looking for Adventurous Theater? Try the Dream Up Festival
description: Whats that? You havent gotten your fill of offbeat theater at the New York International Fringe Festival, which ends Sunday, Aug. 28? Fear not: The annual Dream Up Festival, at Theater for the New City, begins the same day. A perhaps lesser-known but hardly less adventurous event, Dream Up will include 19 new works from American and international companies.

title: National Parks, 100 Years In
description: Aug. 25 marks the 100th anniversary of the U.S. national parks system. Here is a selection of our travel coverage from recent years.

title: What the White House Decorator Likes About His Study in Madrid
description: Name Michael S. Smith

title: Goldman Sachs, Banker to the Elite, Turns to the Common Man
description: It is not just coincidence that after 147 years of serving institutions and the ultra-wealthy, Goldman Sachs has decided that it will start catering to the common man: It is opportunism borne of necessity.

title: A Singer-Songwriters New Sound  and Tinsel Wig to Match
description: Angel Olsens third full-length album, My Woman, out next week, may raise the eyebrows of fans expecting the singer-songwriters trademark earthy, folky sound. In the video for Intern, the opening track, which Olsen directed herself, she wears a silver tinsel wig, her voice floating and trembling over a blazing synth line. I like pushing myself, says the 29-year-old. When she leaves her comfort zone in songwriting, she explains, my voice does things other than it normally would. I hold back on something because it goes better with the song. On the album, she explores the contradictions of a relationship and the process of breaking down ideals: I dare you to understand / What makes me a woman.

title: A Restaurants Sales Pitch: Know Your Lobster
description: It was a steamy summer day in New York in 2009 when Luke Holden, an investment banker, had a craving for a lobster roll. Not just any lobster roll, though. He longed for the fresh off the docks taste he enjoyed growing up in Cape Elizabeth, Me.

title: When Unlikely Grand Slam Finalists Lose, Many Never Get Back
description: Roberta Vincis upset of Serena Williams in the United States Open semifinals last year sent shock waves through tennis by slamming the door on Williamss Grand Slam bid.

title: When Kids Are in the Bed: The Ups and Downs of Co-Sleeping
description: As new parents, Penn State researcher Doug Teti and his wife were co-sleepers, sharing their bed at night with all three of their children, now grown.

title: Earthquake in Myanmar Kills 3 and Damages Over 170 Temples
description: YANGON, Myanmar  An earthquake on Wednesday in Myanmar left at least three people dead and badly damaged dozens of ancient temples in the old city of Bagan, government officials said.

title: Hackers Publish Nude Pictures on Leslie Joness Website
description: Leslie Jones, a co-star of this years Ghostbusters movie who has been besieged in the past month by online abusers who have targeted her appearance and her race, was victimized again on Wednesday when her personal website appeared to have been hacked.

title: Donald Trumps Description of Black America Is Offending Those Living in It
description: ATLANTA  Demeitrus Williams has heard what Donald J. Trump has been saying recently about black people: That their neighborhoods were war zones. That they struggle to get by on food stamps. That they see nothing but failure around them.

title: Pictures of Baseballs Golden Era, Yours for a Stack of Green
description: The archive of Charles M. Conlon, a photographer who captured some of the giants of baseballs golden years, will be auctioned Saturday. The negatives preserve a multitude of iconic images  including one from 1910 that shows Ty Cobb sliding into third base in a cloud of flying dirt  and are expected to sell for more than $1 million.

title: A Planet Orbiting Our Closest Neighbor, Proxima Centauri
description: Proxima b is the closest exoplanet to our sun.

title: Obama Designates National Monument in Maine, to Dismay of Some
description: President Obama turned a vast stretch of Maine woods into the nations newest federal parkland on Wednesday, siding with conservationists who want the wild lands protected, over residents and officials who oppose intrusion from Washington and restrictions on use of the land.

title: One Star Over, a Planet That Might Be Another Earth
description: Another Earth could be circling the star right next door to us.

title: Popcast: Frank Ocean Returns
description: A roundtable discussion on the release of the musicians latest works.

title: Whats Lost When Pops Orchestras Tap Pop Culture
description: Tchaikovskys bombastic 1812 Overture has been a staple of the Boston Pops Fourth of July concert since 1974, when the famed Pops conductor Arthur Fiedler added it  complete with cannon blasts and church bells  to lift attendance. It became the traditional lead-in to the fireworks display over the Charles River.

title: Bob Odenkirk to Write Comic Memoir
description: In his ever-evolving show-business career, Bob Odenkirk has been a sketch-comedy star and a leading man of drama; a very bad lawyer and also that same lawyer making all the choices that would send him down that corrupt path. Now he can add memoirist to his rsum: Random House said on Wednesday that it had acquired a book of personal essays from Mr. Odenkirk that the publisher described as a comic exploration of his life and work. The book will trace Mr. Odenkirks trajectory from Second City in Chicago to Saturday Night Live, The Ben Stiller Show and Mr. Show With Bob and David, as well as his role as Jimmy McGill (a.k.a. Saul Goodman) on the AMC crime drama Breaking Bad and the prequel series Better Call Saul.

title: Popcast: Frank Ocean Returns
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | RSS | Stitcher| Audioboom

title: Myanmar Temblor Damages Ancient Temples
description: An earthquake on Wednesday in Myanmar left at least three people dead and damaged scores of ancient temples in the old city of Bagan, government officials said.

title: The Disgruntled Voters Dilemma
description: To the Editor:

title: Finding Refuge With the Skin Im In
description: The checkout ladys panic surged as she held the coins six inches above my hand and dropped them into my palm. They clanged until I made a fist. She ran her fingernails through her hair.

title: In One L.A. Gallery, Flowers and Furniture Combine
description: In the midst of Los Angeless enduring drought, a meadow  albeit one forged from bronze and blackened steel  grows in West Hollywood. At his eponymous gallery on Thursday, Eric Buterbaugh opens Chuck Moffit: With the Promise of Nectar, a collaborative installation that, in true L.A. fashion, is a crossover of genres. In an unlikely pairing, the gallerist-cum-flower-and-scent designer is creating a site-specific installation of purple dahlias and custom scents in response to a new collection of Moffits sculptural furniture, which he made by hand in his lone studio on the high-altitude slopes of Mount Baldy.

title: The Complex Math Behind Spiraling Prescription Drug Prices
description: This is an update of an article that was  published earlier this year.

title: Seven Fall Trends You Can Wear Right Now
description: The elements of the season  including strong shoulders and lots of layering  from the pre-fall collections are already in stores.

title: Former Director Unveils Disputed Plan for Williams Board
description: The Williams Companies, which recently lost a court battle to preserve a takeover by another pipeline operator, is facing a new fight. This time, it is from a former director who owns a big stake in the company and has an unconventional plan to overhaul the entire board.

title: Hunt for Nazi Gold Train Digs Up Nothing but Dirt
description: WALBRZYCH, Poland  Two treasure hunters who were hoping to find a buried Nazi train full of gold, jewels and weapons halted their efforts on Wednesday, after a week of digging turned up no sign of the train.

title: Tap Dance and Video Projections Are Coming to the Guggenheims Rotunda
description: The MacArthur-winning tap choreographer Michelle Dorrance and the American Ballet Theater principal dancer Daniil Simkin will perform inside the Guggenheim Museum as part of the museums Works & Process Rotunda Projects.

title: Judges Sentencing in Massachusetts Sexual Assault Case Reignites Debate on Privilege
description: The two women were asleep on a bed after drinking at a party when they were sexually assaulted. A high school athlete pleaded guilty to indecent assault and battery on a person over 14 in the case, according to court documents.

title: Virtual Reality at The New York Times
description: Jake Silverstein, editor of The New York Times Magazine, sat down with Jenna Pirog, Graham Roberts and Sam Dolnick to talk about all things virtual reality.

title: The Japanese Vegetable Whisperer Behind Great French Restaurants
description: Asafumi Yamashita never imagined he would cultivate produce for a living. He was an expert in the Japanese tradition of bonsai when he moved from Tokyo to Paris almost 30 years ago. Asked by a chef to grow vegetables unavailable in local markets, he went back to Japan to look for seeds: The quality there makes them more potent and reliable, he says. But its his careful tending that has made him the designated grower for four Michelin-starred restaurants in Paris, including LAstrance and Le Cinq. I know each of my crops because I listen to them, he explains. Some years, my turnips decide to taste like pears, some years they taste like parsnips. Yamashita is a key player in a revolution in French cuisine, what he describes as taking the vegetable away from its role as a side and making it the key element on the plate. But not just anyone is worthy of his produce; he handpicks the chefs he supplies to be sure they respect his offerings. Giving my vegetables away is like marrying off my daughter.

title: Jennifer Holliday to Join Cast of The Color Purple
description: Jennifer Holliday, the actress who won a Tony Award for her blistering performance as Effie White in the original production of Dreamgirls, is joining the cast of The Color Purple.

title: The Complicated Appeal of the Harambe Meme
description: In the months since Harambe, a 17-year-old silverback gorilla, was shot and killed at the Cincinnati Zoo after he grabbed and dragged a child who had fallen into his enclosure, zoo officials have tried to return to normal. But the people of the internet have other plans.

title: Pencils, Books  and Full Internet Access
description: To the Editor:

title: Chinas Viral Idol: Papi Jiang, a Girl Next Door With Attitude
description: BEIJING  Jiang Yilei is the girl next door who rants about dieting and nagging parents in the living room of her cluttered apartment here. She has bangs, wears minimal makeup and keeps two cats.

title: The Real Montauk? Ask This Native Surfer
description: MONTAUK, N.Y.  Id rather swim in the ocean every morning than take a clean shower, said Jesse Joeckel, standing at Ditch Plains Beach.

title: Subscribe and Save on Amazon? Dont Count on It
description: WHAT do subscriptions to a newspaper, magazine or Netflix account have in common? Once you sign up, you expect to pay the same rate every month.

title: Crusader Without a Cape Sends Out the Bat Signal in New Jersey
description: On a recent night, somewhere in the swamps of Jersey, it was the children, primarily, who asked the hard questions.

title: Review: Warmth of the American Songbook, From 2 Keepers of the Flame
description: As much as any two performers, Michael Feinstein and Marilyn Maye embody the traditional concept of show business professionalism, in which an entertainer is expected to wow an audience by doing it all. And on Tuesday night, they joined forces for a satisfying evening of upbeat camaraderie and nostalgia at Feinsteins/54 Below.

title: Thomas Dooley Is Viacoms Best Bet for a Breakup
description: Viacom has one good reason to keep its interim chief executive, Thomas Dooley: a breakup of the media company.

title: Get Ready for the Real Donald Trump
description: When Republican politicians start talking about reaching out to minority voters, you can be sure of two things: They are scared they are going to lose badly with those voters in yet another election, and they arent actually going to change any of their policies.

title: Bear Traps and Empathy Engines: Virtual Reality at The New York Times
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Tracee Ellis Ross: Shes a Hit at the White House, Too
description: Tracee Ellis Ross worried as Anthony Anderson, her co-star in ABCs black-ish, read off this years Emmy nominees for best actress in a comedy in alphabetical order  Ellie Kemper for The Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, Julia Louis-Dreyfus for Veep, Laurie Metcalf for Getting On. I couldnt figure it out: Are they going by the E or the R? Ms. Ross recalled. Oh, I hope its the R, because weve passed the Es!

title: Growing Older, Getting Happier
description: Older people tend to be happier than younger people, and their happiness increases with age, a study in the Journal of Clinical Psychiatry reports.

title: N. K. Jemisin on Diversity in Science Fiction and Inspiration From Dreams
description: When N. K. Jemisin was halfway through writing her fantasy novel The Fifth Season, she called her editor in a panic and said she couldnt finish. Ms. Jemisin felt the story  which unfolds in a world where mutants who can control seismic energy are feared and oppressed  was too painful to write, given the uncomfortable parallels to persistent racial injustice in the real world.

title: N.C. Trooper Investigated in Fatal Shooting of Deaf Motorist
description: The North Carolina State Bureau of Investigation is conducting a criminal inquiry into the fatal shooting of a deaf motorist by a state trooper last week. The death has raised questions about the use of deadly force by police officers and about how they interact with the disabled.

title: Document Flood and Fire Damage to Ease Insurance Claims
description: Victims of the recent flooding in Louisiana and wildfires in California should all do one thing: Document the damage to their property.

title: Israel Clears Troops in Airstrike Near School in 2014 Gaza War
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli military had the speeding motorcycle in its sights and had fired an air-to-ground missile at it when the three riders, identified as militants, entered a traffic circle in the town of Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip. It was Aug. 3, 2014.

title: With a Very Public Alarm, the Strawberry-Gooden Story Continues
description: Darryl Strawberry paused for 25 seconds and shifted in his seat before he answered a question about Dwight Gooden from the audience at the end of a WFAN event last Thursday. How worried are you about Doc and his future? the person asked. Gooden had been scheduled to appear with Strawberry and the host, Joe Benigno, but he did not show.

title: The Met Museum Extends Hours for the Final Weekend of Manus x Machina
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art has just added a little more time to see Manus x Machina: Fashion in the Age of Technology. Six hours, to be exact.

title: Angry Claims and Furious Denials Over Organ Transplants in China
description: HONG KONG  Eyes flashing, lips curled in operatic scorn, a middle-aged woman holding a placard reading Evil Cult Falun Gong! ordered me off the sidewalk outside Hong Kongs convention center, where organ transplant specialists from around the world were gathered.

title: Eight Great Bar Carts
description: Sleek objects that evoke a functional minimalism as effortlessly as they do a bygone glamour.

title: Obesity Is Linked to at Least 13 Types of Cancer
description: A review of more than a thousand studies has found solid evidence that being overweight or obese increases the risk for at least 13 types of cancer. The study was conducted by a working group of the International Agency for Research on Cancer, part of the World Health Organization.

title: Gene Tests Identify Breast Cancer Patients Who Can Skip Chemotherapy, Study Says
description: When is it safe for a woman with breast cancer to skip chemotherapy?

title: The Countries Where Women Won More Medals Than Men in Rio
description: The success of women in Olympic sports can be tied to the opportunities available in their home countries.

title: In Glory, Britney Spears Promises Pleasure, but Offers Nothing Personal
description: Britney Spears strives mightily to be one-dimensional on Glory, her ninth studio album. But Ms. Spears has plenty of back story; shes a 34-year-old working mother, the headliner in her own Las Vegas spectacle and a performer who has weathered teenage fame, backlash, public meltdowns and wave after wave of tabloid headlines. Glory, her first album since 2013, is her latest attempt to reclaim her place on the pop charts, which are now crowded with younger performers who have studied her the way Ms. Spears studied Madonna. Her latest strategy is relentless and unambiguous: Stick to sexy.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Sterling K. Brown Reads My First Son, a Pure Memory
description: In this episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, Sterling K. Brown (The People v. O.J. Simpson) reads the essay My First Son, a Pure Memory, in which a man shares the story of his wifes miscarriage.

title: Review: New Music Inspired by Christs Agony and Dating Apps
description: Wagner meets Tinder: Intimacy in the age of dating apps was the inspiration, the composer Wang Lu said in remarks from the stage, for her effervescent chamber concerto Cloud Intimacy, which received its world premiere on Tuesday at Merkin Concert Hall. This quirky and touching work for six instrumentalists ended on what might have been the first selfie cadenza for a cellphone-mugging clarinetist (Campbell MacDonald).

title: A Playwright Finds Drama, and Humor, in Roe v. Wade
description: ASHLAND, Ore.  Lisa Loomer has written plays about how womens bodies are tortured in the name of beauty and about the relationship between white mothers and their Latina nannies in Los Angeles. Taking on the politics of abortion would seem right up her alley.

title: Patient H.M. Recalls the Story of a Surgery That Took a Mans Memories
description: For nearly six decades, Henry Molaison was known only by his initials, H.M., a brutally fitting detail for a man whose identity had more or less been erased. On Aug. 25, 1953, a surgeon drilled two holes in his forehead, pried up his frontal lobes with a flat brain spatula and suctioned out several elegantly shaped structures  they looked like hooks, almonds, seahorses  in an effort to subdue an ungovernable case of epilepsy.

title: Italy, U.S. Presidential Race, Syria: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: At Westfield, New Openings and Celebratory Events
description: Brush up on fashion history at the new Westfield World Trade Center mall this week. On Thursday, Lacoste will open L Comme Lgende, L Comme Lacoste, an exhibition celebrating the heritage of the French brand. It will include a wooden racket that once belonged to the founder and tennis legend Ren Lacoste, who won 10 grand slams from 1925 to 1929. For more things French, stop by Caudale from 5 to 8 p.m. where the vinotherapy skin-care company will celebrate the opening of its boutique spa with free mini-facials with its crushed cabernet scrub at the Beauty Barrel Bar. On Friday, the Madrid jewelry company UNOde50 will open a store where youll find a 20th-anniversary collection with 20 pieces from the last two decades, including a silver-plated peseta necklace ($145) and key-shaped ring ($109). At 185 Greenwich Street.

title: Uber Partners With Betterment to Offer Drivers I.R.A.s
description: The ride-hailing service Uber told drivers in four large American cities on Wednesday that it had teamed up with the robo-adviser Betterment to offer individual retirement accounts.

title: Kelsey Lu McJunkins, Hitting the Stages of Afropunk and Barclays Center
description: AGE 27

title: Lars Fisk: An Artist in Red Hook
description: The cunning sculptor has been making public art for two decades.

title: Phishs Art Director Calls Four Shipping Containers Home
description: Lars Fisk has weathered two hurricanes in the four shipping containers he calls home. Once planted on the edge of the Costco parking lot that abuts the Socrates Sculpture Park in Long Island City, Queens, the containers were moved last year to a slim, weedy lot in Red Hook, Brooklyn.

title: Brooklyn Garden That Was Shut Down Over Marijuana Plants Will Reopen
description: A lush community garden in East New York, Brooklyn, which was locked after the authorities discovered marijuana plants growing among the stone fruit trees and collard greens, will reopen possibly as soon as this week, city officials said.

title: Italys Fragile Beauty
description: Milan  If you put a pin right in the middle of a map of Italy, youre likely to hit Amatrice. A small, historic city known as the town of the hundred churches, it lies two hours from Rome and 3,280 feet above sea level, in the scenic Gran Sasso National Park, on the watershed between the Adriatic and the Tyrrhenian Seas. The area straddles four of our most famous regions: Lazio, Abruzzo, Marche and Umbria. Amatrice is the centerpiece of picture-postcard Italy, for those who find Tuscany too obvious, Rome too noisy and Venice too crowded.

title: The Great Fashion Mash-Ups of 2016
description: Were living in a post-normcore world. Heres what it looks like.

title: Life Expectancy Falls by 5 Years for Syrian Men, New Analysis Finds
description: Life expectancy for men in Syria has declined by five years since the war there began in 2011, a new analysis of mortality data has found, a sudden collapse not seen since the decline that Russian men experienced after the end of the Soviet Union.

title: Colombia and FARC Reach Deal to End the Americas Longest War
description: Colombias government and the largest rebel group in the country have reached a deal to end more than 50 years of conflict, the two sides announced Wednesday, paving the way for an end to the longest-running war in the Americas.

title: Awkward Target for Outrage Over EpiPen: A Senators Daughter
description: WASHINGTON  A bipartisan group of senators pressing on Wednesday for an explanation of the skyrocketing cost of the EpiPen, a lifesaving injection device for those with severe allergies, found themselves directing their outrage toward an inconvenient target: the daughter of Senator Joe Manchin III.

title: Morton Schindel, Who Turned Childrens Books Into Animated Films, Dies at 98
description: Morton Schindel, who turned beloved childrens books into animated films narrated by actors like Meryl Streep and James Earl Jones while preserving the spirit of the original illustrations, died on Saturday at his home in Weston, Conn. He was 98.

title: Fed, Eager to Show Its Listening, Welcomes Protesters
description: WASHINGTON  When a dozen protesters in green T-shirts showed up two years ago at the Federal Reserves annual conference in Jackson Hole, Wyo., they were regarded by many participants as an amusing addition.

title: A Modest Reward for Helping Amazon Fix a Mistake
description: Dear Diary:

title: Unions in the Ivory Tower
description: In a corrective action more than a decade in the making, the National Labor Relations Board ruled on Tuesday that graduate students who work as teaching and research assistants at private universities have the right to unionize.

title: Veteran Kills Himself in Parking Lot of V.A. Hospital on Long Island
description: A 76-year-old veteran committed suicide on Sunday in the parking lot of the Northport Veterans Affairs Medical Center on Long Island, where he had been a patient, according to the Suffolk County Police Department.

title: Gary Sanchez Homers Again as Yankees Win in Seattle
description: SEATTLE  Gary Sanchez dug into the batters box on a sublime sun-kissed afternoon, and so began another day at the office.

title: Mylan Raised EpiPens Price Before the Expected Arrival of a Generic
description: In 2012, the company behind the EpiPen settled a lawsuit by agreeing to allow a generic competitor into the market in 2015, potentially cutting into a big part of its business.

title: University of Texas Students Find the Absurd in a New Gun Law
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  On the first day of classes at the University of Texas in this city that revels in its own oddball creativity, students protested a law allowing concealed handguns on state college campuses by carrying something they thought was just as ridiculous and out of place: Thousands of sex toys.

title: Taking a Stand at Standing Rock
description: Near Cannon Ball, N.D.  It is a spectacular sight: thousands of Indians camped on the banks of the Cannonball River, on the edge of the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation in North Dakota. Our elders of the Seven Council Fires, as the Oceti Sakowin, or Great Sioux Nation, is known, sit in deliberation and prayer, awaiting a federal court decision on whether construction of a $3.7 billion oil pipeline from the Bakken region to Southern Illinois will be halted.

title: U.S. Soccer Suspends Hope Solo and Terminates Her Contract
description: U.S. Soccer terminated the contract of goalkeeper Hope Solo on Wednesday for what it called conduct that is counter to the organizations principles. The federation also said it had suspended Solo from the womens national team for six months, but in ending her contract, it sent a strong signal that Solo  who has balanced on-field excellence with off-field controversy for more than a decade  might have played her last game for the United States.

title: Support for Saudi Arabia Gives U.S. Direct Role in Yemen Conflict
description: WASHINGTON  It was a frenetic Monday afternoon at Abs Hospital in northern Yemen, with doctors and nurses busily shuttling among the patients and a maternity ward filled with 25 women expecting to give birth.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: When I arrived at the break of day, I saw a destroyed village, screams, death.

title: French Burkini Bans Provoke Backlash as Armed Police Confront Beachgoers
description: PARIS  Armed police surrounding Muslim women on beaches and ordering them to remove their modest clothes or leave. Calls from onlookers to go back to where you came from. Public humiliation and ostracism with echoes of the morals police of theocratic countries like Iran or Saudi Arabia, not a country that sees its values as a paragon of Western freedoms.

title: Few Homeless Shelter Workers Are Trained to Administer Heroin Antidote
description: An antidote for a heroin overdose is as easy to buy in New York City pharmacies as a bottle of aspirin.

title: A Killing Hidden by the Light
description: Surveillance footage captured the lead-up to the death of Roberto Rodrguez, a Mexican immigrant who was fatally stabbed in May in the South Bronx.

title: Hawaii Is Redefining the Road Game
description: Many college football teams, particularly those outside the so-called Big Five conferences, begin their seasons with two games on the road.

title: A Conflicted Donald Trump Tries a New Tactic: Sticking to the Script
description: After months of flailing attempts, Donald J. Trump has begun to recast his political message in more structured terms and wrestle with his temptation to go off script, as his campaign seeks to revive his fading candidacy and turn the focus this fall to Hillary Clintons honesty and integrity.

title: Quest for a New Life Ends in a Tangle of Gang Ties
description: Leer en espaol

title: Giants Break Silence on Josh Browns Suspension Over Arrest
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants co-owner John K. Mara on Wednesday defended the teams decision to re-sign kicker Josh Brown despite Browns 2015 arrest on a domestic violence charge and a statement by Browns former wife to the police that he had been physically violent with her on numerous occasions.

title: Series Run May Have Cost Mets in Injuries to Starters
description: ST. LOUIS  Before the season, the Mets hoped their starting rotation at this point would comprise Matt Harvey, Jacob deGrom, Noah Syndergaard, Steven Matz and Zack Wheeler. Instead, their rotation heading into next week could be deGrom, Syndergaard, Bartolo Colon, and the rookies Seth Lugo and Robert Gsellman.

title: A Competition With Rod Lavers Name and Roger Federers Backing
description: Rod Laver and Roger Federer are separated by 43 years of age and more millions of dollars than Laver would care to count. But as to which tennis legend produced the richer social stories to pass on for posterity, Federer would readily admit: Its no contest.

title: No Medals, but Benefits Nonetheless, for Those Who Skipped Rio
description: FARMINGDALE, N.Y.  Rory McIlroy did not watch much of the golf during the Olympics. He did not watch much of anything. He spent a week at an isolated cabin in upstate New York, where there was no electricity.

title: Cause a Commotion
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Hi, yes, Ill be in the spam filter if you need me.

title: Review: A Welsh Family Clings to Native Soil in The Good Earth
description: The village, somewhere in the valleys of South Wales, is its own tiny world. A ragged place surrounded by natural beauty, its not much more than a row of houses on a single street, so self-contained that you dont have to be from far off to be not from round here. Outsiders are dubiously regarded.

title: Kim Jong-un Hails Firing of Submarine Missile as Greatest Success
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The North Korean leader Kim Jong-un said his countrys test of a submarine-launched ballistic missile this week had achieved the greatest success.

title: Syria Used Chlorine in Bombs Against Civilians, Report Says
description: Syrian military helicopters dropped bombs containing chlorine on civilians in at least two attacks over the past two years, a special joint investigation of the United Nations and an international chemical weapons monitor said on Wednesday in a confidential report.

title: Mr. Robot Season 2, Episode 8: A Shock to the System
description: The most striking thing in this weeks episode of Mr. Robot wasnt in this weeks episode of Mr. Robot. Its Elliot Alderson, the mentally ill mastermind behind the hacker collective fsocietys rapidly disintegrating plan to level the worlds economic playing field. For the first time in the history of the series, Elliot  and Rami Malek, the wide-eyed actor whom the role has made a star  did not appear.

title: Trump Calls Clinton a Bigot as British Brexit Leader Stumps for Him
description: JACKSON, Miss.  Thousands of miles away from home, in a solidly Republican state, a British populist politician came here on Wednesday to deliver a message of hope and a message of optimism.

title: Living Near a Fracking Site Is Tied to Migraines, Fatigue
description: Living near a natural gas hydraulic fracturing site is associated with increased rates of sinus problems, migraines and fatigue, according to new research.

title: Jay Bruce Limps Off as Cardinals Clobber the Mets
description: Stop us if this sounds familiar: A Mets player did something during a game to hurt himself and had to depart the contest early. In this case, during a routine double to left field in the second inning, Jay Bruce grimaced as he ran out of the batters box in Wednesdays 8-1 loss to the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Marlins Halt Royals Winning Streak at Nine Games
description: Jose Fernandez pitched seven innings and appeared to avoid a serious injury when he tweaked his right leg on his final pitch on Wednesday night, helping the host Miami Marlins beat Kansas City, 3-0, and ending the Royals nine-game winning streak.

title: Corrections: August 25, 2016
description: NATIONAL

title: Whats on TV Thursday: RuPauls Drag Race All Stars and The Syndicate: All or Nothing
description: The queens rule in a new season of RuPauls Drag Race All Stars. Wallace Shawn engages in table talk in Melinda and Melinda and My Dinner With Andr. And some servants at a British manor win the lottery in The Syndicate: All or Nothing.

title: In Tennis, Playwrights Find a Ready Device for Onstage Drama
description: Andy Bragen raced to the net, hoping to capture a key point in the tight third-set tiebreaker. The results, initially at least, were calamitous. Mark Alhadeff whistled a passing shot by Bragen to widen his lead to 5-1. Losing the point was awful, but even worse for Bragen was the knowledge that Alhadeff was about to let loose with a self-congratulatory yell.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | predator
description: predator  \pre-d-tr, -tor\  noun

title: A Stark Reminder of Guantnamos Sins
description: It is haunting, maddening even, to revisit the facts of Abu Zubaydahs time in American custody more than 14 years after he was detained in Pakistan in the frenzied period following the Sept. 11 attacks. Abu Zubaydah, the first prisoner known to have been waterboarded by the Central Intelligence Agency, loomed large in Americas imagination for years as the personification of evil.

title: The Downwardly Mobile for Trump
description: What makes Americans receptive to what Donald J. Trump has been saying on the campaign trail?

title: Another Drug Pricing Ripoff
description: The rapid increase in the price of the EpiPen, a device used to give an injection that can save people from deadly allergic reactions, has shocked consumers and lawmakers. Yet it is just one more outrageous instance of pharmaceutical companies raising prices for lifesaving medicines with no justification other than the desire to increase profits  and doing so knowing that government can do little about it.

title: Anne Frank Today Is a Syrian Girl
description: AMSTERDAM  On April 30, 1941, a Jewish man here in Amsterdam wrote a desperate letter to an American friend, pleading for help emigrating to the United States.

title: More Evidence That Soda Taxes Cut Soda Drinking

title: In the Race for Registered Voters, Republicans Are Gaining
description: Republicans have narrowed the Democrats lead in registered voters in several swing states, especially in North Carolina and Florida.

title: State Dept. Study on Saudi Textbooks
description: A two-part study of Saudi textbooks commissioned by the State Department and conducted by the International Center for Religion and Diplomacy, a Washington research group, was finished in 2013 but was never released for fear of angering Saudi officials. The New York Times obtained a copy under the Freedom of Information Act.

title: Hearts Set on Montauk
description: Beach-lovers both, Amy and Bobby Reich knew they wanted to settle in Montauk, N.Y., for the long haul.

title: 36 Hours in Belgrade
description: Epic night life, thriving cafe culture, hearty meals and emerging, design-conscious industrial districts: Belgrade has a gritty, distinctive appeal.

title: Cycling Matches the Pace and Pitches of Tech
description: Thinking he needed to take up a California sport, Greg Gretsch started cycling in 1988, when he moved to the Bay Area to work in marketing at Apple after graduating from the University of Georgia. He bought a 10-speed road bike and joined a group of other Apple employees for a standing noon ride.

title: Holy Water for Pilgrims, via the Mail
description: Every summer, hundreds of thousands of Indians, barefoot and draped in orange clothing, make a 100-mile pilgrimage on foot to fetch water from the sacred Ganges River that they then offer at their local temples to Shiva, the Hindu god of destruction.

title: Black Women and Braids: Images Align Their History
description: For generations, black women have sat for hours on end, in salon chairs, on front porches and on living room floors, having their hair gently  and sometimes not so tenderly  woven to form the perfect braid.
