title: Jessica Clarke, Lawrence Gibson
description: Jessica Barbara Clarke and Lawrence Kodjo Gibson were married Aug. 27 at the Dunbarton Chapel at Howard University in Washington. The Rev. Dr. Vincent E. Stokes Sr., who is the brides uncle and a Baptist minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Tracy Roosevelt, Robert OLoughlin
description: Theresa Marie Roosevelt, a daughter of Ann M. Roosevelt and James Roosevelt Jr. of Cambridge, Mass., was married Aug. 27 to Robert David James O'Loughlin, the son of Christine W. Hale of Brundall, England, and the late Robert G. OLoughlin. Lorraine Redmond, a deputy registrar at the London Borough of Camden, officiated at Goodenough College in London. On Sept. 17, the Very Rev. Kevin J. OLeary, a Roman Catholic priest, will lead a ceremony at St. Peters Parish in Cambridge, with the Rev. Leonard OMalley, the church pastor, participating.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: I Miss Downton Abbey! and the 2016 MTV Video Music Awards
description: Has absence made the heart grow fonder? I Miss Downton Abbey! comes to the rescue. And the 2016 MTV Video Music Awards move to Madison Square Garden.

title: Corrections: August 28, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Syria, Donald Trump, Breitbart: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: A Powerful Russian Weapon: The Spread of False Stories
description: STOCKHOLM  With a vigorous national debate underway on whether Sweden should enter a military partnership with NATO, officials in Stockholm suddenly encountered an unsettling problem: a flood of distorted and outright false information on social media, confusing public perceptions of the issue.

title: Homes That Sold for $700,000 to $899,999
description: 507 East 12th Street, East Village

title: Amanda Cowie, Alex Jansen
description: Amanda Brooke Cowie and Alex John Jansen were married Aug. 27 at the Yellowstone Club, a private ski and golf community in Big Sky, Mont. Robin A. McIntosh, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life Church minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: 1966: China Admonishes Red Guards
description: TOKYO  Communist Chinas leaders  alarmed by a state of growing internal chaos  today [Aug.28] ordered their youthful Red Guards to stop using violence in pushing their cultural revolution.

title: GPS Unit Tracks Down a Missing Van and a Face Familiar to the Police
description: A thin and shirtless man answered a reporters knock on his apartment door in the Bronx on Wednesday morning. His name was Juan Velazquez.

title: Not Forgotten: Emmett Till, Whose Martyrdom Launched the Civil Rights Movement
description: Emmett Till was just 14 when he was murdered for allegedly whistling at a white woman. Outrage at his death and the acquittal of his killers helped spark the civil rights movement.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Kim Severson is filling in for Sam Sifton, who emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Where U.S. Presidential Votes Really Count: The Electoral College
description: Any American political strategist or reporter  Ive been one for more than four decades  loves the map: Thats the electoral map that decides the presidential election every four years.

title: Now Arriving on the New York Subway: Free E-Books, Timed for Your Commute
description: Rainier Velardo watched the basketball-player-tall man in the blue shirt who sat down next to him  the man had gotten on at the last subway stop, West Fourth Street in Manhattan, and this was an F train going to Brooklyn. Mr. Velardo watched the man tap the screen of an iPad. He heard the man chuckle and say: Youd think I would know this. I wrote it. And then, with even more of a chuckle, Didnt see that twist coming.

title: 1916: Romania Declares War on Austria-Hungary
description: Roumania has entered the war on the side of the Allies by declaring war on Austria-Hungary, and Germany has retaliated by breaking off relations with Bucarest and ranging herself with the Dual Monarchy against Roumania.

title: A Summer Evening in Texas Isnt Complete Without a Bat Show
description: Every night in the summer, more than 15 million bats emerge from a hot, cavernous sinkhole just outside San Antonio. They spiral up and out of the caves gaping mouth like a tornado and slowly gain elevation. If youre sitting nearby, you can feel the wind from their wings.

title: Charles Osgood to Leave CBS Show Sunday Morning After 22 Years
description: Charles Osgood, whose distinct voice and dapper broadcasting style has made the CBS show Sunday Morning a weekly ritual for many viewers, will be leaving at the end of September after 22 years as the programs anchor.

title: Democrats Step Up Pursuit of House Republicans Left Limping by Donald Trump
description: LEESBURG, Va.  Emboldened by Donald J. Trumps struggles in the presidential race, Democrats in Congress are laying the groundwork to expand the list of House Republicans they will target for defeat as part of an effort to slash the Republicans 30-seat majority and even reclaim control if Mr. Trump falls further.

title: An Islamic Radical Who Changed His Mind
description: For years, Jesse Morton advocated a violent vision of Islam, inspiring recruits to commit acts of terror. He explained why he recanted and joined a think tank that researches radicalization.

title: It Is a Piece of Penn Station: An Exiting Departures Board Inspires Strong Emotions
description: The large Amtrak departures board in Pennsylvania Station in Manhattan draws masses of commuters to the floor beneath it, where they stare up as if in a trance. The slightest movement of the sign inside the countrys busiest train station sets off a variety of reactions  despair after the appearance of the word delayed or, even worse, canceled; relief and elation after a track is assigned and people rush to the trains below.

title: Crackdown on For-Profit Colleges May Free Students and Trap Taxpayers
description: The Obama administrations decision to bar ITT Educational Services, one of the nations largest operators of for-profit colleges, from using federal financial aid to enroll new students shuts off the cash spigot to the troubled company. But it also creates a new set of problems.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Aug. 29
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: 3 Suspects in 2009 Attack on Sri Lankan Cricket Team Are Killed in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Four militants, three of whom were suspects in a 2009 attack on the Sri Lankan cricket team, were fatally shot in Lahore, Pakistan, when another group of militants tried to free them from custody, the police said.

title: Iran Arrests Person Linked to Negotiations on Nuclear Deal
description: Iran said on Sunday that a person close to the government team that negotiated its nuclear agreement with foreign powers had been arrested on accusations of espionage and released on bail.

title: Depleted Mets Lose to the Phillies
description: A longing would be understandable among fans at Citi Field on Sunday and in the coming days. Like buying tickets to a Broadway show only to watch understudies unexpectedly fill in, the pitchers Robert Gsellman, Rafael Montero and Seth Lugo do not carry the same prestige as other members of the Mets rotation.

title: New Books by Imbolo Mbue, Krys Lee, Gonzalo Torn and Lisa McInerney
description: By Imbolo Mbue

title: Ursula Le Guin Has Earned a Rare Honor. Just Dont Call Her a Sci-Fi Writer.
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  If youre a big-deal American writer, you hope for a couple of things to cement your legacy. Finding out one fine October morning that your presence is being requested in Sweden would be ideal. Almost as good is enshrinement in the Library of America, the closest thing to immortality between hardcovers.

title: After 30 Albums and 3 Recent Prizes, a Jazzman Flirts With the Mainstream
description: Steve Coleman is the most important jazz musician that many fans have never heard of. Hes been the leader on 30 albums in the last three decades and the mentor to a dozen younger artists now making headlines, yet hes remained an underground figure, content to burrow his own pathways. Lately, though, his profiles been rising. In the last two years, hes won a trifecta of arts prizes: a Guggenheim fellowship, a Doris Duke performing artist award and a MacArthur genius grant.

title: Donald Trumps Surrogates Back Off Deportation Force for Illegal Immigrants
description: A parade of surrogates for Donald J. Trump backed away on Sunday from a primary element of his immigration policy, further muddying an issue on which Mr. Trump himself sowed confusion in recent days.

title: Watching the Obamas First Date, and Feeling a Little Uncomfortable
description: Last week, Michael D. Shear and Julie Hirschfeld Davis, White House correspondents for The New York Times, went to see Southside With You, the new feature film that is a fictionalized account of President Obamas first date with the woman who would become his wife. The movie, set in 1989 in Chicago, stars Parker Sawyers and Tika Sumpter as Barack Obama and Michelle Robinson.

title: C.C. Sabathia Speaks Volumes, but Yankees Bats Are Mute in a Series Finale
description: In scratching back into the playoff chase during the last week, the Yankees put a heavy burden on the young and talented players now populating their roster. The team still has veterans with large profiles and larger salaries, but it has been youth that often carried the day.

title: Dont Breathe Tops the North American Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  Dont Breathe became the latest in a string of hit horror movies over the weekend, while the indie romance Southside With You bested the boxing drama Hands of Stone.

title: God of Vengeance to Be Revived by New Yiddish Rep
description: God of Vengeance, a drama from the early 20th century and the inspiration for Paula Vogels Indecent, a possible addition for the coming Broadway season, will be revived in December by New Yiddish Rep.

title: The Squarest, Man
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Every now and then, we hear from solvers who believe that the New York Times crossword relies too heavily on New York-centric entries. The last several days should have put that to rest.

title: Can the Old Masters Be Relevant Again?
description: Old masters, new world.

title: Africas Tennis Talent, Though Obscure, Is Burgeoning
description: Fifteen years ago, I was a Peace Corps volunteer living in a village of mud huts on the dry Sahel landscape of northern Ivory Coast. The nearest market town, Ferkessdougou, was 20 miles away, and every Thursday morning I would mount my Trek 820 and pedal out past the last huts, announcing in limited Senufo-Palaka my intention to ride to Ferk and return by sundown.

title: To Bolster KLMs Identity, a Charmingly Clueless Approach to Humor
description: QUICK, IS KLM a brand of milk, the call letters for a radio station or a 97-year-old Dutch airline?

title: The Get Down and Stranger Things Feed Nostalgia With a Historical Remix
description: Nostalgia is too big a force in pop culture to belong to any one institution. But Netflix owns a bigger percentage of it than most, simply because the past is built into its business model.

title: When Egypt Goes to the Beach
description: Cairo  I paused for a second as I packed for a last-minute break on Egypts North Coast, known as Sahel in Arabic. Should I take my bikini? Or a one-piece? Or what?

title: Spain: A Country With No Government
description: MADRID  On Jan. 2, 1492, Isabella of Castile and Ferdinand of Aragon  known as the Catholic Monarchs  occupied Granada, completing their conquest of Moorish Spain. Ever since, Spain has always had a government  and occasionally two, when Napoleon invaded in 1808, and during the 1936 to 1939 civil war that split it. But never during those more than five centuries was it ever without any. That is, until Dec. 20 last year, when elections failed to give any party the majority needed to form a government and all attempts at a coalition failed.

title: The Best Deal for Colombia
description: In 1983, guerrilla fighters from the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia murdered Alberto Uribe in a botched kidnapping attempt. Two decades later, Alberto Uribes son, lvaro, would serve as Colombias president, from 2002-10, leading the government in a civil war against the rebel group he held responsible for his fathers death.

title: A Reporter Recalls One of the Many Victims of Colombias War: Her Father
description: The first person I wanted to call when I heard that Colombias government and the countrys largest leftist rebel group had reached a peace deal last week was my father.

title: Plane Rides and Presidential Transparency
description: When Hillary Clinton headed for Reno, Nev., to make a big speech attacking Donald J. Trump on Thursday, her campaign used two planes. One was for the candidate and her entourage. The other was for the reporters, photographers and videographers assigned to follow her every move  which, of course, is impossible when shes not physically on the same aircraft.

title: MTV V.M.A. Red Carpet Fashion Arrivals
description: Updating: Beyonc; Nicki Minaj; Kim Kardashian West; and Kanye West and more fashion from one of the music industrys biggest award shows.

title: Heng on North Koreas Missile Test
description: After a test of a submarine-launched ballistic missile last week, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un claimed the United States was in striking distance.

title: An Epidemic of Dead Eyes in Kashmir as India Uses Pellet Guns on Protesters
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  The street outside is patrolled by riot police officers in camouflage, bracing for the nightly spasm of violence, but it is quiet here inside the operating room. The surgeons knife slides into an eyeball as if it were a soft fruit.

title: Four Seasons Dessert With Barry Diller
description: Dear Diary:

title: New Orleans Program Teaches Officers to Police One Another
description: NEW ORLEANS  This citys Police Department is not huge, and its past is particularly rough, so in a room of a dozen or so officers, most are going to know the bad cases all too well.

title: How to Watch Tennis: Trust Numbers, Not Eyes
description: I want you to watch the United States Open through a different lens, with an analytical eye, replacing guesswork and opinion with patterns and percentages.

title: Israel Joins Bikini Fray, Ordering Concert Singer to Cover Up
description: TEL AVIV  Even as France has started an international debate about whether some women cover up too much on the beach, Israel has gone the other way, with fresh concerns about whether some cover up too little.

title: Drop Expected in U.S. Auto Industry Sales as Labor Dept. Readies Jobs Report
description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead:

title: Florida Contests Could Tip the Congressional Balance
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  Senator Marco Rubio went down the list of political enemies and rivals like a roll-call vote: President Obama. Hillary Clinton (more Obama). Both of his possible Democratic rivals, Representatives Patrick Murphy (he has not had to struggle a single day in his life) and Alan Grayson (who frankly I dont think is well). And even Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York, whom Mr. Rubio says he wants to prevent from becoming majority leader.

title: Central Bankers Hear Plea: Turn Focus to Government Spending
description: GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK, Wyo.  Central bankers who gathered here to discuss better ways of jump-starting slow economic growth received a surprising message from their lunchtime speaker on Friday: Stop. Youre making things worse.

title: Canada, a Hockey Power, Is Embracing Tennis and Grand Slam Success
description: MONTREAL  Aleksandra Wozniak, the first woman from the province of Quebec to acquire a top-50 world ranking in tennis, grew up in Blainville, a Montreal suburb, where punishing winters worked to suppress tennis like piles of snow on a daisy.

title: Muslim Holy Day on Sept. 11? Coincidence Stirs Fears
description: Every year, Muslim leaders around the world look to the moon to predict the date for one of their most important holidays, Eid al-Adha  the feast of sacrifice.

title: Warned of a Crash, Start-Ups in Silicon Valley Narrow Their Focus
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Evernote, a Silicon Valley start-up that makes a note-taking app, was supposed to be dead by now.

title: Muslims Seek New Burial Ground, and a Small Town Balks
description: DUDLEY, Mass.  When Dr. Amjad Bahnassi, a psychiatrist who lives in the central Massachusetts city of Worcester, wants to visit his sons grave, he braces for the drive to the Muslim burial ground in Enfield, Conn., about 60 miles away. It is the nearest cemetery devoted solely to Islamic burials  and, he said, it is filling up.

title: When the Playoff Chase Severs the Bond Between Pitcher and Catcher
description: LOS ANGELES  Among the first lessons a modern baseball player learns is that the game is a business. Long before that free-agent payday, there are arbitration hearings, or maneuvers like sticking a player in the minors for a few more days to delay his free agency another year, that are seen as part of the bargain.

title: Coal Country Is Wary of Hillary Clintons Pledge to Help
description: LEBANON, Va.  As Kevin Widener was growing up on his familys tobacco farm in the rolling hills of southwest Virginia in the 1990s, lawmakers and lawyers in Washington were waging a war on smoking.

title: Juan Gabriel, a Pop Music Icon in Mexico, Dies at 66
description: Juan Gabriel, the prolific singer and songwriter who was one of Mexicos most successful musical artists, died on Sunday at his home in Santa Monica, Calif. He was 66.

title: Broadband Law Could Force Rural Residents Off Information Superhighway
description: WILSON, N.C.  On the first day of the harvest last week, a line of trucks brimming with sweet potatoes rolled into Vick Family Farms, headed for a new packing plant that runs on ultrafast internet.

title: 2 Brothers on Parole Killed Dwyane Wades Cousin, Chicago Police Say
description: CHICAGO  The police said on Sunday that two brothers, both felons on parole, were trying to shoot a driver last week when their gunshots fatally struck Nykea Aldridge, a young mother pushing a stroller on a nearby sidewalk.

title: Long Nights With Little Sleep for Homeless Families Seeking Shelter
description: On Wednesday, New York City hit a record 59,373 people in shelters overseen by the Department of Homeless Services.

title: Scramble for Postseason May Be Less Chaotic Than It Appears
description: Over the last few years, as fans have adjusted to Major League Baseballs expanded playoff format, a theme has emerged: There is almost always hope. The days of just a few teams contending for the pennant and everyone else planning for next year have become a thing of the past.

title: In Syria, Rebels Threaten Kurdish-Controlled Territory as U.S. Allies Clash
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  In a new escalation that further complicates American involvement in the Syrian war, Syrian rebels pressed deeper into the northern part of the country on Sunday, seizing territory with the aid of Turkish airstrikes.

title: Duel of Suitors Yields an M.L.S. Franchise for Minnesota
description: ST. PAUL  A David and Goliath story generally requires a David to root for, but neither side competing for the M.L.S. expansion franchise in Minnesota resembled a boy with a slingshot.

title: Darian Thompson, Giants Rookie, Emerges as Likely Starter at Free Safety
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  When he was a freshman in high school, Darian Thompson, the Giants rookie who will very likely start at free safety this season, weighed 100 pounds and stood 5 feet 10 inches.

title: Patrick Reed Wins the Barclays as Rickie Fowler Stumbles
description: FARMINGDALE, N.Y.  There has not been much lacking in Patrick Reeds 2016 season except a victory, and with a clutch performance on a sunny, warm and raucous Sunday afternoon at Bethpage Black, Reed filled in the missing link.

title: Qualifying for United States Open After Hard and Lonely Years
description: Days before the first ball is served in the first round of the United States Open on Monday, Saketh Myneni of India will have already had his big victory. On Friday, after five failed attempts to qualify for the main draw of a major tournament, Myneni finally broke through.

title: Fear the Walking Dead Season 2, Episode 9: Lessons to Be Learned
description: Safety is relative in the zombie apocalypse.

title: Comedians to Kick Off New PEN America Series for Muslim Voices
description: Where Khizr Khan led with his impassioned speech at the Democratic National Convention, a group of Muslim comedians, writers and other cultural figures will now follow, as part of a two-year series organized by PEN America aimed at broadening what PEN calls the narrow representations of Americas three million Muslims.

title: For a Little While, the MTV Video Music Awards Were Kanye Wests Show
description: Kanye West treated his free pass at this years MTV Video Music Awards  about 10 nationally televised minutes during which he could do whatever he wanted  as a victory lap.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It didnt eliminate the lack of affordable housing. It didnt eliminate poverty. It didnt eliminate domestic violence.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Shaquille ONeal in Running Wild With Bear Grylls and Charlie Wilsons War
description: Shaquille ONeal confronts Mother Nature in Running Wild With Bear Grylls. Some super-athletes begin their ascent of Mount Midoriyama in American Ninja Warrior. And Tom Hanks and Julia Roberts remind us of when politics were fun in Charlie Wilsons War.

title: Corrections: August 29, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: The Night Of Finale: In a Lonely Place
description: Back in my recap for the sixth episode, I speculated that we could be headed toward an In a Lonely Place ending, in which a mans innocence does not equal absolution. And now that weve gotten an In a Lonely Place ending, suffused with ambiguity and melancholy, its worth explaining the connection between The Night Of and the 1950 noir classic with Humphrey Bogart. (Spoilers for a 66-year-old movie ahead.)

title: Meet the Hartford Yard Goats, Now Playing Anywhere but Hartford
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  In March 2015, Hartfords soon-to-be first professional baseball team in 44 years announced to much fanfare that it would be known as the Yard Goats, an old rail yard term for an engine that switches trains between tracks.

description: Niels Ackermanns award-winning pictures capture personal stories in Ukraine.

title: Beyonc Shares V.M.A. Red Carpet With Mothers of Black Lives Matter
description: At the MTV Video Music Awards on Sunday, Beyonc made one of the few coherent political statements of the night when she invited the mothers of four black men killed in racially charged episodes to join her on the red carpet.

title: False Reports of Gunfire at LAX Airport Prompt Panic and Evacuations
description: Unconfirmed reports of gunfire at Los Angeles International Airport on Sunday caused panic in the airport and on social media as passengers fled outside and the police raced to respond.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Trump, the Insult Comic Candidate
description: Todays comedian has a cross to bear that he built himself. A comedian of the older generation did an act and he told the audience, This is my act. Todays comic is not doing an act. The audience assumes hes telling the truth.

title: Back to School With Budgets Still Tight
description: The children entering kindergarten and first grade this school year were not yet born when the Great Recession ended in mid-2009. Incoming high school seniors were not yet in middle school.

title: Donald Trumps Bigotry
description: According to recent polls, the image of Donald Trump as a bigot has begun to crystallize, and for good reason: Because its true!

title: Why Did We Stop Teaching Political History?
description: American political history, it would seem, is everywhere. Hardly a day passes without some columnist comparing Donald J. Trump to Huey Long, Father Coughlin or George Wallace. All the Way, a play about Lyndon B. Johnson, won a slew of awards and was turned into an HBO film.

title: Russia Blames Others for Its Doping Woes
description: The recent obituary of Nina Ponomareva, a discus thrower who in 1952 became the first Soviet athlete to win an Olympic gold medal, recounts how she later made a foolish mistake. On a trip to London, she was caught shoplifting some hats. To the authorities in Moscow, however, the mistake was not hers. It was all a British dirty provocation.

title: High-Rise Anxiety in New York
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio is racing to save New York as a reasonably affordable city to live in. Its a hard enough job as it is, made harder by two significant obstacles  two unpredictable, hard-to-manage phenomena.

title: States of Cruelty
description: Something terrible has happened to pregnant women in Texas: their mortality rate has doubled in recent years, and is now comparable to rates in places like Russia or Ukraine. Although researchers into this disaster are careful to say that it cant be attributed to any one cause, the death surge does coincide with the states defunding of Planned Parenthood, which led to the closing of many clinics. And all of this should be seen against the general background of Texas policy, which is extremely hostile toward anything that helps low-income residents.

title: Why We Never Die
description: As a child, I was terrified of death. It was often in the twilight hours, between the moment of lying down and the imperceptible instant of slipping off to sleep, that the terror would arise. The thought of vanishing completely from the world, of being engulfed in ineradicable darkness, would seize upon me and crush with it the very existence of the world. It was not simply that I would no longer be there. It was that reality itself would collapse, devoid of any point of apprehension. Petrified before a void so vast that it could not be contained within thought, let alone a thinking being, it was impossible to know how long it would take to drift off into the abyss that silently beckoned me.

title: Are Medical Websites Healthful?
Coming of Age in the Shadow of Chernobyl
description: PERPIGNAN, France  Niels Ackermann went to Ukraine for the first time in 2009 somewhat by accident. He yearned to photograph in Russia, but it was too expensive for his budget as a university student in his hometown, Geneva. Flights to Kiev were cheaper than to Moscow, and no visa was needed.

title: Picture Prompt | An Invention the World Needs
description: The picture above shows the Transit Elevated Bus, a bus so large, high and long that it can move above busy streets.

title: Australian Aid Worker Who Was Abducted in Afghanistan Is Released
description: SYDNEY, Australia  An Australian aid worker who was kidnapped in Afghanistan and held for four months has been released and is doing well, Australias foreign minister, Julie Bishop, said on Monday.

description: Article: Court Overturns Burkini Ban in French Town

description: If you follow the United States Open, youre going to be hearing a lot in the next two weeks about the new roof on the Arthur Ashe Stadium.

description: Which statements caused Republicans to bail on Donald Trump.

title: If You Miss a Train in France, You May Catch a Tune Instead
description: You dash through a crowded railway station, tripping over bags, spilling your coffee, only to have the doors slide shut in your face, leaving you breathless and sweating on the platform as the train pulls away.

title: Morning Agenda: Silicon Valley Heeds Warnings of Apocalypse
description: Here we sit, a year after we were supposed to die,  Chris ONeill, chief executive of Evernote.

title: 5 Standout Moments From the 2016 V.M.A.s
description: The MTV Video Music Awards are mostly concerned with minting moments, not winners. But this year, even with some of pops biggest names on the same stage, the moments were in short supply (save for the 16 of them the show turned over to Beyonc). Most striking was what was absent: tributes to Prince and David Bowie; big political statements about the major parties candidates for president; controversial interactions  orchestrated or not  between the assembled glitterati. At the end of the nearly three-hour show, just five performances, speeches and proclamations of love held our attention.

title: Noah Hawley on a Thriller in Which Thomas Edison and George Westinghouse Face Off

title: A Book Examines the Curious Case of a Man Whose Memory Was Removed
description: PATIENT H.M.A Story of Memory, Madness, and Family SecretsBy Luke Dittrich440 pp. Random House. $28.

title: Edible Sunscreens Are All the Rage, but No Proof They Work
description: Every morning before Scott Kyle, a 53-year-old competitive sailor from San Clemente, Calif., hits the water, he chugs an orange-flavored beverage named UVO, a drinkable sunscreen intended to fight off sunburn from the inside out.

title: For a Perfect Catch in Seattle, Fishmongers Go for the Halibut
description: SEATTLE  The catch of the day has a couple of meanings to Mike Kirn, who works at Pike Place Fish Market. If youre talking fork, plate and a nice dill sauce, he puts his money on white king salmon. But when he is trying to catch one in midair, with hundreds of people clustered around to watch  not an unusual amount on a touristy afternoon  halibut, Mr. Kirn says, is the fish without equal.

title: Cow Dung Goes High Design
description: THE DAIRY FARMER Gianantonio Locatelli climbed up the steel ladder and peered over the brim of a large corrugated vat, about the size of a very deep above-ground swimming pool. Its full! he exclaimed, with warbling joy. Its beautiful!

description: Matthew Ahn has set a new record for the fastest time to travel to all New York City subway stations  21 hours, 28 minutes and 14 seconds. We rode along with him for his record-breaking trip.

description: Updated, 9:50 a.m.

title: Harnessing the Firenado
description: A new, blue, whirling shape of fire, inspired by bourbon, could one day help clean up oil spills.

title: New Form of Fire, Inspired by Bourbon, Might Help With Oil Spills
description: A small blue flame, circulating in a vortex called a fire whirl, could become an important tool in oil spill cleanup, according to the scientists who created it. And they give bourbon credit for inspiring the research.

title: Suicide Attack Kills Scores of Military Recruits in Aden, Yemen
description: CAIRO  A powerful car bomb rocked the southern port city of Aden, Yemen, on Monday morning, killing at least 54 young military recruits who were preparing to join government forces and wounding scores, officials said.

title: Rethinking the Use of Hormones to Ease Menopause Symptoms
description: Ever since the large government study called the Womens Health Initiative found a number of risks associated with menopause hormones, millions of women who are in or near menopause have been weathering hot flashes and other symptoms on their own. But now, new research suggests that the benefits of short-term hormone treatment to control life-disrupting menopausal symptoms outweigh the risks  as long as the treatment is started at or near menopause.

title: Facekini-Wearing Chinese Stand Up for the Right to Bare Nothing
description: Before burkinis made global headlines, there was Chinas facekini.

title: Surprisingly Little Evidence for the Accepted Wisdom About Teeth
description: I brush my teeth twice a day, but not for as long as my dentist would like. Id like to say I floss regularly, but that would be stretching the truth. I dont scrape my tongue, I dont rinse with mouthwash and I dont use an interdental brush or Waterpik. However, I have one filling in my mouth, and I got that only when I had braces as an adult 15 years ago.

title: Trump and Clinton Have Knots to Untangle Before Labor Day
description: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton will enter the week before Labor Day trading barbs over racism, transparency and scandals.

title: The Trump-Farage Road Show
description: In case you missed it, a significant political event took place last week in Jackson, Miss., where Donald Trump joined forces with Nigel Farage, the anti-immigrant leader of the successful campaign to take Britain out of the European Union.

title: Man Thought to Be Chinas Jack the Ripper Is Arrested
description: HONG KONG  Gao Chengyong led a quiet life in a small city in western China. A onetime migrant laborer, he raised two boys who went to college. He enjoyed ballroom dancing with his wife.

title: With Uzbekistans Ruler Gravely Ill, Questions Arise on Succession
description: MOSCOW  The authoritarian president of Uzbekistan, Islam Karimov, who has ruled the isolated Central Asian country for more than 25 years using old Soviet methods like forced labor for cotton harvesting, has been hospitalized with a stroke, his younger daughter announced  Monday on Facebook.

title: Mylan Tries Again to Quell Pricing Outrage by Offering Generic EpiPen
description: In its latest move to quell outrage over its price increases, the maker of the EpiPen has resorted to an unusual tactic  introducing a generic version of its own product.
