description: Dear Diary,

title: A Valet Who Parks Dogs
description: Dear Diary:

title: U.S. Funding for Fighting Zika Virus Is Nearly Spent, C.D.C. Says
description: WASHINGTON  The director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warned on Tuesday that federal funds to fight the Zika virus were nearly exhausted, and that if Congress did not replenish them soon, there would be no money to fight a new outbreak.

title: Crickets, Snakes, Crabs: A Mix of Fact and Fraud in New Yorks Subway
description: Perhaps youve heard the saying, You cant make this stuff up.

title: Jared Donaldson, Unlikeliest of American Teenagers, Advances at the U.S. Open
description: When the mens singles draw for the United States Open was announced last week, there was great disappointment in the American tennis community because four of the most promising young American men were paired off against one another.

title: 10 Kayakers Rescued From Hudson River After Collision With Ferry
description: Ten kayakers were rescued after five of them were injured in a collision with a ferry on the Hudson River near West 39th Street on Tuesday, the authorities said.

title: Marco Rubio and John McCain Win Primaries in Florida and Arizona
description: MIAMI  Senators Marco Rubio of Florida and John McCain of Arizona brushed off primary challenges on Tuesday from Republican contenders.

title: Jaime Davidovich, Artist Whose Videos Bypassed the Gatekeepers of Culture, Dies at 79
description: Jaime Davidovich, an Argentine-born conceptual artist who brought the downtown New York art scene to television viewers in the early 1980s on his cable-access program The Live! Show, died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 79.

title: Stumping for Hillary Clinton, Obama Will Urge His Supporters to Get Out the Vote
description: WASHINGTON  One of President Obamas top priorities during his last months in office is to help make sure that Hillary Clinton succeeds him. To do so, the president will make at least a dozen campaign appearances in battleground states from now to Election Day on Nov. 8.

title: Tim Tebow Digs In, Trying to Convince Scouts and Skeptics
description: LOS ANGELES  If there were doubts about the seriousness of Tim Tebows latest career twist, he turned over the palms of his hands, which were calloused, blistered and crimson  a result of swing after swing after swing of a baseball bat.

title: Fact-Checking Apples Claims on E.U. Tax Ruling
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Timothy D. Cook, Apples chief executive, issued a defiant letter to his European customers on Tuesday after the regions antitrust enforcer ordered Ireland to collect 13 billion euros, or about $14.5 billion, in back taxes from the company.

title: The Magic Formulas Behind the Set Lists at Afropunk Fest
description: Before there was Afropunk Fest, there was Afro-Punk  the 2003 documentary from James Spooner that helped open up a conversation about where race, identity and punk music intersect. The festival  a weekend gathering at Commodore Barry Park in Fort Greene, Brooklyn  came two years later, after Mr. Spooner joined Matthew Morgan, a music industry self-starter, in an effort to put a spotlight on black music and art that often falls outside of the mainstream.

title: Left for Dead, Royals Revive on a Wing and a Praying Insect
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Billy Burns was here when everything changed for the Kansas City Royals, the night they morphed from perennial losers into the vampires of baseball.

title: House Panel Investigating Troubled V.A. Hospital on Long Island
description: The House Veterans Affairs Committee is investigating the beleaguered Northport Veterans Affairs Medical Center and will hold a field hearing on Long Island next month, a committee staff member said on Tuesday.

title: Apple, Congress and the Missing Taxes
description: Apple and the United States are crying foul over the ruling in Europe that Apple received illegal tax breaks from Ireland and must hand over 13 billion euros ($14.5 billion), a record tax penalty in Europe.

title: A Fans Gifts Give Yoenis Cespedes a Lift
description: Before Yoenis Cespedess first game back from the disabled list on Aug. 19 in San Francisco, he received a gift: a blue stuffed animal, a little dragon. Joyce Wilson, an Oakland Athletics season-ticketholder, gave Cespedes the present. Cespedes, the Mets star outfielder, does not know her name, but he does, in a real sense, know who she is.

title: Christie Vetoes Minimum Wage Bill, Calling Raise to $15 Really Radical
description: When it comes to the subject of raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour, the gulf between the governors of New Jersey and New York is much wider than the Hudson River.

title: De Blasio Donor Violated City Rules, Conflicts Board Says
description: After having donated the maximum amount to Mayor Bill de Blasios election campaign, plus thousands more to help the mayor in a runoff that never happened, a Manhattan law firm partner was given a seat on the New York City Water Board.

title: Critics Say North Carolina Is Curbing Black Vote. Again.
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N.C.  When a federal appeals court overturned much of North Carolinas sweeping 2013 election law last month, saying it had been deliberately intended to discourage African-Americans from voting, something else was tossed out as well:  the ground rules for this years elections in a critical swing state. In each of the states 100 counties, local elections boards scheduled new hearings and last week filed the last of their new election rules with the state.

title: Colin Kaepernicks Anthem Protest Underlines Union of Sports and Patriotism
description: The pressing question for many viewers tuning in to a preseason football game on Thursday night will be whether San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick will once more refuse to stand for the national anthem.

title: For Christian Harrison, Just Playing in the Open Is the Biggest Victory
description: Twelve games into his third ATP Tour match and Grand Slam tournament debut, Christian Harrison won one. The modest crowd let out a roar that was well overdue.

title: Antidoping Authorities From 17 Nations Push for a Series of Reforms
description: With the Rio Olympics having barely concluded, antidoping authorities from 17 countries met in Copenhagen this week and pushed ahead with a series of proposals, including one that would prohibit any antidoping employee from having an overlapping leadership role in international sports.

title: Does Killing Terrorist Leaders Make Any Difference? Scholars Are Doubtful
description: WASHINGTON  It seems obvious: Killing terrorist leaders should weaken their organizations, depriving those groups of strategic direction and ideological appeal. The death of someone like Abu Muhammad al-Adnani, a senior Islamic State figure reported killed on Tuesday in Syria, should seem like a significant setback for the group.

title: James Cronin, Who Explained Why Matter Survived the Big Bang, Dies at 84
description: James W. Cronin, a physicist who shared a Nobel Prize for repudiating a fundamental principle of physics and explaining why the universe survived the Big Bang with anything in it, died on Thursday in St. Paul. He was 84.

title: Singer Chris Brown Arrested After Standoff at His Los Angeles Home
description: The trouble-prone R&B singer Chris Brown was arrested by the Los Angeles police on Tuesday and charged with assault with a deadly weapon after an hourslong standoff with the police outside his Los Angeles-area home, a police spokeswoman said.

title: Use This Sparingly
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  If my parents leave me any kind of a legacy, it will most likely be Waste not, want not. My father in particular encouraged a humorous kind of thriftiness, where he would bestow upon me some new material possession  a pair of shoes, lets say  and then sit me down to calculate approximately how long they would last if I only used them a certain number of times a week. Or walked lighter in them. Or wore them on my hands instead of my feet.

title: Serena Williams Prevails in Opener, No Problem
description: All the worries over Serena Williamss right shoulder and concerns about her difficult first-round opponent seemed to vanish in a little over an hour Tuesday, as Williams let the rest of the womens field know that despite the alarms, she is in very good form.

title: Patchwork Mets Give Their Playoff Hopes a Boost
description: Nothing has been easy about this Mets season. Each day has meant more injuries and the increased juggling of an aching roster. Tuesday brought discouraging news about starting pitcher Steven Matz and second baseman Neil Walker.

title: Donald Trump to Visit Mexico After More Than a Year of Mocking It
description: Donald J. Trump will visit Mexico on Wednesday for a private meeting with President Enrique Pea Nieto  a trip that will take him to a nation he has repeatedly scorned  before quickly flying back for what is billed as a major immigration speech in Arizona.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If Id have known the dirt had lead, he wouldnt have been out there playing in it.

title: Day 2 at the U.S. Open
description: A full day and night of matches at the U.S.T.A. Billie Jean King National Tennis Center.

title: Japanese Government Urges Another Increase in Military Spending
description: TOKYO  The government of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is requesting another increase in spending on Japans armed forces, with a plan to expand missile defenses that would test the nations commitment to pacifism and escalate a regional arms race with China and North Korea.

title: Giants Are Said to Re-Sign Tackle Will Beatty
Corrections: August 31, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Youre the Worst and Gene Wilders Willy Wonka
description: You can pay tribute to Gene Wilder, who died on Monday, by streaming classics like Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory and Blazing Saddles. Meanwhile, Four Weddings and a Funeral arrives on the new Starz app. And the addled soul mates at the heart of Youre the Worst return for a third season.

title: North Korea Has Executed a Deputy Premier, Seoul Reports
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, has executed his deputy premier for education and purged two other senior officials, sending them to re-education camps, the South Korean government said on Wednesday.

title: U.S. Reaches Goal of Admitting 10,000 Syrian Refugees. Heres Where They Went.
description: Where Syrian refugees have settled in the United States.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | chameleon
description: chameleon  \k-mel-yn\  noun

title: Yankees Eke Out a Win in the Tenth Inning at Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The top two hitters in the Yankees lineup reached base nine times Tuesday at Kauffman Stadium. That is usually a winning formula, and the result reflected that: a 5-4 Yankees win over the Kansas City Royals in 10 innings. But it was a slog.

title: In the Mediterranean: Leisure and Landscapes, Crisis and Conflict
description: Nick Hanness fascination with the Mediterranean led him to traverse the region making pictures whose details spoke metaphorically about the political and economic upheaval of recent years.

title: The Real Clinton Foundation Revelation
description: When I was the chief White House ethics lawyer for President George W. Bush, I asked many prospective administration officials if they would sell stock in companies, give up stock options, step down from nonprofit boards or make other painful choices to enter public service. Some balked. I told them that someone more important than I was, perhaps the president or the White House chief of staff, would ask them, Do you want this job or dont you?

title: Ballot Measures: American Direct Democracy at Work
description: Middleton, Wis.  Throughout our nations history, citizens and legislators alike have used ballot measures to shape public policy and public opinion in the states. This process of direct democracy has often proved more effective than the customary actions of a party, politician, interest group or deep-pocketed donor at addressing some of the most divisive topics in our history: including suffrage, prohibition, gay rights, the death penalty and marijuana.

title: Win, Lose, but No Compromise
description: Anyone who says it doesnt matter whether Donald Trump or Hillary Clinton wins this election needs their head examined. The damage that Trump could do to our nation with his blend of intellectual laziness, towering policy ignorance and reckless impulsiveness is in a league of its own. Hillary has some real personal ethics issues she needs to confront, but shes got the chops to be president.

title: Neighbors Question Cuba Migration Policy
description: Nine Latin American governments this week called on the United States to end its preferential immigration policy for Cubans, calling it discriminatory and a boon to human smuggling networks in the region.

title: My Paralympic Blues
description: The woman to my left wants to know what happened to me.

title: In the Mediterranean: Leisure and Landscapes, Crisis and Conflict
description: Coincidence is a hallmark of Nick Hanness work, even though he isnt always sure how, where or even if it will manifest.

title: Picture Prompt | Parenting
description: This image went with a recent review of a book that suggests children learn more if their parents back off and just let them play, learn and discover at their own pace.

title: Frances Burkini Debate Reverberates Around the World
description: LONDON  The burkini has become perhaps the most potent symbol in Frances long-running battle over its vaunted secular identity. This summers heated debate over bans on the full-body swimwear by beach towns on the French Riviera has reverberated around the world, with widely different reactions.

title: Living in Riverside, Conn.
description: This neighborhood in the town of Greenwich, Conn., is largely residential, with houses closer to Long Island Sound fetching higher prices.

title: Riverside, Conn.: Coastal Beauty for a Price
description: The Greenwich, Conn., neighborhood of Riverside, so named because the Mianus River forms its western border down to Long Island Sound, is really two neighborhoods when it comes to home prices. Interstate 95 is the dividing line, as it cuts across Riverside, and the section to the south, closer to the Sound and the rail station, has the higher prices.

title: Letter of Recommendation: The Useless Machine
description: On the lower left-hand corner of my desk sits a wooden box, roughly the size and shape of a smallish jewelry case and featureless save for a small metal switch on its uppermost surface. From time to time over the course of my workday, I reach out to flick this switch, and a hatch opens at the top of the box, and a small fingerlike projection, driven by a whirring motor within, emerges and pushes the switch back into its original position. Having been switched on, this machine has now fulfilled its sole function of switching itself off again.

title: Whoopi Goldberg Wants to Make You Feel Better
description: Youve been the moderator of The View since 2007, where you have been known to share the occasional provocative opinion, including that Bill Cosby should be considered innocent until proven guilty, which you later walked back. Do you consider the Roger Ailes case similarly? I used to think that innocent until proven guilty was the American way. But now social media makes that decision for you. People are at a disadvantage in a way that they werent before; you dont really seem to be able to have your own opinion about something. I believe strongly that we should always encourage women to say something, so that if its true, you can prove it and get somebody off the street, and if its not, clear them and move on.

title: Scheduled Flights to Cuba From U.S. Begin Again, Now With Jet Engines
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla.  Amid live Cuban music, fresh guava pastries and a water cannon salute, the first scheduled passenger jet service in history between Cuba and the United States began on Wednesday with a 9:45 flight from here to Santa Clara, east of Havana.

title: Never the Noodles Shall Meet: A Chinese Treaty Is Tested
description: Amid the modern skyscrapers of Shanghai, the parties to a time-honored treaty are at war.

title: Once a Bucknell Professor, Now the Commander of an Ethiopian Rebel Army
description: Berhanu Nega was once one of Bucknell Universitys most popular professors. An Ethiopian exile with a Ph.D. from the New School for Social Research in Manhattan, he taught one of the economics departments most sought-after electives, African Economic Development. When he wasnt leading seminars or puttering around his comfortable home in a wooded neighborhood five minutes from the Bucknell campus in rural Lewisburg, Pa., Nega traveled abroad for academic conferences and lectured on human rights at the European Parliament in Brussels. He was very much concerned with the relationship between democracy and development, says John Rickard, an English professor who became one of his close friends. He argued that you cannot have viable economic development without democratization, and vice versa. A gregarious and active figure on campus, he rooted for the Philadelphia Eagles and the Cleveland Cavaliers, campaigned door-to-door for Barack Obama in 2008 and was known as one of the best squash players on the Bucknell faculty. He and his wife, an Ethiopian-born optometrist, raised two sons and sent them to top-ranked colleges, the University of Pennsylvania and Carnegie Mellon. On weekends he sometimes hosted dinners for other Bucknell professors and their families, regaling them with stories about Abyssinian culture and history over Ethiopian food he would prepare himself; he imported the spices from Addis Ababa and made the injera, a spongy sourdough bread made of teff flour, by hand.

title: Should a Teacher at a Sketchy College Help Recruit Students?
description: I am a professor at a university that has experienced serious financial problems in the last five years. As a result, our university has brought in a number of consultants, many of whom work largely for for-profit universities. In response to their advice, the university has significantly shifted its profile, its mission and its ways of doing business. In short, we now accept everyone who applies to the school, and professors and administrators have been strong-armed into passing almost everyone, regardless of how shoddy their work is. I am embarrassed that people are being issued degrees and sent into the work force without the prerequisite skills to do their jobs.

title: Busy Schedule? Some College Football Games Give Fans More Than a Decade to Plan
description: Major League Baseball announces every teams schedule each year about seven months before the season begins. The N.F.L. does it roughly five months in advance, and the N.B.A. waits until just a few months before the opening tip.

title: Court Costs Entrap Nonwhite, Poor Juvenile Offenders
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  When Dequan Jackson had his only brush with the law, at 13, he tried to do everything right.

title: Jets, Looking for a Hail Mary, Could Keep a Fourth Quarterback
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Eric Mangini was working as an assistant with New England in 2000 when the Patriots bucked convention in setting their roster: They kept four quarterbacks. Rather than try to sneak the fourth, a rookie sixth-round draft pick, through waivers to stash him on their practice squad, the Patriots held a spot for him.

title: Lead Tests on New York City Schools Water May Have Masked Scope of Risk
description: When the results of tests for lead in the water at more than 1,500 New York City school buildings were announced in July, officials said that fewer than 1 percent of all the samples taken showed lead concentrations that exceeded Environmental Protection Agency guidelines. Given other safety measures in place, officials assured parents, the water was safe to drink.

title: Making House: Notes on Domesticity
description: A woman once told me about a visit she made with her husband to an oncologist, to receive the results of his biopsy. She was perhaps in her late 60s, a grandmother, married for 40-odd years. They were kept waiting for a long time, a tense interlude in which she occupied herself with the question of how she would redesign the waiting room if it had to become their permanent home. She had created domestic spaces for so many years, she said, that such thoughts had become a sort of mental tic, a reflexive action she performed to soothe herself. By the time she had resolved the various problems of insufficient light, wrongly positioned doorways and an institutional style of dcor, the wait was over and they were called in for their appointment  where, thankfully, she said, the news was better than expected.

title: His Movie, Her Job and Their Relationship
description: Often these days it can be hard to distinguish between a film festival and a fashion week: Both are rife with models, gowns, celebrities, brands and posing.

title: Harley Flanagan, Original New York Punker, Finds His Mellower Side
description: Harley Flanagan is a New York legend. Just ask him.

title: Article of the Day | With Dogs, Its What You Say  and How You Say It
description: Article: With Dogs, Its What You Say  and How You Say It

title: Sergei Loznitsas Movie Austerlitz Observes Tourists in Concentration Camps
description: Seventy years later, the Holocaust continues to pose a challenge for filmmakers. Dramas like Son of Saul emerge with fresh formal experiments, while older works like Shoah endure as authoritative historical records.

title: Une Vie Brings a Guy de Maupassant Novel to the Screen, at Last
description: After more than a decade of filmmaking that won critical plaudits but little broad recognition, the French film director Stphane Briz shot into the public eye last year with La loi du march (The Measure of a Man), which won the best actor award for Vincent Lindon at the 2015 Cannes International Film Festival, and big audiences in France.

title: Venice Film Festival Commits to Diversification
description: The Venice Film Festival has something of a split personality. Each year, some of the most anticipated films of the fall season from high-profile directors are rolled out alongside small, often obscure debuts that await discover.

title: A Novels Exiles Flee North Korea: Now What?
description: HOW I BECAME A NORTH KOREANBy Krys Lee246 pp. Viking. $26.

title: The End of Intervention: Two Books Explore the American Catastrophe in the Middle East
description: THE MIRROR TESTAmerica at War in Iraq and AfghanistanBy J. Kael WestonIllustrated. 585 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $28.95.

title: Eschewing a Vegan Lifestyle at Home, but Still Embracing It at Work
description: LOS ANGELES  They built an empire peddling vegan living, selling salads and serenity at healthy restaurants in California. But their views on the food chain evolved and, in the end, karma knocked.

title: Donald Trump, Apple, Serena Williams: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Hillary Clinton, Swiping at Donald Trump, Argues U.S. Is Vital World Leader
description: CINCINNATI  Hillary Clinton offered a vigorous case on Wednesday for Americas place as a singular and vital leader in the world, outlining an approach to global affairs that differs sharply from the America First posture espoused by Donald J. Trump.

title: How to See London Theater on the Cheap
description: We stepped out into a drizzly London evening on St. Martins Lane in the heart of the citys West End. I had decided to treat my mom, an obsessive Game of Thrones watcher, to an afternoon performance of Doctor Faustus at the Duke of Yorks Theater, starring the inveterate heartthrob Kit Harington.

title: Five Places to Go in Austin
description: For years, Burnet Road in Austin was mostly seen as a tatty stretch of car repair shops, old-school food joints, gas stations and derelict businesses. But the well-trafficked major thoroughfare, about 15 minutes from downtown, is becoming a hot spot in this fast-growing city, with sleek, amenity-filled condos and sparkling new outposts for up-and-coming and already proven Austin restaurants. Youll still find used car lots and lighting stores on Burnet Road, but the strip is evolving. Its symbolic of the new Austin, said Eric Silverstein, founder of the Peached Tortilla, a food truck operation that opened its first restaurant on the street in 2014.

title: In Boulder, Where Inner Peace Meets Outer Beauty
description: My cultural pilgrimage to the Rocky Mountains began more than 20 years ago, a few steps from my door in the East Village of Manhattan. The poet Allen Ginsberg was staging one of the regular readings at St. Marks Church in-the-Bowery, featuring his Buddhist-inspired verse. As he fielded queries after the reading, he mentioned that he was decamping to teach at something called the Jack Kerouac School of Disembodied Poetics in, of all places, Boulder, Colo.

title: Beyond Wonka: They Want Every Kid to Know Roald Dahls World
description: LONDON  The gray doorway in the Marylebone neighborhood here is unmarked, but for 11 words spelled out across the top rail: The greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places.

title: New York Today: Empire State of Dairy
description: Updated, 10:29 a.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Timothy Cooks Tax Arguments, Troncs Just Say No Defense, Alphabet Drives Onto Ubers Turf
description: Its just a drop in the bucket for Apple, with its cash pile of more than $230 billion. But the company nonetheless described the ruling by Europe that Ireland should recoup 10 years worth of back taxes, or about $14.5 billion, as a devastating blow to the rule of law.

title: Marc Riboud, Photojournalist Who Found Grace in the Turbulent, Dies at 93
description: Marc Riboud, the celebrated French photojournalist who captured moments of grace even in the most fraught situations around the world, died in Paris on Tuesday. He was 93.

title: Political Tension Between China and South Korea Intrudes on a Fierce Rivalry
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The term Koreaphobia was coined in China and is used with relish in Seoul. It does not refer to the recent political tension between the two neighbors but to the struggles that Chinas soccer team has had when facing South Korea.

title: Democrats Edge in Voter Registration Is Declining, but Looks Can Be Deceiving
description: With Donald J. Trump behind in the polls, one apparent sign of hope for Republicans is the dwindling Democratic advantage in voter registration, particularly in battleground states like Florida and Pennsylvania.

title: Obama Begins His Final Asia Trip as President
description: President Obama leaves on Wednesday for his final trip in office to the other side of the world, heading to China and Laos after a brief stop on a spit of land in the middle of the Pacific Ocean.

title: What Kids Wish Their Teachers Knew
description: When Kyle Schwartz started teaching third grade at Doull Elementary School in Denver, she wanted to get to know her students better. She asked them to finish the sentence I wish my teacher knew.

title: An Attack on Afghanistans Future
description: WASHINGTON  On the morning of Aug. 24, I awoke to a nightmare that had become a reality. The American University of Afghanistan  an oasis of intellect, education and optimism in the heart of Kabul  was under attack.

title: Chappatte on Turkeys Military Operation in Syria
description: Turkey sent tanks, warplanes and special operations forces into northern Syria last week.

title: Long Island Expressway Crash in Queens Kills 3 and Injures Others
description: Three people were killed and at least 10 more were injured on Wednesday when several vehicles collided on the Long Island Expressway in Queens, which led to a shutdown of several lanes during part of the morning rush, the police said.

title: Not Forgotten: Princess Diana, Who Was Beloved, Yet Troubled by Her Crown
description: Princess Diana, whose title and troubles made her a symbol of a nations emotional and generational conflicts, died on Aug. 31, 1997.

title: Canada to Join China-Led Bank, Signaling Readiness to Bolster Ties
description: BEIJING  Canada said on Wednesday that it had applied to join Chinas version of the World Bank, breaking with previous leaders who had shared United States officials skepticism of the new Beijing-led lender.

title: Deutsche Bank C.E.O. Calls for More European Bank Mergers
description: LONDON  The chief executive of Deutsche Bank on Wednesday called for more consolidation in the banking industry in Germany  and across Europe  and action by central banks as the regions lenders struggle to navigate an environment of historically low interest rates.

title: $900,000 Homes in Maryland, Arkansas and Idaho
description: BALTIMORE

title: What You Get for ... $900,000
description: A brick townhouse in Baltimore, a house in Arkansas and a cabin in Idaho.

title: Yesterday, Outraged by Apples Tax Dodge. Today, by Its Tax Bill.
description: WASHINGTON  American lawmakers have for years been assailing companies for dodging taxes with overseas maneuvers. But now that the European Union has done something about it by trying to wrest billions of dollars from Apple, those officials have offered a response viewed by many as rife with hypocrisy: collective outrage.

title: 1966: Russia Bars Kennedy Findings
description: MOSCOW  The Soviet Union told the U.S. embassy here to stop distributing a Russian-language text of the Warren Commission report on the assassination of President Kennedy, an embassy spokesman said today [Aug. 31]. The spokesman said the Foreign Ministry called the report slanderous to the Soviet people and said its distribution here was improper and inadmissible. The embassy asked the Foreign Ministry to reconsider the ban.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 1, 1966

title: Reader Idea | New York Times Virtual Reality in the Classroom
description: Using virtual reality, or VR, in the classroom can help students learn about the world in a powerful new way, says Cayne Letizia.

title: House Hunting in ... the Bahamas
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM HOME WITH A POOL ON A CANAL

title: A Four-Bedroom Home With a Pool on a Canal
description: On the island of New Providence, the house, in the gated development of Old Fort Bay, is on the market for $3,800,000.

title: In Afghanistans Farm Belt, Women Lead Unions and Find New Status
description: SHIBAR, Afghanistan  In this lush farm belt deep in central Afghanistan, women have been the organizing force behind a new wave of small village farm unions.

title: Vicente Fox, Ex-President of Mexico, Scoffs at Donald Trumps Visit
description: Donald J. Trump is heading to Mexico on Wednesday to meet with President Enrique Pea Nieto, but one of the Mexican leaders predecessors had a different message for the Republican presidential nominee: You are not welcome here.

title: 2 Months After Brexit Vote, Britains Push to Leave E.U. Is a Muddle
description: LONDON  Since Britains vote in June to quit the European Union, its government has promised repeatedly to make a success of withdrawal, known as Brexit.

title: An Attempt for One More Appeal in the N.F.L. Concussion Case
description: Lawyers for the former running back Cookie Gilchrist have asked the Supreme Court to hear their appeal of a concussion-related settlement between the N.F.L. and all retired players that is worth hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Stranger Things, TVs Summer Hit, to Return in 2017
description: Netflixs hit series Stranger Things is coming back for a second season.

title: Looking for a New Job? These Free Apps Can Help
description: IN a volatile economy, many Americans are on the job hunt. But with the days of scanning the classifieds in a newspaper long behind us, one of the best ways to find a new gig is with the help of an app.

title: A Hollywood Agency Opens an Art Space, but It Wont Function Like a Gallery
description: LOS ANGELES  Ever since the art lawyer Joshua Roth joined United Talent Agency in early 2015 to start its first fine art division, gallery owners have wondered if the giant Hollywood agency would encroach on their business.

title: Q. and A.: Andy Murray on Life Atop Tennis
description: For a fifth year, The New York Times is speaking to Andy Murray after his matches at the United States Open, where he broke through for his first Grand Slam title in 2012.

title: Chinese School With Mass Illness Is Deemed Safe, but Many Doubt Findings
description: BEIJING  The prestigious school in eastern China that  became the focus of national outrage last spring after nearly 500 students fell ill has been tested and classified as environmentally safe, the city government of Changzhou has said.

title: U.S. Open Today: Milos Raonic and Garbie Muguruza Lose; Roof Closes
description: Ryan Harrison, a onetime top prospect as a teenager, earned the biggest win of his life at age 24 by defeating a hobbled Milos Raonic, 6-7 (4), 7-5, 7-5, 6-1, on Wednesday to reach the third round of the United States Open.

title: Bronx Museum Names New Board Leaders After Resignations
description: Following the abrupt resignation last week of its top trustees, the Bronx Museum of the Arts on Wednesday announced two interim appointments  Joseph Mizzi as interim chairman and Joan Krevlin as a vice chairwoman. (Marilyn Greene continues to serve as the other vice chairwoman.)

title: As Brock Turner Is Set to Be Freed Friday, California Bill Aims for Harsher Penalties for Sexual Assault
description: Days before the scheduled release of a former Stanford University student from jail on Friday after serving three months for sexual assault, California lawmakers voted to close what they called a sentencing loophole by mandating harsher penalties for similar assaults.

title: Highlights of Donald Trumps Immigration Speech and Mexico Trip
description: Donald Trump, in his much-anticipated speech on immigration in Phoenix on Wednesday, pressed his hard-line approach to illegal immigration, even as he backed off a previous pledge to forcibly remove 11 million immigrants here illegally.

title: Suspicions Confirmed: Couple Faked Photographs in Everest Climb
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Mountaineers were dubious in June, when Dinesh and Tarakeshwari Rathod announced that they had achieved a lifelong goal, becoming the first Indian couple to climb to the summit of Mount Everest.

title: Cooking Without Recipes
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Seeing Orange: What Caught Commenters Eyes About a Small Syrian Boy in a Big Chair
description: When Craig Allen and his fellow New York Times photo editors attempted to articulate why the image of Omran Daqneesh  the 5-year-old Syrian boy sitting shell-shocked in the back of an ambulance  stood out among all the other recent images of children in war-torn areas, Times Insiders from around the world were moved to offer their own insights and interpretations.

title: 1941: Nazis Expel 200,000 in France
description: VICHY  Dr. Ernst, Nazi commissioner for the German-occupied city of Strasbourg, boasted recently in a speech at a meeting of the German Academy in that city more than 100,000 Frenchmen and Jews have been expelled from Alsace since the armistice last year, according to the current issue of Le Lorrain, the weekly organ of the refugees from Alsace and Lorraine who are in unoccupied France. Last week [Aug. 25] an editorial in the same periodical placed the number of Frenchmen exiled by the Nazis from their ancestral homes in Lorraine in the same period as also more than 100,000. Coupling these figures, one arrives at a total of 200,000 Frenchmen who have been driven from Alsace-Lorraine within the last year.  New York Herald Tribune, Sept. 1, 1941

title: Obama to Guest-Edit Wired Magazine
description: It is perhaps only fitting that a president who rose to power by harnessing the internet would guest-edit one of the nations leading technology and science magazines on the way out.

title: Daily Report: Uber and Google, Ride-Sharing Frenemies
description: Silicon Valley is a bit like junior high school. Sometimes friends become enemies. Enemies become friends. And frenemies stay somewhere in between  just dont share a secret with them.

title: Restoring That Email You Just Deleted Accidentally
description: Q. On the iPhone, is there a way to quickly get a message back in your inbox that you accidentally trashed when new mail was downloading?

title: When Donald Met Melania, Paolo Was There
description: A couple of weekends ago, Paolo Zampolli received a text message from Melania Trump, the wife of the Republican candidate for president, urging him to give her a call. The next day, Mr. Zampolli, a former modeling agent who had discovered the Slovene 20 years ago in Milan, listened as Ms. Trump expressed anguish over a gossipy report in the British tabloid The Daily Mail accusing her and Mr. Zampolli of operating an escort service in the 1990s.

title: Marc Riboud | 1923-2016
description: Marc Riboud captured moments of grace even in the most fraught situations around the world.

title: Video Games Allow Characters More Varied Sexual Identities
description: In the popular simulation game The Sims, players have long been able to create male and female characters  but only up to a point. That changed this year.

title: Mexicans Accuse President of Historic Error in Welcoming Donald Trump
description: MEXICO CITY  If President Enrique Pea Nieto invited Donald J. Trump to visit Mexico for a dialogue in the interest of democracy, the message has fallen on deaf ears.

title: Dilma Rousseff Is Ousted as Brazils President in Impeachment Vote
description: BRASLIA  The Senate on Wednesday impeached Dilma Rousseff, Brazils first female president, and removed her from office for the rest of her term, the capstone of a power struggle that has consumed the nation for months and toppled one of the hemispheres most powerful political parties.

title: Russia Claims Credit for Killing Senior ISIS Leader in Syria
description: MOSCOW  The Russian military said on Wednesday that its warplanes had carried out a strike in Syria that killed up to 40 Islamic State militants, including Abu Muhammad al-Adnani, the groups senior strategist and spokesman who was heavily involved in planning attacks overseas.

title: Transparency on the Supreme Court
description: To the Editor:

title: Putting Profits Over Safety
description: To the Editor:

title: A Celebrity Z-List? Yes, It Exists
description: When Sofia Richie chopped her hair and visited a doctors office recently, Us Weekly was there. Not to be outdone, People heralded Mindy McKnight as the voice for millennial moms. And In Touch offered an adorable picture of Sarah Wright Olsens infant napping next to a plush rabbit.

title: See Hamilton (Sort Of) for Cheap
description: Youve seen the musical, now see the spoof. Thats the formula used by Gerard Alessandrini for his long-running Forbidden Broadway revues, which poke merry if sometimes merciless fun at hit shows. But with Mr. Alessandrinis new Spamilton, perhaps another formulation might be more apt: You cant see the musical, so see the spoof.

title: Worlds Oldest Fossils Found in Greenland
description: Geologists have discovered in Greenland evidence for ancient life in rocks that are 3.7 billion years old. The find, if confirmed, would make these fossils the oldest on Earth and may change scientific understanding of the origins of life.

title: Not the Airline Passengers Fault
description: To the Editor:

title: How to Win Friends and Influence People (on Fake Mars)
description: Amid the craggy landscape near the Mauna Loa volcano on Hawaii, six researchers lived for a year as if they were on Mars. Confined to a 1,000-square-foot habitat inside and spacesuits outside, the researchers spent their time extracting water from dry rock, growing plants and crawling through gigantic lava tubes.

title: Gabons President, Ali Bongo Ondimba, Is Re-Elected in Disputed Result
description: DAKAR, Senegal  President Ali Bongo Ondimba of Gabon has been narrowly re-elected, according to results released by election officials on Wednesday.

title: Paul LePage, the Governor of Maine, Now Says Hes Not Quitting
description: AUGUSTA, Me.  Paul R. LePage, the embattled Republican governor of Maine, declared on Wednesday that he would not step down despite widespread criticism over a profane threat and generalizations about drugs and race that had prompted him to hint on Tuesday that he might abort his second term.

title: 7 Indie Films You Need to Know About
description: It may have been a season of superheroes, but moviegoers have been talking about these seven sleepers, indie features that didnt make a splash but are hits nonetheless.

title: Female Lawyers Gender-Bias Suit Challenges Law Firm Pay Practices
description: When Kerrie L. Campbell joined the Washington office of the law firm Chadbourne & Parke in January 2014, she brought more than two decades of experience in consumer product safety and product defamation litigation. But she contends that other Chadbourne partners shut her out of leadership positions and paid her far less than male partners at her level.

title: Its Colossal! Its Stupendous! Its Doug Aitken!
description: In 2013, Doug Aitken, the internationally acclaimed creator of video and sound installations, produced Station to Station, a collaboration with multitudes of other well-known artists, musicians and performers. Called a nomadic cultural incubator, cross-continental happening and moving earthwork, it took place on a customized train that traveled from Brooklyn to San Francisco, pausing along the way in Pittsburgh, Santa Fe and five other stops to entertain locals with artworks and performances. It was just one example of Mr. Aitkens maximalist ambition to make spectacular art commensurate with, yet critical of, the technologically accelerated complexity of modern life. Opening Saturday, Sept. 10, at the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles, Doug Aitken: Electric Earth will survey his two-decade career. Anchored by seven enveloping installations, the exhibition will include single-screen films, photographs and electrified sculptural constructions. (Through Jan. 15, moca.org.)

title: Mark Morris Open House: Pastries, Classes and, Yes, Dancing
description: Its been 15 fruitful years since the Mark Morris Dance Center planted itself in Fort Greene to bring high-quality dance to Brooklyn. The organization hosts its annual open house with a day of free activities on Saturday, Sept. 10, beginning at 9 a.m. with coffee and pastries. (Dancing does require sustenance.) Events continue throughout the day with classes for children and adults in a wide variety of styles: ballet, modern, Gaga, salsa, tap and Afro-Caribbean. Participants will also have the opportunity to learn sections from Mr. Morriss holiday classic, The Hard Nut, which returns to the Brooklyn Academy of Music in December. But for those who prefer to watch, there is a special attraction: The Mark Morris Dance Group will perform Mr. Morriss ravishing 1995 dance Pacific at 1 and 3 p.m. After each performance, there will be appearances by students from the companys Urban Rhythms and Arts Immersion programs. And theres a beer garden, courtesy of Sixpoint Brewery, on the centers fourth-floor terrace. Cross your fingers for sun. (mmdg.org/openhouse.)

title: Chasing Rap Dreams in Atlanta, With a Sense of Humor
description: A number of television writers seem to have simultaneously realized that the music world is a rich vein for stories, and thus weve had Empire, Vinyl, Roadies and Sex&Drugs&Rock&Roll. On Tuesday, Sept. 6, FX adds to the list with Atlanta, a series that banks on a droll sense of humor to set it apart. The show is about a would-be Atlanta rapper named Alfred Miles (Brian Tyree Henry) who calls himself Paper Boi. Donald Glover, an oddball rapper in real life known as Childish Gambino, who is also the creator of the series, plays Paper Bois cousin Earn, who wants to be his manager. But Paper Boi is skeptical that Earn is tough enough. I need a Malcolm, he tells him in the premiere. Youre too Martin. You know what they did to him? They killed him. To which Earn replies, Didnt they kill Malcolm, too?

title: Beyonc and Kanye West Tours Bring Intimacy to the Big Stage
description: Two of this years most structurally impressive tours arrive in the area to remind viewers that big spaces dont always have to feel that way. Beyonc has been playing stadiums on her Formation World Tour, using a handful of tricks to shrink them  a gargantuan rotating screen onstage and a runway extension that cuts through the middle of the field. But the most intimate moments are the ones where she stands totally alone, forcing everyones gaze right on her. Kanye West has a similar strategy in mind on his Saint Pablo Tour, with a different approach. He has done away with a traditional stage altogether and instead delivers his performance atop a set of platforms hovering over the crowd. It places him eerily close to almost the whole audience, but it also isolates him, a hero and a loner. (Beyonc, MetLife Stadium, Wednesday, Sept. 7; Kanye West, Madison Square Garden, Monday and Tuesday.)

title: Resonant Bodies Festival Showcases Contemporary Vocal Music
description: Shaped anew each year by the tastes of its artists, the Resonant Bodies Festival, an immersion in contemporary vocal music organized by the intrepid Lucy Dhegrae, has swiftly become an annual delight. The three festival concerts  Tuesday, Sept. 6; Wednesday; and Thursday  each feature three singers who have programmed their own sets. Among the highlights are appearances by the rich-voiced mezzo-soprano Abigail Fischer, the tenor Peter Tantsits, the authoritative bass-baritone Dashon Burton and the soprano Julia Bullock (fresh from her new evening of Josephine Baker arrangements at Lincoln Center), with works by Lukas Foss; John Cage; and the young, talented David Hertzberg. The flutist and soprano Alice Teyssier, the composer and vocalist Sofia Jernberg, the daring Frauke Aulbert, Sophie Burgos and Charlotte Mundy round out what is always a fascinatingly varied series. (Roulette, Boerum Hill, Brooklyn; 917-267-0363, roulette.org.)

title: Demon, a Supernatural Satire From Poland
description: Its hard to classify Demon, opening Friday, Sept. 9, at Lincoln Plaza and the Landmark Sunshine. Certainly, the film  a variation on the Jewish legend of the dybbuk, a malevolent spirit that inhabits living bodies  has supernatural elements. At a wedding in Poland, in a crumbling inherited house, the groom (the Israeli actor Itay Tiran) starts behaving strangely: having visions, spitting up blood, speaking in a womans voice.

title: Court Throws Out $655.5 Million Terrorism Verdict Against Palestinian Groups
description: A federal appeals court in New York has thrown out a $655.5 million verdict rendered last year that had held the Palestinian Authority and the Palestine Liberation Organization liable for their roles in supporting terrorist attacks in Israel that claimed American lives.

title: Relaxed, Slouchy Military Looks for Fall
description: For men this season, the classic style gets a beatnik twist.

title: In the Almost Marriage of Abbott and Alere, Both Sides Point Fingers
description: When Abbott Laboratories $5.8 billion acquisition of Alere was announced on Feb. 1, the two companies lauded the transaction. Miles D. White, the chairman and chief executive of Abbott, said the combination would create the worlds premier point of care testing business. Namal Nawana, president and chief executive of Alere, said Abbotts broad portfolio would achieve its goal of improving patient care.

title: Georgetown University, Learning From Its Sins
description: The Jesuit cemetery in St. Inigoes, Md., used to be surrounded by tobacco fields. Over the course of roughly 150 years, those fields were worked by hundreds of slaves owned by the Jesuits. In June, I sat in that cemetery, as a priest and a history professor at Georgetown University, with 16 Jesuit seminarians. We discussed what had happened there in 1838, when several hundred men, women and children were rounded up by the churchmen and their hired agents and transported first by wagon, then by ship to plantations in Louisiana.

title: How the Christodora House Became the Chelsea Hotel of the East Village
description: In the early morning hours of Aug. 7, 1988, Jerry Saltz, now the art critic for New York Magazine but then a struggling 35-year-old writer, stared out from his 10th-floor apartment in Christodora House and watched an angry mob below shouting, Kill yuppies.

title: Street Style: Afropunk
description: Bold and creative fashion was out in force at the music festival in Brooklyn.

title: Myanmar Peace Talks Begin, High in Symbolism and in Skepticism
description: NAYPYIDAW, Myanmar  In the grandest gesture yet of her young administration, Myanmars leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, opened a peace conference on Wednesday to bring together hundreds of the countrys ethnic armed groups in hopes of ending decades of conflict.

title: N.F.L. Clears James Harrison, Clay Matthews and Julius Peppers
description: Three star players from the Green Bay Packers and the Pittsburgh Steelers were cleared Wednesday of claims that they used performance-enhancing drugs after a news report had linked them to a pharmacist who said he had given them steroids.

title: Officials Release Sketch of Possible Witness in Queens Joggers Killing
description: Four weeks after a woman was strangled while on an evening jog through a stretch of wetlands near her home in Queens, the police released a sketch on Wednesday of a man who had been seen in the area and might be a witness with information about the killing.

title: Never-Before-Seen Peter Lindbergh Photos
description: The photographer dips into his vault to share images of Kate, Madonna, Gisele and Lara, from the early 90s and beyond.

title: Puerto Ricos Fiscal Affairs Will Be Overseen by 7 Experts in Finance and Law
description: The White House said it had chosen seven experts in finance and the law to supervise Puerto Ricos fiscal affairs in the coming months under a law enacted this summer intended to help the island restructure its $72 billion debt.

title: Vintage, Unpublished Photos  and Memories  of Kate Moss and Madonna
description: Ask Peter Lindbergh which year of his career hed most like to relive, and he has plenty of good options. 1988 comes to mind: Its the year he shot the iconic white shirt photo of Linda Evangelista, Karen Alexander, Christy Turlington, Estelle Lefbure, Tatjana Patitz and Rachel Williams at the beach  an image that would launch the careers of the then-unknown models, and of Lindbergh himself. It is regarded as the first artifact of the supermodel era. Or maybe 1994, the year he shot Madonna in a tribute to Martha Graham (never-before-seen photos from that session are in the slide show here, along with previously unpublished shots of Kate Moss, Gisele Bndchen and Lara Stone). Or 2002, the year he shot his second Pirelli calendar and became the first photographer to be exhibited at Moscows Pushkin Museum.

title: Campaign News, From Many Angles
description: To the Editor:

title: Before Donald Trump, Gov. Paul LePage of Maine
description: To the Editor:

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Angela Bassett Reads What the Psychic Knew
description: In this episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, the actress Angela Bassett reads the essay What the Psychic Knew, about a prediction that throws off the balance of the authors life.

title: Creating Order in the Universe With Thousands of Kites
description: In late 2006, Mary Boone phoned the artist Jacob Hashimoto several months ahead of his first show at her venerable gallery to ask about his progress. She said, I heard that you havent finished any of the work, and she explained that when she does a show of six or seven pieces, she hopes to choose from 15, he remembers. I told her that my studio is like a sourdough bread bakery  you have the mother, which is the dough that youre growing, and you feed it flour and water, and the mother gets bigger and keeps leavening. And, eventually, you take off chunks and make your biscuits, but most of the time, youre feeding the mother.

title: Review: The Art of Waiting, What to Expect When Youre Still Not Expecting
description: The female body, as any owner knows, can be a diabolically creative source of torment. There are so many things about it that can disappoint, embarrass or send your self-esteem straight down the barrel of a Cuisinart. Almost all women have some notion of the ideal body, and almost all women, at some point or another, wonder whether theirs got lost in the mail.

title: Wagner Moura Is All Set to Die on Narcos
description: The second season of Narcos doesnt debut until Friday, but Wagner Moura, who stars as the drug kingpin Pablo Escobar, is already thinking about life after the acclaimed Netflix series.

title: Have a Story to Tell? Your Personal Memoirist Is Here
description: Isaac Ehrlich, 74, wanted his children and future generations to know the story of his mother, Sonia. Her life story is woven through the tragedies of the 20th century. She lost 40 relatives in the Holocaust. She was shipped to Siberia from Poland. She eventually found her way to Riverdale, in the Bronx, where she still lives.

title: Strange and Imaginative Dishes and Cutlery
description: A sampling of the carefully crafted plates, bowls and cutlery available at Jouw.

title: A New Shop for Artful, Imaginative Dining
description: Since 2012, the Amsterdam-based creative group Steinbeisser has thrown the sort of challenging experimental gastronomy dinners reflected in the agencys name, which in German means biting on rock  and the dishes and eating utensils are as thought-provoking as the food. On commissioned tableware such as rocking plates and arms-length spoons, dishes from such Michelin-lauded chefs as David Kinch of Manresa, Tanja Grandits of Stucki and Corey Lee of Benu bring diners out of their comfort zone, as the Steinbeisser co-founder Martin Kullik describes it, showing different perspectives of how we can relate to food and to one another. Just as the multicourse meals are entirely biodynamic and preservative-free  and crafted with carefully sourced ingredients  the implements are similarly considered, carved and forged by contemporary jewelry designers and woodworkers from materials found in the area where each dinner is held, from Berlin to Basel to an upcoming meal in Saratoga, Calif.

title: Islam Karimov, Uzbekistans President, Is Gravely Ill. No, Wait! Hes Fine.
description: MOSCOW  The mystery surrounding the health of Islam Karimov, the longtime president of Uzbekistan, deepened on Wednesday with his daughter suggesting that he was recovering after a stroke, but an announcer reading Mr. Karimovs traditional independence day address on television.

title: A Ring of Fire Eclipse Starts Thursday
description: A ring of sunshine will blaze above parts of Africa on Thursday as the moon glides between the sun and Earth. The solar spectacle is called an annular eclipse, and sometimes referred to as a ring of fire eclipse.

title: How to Go to Cuba Now
description: [UPDATED NOV. 8, 2017]

title: 2 German Banks Shelved Merger Talks, but Other Deals Are Possible
description: The stars are aligning for an era of German banking consolidation. Commerzbank and Deutsche Bank held discussions in August about a possible merger, Reuters reported on Wednesday. While these did not work out, the wider logic of banking mergers is becoming increasingly compelling.

title: A Democratic Senate Might Need to Curtail Filibuster, Harry Reid Says
description: LAS VEGAS  Senator Harry Reid says Democrats should move to curtail the filibuster if they win the White House and Senate in November only to run up against persistent use of the tactic by Republicans.

title: Review: Angel Olsens My Woman Goes Fearlessly Retro
description: My Woman, Angel Olsens third full-length album, pushes away indie-rock expectations and seizes the prerogatives of pop.

title: Justin Trudeau Is on the Cover of a Marvel Comic Book. He Is Now a King Among Memes.
description: The latest Justin Trudeau moment delighting people around the world is not even one he is responsible for: Mr. Trudeau, the Canadian prime minister, is on the cover of a Marvel comic book.

title: The Lonely Toil of Frank Ocean: Is It Art, or Denial?
description: What times these are for work! Its the title of a song that Rihanna and Drake have made pretty much 2016s best single, and the partial title of another that Fifth Harmonys made one of the years naughtiest. The entire Beyonc Lemonade experience involves the work of marriage and black womanhood. But no musicians been more literal about the work hes doing than Frank Ocean.

title: Meet the 24-Year-Old Director Bringing Kanye Wests Visions to Life
description: On Saturday, the day before the MTV Video Music Awards, Kanye West informed the director of his new flesh-heavy dance video, Fade, that it would have its premiere during the rappers slot on the show. The only problem: The video wasnt finished.

title: Donald Trump, Dilma Rousseff, Cuba: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Trying to Smoke Out the Players in the Hacking of the D.N.C.
description: WASHINGTON  American intelligence agencies believe that the Russian government was behind the theft of emails and documents from the Democratic National Committee, but many questions remain about how the documents made their way to WikiLeaks, which released them.

title: How Russia Often Benefits When Julian Assange Reveals the Wests Secrets
description: Julian Assange was in classic didactic form, holding forth on the topic that consumes him  the perfidy of big government and especially of the United States.

title: 4 Buys for a Fall-Ready Wardrobe
description: What you need: Some great new jeans and smart workout wear, among other things.

title: Moderate Drinking Does Not Affect Fertility
description: A new study has found that moderate alcohol consumption does not affect a womans ability to get pregnant, although higher amounts might.

title: F.D.A. Orders Stronger Warning on Common Painkiller-Sedative Mix
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration announced on Wednesday that it would require its toughest warning labels to caution patients against taking opioid painkillers together with benzodiazepines, like Xanax and Valium. The combination makes an overdose more likely and the warning is aimed at making sure people understand that.

title: Fashion Week Celebrations You Can Actually Get Into
description: The long wait for the goods from Rihannas debut Fenty Puma collection is over: Sneaker-stiletto boots ($600) and hoodies ($150) will be available at a pop-up opening Tuesday. Be on the lookout for 2,500 keys hidden through the city and redeemable for gift cards, gear and concert tickets. At 125 West 33rd Street.

title: Mariano Rajoy Fails to Gain Backing for Spains New Government
description: Mariano Rajoy, Spains caretaker prime minister, failed on Wednesday to gain Parliaments endorsement to form a new government, raising the likelihood that a third national election would be needed to try to break the countrys political deadlock.

title: Study Finds Increase in Temporary Paralysis Accompanied Zika Outbreaks
description: In seven countries that recently experienced Zika outbreaks, there were also sharp increases in the numbers of people suffering from a form of temporary paralysis, researchers reported Wednesday.

title: U.S. Will Extend HARP Home Loan Program Into Next Year
description: Seven years after the federal government first offered an option to help some homeowners refinance into more affordable mortgages, the program is being extended yet again, and plans for a new refinancing program are being completed.

title: King Joffrey Is Coming. But Only to Act in a Play.
description: LONDON  This would be a great place for a date, said Jack Gleeson, staring at a display of dead fetuses at the Hunterian Museum at the Royal College of Surgeons here.

title: Donald Trump Gambles on Immigration but Sends Conflicting Signals
description: Donald J. Trump made an audacious attempt on Wednesday to remake his image on the divisive issue of immigration, shelving his plan to deport 11 million undocumented people and arguing that a Trump administration and Mexico would secure the border together.

title: What Colin Kaepernicks Protest Looks Like to a Black 49ers Fan
description: San Francisco  Why are we, as sports fans, continually surprised when one of our heroes turns out to be a real person, with real feelings who is living in the same world we also live in? And when that athlete is black, why does white America respond with anger, as if the hero has broken some kind of sacred rule or understood deal? That deal seems to be, You just go out and win games, collect your check, and if we really like you, you can retire and sell us stuff in TV commercials.

title: Vera Caslavska, Gymnast Who Faced Off With Soviets, Dies at 74
description: Vera Caslavska, a Czech gymnast whose seven Olympic gold medals in the 1960s made her a dominant figure in the sport and whose public opposition to the Soviet invasion of her homeland ended her competitive career, died on Tuesday in Prague. She was 74.

title: Donald Trump Tries a Jarring New Style: Diplomatic
description: He did not mock. He did not scold. He did not blunder.

title: An Overdue Victory for Gay Parents and Their Children
description: It took 25 years, but on Tuesday New York States highest court finally admitted the damage it did in 1991 with a ruling that denied parental rights to many people in nontraditional families  including unmarried opposite-sex couples, stepparents, and gays and lesbians  who are raising children.

title: A Look at Trumps Immigration Plan, Then and Now
description: Heres a look at how the Republican candidates positions on immigration have changed, or remained the same, throughout the campaign.
